title: A Quiet Path
description: A stray breeze trails through from the north, carrying with it the scent of lavender and, oddly, grilled rolton.  Though many might ponder this strange combination of fragrances, the truly remarkable aspect of this quiet path lies in the regal beauty of the ancient trees whose branches reach out overhead, offering welcome to all who pass.

title: Wehnimer's, Land's End Rd.
description: Vigilant night guardsmen scrutinize the citizens and travelers arriving and departing through the wide gates spanning the land route into Wehnimer's Landing.  The cluttered streets of the city to the south are a far cry from the deceptively calm expanse of the wilds of Elanith outside.  Two daunting towers survey the countryside and protect the town, flanking the road to the east and west.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd.
description: The cobbled road girds the town along the inner side of the northern palisade.  Just to the north stand the twin sentinels of the gate's guardtowers, silhouetted against the night sky.  Guardsmen come and go through the main gates, keeping a close eye on the people of all races who move to and fro.  Opposite the gates, you see the shop of Dakris the Furrier.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd.
description: The road turns gradually at this point as it forms the northwest corner of the city.  The main path curves along the north and west walls, and another leads south between the buildings.  The massive oak and modwir logs of the city palisade tower overhead.

title: Wehnimer's, Talon St.
description: The street runs between the northern palisade and the central square to the south and east.  The traffic is varied here, as a few traders and travelers mingle on the dark streets with the ever-present and watchful militiamen.  The damaged walls of Cholgar's Bathhouse occupy nearly the entire block.

title: Town Square, Northwest
description: This corner of the square is lively and hectic even at night.  A number of representatives of the Landing's population, including several elven loggers and a party of rough-looking dwarves, loiter around the door of the Raging Thrak Inn, where the rowdy cheers of patrons and voices raised in songs of many sorts, from snatches of heroic ballads to blushingly bawdy tunes, beckon you to enter.

title: Town Square Central
description: This is the heart of the main square of Wehnimer's Landing.  The impromptu shops of the bazaar are clustered around this central gathering place, where townsfolk, travellers, and adventurers meet to talk, conspire or raise expeditions to the far-flung reaches of Elanith.  At the north end, an old well, with moss-covered stones and a craggy roof, is shaded from the moonlight by a strong, robust tree.  The oak is tall and straight, and it is apparent that the roots run deep.

title: Town Square, East
description: Here in the center of a broad plaza near the commercial area of the bazaar stands the impressive facade of the slate-roofed Moot Hall, where the citizens of Wehnimer's Landing hold various official, religious and social functions.  Facing the square are some of the town's more prosperous shops, still doing business with the many customers who still frequent the streets at night.

title: Wehnimer's, Penna St.
description: The distant sounds of the merchants and tradesmen around the shops to the west are muted here.  The cracked pavement, scattered cobblestones, and dirt drainage ditches along the side of the road form a not-so-gradual transition between the busier avenues of the main bazaar and the less frequented, humbler, and more unsavory sections of the town.

title: Wehnimer's, Cheridin Ave.
description: The broad avenue intersects here with the narrower byway connecting to the bazaar to the west, where occasional sounds of distant revelry rise from the lamplit streets.  Older wood and stone buildings, mostly small shops and offices with upstairs lodgings overlooking the street, predominate here.

title: Wehnimer's, Cheridin Ave.
description: On the west side of this narrow stretch of Cheridin Avenue is the unlit back of the Moot Hall, and the dour building that houses the local constabulary and its jail looms along the other side of the street.  To the southeast, a stone dome rises over the compound that surrounds the Landing's largest temple.  Passers-by here move quickly north and south without much pause.

title: Wehnimer's, Cheridin Ave.
description: Several small shops crowd along the street, which is composed of the back walls of the high buildings bordering the central square.  Each storefront vies with the others for street space and the attention of the many travellers who pass through here.  A few traders, hoping to take advantage of some late business attracted by the nearby temple, have set up stands and pushcarts filled with clothing, trinkets and souvenirs.

title: Wehnimer's, Erebor Square
description: The dome of a large temple rises above this peaceful square, silhouetted against the starlit sky.  The circular building is surrounded by marble porticos and teak columns, and a promenade leads to two pillars, through which the inner sanctum can be glimpsed.  Priests and worshippers wander here and there, engaged in various rituals of devotion or study.  A locked almsbox is securely bolted to an iron pole alongside the pillars.

title: Wehnimer's, Erebor Square
description: This quiet corner resembles a calm island amid the bustling life of Wehnimer's Landing.  At the west end, a low, broad dome is visible.  In the center of the square, several benches of polished wood and smooth stone surround a sculpture that stands as a sentinel before the Wehnimer's Museum.  Cast in bronze, the work imparts a sense of peace, calm and protection to the landscaped surroundings.  A gold plaque mounted on a gracefully chiseled malachite base stands before it.

title: Wehnimer's, Erebor Square
description: Ancient grey flagstones pave this quiet corner of the square, set around small gardens of herbs and flowers that provide splashes of faint color in the filtered moonlight.   Polished wood benches arranged under the branches of a variety of overhanging trees offer a place for scholars and travelers to study and rest.

title: Wehnimer's, Wisraith Lane
description: Interspersed among the small shops along the cobbled road are a few modwir-shingled private houses.  They are gaily decorated, competing for individuality with one another by means of daubs of colorful paint, skillfully carved doors and shutters, and window boxes bursting with ornamental flowers and fresh herbs.  A bright yellow awning lit by a glowing lamp marks the entrance to the florist, whose windows are brimming with fresh blossoms.

title: Wehnimer's, Wisraith Lane
description: Sounds of laughter and conversation echo from the residential cottages along this pleasant, cobbled street, where clumps of decorative bushes by the roadside add splashes of green to the lamplit townscape.  A small boy smiles and waves from the front steps of his home, then goes back to counting stars.

title: Wehnimer's, Riverwind St.
description: Here Riverwind Street meets Lyon Way at an angle.  The structures by the roadside are oddly shaped to match the turning of the way.

title: Wehnimer's, Riverwind St.
description: This lane contains a cluster of new town houses with small gardens and low fences.  The houses look out of place next to the shabbier, more rundown warehouses and workshops here.  A few tidy shops catering to the new residents of the street sell food, drink and other necessities.

title: Wehnimer's, Banker's Square
description: The eastern road leads closer to the river, which can be smelled but not seen from here.  The southern road constricts as it makes a straight cut towards the modwir palisade that surrounds the town, avoiding the maze-like side streets of the riverfront and Shanty Town, which are haunted by dockworkers, warehouse porters, and wharf rats.  A dusty pile of rubble might have been a building once, but whatever it was is unrecognizable now.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd.
description: This dingy street is overshadowed by two multi-storied buildings.  At the far end is the unpretentious facade of Beldrin's Gaming Hall, from which the harsh shouts of gamblers, touts, and onlookers echo into the street.  Across the way is a local inn, frequented by sailors, dockworkers and fishermen, from the looks of the clientele gathered around the doorway.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd.
description: Wagons and carts loaded with a variety of goods pass in all directions, from the center of the busy town to the west to the wharfs and piers along the Locksmehr River to the east.  A number of militiamen head north towards the guardtowers and barracks.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd.
description: The large, deserted-looking shed to the east looks as if it once served as a stable or a workshop of some sort.  Now it seems to be nothing more than a crumbling warehouse, and the sparse traffic flowing to the north and south seldom gives it a second look.

title: Wehnimer's, Atropa St.
description: Here Atropa Street meets Dragonsclaw Road, which traverses the Landing to the south, and combines with Taarna Road to the west.  A gentle rise in the ground affords a glimpse of the hills and open countryside that lie beyond the town walls far to the south.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way
description: The roadway follows the natural bend in the river, which encroaches slightly inland here.  To the west, a lane leads off into the business and warehouse districts of the Landing.  The sound of the night surf and the groaning of tall ships straining at anchor echo from the east.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way
description: To the east a dock spears out into the waters of the bay.  Ships from all across the world can be seen tied to the dock, and sailors of many races from many lands pass by.  To one side of the road stands a weathered and grey clapboard warehouse.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way
description: The faint, tangy scent of the bay mingles with the lighter smells of the river, which runs just to the northeast.  The wide road leads along the riverbank through the warehouse and wharf district, where the sounds of longshoremen loading and unloading freetraders drift over from a wooden walkway to the east.

title: Wehnimer's, Bay's Watch West
description: Here at the northern end of Wehnimer's Landing, the fickle waters of the Locksmehr River flow to the east.  The westernmost of the twin guardtowers that keep watch over the river gates into town rises above, casting a dark shadow over the lamplit cobblestones.  The huge ironbound sea gates straddle the river, extending to the matching tower on the eastern bank.

title: Wehnimer's, North Dock
description: The dock's planks are dull and weathered from the salt spray of many seasons.  Northward beyond the massive sea gates, moonlit clouds drift by, silhouetted against the sky over the dark waters of Darkstone Bay.  The hulk of a derelict coastal sailer is tethered to the end of the pier.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way
description: The road snakes and winds to conform to the banks of the river.  In the distance, the low profiles of the shops and warehouses that populate the Landing's western bank can be seen.  To one side of the road, empty flatbed wagons stand at the curb next to an aging warehouse.  The span of a bridge crosses the river to the southeast.

title: Wehnimer's, West Crossing
description: From here, the vista along the horizon affords a view of both banks of the river.  To the west, the dark expanse of the town's low skyline is dominated by rambling structures and a few towers.  To the east lies the bridge across the Locksmehr, spanning the dark waters to the less-populated east bank.

title: Wehnimer's, Riverwind St.
description: Here Riverwind Street leads to the West Crossing, where traffic over the bridge moves off in all directions.  Carts, wagons, pedestrians, and wayfarers of every stripe pass by the busy intersection, no matter how late the night.  A flagstone path leads away from the road, passing out of view through a lattice arch covered with dark ivy.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way
description: The massive gate of the Landing's boatyard dominates this stretch of road.  Through it can be seen boats in various states of repair, tied up at wooden docks or beached along the riverbank.  Just offshore lies a coastal sailer half-sunken in the river's shallows, and silhouetted against the dark horizon just to the northeast is the span of a sturdy bridge.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd.
description: The road travels roughly parallel to the river's course, skirting the shoreline.  Fishermen, traders, miners, sailors, and townsfolk trek back and forth between the storehouses, shops, docks and offices that constitute the life of Wehnimer's Landing.

title: House Phoenix, Entry Court
description: Between Wisraith Lane and the house, a quiet courtyard is situated.

title: Wehnimer's, Beolost Rd.
description: Two peaceful lanes meet here.  Cheerful light glows from the windows of small houses lining the streets, and the aroma of simmering stews and roasting meat fills the air.  The sound of a woman singing merrily from inside a nearby cottage drifts through the quiet lane.

title: Wehnimer's, Airioch Lane
description: Bordering the temple perimeter, this lane contains a few cheery cottages and friendly shops.  It offers refreshing change from the older, rutted streets and noisy stores of the bazaar and the town square.

title: Wehnimer's, Cheridin Ave.
description: Many of the dwellings that line this section of road have shutters closed or curtains drawn to keep out the noise and dust raised by the constant flow of traffic along the street.  Just south of here, the traffic on Cheridin streams west towards the bazaar.  To the east, the lanes twist through neighborhoods composed of serviceable shops and modest residences.

title: Wehnimer's, Lyon Way
description: The intermittent rhythm of movement through the street to the east and west is accentuated by a constant loud clanging coming from the north, where a column of smoke rises from a towering chimney.  A flatbed wagon has been abandoned here where it collided with the wall of a shabby workshop, and now serves only as a home for a few scrawny rats which scamper around its ruined platform.

title: Wehnimer's, Mikhail St.
description: Loud clanging noises come from the yard to one side of the road.  The yard is enclosed by a tall iron gate, welded to which is a peculiar sign in the shape of a horseshoe with crossed hammer and tongs upon it.  Along the side of the street, dumped unceremoniously by the gate, is a heap of coal and a pile of dark-colored rocks.

title: Wehnimer's, Valeria St.
description: The footsteps of a few passing wayfarers and townspeople echo on the cobbled pavement between the rows of two-story wooden houses that flank the lane.  The street is quieter and darker here, blocks away from the busy square to the west.

title: Wehnimer's, Valeria St.
description: Flatbed wagons carrying loads of wood or other goods lumber slowly to the east and west, their wheels echoing in the night as they bounce over a large pothole in the road.  A nondescript building, with a prominent sign in the shape of a key above its black door, is set back slightly from the street, nearly hidden in the shadows.

title: Wehnimer's, Dagmar Lane
description: This long, narrow dirt road presses between several buildings, connecting one of the quieter corners of this part of town with the main thoroughfares, where small residences and humble shops give way to the larger emporia, offices and grander structures.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd.
description: Here along the main north road, the roughhewn logs of the modwir wood palisade echo passing footsteps on the bumpy cobbled path.  The cold, briny night breeze from the nearby bay fills the air in spite of the sturdy barricade.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd.
description: A respectful quiet blankets this area like the deep shadow cast by the high north wall.  Those people that move along this section of road walk with their heads bowed and speak in hushed whispers in obvious consideration to the local empath, who practices the restorative arts at the strange tent that is set back from the roadside in the middle of an overgrown vacant lot here.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd.
description: The perimeter road runs just inside the protective palisades that protect the north wall of the town, affording shelter from the prevailing winds off Darkstone Bay.  The weathered facades of businesses and warehouses line the road leading south into the center of Wehnimer's Landing.  To the east, the road leads to the riverfront, and the town's main gates lie farther to the west.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd.
description: The west river guardtower looms overhead, marking the end of the road just to the east.  Most of the people passing by here are in uniforms of the various divisions of the town's guards or militia, and even the businesses on the south side of the street seem to cater almost exclusively to military types.

title: Wehnimer's, Taarna Rd.
description: The street here leads north and south, its nearness to the north wall and the docks made obvious by the smell of salt water and fish coming in on the breeze off the bay.  A few flowering weeds thrive in patches of dirt between the cobblestones on less-traveled parts of the road.

title: Wehnimer's, Stormarm St.
description: This street cuts a wide path north and south between the north wall and the center of the Landing.  Low, grey stone buildings and nondescript sheds loom to the south and east, and towards the central square the view is more pleasant and varied.

title: Wehnimer's, Stormarm St.
description: This intersection links the bazaar routes with those bisecting and encircling the Landing.  A few ruddyfaced sailors, loudmouthed dockworkers, and off-duty soldiers linger along the wall of a tavern, which is set back from the side of the road up a slight incline.  A shaky wooden stairway, the bane of many an overimbiber's existence, leads up to the tavern door.

title: Wehnimer's, Stormarm St.
description: A few warehouses, small shops and businesses, and unmarked buildings with weathered modwir siding predominate along this part of the road.  The street is less crowded than those near the docks or the square, and the irregular cobblestones are slick and unyielding underfoot.

title: Wehnimer's, Lyon Way
description: The two- and three-story homes of some of the Landing's middle-class citizens are situated at this bend in Lyon Way.  Whitewash has been applied to most of the wooden structures, though soot from somewhere nearby stains many of their painted surfaces, and window boxes full of flowers add faint splashes of color to the moonlit street.

title: House Brigatta, Lane
description: Stepping into the lane, you stand in front of a cozy looking, trim house of modest proportions.  A small brass sign, neatly engraved, announces: House Brigatta.

title: Wehnimer's, Lyon Way
description: Here Lyon Way runs southeast into Riverwind Street, serving as a conduit for passage between the river and the bazaar and shops.  Most of the more reputable-looking citizens seem to be steering clear of a dimly lit cul-de-sac which lies due south of the intersection.

title: Town Square, Northeast
description: The entrance to Tykel's Arms, its heavy door bounded by iron-barred windows, dominates this corner of the square.  All manner of citizens pass by, moving among the solid, multistoried wooden buildings that surround the bazaar.  Just to the southwest can be seen the tree-shaded heart of the square, where citizens and adventurers gather for socializing, healing and rest.

title: Wehnimer's, Valeria St.
description: Traffic to and from the hub of activity in the square to the west passes along the dark street here.  Passers-by guard their valuables closely, glancing into shaded doorways and niches and wary of the press of the crowd.  Two-story buildings of wood and stone line the north and south sides of the cobbled road.

title: Wehnimer's, The Mews
description: The large, barn-like structure that dominates the north side of the block is the city stable.  Through a ground-floor window can be seen the rows of now-empty stalls in the dark interior.  The pavement just outside is strewn with straw and debris that merits a careful step along this part of the road.  To the west is the main square and its cobblestoned bazaar, where furious trading takes place on a daily basis.

title: Wehnimer's, The Mews
description: This narrow lane runs north to south, shaded by the narrow, unadorned buildings that loom on both sides of the rough paving stones.  The clatter of wagon wheels on cobbled streets and the jangling of iron-fitted harnesses echoes from the south, along with a scent of leather and livestock.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd.
description: North Ring Road intersects here with a cobbled street of modest dimensions that opens up to the south, where traffic becomes more dense along the lamplit routes to the main square.  Towards the east, the guardtowers at the river gates can be seen in the distance, rising dark against the night sky.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd.
description: The east-west road continues, closed in on the south by the militia barracks and on the north by the twelve-foot-high wall of the city itself.  The occasional thud of leather boots in unison upon cobbled pavement and the clipped shouts of barked orders reverberate off the modwir walls along this part of the road.  The scents of leather, weapon oil and hearty cooking fill the night air.

title: Town Square, Southeast
description: Pedestrians and wagon traffic move off in all directions here, some going to the large intersection with South Ring Road, others crisscrossing the square via the bazaar.  Men and women carrying neatly tied parcels or sacks and coils of rope slung over their arms emerge from the wooden facade of the old general store.

title: Wehnimer's, Parsnips St.
description: This broad conduit leading between the south wall and the square stands nearly deserted after dark, only a few footsteps echoing on the lamplit cobblestones.  To one side stands a sedate and dignified shop, the scroll-like sign over its door inscribed in a striking and elegant manner.

title: Town Square, Southwest
description: This corner of the square seems somewhat subdued.  Townsfolk pass through on their way to the shops, the bazaar, or the main well at the center of the square.  Others hurry past, anxious to get home or go on about their business.

title: Town Square, West
description: Here in the midst of the town stretches the cobblestoned main bazaar, its lamplit lanes abuzz with traders and vendors hawking their wares at any hour of the day or night.  Groups of citizens, discussing the day's events or preparing for nighttime hunts, gather around the doors of the merchants whose shops border the square.  The gilded but peeling stone facade of the First Elanith Bank dominates this side of the square.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd.
description: Night guards and militiamen pass by, moving between the barracks and the guard towers at either end of the north road.  The broad cobblestoned way proceeds east and west, hugging the inside of the northern wall.  A sparse mix of citizens and visitors, including trappers and traders returning home for the night or staying out to ply some late business, walk among the ever-vigilant guards.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd.
description: Worn and uneven paving stones broken by deep ruts cover the road here, making for treacherous footing.  A faint chorus of sounds emanates from the south and west, as the subdued hum of the bazaar melds with the occasional cries of night birds flying above.

title: Town Square, Small Park
description: A small, shaded park fills an old vacant lot behind a row of buildings, the bright lamplight from the square filtering through the passage to the north to illuminate the area with a soft glow.  A weatherworn grey marble statue of a stocky human in pioneer's clothing overlooks the park, his stone hat encrusted by the gifts of decades of passing birds and his right hand half-upraised as if it once held some now-missing object.

title: Wehnimer's, Sindar Lane
description: A welter of discordant sounds fills the air here, in sudden contrast to the relative calm of the surrounding streets.  The clanging of metal striking metal, the hissing of air and the roaring of the forge, and the gruff voice of the proprietor bellowing out orders make it all too clear that this is the entrance to Aznell's Armory.  A metal sign hangs above the doorway.

title: Wehnimer's, West Ring Rd.
description: The road bends to conform to the inside curve of the southern and western walls of the high modwir log palisades, which converge here.  A whiff of the scents of the marketplace rises from a narrow lane to the east.

title: Wehnimer's, West Ring Rd.
description: Traffic is almost nonexistent at night on this portion of West Ring Road.  Most of the people still out in the streets seem to be using the busier roads that lie to the north and south, leading to the square.  A few warehouses and smaller shops line the way here.

title: Wehnimer's, West Ring Rd.
description: The lane to the east leads into the heart of town and the main square.  Pedestrians and carts laden down with cargo make their way along the road.  The back wall of the grocer's shop borders the road, its wide door surrounded by piles of rough gunny sacks and stacks of wooden crates, some empty, others still to be unpacked.

title: Wehnimer's, West Ring Rd.
description: The road passes beneath the shadow of the palisade.  Before you sprawls a gaudily-painted structure, adorned with elaborate carvings depicting scenes of commerce and lit by polished brass lamps.  This is the Merchant's Guild, where the business people of town, from wealthy traders to lowly street peddlers, meet to discuss matters of mutual concern.

title: Wehnimer's, West Ring Rd.
description: This cobbled road circles the town, providing access to the bazaar and the fringes of the surrounding neighborhoods.  Several night guardsmen, wearing leather armor and bearing short swords and daggers, eye the crowds and keep watch over the dim, lamplit street, where a few traders and townsmen are going about their business.

title: Wehnimer's, Winter St.
description: A few shoppers, traders and local residents walk along this avenue, chatting in the night air or heading home.  On the west side of the road is the grocer's shop, where provisions, from the humblest sack of flour to the rarest varieties of Gnollish mushrooms, can be bought.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd.
description: The quiet of the moonlit street is broken by the sound of metal bouncing against metal.  A small group of rough-looking citizens gather in the shadow of the buildings, apparently busy at some gambling game.  From one small storefront comes the sound of a lilting melody being picked out on a lute.

title: Town Square, South Alley
description: This narrow alleyway passes crookedly between the old wood and stone walls of the surrounding buildings, providing a shaded byway from the busy road to the south to a small park nestled in a grassy niche to the north.  An occasional stray mutt sniffs around the foundations, searching for rats or morsels.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd.
description: A short distance to the east lies a broad intersection.  To the west, the road narrows slightly as it is impinged on by closely-spaced shops, beyond which the western and southern city walls intersect.  A few townsfolk mingle under the circles of lamplight in the cobbled street.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd.
description: A spacious boulevard intersects the Ring Road at this point.  Traders and peddlers pass by, carting their wares home from a busy day in the bazaar, and a few townsfolk scatter east and west bearing packages, sacks and purchases.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd.
description: The moonlit, rolling countryside outside the town can be glimpsed through a crack in the south palisade wall.  A cool and refreshing night breeze whistles between the logs, freshening the air with a brisk scent of pine.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd.
description: A small group of local residents gathers around the small well next to the palisade, chatting idly in the cool night air.  The connecting road runs to the east and west, and a few passers-by head north to the heart of town.

title: Wehnimer's, Airioch Lane
description: This tree-dotted lane passes through a residential pocket of the Landing.  The cobbled dirt road leads past well-kept single or two-floor houses, built of wood and stone with carved shutters and doors that can be closed against inclement weather or dangerous invasions.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd.
description: Many of the travellers through this part of town appear to be pilgrims, priests and monks.  They travel to and fro, moving along the quiet road to the north.  The hoot of an owl echoes from somewhere beyond the palisade wall.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd.
description: The rough-hewn, pointed logs forming the palisade of the town's defensive wall are a constant companion along this route linking sections of Wehnimer's Landing to the bazaar, the square, and the waterfront via the southernmost road.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd.
description: Pedestrians and a few carts and wagons move along the cobblestoned road in the shadow of the palisades, most focused on going about some night time business in town.  They pass by the low wood and stone buildings, rarely glancing up or at one another.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd.
description: The neatly kept shop on the west side of the street looks like a private residence, except for the displays in its bay window of all the latest fashions.  Elm trees cast the cobblestones into deeper shadow, and a striped alley cat lurks watchfully in the light of the shop's bright oil lamp.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd.
description: A somber shop by the side of the road attracts a picturesque clientele.  Lissome travellers cloaked in forest green and hunters of many shapes and sizes gather outside.  Some have quivers slung across their backs, others hold menacing-looking contraptions of wood, metal and fiber.  A rugged wooden plaque in the shape of an arrow is nailed to the shop door.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd.
description: Along the edge of the road stands an abandoned shop, almost invisible in the deep shadows cast by the overgrown gardens which surround it.  A stray dog sniffs among its ruined remains, growling at travellers along the east-west road.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd.
description: South Ring Road leads to the outskirts of Shanty Town, the poorest section of Wehnimer's Landing.  The contrast between the colorful, well-kept buildings of the bazaar and main square and the dingy hovels to the east is striking.  Most passers-by move hurriedly to the west or north to the river crossing.  A ragged child cowers against the south wall, looking lost and forgotten.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way
description: Dockworkers, sailors, fishermen and tradesmen stream by, coming and going even at this hour of night between the docks and the inns and taverns of the Landing.  A group of rough-looking sailors weave drunkenly through the street, chortling over some bawdy joke.

title: Wehnimer's, Shanty Town
description: A few scraggly trees cast dark shadows over this clearing at the center of an assortment of ramshackle huts.  Although the area seems dark and deserted, occasional movements in the windows of the huts indicate that the road may not be unobserved.  Small footpaths lead in several directions.  The hut closest to the street seems to be built largely of broken crates.

title: Wehnimer's, Shanty Town
description: Time and tide have not been kind to the dilapidated shacks along this dreary stretch of riverfront beach.  The rotted and weatherbeaten planks, the patched roofs and the mud lanes cast a melancholy pall of neglect here, in contrast to the lively sounds of the river, drifting over from the dark shore that lies directly to the east.  To the north, occasional sounds of sawing and banging emanate from the boatyard.

title: Wehnimer's, Boatyard
description: This promontory, formed of rocks and sand partially covered by weathered wooden docks, extends a short distance into the river.  A few workmen hustle to complete their nighttime tasks, repairing and refurbishing the sailing vessels that are moored here.  A refurbished frigate lies at anchor just offshore, awaiting a new cargo as well as a new lease on life.  The sand-covered riverbank beach stretches to the south.

title: Wehnimer's, Shanty Town
description: No bright lamps light the unpaved road here, and the layer of mud that passes for streets in Shanty Town is treacherous and slippery with seepage from the nearby river.  A few sorry shacks stand cluttered together in this southeast corner, their doors and windows dark with tattered and drawn curtains, holding untold tales of suffering or malice.

title: Wehnimer's, Shanty Town
description: The tracks of wagon wheels rut the path through here, forming tiny rivulets that connect the puddles.  A few sparse bushes and a tiny garden outside one of the shanties do little to relieve the monotony of the otherwise indistinguishable dwellings to the north and east.  The western path leads back to town.

title: Wehnimer's, Boatyard
description: Half-completed shipping vessels, sections of wooden supports, canvas, and vessels in need of repair are strewn along this strand of riverfront beach, separated from the town proper by the wooden boatyard fence.  The hulking framework of a ship under construction rises against the starlit sky like a giant skeleton belonging to some forgotten sea creature.

title: Wehnimer's, Beolost Rd.
description: Townswomen and loiterers cluster around a local well, which is constructed of stone with a slate overhang that provides a spot for rest and conversation.  The oft-swept, cobbled square also contains the baker's shop and its adjoining tea room, and several other small merchants.

title: Town Square, Garden Niche
description: This small niche between two buildings has been neatly landscaped into a tiny moonlit garden, its careful mosaic of flagstones interspersed with patches of trimmed grass.  A low stone bench rests along one vine-covered wall, and a patch of colorful violets surrounds a painted wooden barrel in one corner.

title: Wehnimer's, Stormarm St.
description: The simple yet well built wooden structures in this small residential section of town are more functional than decorative, and little separates the style of one from another.  A few scraggly trees, planted long ago in patches of dirt between the buildings, add spots of deeper shadow to the cobblestones.

title: Wehnimer's, Stormarm St.
description: Along this neighborhood byway, wagons loaded with sacks of grain, kegs of beer, and firewood stand at the wide door of a local warehouse.  Merchants, tradesmen and other night workers of the surrounding streets busily load and unload stored supplies here.

title: Wehnimer's, Taarna Rd.
description: A small house is set back from the curve in the road, in the midst of a carefully tended garden of strange plants.  A twisting path leading to the door is lined with carved wooden pots in which grow many species of pungent herbs.  Two modwir saplings entwine over the door, forming a leafy arch.

title: Wehnimer's, Taarna Rd.
description: What traffic flows here at night mostly heads north towards the palisade along the bay and east to the riverfront.  A decrepit single-story pawnshop, its paint peeling and dimly lit window panes broken, stands here alongside the shadowy lane.

title: Wehnimer's, Lanthar Rd.
description: Lanthar Road leads east and west here, serving as a passage between the local inns and warehouses bordering the riverfront district and the center of Wehnimer's Landing.  A stray jarlik sniffs at a patch of grass growing between cracks in the cobbled pavement to one side of the road.

title: Wehnimer's, Cul-de-Sac
description: Broken bottles, discarded rubbish, and uneasy feelings pervade this dank, ill-lit dead end.  Several unsavory-looking citizens seem to be lurking here and there in the shadows for want of anything better to do, and the scratching of rats can be heard from within the nearby walls.  A pile of old crates is stacked against the back wall of the alley.

title: Herbalist's, Dispensary
description: Redolent with a sweet, almost cinnamony fragrance, the herbalist's shop is dominated by a glass counter.  It contains small pouches of bark, leaves, berries and stems.  Syiah Kintaru, master herbalist, stands behind it, grinding herbs with a porcelain mortar and pestle.

title: Wehnimer's, Bridge
description: The heavy wood-planked bridge is old, but stands steady against the deep, dark river waters on massive stone pilings below.  Rope railings attached to weathered wooden posts are the only guard against a cold plunge in the Locksmehr, but the span is wide enough to bear the traffic without mishap.  The shadowy profiles of wooden buildings dot the east bank, and to the west lies the more heavily populated main part of town.

title: Wehnimer's, East Crossing
description: A wide bridge spans the dark waters of the Locksmehr River to the west, groaning beneath the wheels of the occasional passing wagon or oxcart.  The shouts of drivers to move aside and the clicking noises they make to urge their weary animals along echo through the damp night air.  A gravel footpath leads north, and the outlines of a few buildings loom farther to the east.

title: Wehnimer's, River Ramble
description: The path bends slightly here to follow the natural flow of the river.  To the west, the sounds of wheels clamoring on the cobblestones indicate that a main thoroughfare is near.  An old warehouse, seemingly abandoned yet somehow sinister-looking, casts a shadow over the dirt-paved road.

title: Wehnimer's, River Ramble
description: The unpaved path that passes for a road here runs between the riverbank and the backs of several old buildings.  The slick, rocky surface makes for uneven footing, forcing wayfarers to keep close to the supporting walls of the wooden structures to avoid a slip down the bank into the dark river waters.

title: Wehnimer's, River Ramble
description: Several wooden planks form shaky makeshift bridges over gaps in the path where it has collapsed into the swirling river currents.  A sturdy length of timber shores up the rear wall of the building to the east, staving off its imminent slide down the riverbank along with the remaining sections of the crumbling walkway.

title: Wehnimer's, Ilstar Lane
description: This alley spans the short distance between the eastern wall and the riverbank.  The blank back walls of the alchemist's house and the cooper's shop provide an unremarkable view.  Wharf rats scurry among at the debris in the lane, scampering into the shadows only when it becomes clear to them that their tails are in imminent danger of being trampled.

title: Wehnimer's, East Ring Rd.
description: There are few buildings in this far corner of the Landing, and the eastern wall of the palisade that separates the streets from the wilderness beyond is so near that it casts a shadow over nearly the entire road.  Clinging precariously to the wide north wall of the sprawling brewery is the more diminutive square form of the cooper's shop.

title: Wehnimer's, Vesitsa Place
description: From here, the greying base of the northeastern river guardtower dominates the landscape.  The massive structure overshadows the plain house by the side of the path, as it looks out, brooding and purposeful, over the town's river gates and the bay to the north.  A handpainted sign hangs in front of the smaller dwelling.

title: Wehnimer's, East Ring Rd.
description: The broad, red brick bulk of a local brewery dominates the street.  A few night workers clad in drab smocks and leather aprons loiter around the structure, taking a break for a pipe and a mug of ale.  The old oaken sign that hangs above the brewery gate squeaks back and forth on iron hinges in the night wind that blows in from the waters to the north and west.

title: Wehnimer's, East Ring Rd.
description: East Ring Road rejoins the Landing's palisades here and continues on inside it to its northernmost conclusion.  An occasional wagon laden with goods passes by, its metal-rimmed wheels echoing in the night as they strike rough spots in the pavement.  The merest hint of the scent of flowers and fragrant herbs drifts over from the south.

title: East Row, Courtyard
description: Built up against the south wall of the brewery compound is a nondescript warehouse.  The courtyard has spotty, neatly trimmed grass, though a fairly straight patch of dirt bisects the area to the north and south.

title: East Row, Ebonwood Way
description: Passing beyond a tall brick brewery to the northwest, a row of scraggly new ebonwood trees line the pathway heading east, while a broad fel tree marks the road to the north.

title: East Row, Fel Road
description: A squat fel tree stands at the southwest corner of the intersection.  Twin rows of small white stones mark the passage east.

title: East Row, Modwir Way
description: A pair of modwirs stand sentinel for the roadway heading east.  A cooing morning dove lends a rhythmic pace to the surroundings, causing merchant and townsfolk alike to walk slowly along the dusty paths in measured time.

title: East Row, Monir Road
description: A pair of monir line the road, one to the west and the other to the southeast.  Some holly bushes are visible to the north, though they seem scraggly even from here.  The way east is wide and paved with cobblestones, a drastic improvement in comparison to the other roads of the area.

title: East Row, Holly Road
description: A massive monir tree to the southwest blocks any major construction of large shops, though some smaller ones managed to squeeze in.  The intersection is haphazardly lined with holly bushes, whose rich green leaves lack fruit and flower adornment.

title: East Row, Spinewood Way
description: Despite the road's namesake, there isn't a single growth of spinewood to be seen.  Instead, the roadway is lined by hulking monir barrels filled with miniature stylized spinewood trees, complete with artificial pale pink flowers.

title: East Row, Tanik Road
description: Newly planted tanik trees line the row, while a thick stand of pines grow to the north.  The road is part rubble and dirt here, stretching eastward toward the town's protective wall.

title: East Row, Pine Point
description: The backside of cottages on the rocky cliffs of Bay's Watch neighborhood is barely visible beyond the dense stand of aged pine trees to the north.  There are mere clumps of grass to the side of the dirt and rock-strewn road.

title: East Row, Pine Point
description: The road dips down here, following the natural curvature of the land.  As a result, the pines growing in the area are tilted somewhat askew.

title: East Row, Pine Point
description: Beyond the shops to the south, newly planted tanik trees mingle with a well-established growth of old pines.  The rocky roadway goes on, though to the west, it dips down slightly.

title: East Row, Pine Point
description: The aged pines to the north do little to inhibit the sea's salty breeze from wafting over the area.  The ground here is rough and the roadway is littered with broken bits of red and blue-grey rock.

title: East Row, Pine Point
description: The lazy sound of a distant bay echos against the backdrop of the simple plank shops lining the southern side of the road.

title: East Row, Tanik Road
description: A few tanik trees are set far off the beaten path of the roadway, conveniently planted to allow for growth of new buildings.  Unlike most portions of East Row, this part is not covered by shade of trees.

title: East Row, Tanik Road
description: Dwarfed in comparison to their adult form, the new growth of tanik trees sport long, droopy branches.  Covered in needles, the tanik branches arc upward just barely missing the rooftops of the nearby shops.

title: East Row, Tanik Road
description: Some of the tanik in this area are decorated with small ornaments and colorful strings of yarn.  A few of the shops in the area are similarily adorned, giving the area a fancifully themed appearance.

title: East Row, Tanik Road
description: A single, large tanik grows diagonally, leaning precariously against the log fortification wall.  The droopy branches begin about a third of the way up the tree's length, with the ends jutting upward to narrowly avoid the heads of tall passersby.

title: East Row, Spinewood Way
description: The ceramic planters lining the roadway are stark white, though the stylized spinewood trees within them are painted in a vivid chromatic rendition of the typical sort.  The southern portion of the intersection is cobbled with plain stones, contrasting greatly from the roadway to the east and west.

title: East Row, Spinewood Way
description: A profusion of decorative grasses fills the area between the shops, while to the south, a line of monir trees is visible beyond the rooftops.  Lining the way east and west, fake carved spinewood trees sprout out with stylized vigor from yellow ceramic pots.

title: East Row, Spinewood Way
description: Garish orange planters of ceramic line the dirty roadway, each one spaced evenly from the next.  Each pot houses a single fake spinewood tree, carved of some shoddy wood, then painted accordingly.  The shops of the area are painted in similar hues of orange, yellow and green.

title: East Row, Spinewood Way
description: Unlike the other roads of East Row, this one does not end in a profusion of foliage or plantlife.  Spinewood Way ends at the town's fortification walls, which are composed of log and post construction.  No attempt is made to beautify the area, save for the neatly trimmed lawns near each shop.

title: East Row, Holly Road
description: The profusion of holly hedges to the east and west come to an abrupt halt, held at bay by four gaudy, miniature spinewood tree replicas in ceramic pots.  Uncharacteristically, the intersection is paved in cobblestones, creating a courtyard effect out of the area.

title: East Row, Holly Road
description: Twin rows of holly bushes define the dusty roadway, which is barely wide enough to clear a pair of wagons.  Coming and going from local shops, children and their mothers dart between the shrubbery, one clearly in the tow of the other.

title: East Row, Holly Road
description: Indicating a portion of the area less frequenty traveled, spotty grass dots the roadway.  A pair of crooked pine trees bow over the area, creating a natural canopy overhead, while newly-trimmed holly bushes and whitewashed shops invite visitors off the beaten path.

title: East Row, Holly Road
description: As if trying to hide the log fortifications to the east, a thick patch of mature holly bushes grow unattended in wild and splaying directions.  Their scraggly branches reach the ground and almost over the wall, clearly accomplishing the intended purpose.

title: East Row, Monir Road
description: Some new monir trees create a semicircular courtyard out of the area, while some holly trees to the north and a massive modwir to the south make completing the round difficult.  The cobblestones here are neatly swept, their placement and positioning systematic and maintained.

title: East Row, Monir Road
description: A trio of stunted monir trees grow here, one to the south and two to the north.  The road to the east and west is paved with simple brown cobblestones, and not a one is missing.  The way is easy and clean, indicating recent renovations of the area.

title: East Row, Monir Road
description: A massive monir tree makes a roundabout of the roadway, slicing the avenue of perfectly placed paving stones in two.  Small clumps of grass grow about the hulking tree trunk, but just like everything else on this road, the grass is neatly trimmed.

title: East Row, Monir Road
description: The massive, hulking posts of the fortifications to the east are reinforced with large stakes of monir, as if the wall here was once a weak point.  To the west, a variety smaller monir trees line the roadway, their boughs braced upon one another in a natural, arching motion.

title: East Row, Modwir Way
description: A single large modwir stands in the center of the intersection, forcing the traffic into a bowed diversion.  High above, the tree's clumpy branches are dotted with moderately sized cones, though a few are also scattered across the roadway below.

title: East Row, Modwir Way
description: The almost fuzzy look of the modwir's foliage above casts bland and diffuse shadows on the ground.  Far from impressive, a twin row of plain cobblestones lines the road heading toward the fortifcations to the east.

title: East Row, Modwir Way
description: High above, the clumpy foliage of scarcely planted modwirs only partially blots out view of the sky.  Heading east and west, the roadway is marked by a curb of plain cobblestone.

title: East Row, Modwir Way
description: Built almost up to the trunk of a tall modwir, a post and log fortification wall separates the town from the dull hum of the wilds to the east.  Occasionally, the sound of a lone coyote's yipping can be heard beyond.

title: East Row, Fel Road
description: The southern portion of the intersection is lined with ebonwood trees, while the northern half is dotted with modwir.  To the east and west, hulking fel trees create a hefty canopy overhead.

title: East Row, Fel Road
description: Fel trees are planted widely apart, though their massive tops overlap to create natural cover from above.  Small white stones mark the edge of the road, distinguishing the dirt of the walkway from the entryway to the shops scattered throughout

title: East Row, Fel Road
description: Squat fel trees are disbursed evenly throughout the area, planted deliberately to the sides of the white stone-lined roadway.  Far to the east, the growth of trees becomes more densely packed.

title: East Row, Fel Road
description: Entering from the west, small white stones lining the road end in a small semicircle before the large trees to the east.  A trio of massive fel trees dwarf the fortification wall, their heavy boughs draping over its top.

title: East Row, Ebonwood Way
description: Dwarfed by fel trees to the north, small and scraggly ebonwood trees stand guard at each corner of the intersection.  The wide pathway cuts directly through the melee of shops, ending far to the east at the town's fortified walls.

title: East Row, Ebonwood Way
description: Creating a natural end to the roadway, young ebonwood trees are packed more densely here.  Visible beyond the new growth to the east, the town's wooden fortifications loom overhead.

title: East Row, Ebonwood Way
description: Twin rows of ebonwood trees continue east and west, evenly spaced to accommodate for growth of new storefronts.  The dusty road is wide enough to allow passage for a wagon, though no deep ruts are present.

title: Wehnimer's, Garden
description: A small, well-tended garden surrounds a little shack here.  Clipped traesharm berry bushes serve as a low fence, enclosing the herbs and flowers of the plot.  A garden bower, made of modwir twigs twisted together and covered with flowering vines, shelters a bench of finely polished onyx.

title: Wehnimer's, Garden Close
description: A winding path leads to a small house with a pleasant garden.  The sheltering curve of the town wall and the gently invigorating breeze off the river make this a restful spot to linger.

title: House Aspis, Outside the Gate
description: At the end of the quiet lane you come upon a high stone wall.  Set into the midst of the wall is an elaborate wrought-iron gate.  Next to the gate, a polished silver plaque is inset into the stonework.

title: Wehnimer's, Garden
description: This small, shady end of the garden forms a little moonlit glade tucked up against the curve of the palisade as it cradles the Landing at the southeast corner.  Night-blooming flowers and shrubs surround a quiet patch of cool grass, a few steps away from the hustle and bustle of town.

title: Wehnimer's, Garden Copse
description: The bushes and shrubs grow a bit wilder here, in the shadow of the town wall.  A thick clump of trees of moderate height seem to huddle together as if concealing something.  A narrow footpath through them leads south.

title: Wehnimer's, Bay's Watch East
description: This remote northeast end of Wehnimer's Landing, swept by the fresh breeze from the bay, seems far removed from the commerce and activity of the town to the west.  A few guards and militiamen patrol here, the intense look on their faces as the watches come and go bespeaking of the importance of the round-the-clock vigil they keep.

title: Empath Guild, Entrance
description: Deep gravel crunches loudly underfoot.  A tall, well-constructed wall of yellow brick bends away to the east and west as if enclosing an area the size of a small house.  In the center the wall is interrupted by a pair of open gates flanked by wall mounted torches.  Ivy clambers out of two large red clay pots and up the gates, holding fast to them and preventing them from closing.  A silver plaque is mounted on the wall.

title: Cooper's Shop, Front Room
description: This busy cooper's shop does a thriving business in barrels and casks, selling most to the brewery next door.  The sound of scraping and planing comes from the southeast.  You see the cooper and several apprentices intently inspecting staves of oak and modwir wood for the next batch of barrels.

title: Cooper's Shop, Workshop
description: The crunch of wood shavings underfoot and the tangy scent of newly cut lumber indicate barrels are fitted and joined in this open workshop.  Mallets, chisels and hammers are neatly arranged in a tool chest on the floor.  Kegs in various states of completion surround you.

title: Landing Hall, Courtyard
description: A large domed structure of solid granite rests in the middle of a grass clearing, seemingly out of place from the bustling streets outside.  The dome of gold rises grandly from the roof of the building, providing a shining beacon in the moonlight.  Brilliant stained glass is set along the bottom circumference of the dome, adding a touch of color to the gold.  A narrow cobblestone path leads to the massive oak doors that provide entry into the building.

title: Krythussa's Confectionary Shop
description: A barrage of sweet-smelling chocolate, candy, and other goodies assaults the senses as their scents fill the air of the quaint but simple confectionary.  Crystal shelves stacked with glass jars in a variety of shapes and colors line the walls.  The pale light of the moon, accompanied by several multicolored handblown globed lanterns, creates a dazzling array of colors across the floor.  A glass counter stands to the left of a small alcove.

title: Moot Hall, Great Lobby
description: This is the great lobby of the Moot Hall.  Hushed voices discussing urgent town matters echo off the high ceiling.  The walls are draped in rich tapestries framing niches that hold marble busts of local dignitaries.  Ahead of you is a double door, and to your left, a mahogany door bearing a silver plaque.

title: Moot Hall, Storage Facility
description: You are in the anteroom of the public storage locker facility.  This area is busy with clerks going over paperwork.  A hallway leads east to the locker booths.

title: Moot Hall, Storage Hall
description: You are in a darkly lit hallway which travels east and west.  On the north wall is a curtained opening.

title: Moot Hall, Storage Hall
description: You are in a darkly lit hallway which travels east and west.  On the north wall is a curtained opening.

title: Moot Hall, Storage Hall
description: You are in a darkly lit hallway which intersects another running north-south.  The east wall of the hallway contains a curtained opening, as do most of the walls along the corridor.

title: Moot Hall, Storage Hall
description: You are in a darkly lit hallway which runs north-south.  On the east wall is a curtained opening, and to the north you can see what looks like an intersection leading out of the storage area.

title: Moot Hall, Storage Hall
description: You are in a darkly lit hallway which ends here at a curtained opening along its east wall.  To the north you can see what looks like an intersection leading out of the storage area.

title: Moot Hall, Storage Hall
description: You are in a darkly lit hallway which ends here at the north wall.  On the east wall is a curtained opening and to the south you can see what looks like an intersection leading out of the storage area.

title: Moot Hall, Landing
description: You are on the landing of the second story of the Moot Hall.  The dust on the bannister and the cobwebs in the corner of the room indicate this part of the building does not see many visitors, in spite of what the sign on the varnished modwir door here says.

title: Moot Hall, Upstairs Corridor
description: This part of the upstairs corridor is fairly busy.  Several benches line the walls alongside the sturdy oak door at the far end.  Citizens of various ranks and classes mill about, grasping scrolls and bundles of documents in their hands and talking in serious whispers.

title: Moot Hall, Upstairs Corridor
description: This end of the hallway is quieter, its hardwood floor muffled by a large burgundy-colored rug.  Potted plants, well-watered but looking a bit starved for sun in their dark corners, stand on two elaborate brass tables on either side of a richly carved mahogany door at the end of the hall.

title: Citizenship Office
description: Soft chimes emanate from a delicate crystal chandelier that hangs overhead.  As the chandelier rotates slowly on its axis, the crystal prisms refract the light from the candles' flames and lengthen the shadows over the walls and floor.  Twin filing cabinets, roughly the height of a halfling, occupy opposite corners of the office.  Swaying gently above and behind the intricately carved desk hangs a royal-blue silken banner with the words, "Welcome One And All," embroidered in gold thread.

title: First Elanith Bank, Lobby
description: An ancient gnoll keeps a watchful, though nervous, eye over the people visiting Wehnimer's Landing's main bank, the First Elanith Secure Stronghold.  Large, dirty windows allow little air to disturb the layers of dust on the threadbare carpet.  The few flickering candles around the room add virtually no light.  A broken gate from a teller's window sits in the corner.

title: First Elanith Bank, Teller
description: Most of the teller windows that line this room are missing the gates and gratings that once secured them.  Impatient clients stand at one of the two intact windows, waiting to get the attention of the tellers on the other side.

title: Aznell's Armory, Forge
description: Bits and pieces of armor adorn the walls, leather on one, and metal on the facing wall.  Scraps of leather and metal are littered across the floor, thickest near the iron anvil where apprentices are working on a misshapen lump of metal.  The heat and the closeness of the forge press in around you.

title: Tykel's Arms, Showroom
description: Glancing about the interior of the shop reveals all manner of bladed weapons, from daggers to twohanded swords.  Most of the weaponry is wrought in bronze, although finer specimens reflect the glint of steel.  All seem to share an air about them that says, "This weapon is meant to be used".  Tykel the Weaponsmith stands ready to sing the praises of his handiwork.

title: Tykel's Arms, Backroom
description: This is the quiet backroom of the weaponsmith's shop.  Here are stored prized pieces of exquisite armor and weapons, most either ancient heirlooms or crafted by famous armorers from throughout the land.

title: Dakris's Furs, Front Room
description: This is the large front room of the furrier's shop.  Roughly hewn planks, supported by wooden barrels, span the space and serve as a counter.  Behind it presides Dakris the Furrier, purveyor of rare furs and hides.  A few simple chairs are randomly scattered along the dirt floor.  Across the room, to the southeast, you see a doorway covered only by a draped velnalin hide.

title: Dakris's Furs, Rugs and Bedding
description: Several varieties of animal skin rugs compete for floor space with piles of hides, mats and pillows.  The overall effect gives the room a rugged, yet cozy, feel.  With floor space so limited, some of the finer rugs have been mounted on the walls for ease of display and to add room for more samples.

title: Dakris's Furs, Showroom
description: The hides and heads of various violent beasts have been stuffed, preserved then mounted on the unfinished walls of the showroom.  Sawdust has covered the counter and accumulated in small piles on the floor about its edges.  The faint smell of preserving chemicals leaves a rather unpleasant aroma in the air.

title: Kilron's Pawnshop, Front Room
description: This little pawnshop is somewhat cheerier than you would expect, presided over by its well-dressed and well-heeled owner, Kilron.  A polished white marble counter is set off by freshly whitewashed walls and a highly varnished wood floor.  An antique cabinet on the far wall holds several impressive and equally ancient weapons, some precious trinkets, and several items that you cannot identify, except that they seem to glow in different shades of colored light with different intensities.

title: Pawn Shop, Backroom
description: This backroom is where many of the items pawned are offered for resale.  On one wall a prominent sign reads, "Warning:  All items that are sold here are used merchandise and sold on an "as-is" basis with no guarantees and no refunds. -- Kilron".  A sales clerk stands nearby, ready to offer help with any purchases.

title: Hearthstone, Courtyard
description: Before you stands a grand old manor, framed by huge willows to the east and west.  The elegant trees sway gently in the moonlight, dappling the cobblestone courtyard with ever-shifting patterns of light and dark.  Snippets of conversation drift away from the long porch stretching along the full width of the great old house, as several guests enjoy the hospitality and ambience of this fine hideaway.

title: Wehnimer's Exterior
description: Tall oaks and modwir pines have grown up along the outer edge of the western palisade surrounding Wehnimer's Landing.  To the north you hear the sound of horses stamping impatiently against the wooden walls of their stables as they await their turn in the Jousting Arena.  The wind whispers softly through the trees, bringing you a sense of peace as you wander.  A shady path leads off to the southwest, sheltered by a thick stand of modwirs.

title: Hearthstone, Front Porch
description: Airy and open, the porch is enclosed by smooth, freshly painted white modwir up to a height of about four feet.  As you ponder the sky-blue color of the ceiling and a lacework of deep green ivy that crisscrosses the open space between posts, the hubbub of the world beyond quickly fades away.  Rocking chairs of various sizes are an inviting sight, and an elegant green marble arch provides a tantalizing view of the splendors inside the old manor.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Dining Room
description: Loud and abusive noises emanate from behind the swinging kitchen doors, much to the laughing delight of some of the customers, and to the chagrin of others.  Tapestries hanging from the walls depict soothing idyllic wildlife scenes.  Hard wooden tables and chairs are placed evenly, allowing enough space for the cook and wait servants to pass.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Barroom
description: A long and polished wooden bar occupies the whole north wall of the tavern here in The Raging Thrak, which is named for the fiery proprietor.  Hard wooden chairs, tables and benches are spaced liberally throughout the room.  The tavern does good business, and seems to be at least half full, no matter what time of day.

title: Moot Hall, Registrar's Office
description: This cramped, dusty office displays all the standard appointments that mark it as serving an extremely important role in the bureaucracy of the town government.  Dilapidated, make-shift shelves are crammed full of books and papers that bear no evidence of being organized in any useful manner.  Everything is covered with a thick layer of dust, and the walls and ceiling are stained with black from the smoke that rises from the single, small lamp that rests on a high desk in the center of the room.

title: Clerics' Shop, Salesroom
description: The atmosphere in this shop is one of quiet contemplation.  The walls are covered with somber murals depicting the gods and heroes of Elanthia in their ongoing struggles against the forces of the Undead.  Racks along the walls hold gleaming weapons that seem almost to glow with an inner light of their own.  The shop's proprietor, Brother Wuldreth, attends to business with serene determination.

title: Elaraeyn's Boutique
description: Illumination from smoky oil lamps reflects off polished glaes walls etched with delicate runes, making pale shadows appear to dance in the flickering light.  To one side of the room sits an oak clothes rack with some stuff hanging on it.

title: River Tower East, Headquarters
description: Papers are strewn over the desk that stands in the middle of the room.  On the wall behind the desk is a banner with the insignia of the guard regiment assigned to man the walls and watchtowers of Wehnimer's Landing.

title: River Tower East, Barracks
description: You enter a square room with cots pushed back against the walls and a trunk at the foot of each bed.  Everything in the room denotes order and readiness.  In times of emergency, the extra militia sleep here.  To the north a recessed alcove is partly obscured by spare uniforms hanging from hooks.

title: River Tower East, Alcove
description: Once in the alcove you are surprised to see a room of quite comfortable dimensions.  A window slit looks out on the log walls of the surrounding stockade and across the choppy waters of Darkstone Bay.  A hooded cloak and a floppy-brimmed felt hat are laid out on a dressing table, and beside them are scattered some notes in an unrecognizable cipher.

title: Alchemist's House, Shop
description: The front part of the small house serves as an alchemist's shop.  The cramped room is filled with various ramshackle furnishings holding all manner of amulets, wands, phials, and magical potions.  A locked glass-paned bookcase holds ancient volumes and magical scrolls.  A strong steel door is set into the back wall.

title: Alchemist's House, Library
description: The hushed silence of this dark, dusty library envelops you.  Though draped with plush curtains, the room is bathed in a soothing golden light.  Atop a reading table, an ancient alchemical treatise in an obscure script lies open, surrounded by quills, parchment and other tools of scholarly research.  A low arch leads east.

title: A Rainbow-Colored Tent
description: Light from a few scattered candles reflects from the gaily striped rainbow-colored walls of the tent, illuminating the bare interior with a faint multihued glow.  Bits of charred wood and fabric and what looks like a few fragments of bone are imbedded in the freshly packed dirt floor, and a vague scent of something burnt hangs in the air like a memory.

title: Caverns, Twisting Tunnel
description: The tunnel is barely large enough for a giantman to squeeze through, and smells strongly of clay and unwashed dwarf.  It winds down from the tent above, its twists and turns hiding whatever lies below from view.

title: Reignbeau Caverns
description: Many-hued clay forms the walls, ceiling, and floor of this low, twisting cavern.  Dozens of stalactites drip thick liquids in every color of the rainbow.  It takes a keen eye and a quick step to avoid an unintended change in hair color.  The clay that oozes from the walls and drops from above forms dozens of multihued puddles around you.  Grumbling, uncooperative dwarves loiter in every corner.

title: Reignbeau Caverns, Tunnel
description: Small tunnels branch out in every direction and it's hard to be sure which one you entered through, let alone which to leave through.  Colored footprints dot the floor, wandering in every direction.

title: Reignbeau Caverns, Order Room
description: A massive dye-stained stone counter dominates the muddy rock-walled chamber, overseen by a disgruntled-looking dwarven clerk who glares and mutters to himself at each customer's approach.  Behind the counter, a dwarf-sized tunnel leads into some mysterious back room from which sounds of splashing and cursing and grumbling can be heard.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Trophy Room
description: The charred form of a fireplace occasionally billows small clouds of dust from a spot away from the crowd in the tavern.  Charred animal skins lie before the hearth, flanked on either side by clawed and raggedly ripped couches.  Broken and blackened trophies of forgotten hunts line the burnt and stained walls.

title: Frith's Inn, Parlour
description: This room is a bit quieter than the main saloon.  A fireplace of large river stones dominates the far wall, a fire within it crackling cheerfully.  Sturdy tables fill the room, awaiting paying customers.  Serving wenches bustle about, always ready with a smile and a foam-topped tankard of ale.

title: Frith's Inn, Main Saloon
description: Drawn by the aroma of good food and strong drink, you enter the main saloon.  The innkeeper presides merrily, ensuring everyone gets a share of attention from the pretty serving wenches and the handsome lad behind the bar.  Long benches and rectangular tables seat high-spirited patrons.

title: Frith's Inn, Front Desk
description: The front room of this unassuming inn imparts a sense of warmth and comfort.  Serving wenches carrying trays of food and drink to rooms throughout the hostelry cast a welcoming glance at you as they pass.  Laughter and the sound of good fellowship reach your ears from the direction of some swinging doors.  At the mahogany front desk, the friendly proprietor stands ready to attend to your needs.

title: Gemcutter's, Front Room
description: Inside the Gemcutter's shop, you see two glass showcases holding jewelry and precious stones.  Directly ahead of you is a low desk with several racks holding tools of the Gemcutter's trade.

title: Crimson Crocus Table
description: Three bright blue bowls on the table contrast sharply with the crimson crocuses blooming in them.  The combination of the thick, light green leaves and red blossoms against the ceramic pottery is very eye-catching.

title: Ravenswood, Forest
description: The path winds through a small clearing.  The patch of sunlight between the trees is filled with a heavy growth of bright green ferns that stands four feet high.  Bright yellow butterflies flitter around trails leading through the ferns to several small cottages set back in the shadows of the woods.

title: Reignbeau Caverns, Tunnel
description: Small tunnels branch out in every direction and it's hard to be sure which one you entered through, let alone which to leave through.  Colored footprints dot the floor, wandering in every direction.

title: Wayside Inn, Dining Room
description: This ramshackle hostel bears the signs of rough use by hard-bitten travellers and headstrong adventurers.  Several blade-scarred tables and low stools are lined up against the walls, while the central area is dominated by a large firepit around which is a low platform covered with a few ratty bearskins.  The clatter of clay tankards and the smell of humble victuals provide some small comfort to the steady stream of wayfarers who pause here to meet and greet one another.

title: Indigo Iris Table
description: A shallow rectangular dish in the center of the table holds an arrangement of irises and maple branches.  The branches have been preserved with their red-gold autumn leaves still affixed to them, providing a sharp contrast to the deep indigo of the irises.

title: Fragrant Freesia Table
description: A small bouquet of freesias fills the air around the table with a heady fragrance.  Narrow green and blue ribbons are tied around the neck of the simple glass jar that serves as a vase, giving the table a rather homespun air.

title: Giant Thrak Table
description: In an effort to accomodate larger clientele, this section of the table has been raised on wooden blocks, which does nothing to increase the stability of its surface.  Two of the chairs gathered here are oversized, padded chairs with high winged sides.  Squarely in the center of this section is a block-style thrak figure painted dark grey.

title: Aesthetic Aster Table
description: A tall, slender ceramic vase filled with golden asters sits primly in the center of the table.  Carefully starched and folded linen napkins sit squarely in the centers of four matching pewter plates.

title: Wehnimer's Historical Society
description: A curious variety of artifacts punctuate the rough pine walls, ranging from a scuffed and tarnished Giantman clan armband to a remarkably well-preserved Dwarven pickaxe.  Small woolen tapestry rugs cover most of the floor, overlapping in casual disarray.  Sitting on the narrow table in the center of the room is a woven basket full of Sylvan woodcarvings.

title: Dancing Daisy Table
description: Suspended from the ceiling is a mirrored planter box.  Dozens of daisies -- yellow, white, light purple -- crowd the box and sway gently as though dancing in the air.

title: Shady Table
description: Several chairs surround a marble table which sits in a patch of shade cast by the vine-covered wall.  Three small finches enjoy each other's company nearby, their chattering conversation fills the air as they chase each other around the courtyard and preen on the fountain.

title: Silvergate, A Small Courtyard
description: An ivy-covered wall surrounds this small, enclosed courtyard.  Several comfortable tables, resting on tiles set into the close-cropped grass, are scattered about the courtyard, with plenty of room between them for privacy.  You faintly hear the sounds of the city coming from the other side of the wall, and in the distance you can see the towers of the temple as they rise over the rest of the city.

title: Silvergate, Private Lounge
description: The grey stone of the manor walls is softened by a silvery wool carpet and large tapestries depicting the histories of the peoples of this land.  Comfortable chairs and a sofa, flanked by end tables, are arranged to provide a quiet spot to sit and compare notes at the end of a long day's hunt.  In the far corner of the lounge you see a silver veined marble bar, its mahogany base gleaming in the light which filters through windows overlooking the wilderness beyond this haven.

title: Silvergate, Foyer
description: Comfortable sofas fronted with low tables are arranged neatly around this welcoming lobby.  Well-placed sconces highlight the paintings and statues which decorate the walls.  Small groups of smiling people pass through, filling the lobby with their voices, while at the far end of the room a cheerful clerk stands behind a large modwir desk, busily attending to the Inn's guests.  To the southwest is a secure-looking ancient oak door.

title: Silvergate, Grand Ballroom
description: Burgundy and gold damask frame the arched windows and alcoves lining the walls of this spacious room.  The polished oak floor beckons you to the dance while comfortable sofas fill the alcoves, inviting guests weary from the dance to rest.  A marble archway to the north leads to the foyer.

title: Silvergate Inn, Tea Room
description: Tiny, colorful songbirds and magnificent honeysuckle vines on hand-painted white silk wall coverings reach up to the high, coffered ceiling.  Lit crystal-shaded golden oil lamps rest on tables scattered around the plush green carpet.  Overstuffed armchairs circle each table.  A tall leaded glass window offering a view of a bustling courtyard neatly frames a wide bench seat with pale golden silk cushions.  Opposite the window is a tray-covered pearwood sideboard.

title: Silvergate, Grand Hall
description: Although large and open, this hallway manages to feel cozy.  Burgundy wool carpet covers the stone floors and a wide stone staircase with garland-trimmed bannisters which rises gracefully to the upper levels of this fine old manor house.  Carved oak display cases flank the foot of the stairs and fill most of the eastern wall.  Opposite the stairs, well-cushioned sofas and chairs are grouped around each of four large leaded glass windows.

title: Silvergate, Lion's Den Pub
description: Bemused, your eyes wander around this well-occupied lounge.  Happy conversations drift on the air with only an occasional voice rising in heated argument.  A serving maid deftly weaves her way from the bar through the maze of tables arranged in the center of the room, serving platter expertly balanced in her hands.  Among the high-backed booths lining the walls, you see one that appears to be unoccupied.

title: Silvergate, Courtyard
description: A magnificent grey stone manor rises before you.  Thick arrays of ivy climb the ancient walls and frame a set of arched doors leading into the manor itself.  Flanking the main building, twin towers rise gracefully, providing a striking balance and harmony to the view.

title: Silvergate Inn, Lion's Den Pub
description: The serving maid stops in at each of the tables to check on her customers, and she nods a greeting in your direction.  The conversation is louder here, and someone's cigar adds to the smoky haze that fills one side of the room.

title: Red Table
description: Fine red linen fabric with yellow and orange swirling flame embroidery covers this table elegantly set for four.  The crystal goblets and polished silverware reflect the light of nearby flickering candles.

title: Twin Thraks Table
description: A collection of highly polished shields hangs on the wall beside this table, reflecting the table and its occupants in a softly rounded way.  A thick candle with three lit wicks appears to burn all the brighter for being reflected in the burnished surfaces of so many shields.  A pair of identical thraks are painted on the table.

title: Esculent Echinacea Table
description: Carved onto the wooden surface of the table is a bouquet of echinacea and ferns.  The fringed petals of the blossoms are tinted a pale lavender.  The flowers are so realistically depicted that one of them appears to have been nibbled at by a passing animal.

title: Thrakling Table
description: Tallow candles set in tin pans light this table, their heavy scent mingling with the smells of roasts and ales in the Inn's air.  A moth, having fluttered too close to the flames, has fallen onto its back in one of the pans.  Little thraklings are painted beside egg-shaped knot holes, as though they are emerging from their nest.

title: Land Tower East, Office
