description: The ground floor of this guard tower appears to be some kind of office.  A single guard sits behind one of the desks reviewing some paperwork.  A small wood stove in the corner provides heat to the room.

title: Pink Thrak Table
description: Several heavy notches line the edges of this table.  You wonder briefly what was being tallied, and by whom.  In the center of the table is a painting of a pink thrak sniffing a daisy.

title: Helga's Tavern, Barroom
description: The blended odors of ale, sweat, leather, perfume and hearty stew fill the stifling air of the tavern.  Disheveled regulars and road-weary travelers rub elbows at the wooden bar, which looks recently varnished but already bears a variety of stains and grime.  Helga, the ancient, obese proprietor, moves behind the bar, wiping glasses with a dirty towel as she keeps a beady eye on the patrons.  A small fireplace in one corner burns feebly, adding little light or warmth to the room.

title: The New Look, Hair Coloration
description: The canvas walls of this small pavilion are hung with carefully tied bundles of hair in a variety of colors.  A vat of lye sits next to the pinned-back tent flap, but even that extra ventilation isn't enough to keep the harsh vapors from stinging your eyes.  Casually stacked on a low counter are bowls of henna paste, vinegar, sodden ashes, and dark ink.

title: Healer's Tent, Treatment Room
description: A sense of relief and anticipation pervades the softly-lit tent.  The makeshift room, small and crowded with the ill and wounded, contains the astringent odor of balms and ungents.  Old rugs depicting the healing powers of various deities and magical practices lie on the ground.  At the far end of the tent stands a long, padded table.

title: Rolling Thrak Table
description: Rich, red clay soil has been ground into the table top, giving it a mottled appearance.  A picture of a thrak rolling around on its back in a patch of grass has been painted in the center of the table.

title: Jeweled Jasmine Table
description: A clear glaes dome forms the centerpiece of the table.  Within the dome is a bouquet of creamy jasmine blossoms and maidenhair ferns.  Small, grey pearls take the place of the stamens in each flower.

title: Ancient Thrak Table
description: Smooth to the touch, the edges of the table and the chairs placed here are comfortably worn.  Even the letters carved into the table top are now shallow, perhaps carved by lovers, long ago.  The outline of an old thrak curls around one set of initials.  The only feature not worn away by time is an eye with a tear at the corner.

title: Patient Peony Table
description: Two narrow sketches are propped against the wall.  Rough charcoal strokes form the outlines of a grouping of peony plants in terra cotta pots.

title: Bleeding Heart Table
description: A wooden planter forms a square in the center of the table.  Tiny, purple bleeding hearts bend over the rim of the planter box as though too shy to raise their heads.

title: Queen's Lace Table
description: The heavy wooden table is completely swathed in a thick, ivory lace tablecloth.  A bundle of wild carrot flowers, commonly called Queen's lace, is tied together with a ribbon of dried grass.

title: Cavorting Thrak Table
description: Centered on the central plank of the table is a glass full of water, set upside down on a small plate.  There are grooves in the floor boards, where the heavy wooden chairs have been dragged back and forth through the years over the same places.  Marching around the edge of the table are tiny paintings of dozens of thraks in a madcap parade.

title: Sleeping Thrak Table
description: The lamp on the table has been neatly trimmed, and casts a soft warm glow over the area.  Fluffy rolton fur cushions tied to the chairs create the impression that a flock of the sheep-like creatures has stopped by the Inn.  Painted on the table around the lamp is a circle of drowsy thraks, the head of one resting on the tail of the next.

title: Public Lockers
description: You are standing in a tiny room whose facing wall is an array of small, locked doors.  One of the lockers has been removed for you and is sitting on a small counter.

title: North Shore, Sandy Path
description: Deep white sand winds closer down to the shoreline.  Scrub bushes and low dunes line the path.  A few thatched roof beach-houses stand out from behind the dunes.

title: North Shore, Beach
description: Sparkling blue white-capped waves roll inward, breaking onto the beach.  Broken bits of seashells and dried seaweed are intermingled with the sand.  White-winged gulls float lazily overhead, riding the crisp offshore breeze.

title: East Row, Ebonwood Way
description: Empty spaces to the north and south beyond the ebonwood trees allow for further construction.  Townsfolk amble by, casually chatting between moments of shopping.

title: Helden Hall, Outside the Gate
description: Rough-hewn stone walls tower above a wrought-iron gate, the only entrance.  As you peer through the gate, you see an immense structure at the end of a vast bailey.

title: City Stables, Stalls
description: Soft whinnying, snorting, and the stamping of hooves resound throughout the stables.  Stablehands are constantly on the move, fetching fresh horses for the travelling merchants, messengers, or guards who board their steeds here.  The stalls are clean and well-tended, and the horses seem content with their lots in life here in the Landing.

title: Prison, Courtyard
description: A stiff breeze carries the faint scent of Darkstone Bay over the high basalt walls into this small, secluded yard.  Several low marble benches are scattered here and there, and a heavy iron portcullis leads to the interior of the prison.  A slender stone path leads out of the courtyard and back to the crowded streets.

title: Prison, Foyer
description: Footsteps echo off the smooth stone floor and barren walls of this sparsely decorated foyer.  A slender ebon pedestal stands in the center of the room, with a golden statue of the scales of justice displayed atop it.  A pair of sleepy-looking guards stand to either side of the thick iron gate leading west into the depths of the prison and an arched doorway leading directly east.

title: Prison, Office
description: Rough oak walls climb to high wooden rafters in this stuffy, smoky room.  Several wall-candles provide dim illumination, revealing a sparsely decorated office.  A squat oak desk stands in the northeastern corner with an oak chair on either side, the only furnishings in the room.  A rank smell and odd sounds emanate from the western hallway, and muffled shuffling can be heard coming from the door on the northern wall.

title: Prison, Operations
description: A massive oak table dominates the cramped confines of this space, and half-open cabinets line the walls.  Three burning lanterns dangle from chains fastened to the ceiling, providing ample light for the constable and his assistants.  Glimpses inside the open cabinets reveal piles and piles of folders--some thin, many fat.  Sprawled across the table is a detailed map of Wehnimer's Landing, held in place with four stones and imbedded with pins signifying important locations.

title: Prison, Sleeping Quarters
description: Two bunk beds reside in opposing corners, their mattresses thin and hard.  A tiny round table stands in the center, the unwashed tin plate and utensils resting upon it already attracting the interest of flies.  A large weapons rack leans against the north wall, with a matching armor stand taking a position along the southern wall.

title: Maidenly Magnolia Table
description: On the wall behind the table hangs a gilt-framed oil painting of a dark ceramic vase filled with magnolia blossoms.  A dainty lace handkerchief is neatly folded beside the vase.

title: Sea Thrak Table
description: A large painting of the Coastal Cliffs hangs over this section of the table, so realistic a view you practically feel the salt spray on your face.  The chairs pulled up to the table have been painted in stormy greys and blues.

title: Dancing Thrak Table
description: There are oddly shaped pits and cracks in the surface of the wooden table and on the seats of the sturdy chairs pulled up against it.  The table surface is so uneven, you wonder if it's safe to put down your drink.  A painting of a thrak is difficult to make out amongst the other wear and tear marks on the table.  The thrak is standing on one toe in mid-pirouette.

title: Lucid Lotus Table
description: Panels of white glass are set into the wooden table forming the outlines of a large lotus.  The thick stems supporting the tiled blossom are each carved from green-stained pine.

title: Hardy Heather Table
description: Small bundles of pink heather hang from dark green and blue ribbons from the ceiling over the table as though being dried for everlasting bouquets.  Some of the small flowerets have fallen to the floor, where their scent is released time and again by passing footsteps.

title: Helden Hall, Viewing Chamber
description: A wide walkway encircles the fighting pit.  Carved into the stone walls are seats for spectators to view the contests of bravery and honor below.  The stones of the walkway are worn smooth from years of stomping as the observers cheer for their favorite combatant.  The only decoration on the chamber's circular wall is a finely made tapestry.

title: Temple, Hall of Sacrifice
description: This part of the hallway is decorated in tapestries which were hung methodically in rows.  Each of the handwoven marvels depicts various acts of self-sacrifice: a valiant warrior placing himself in front of a fallen friend, a noble-looking lady giving her cloak to an impoverished child and many other similar scenes.

title: Temple, Corridor
description: Fragrant flowers are crushed beneath your feet as you walk down this corridor of polished white marble.  An ornate arch of pink granite marks the entrance to the wedding chapel, where many a blushing bride and her betrothed have exchanged their vows of everlasting love under the watchful eyes of their gods.

title: Temple, Chapel
description: Two pillars frame a simple chapel.  Followers of the land's many religions offer prayers here, each to their own gods.  On a pine pew a Zhaolmin monk in tattered robes sits beside a solitary elf softly intoning an ancient chant.  In front of the pews, you see an unadorned altar.

title: Temple, Wedding Chapel
description: Stained-glass windows glow like jewels, reflecting the light of the many pure white candles that flicker around the simple altar where couples kneel to exchange their wedding vows.  Hand-sewn tapestries depict scenes from married life in rich, colorful detail along the walls.  Fresh flowers are brought in each day, and their soft, romantic fragrance fills the small chapel.

title: Temple, Bridal Room
description: Soft candlelight casts a warm glow about the room.  The white marble floor is covered with hand-woven rugs and a huge mirror hangs from the wall in an ornate frame of gold.  Here, the bride and her attendants await the start of the wedding ceremony in privacy, serenity, and comfort.

title: Temple, Tapestry Room
description: A large candle burns with a steady flame in each corner of this room.  Various forms of artwork adorn the walls of this chamber, each representing one of the Gods of Elanthia.  One particular object, a long black tapestry, attracts your attention.  A small chair sits next to the tapestry and seated in this chair is the hooded figure of a man.

title: Temple, Black Altar
description: The smoke of scores of incense burners fills the air of this room with a thick, acrid haze.  Through this haze can be seen the faint outline of a large, black altar of obsidian surrounded by a high rail.  Behind the altar is an arch leading to a blackened passage. Hanging nearby is a brass tube, or chime, suspended from the ceiling by a thong of leather.  Next to this chime hangs a small mallet.  The two acolytes that greeted you as you entered are standing nearby.

title: Temple, Cleric's Office
description: The Lord High Cleric of the Landing has his study here, which houses priceless manuscripts and scrolls, the sum of the learning of the ancient Lords of Liabo and their Sages.  An impassive monk is stationed by the door.  Though unarmed, he inspires awe and respect.  On the Lord Cleric's writing table are an ora chalice and a finely carved, inlaid reliquary.

title: Elaraeyn's Boutique
description: The scents of oak paneling, oiled leather, and fine cigar smoke indicate that Elanthia's most discriminating gentlemen shop here.  Several hooks placed along the wall are bedecked with finery of all hues and textures.

title: Elaraeyn's Boutique
description: Handsomely-textured tartans draped and gathered with braided gold silk cords hang from clear glaes rods, symbols from various clans and houses mounted as decoration.

title: Elaraeyn's Boutique
description: Rich jewel-toned lengths of velvet conceal the walls along this part of the shop, the surroundings becoming more intimate and cozy.  Outerwear for body and head have been displayed here, in all the newest fashions and colors.

title: Elaraeyn's Boutique
description: All sorts of accessories in the way of belts, headwear, and fashionable jewelry can be found on this side of the shop.

title: Elaraeyn's Boutique
description: The heady scent of mixing essences wafts fragrantly around this section of the boutique.  Several porcelain bowls filled with crushed coloring agents line the back shelf, where a dwarven woman works mixing them.

title: Elaraeyn's Boutique
description: Yards of spidersilk suspended overhead form a canopy trimmed with fragrant garlands of white roses and Imaera's lace.

title: Shanty Town, Intersection
description: Mud-filled paths that might conceivably be called roads wander off in many directions, through a veritable maze of run-down shacks, fences and puddles.  An ancient, corroded brass figure of a mermaid lies half-buried in the muck, as if salvaged from some ship lost on the riverbank many years ago and set here to guard the neighborhood.

title: Shanty Town, Riverfront
description: The muddy path rises into a patch of relatively dry ground, populated by numerous shacks clustered out of range of the mud and quite a few tufts of grass and weeds.  A makeshift flowerbed flourishes between two shanties, filled with scrawny rosebushes that are probably stolen.

title: Shanty Town, Riverfront
description: The muddy riverbank winds around a shallow pool that swirls slowly as the current feeds it.  Many seagulls and several muddy children forage in the shallow water.  Tattered fishing nets strung between wooden poles to dry festoon the area, set between run-down cottages and shacks built precariously on the muddy ground.

title: Shanty Town, Riverfront
description: The path spreads into an expanse of muddy ground that stretches down to the riverbank.  Dilapidated shacks are built on the drier patches of ground, some resting at slight angles as they sink into the shifting muddy surface.  Seabirds roam the area, squalling loudly as they poke in the wet ground for snails and other goodies.

title: Shanty Town, Boatyard Alley
description: The boatyard fence winds to the east down to the river's edge.  A variety of graffiti, colorful in more ways than one, has been painted and carved into the wood.  A scrawny dog roots around in the tufts of grass by the side of the muddy road.

title: Shanty Town, Boatyard Alley
description: A narrow crack in the boatyard fence between two shacks provides a view of a scenic storage yard full of salvaged boats and other jetsam and assorted trash.  Someone has stacked a pile of rusted and barnacle-encrusted junk dredged up from the river by the side of the road.

title: Shanty Town, Boatyard Alley
description: The muddy lane curves around the tall wooden fence that surrounds the boatyard, and shouting and banging noises from the other side fill the air, along with a pervasive scent of paint, sawdust, and old fish.  Rundown shacks line the fence and fill the puddle-strewn flatland that extends to the river's edge.

title: Shanty Town, Muddy Lane
description: The roadway becomes almost impassible as it circles a burned-out stump sitting directly in its path.  Ramshackle dwellings sit crowded around the old stump, as if they are mesmerized by the senseless meander the pitiful excuse for a road is executing.  The hovels lurch shoulder to shoulder, like a stack of dominoes ready to topple over in a cascading heap.

title: Shanty Town, Muddy Lane
description: The path turns sharply, dipping down into a mud-filled patch of low ground.  Someone has lain some flat rocks down in an attempt to provide footing in the mud, which has resulted in a patch of slippery, mud-covered flat rocks.

title: Shanty Town, South Wall
description: Rows of tumbledown shacks nestle together along a hillock of dirt that rises up along the south wall.  Dozens of grey pigeons waddle around the street, pecking at morsels in the dirt or fluttering up to rest on the edges of the thatched rooftops.

title: Shanty Town, South Wall
description: A wisp of foul-smelling smoke rises from a heap of smoldering refuse in a pit by the side of the road.  A group of small boys play in a vacant space between the clusters of shacks, tossing coins against the south wall as they curse and slap at one another.

title: Shanty Town, South Wall
description: Run-down shacks and makeshift cottages stand crowded in the shade of the south wall of town.  Guardsmen patrolling above seem to not pay much attention to this corner of town, except to occasionally lean over to spit.

title: Shanty Town, Riverfront
description: The path ends where the south wall of the town meets the river, extending west in a narrow trail against the wall and upstream into a cluster of riverfront shacks.  Piles of flotsam and jetsam left by the river lie in mounds against the end of the wall where it extends into the water, and several filthy children and dogs rummage among the debris, searching for treasures left by the current.

title: Shanty Town, Riverfront
description: The network of paths winds down the riverbank, crossing the half-submerged bulk of a huge rusted pipe that runs northeast to the water's edge.  Ramshackle huts and unpainted shacks stand close together, clustered around the muddy byways.

title: Reignbeau Caverns, Tunnel
description: Small tunnels branch out in every direction and it's hard to be sure which one you entered through, let alone which to leave through.  Colored footprints dot the floor, wandering in every direction.

title: Reignbeau Caverns, Tunnel
description: The roof of the cavern is fairly low here, and a giantman could almost reach up and poke the clay above.  A large fissure cuts through the middle of the cavern, giving off steam like an angry drake.

title: Reignbeau Caverns, Tunnel
description: Many-colored clays drip down the walls of the tunnel, forming rainbow puddles on the floor.  A small niche in the side of the tunnel is filled with a layer of matted straw, and apparently serves as a cozy spot for the dye-splattered workers to take a nap.

title: Reignbeau Caverns, Tunnel
description: Small tunnels branch out in every direction and it's hard to be sure which one you entered through, let alone which to leave through.  Colored footprints dot the floor, wandering in every direction.

title: Reignbeau Caverns, Tunnel
description: Splotches of color cover the walls, dripping down onto the floor.  Your feet stick a bit with every step and their soles must surely be turning every color of the rainbow.  More disgruntled dwarves lounge about, trying to avoid getting their tunics covered with clay.

title: Wehnimer's, East Jetty
description: This windswept jetty, built of granite and basalt boulders, shelters the beach here from the river currents made more insistent by the pounding surf of Darkstone Bay.  A corroded bronze gate stands high across the path, blocking further travel.

title: Warehouse, Entry
description: A fresh layer of soft straw covers the weathered oak floorboards, softening the sound of rumbling wagons as they carry their loads of fine leathers and rare furs to the back of the warehouse for storage.  Tanned hides lay stacked in piles against the smooth stone walls, waiting to be shipped to distant markets, or sold to local merchants and artisans.

title: Warehouse, Nexus
description: The air is filled with shouts and bellowed orders as warehouse workers, wagons, and tradesmen barely avoid each other in their rush to get to their appointed locations at their appointed times.  A large wooden platform sits in the center of this whirling pool of chaos, a calm eye in the center of the howling storm of commerce.

title: Warehouse, East Wing
description: Well-worn flagstones peek through the scattered piles of fresh straw that have inadvertently been kicked in from the warehouse floor.  The straw collects against the clean oak walls of the hallway and settles on the floor between the workshop doors, like small drifts of golden snow.

title: Warehouse, East Wing
description: The quiet hallway is warmly lit by a string of torches evenly spaced along the length of the corridor.  Surprisingly, one of the torches has been allowed to burn out, creating odd shadows that reach towards you, one moment beckoning you forward, the next pushing you away.

title: Warehouse, East Wing
description: The torch at this end of the hallway has been allowed to go out, allowing shadowed darkness to fill the quiet corridor.  A lively draft whistles through a crack somewhere in the ceiling high above you, doubtless the reason the torch went out in the first place.

title: Warehouse, Office
description: One of the legs of a rickety chair is shorter than the others are; to help compensate for its imperfection the leg rests on a square piece of wood.  Occupying the chair, an abandoned stuffed steel golem with pieces of jet for eyes sits limply.  The warped oak floor is covered with a light dusting of straw.  Along the back wall, a pile of cushions takes up space in front of a gaping hole.

title: Warehouse, West Wing
description: The hallway is darker, cooler, and much quieter then the warehouse itself.  Small torches light the long hallway at even intervals, softly illuminating the scattered bits of straw, which cover the oak floor.

title: Warehouse, West Wing
description: The sounds from the warehouse are a distant murmur, often overpowered by the tapping of metal tools, or a soft, sudden curse coming from inside one of the workshops.

title: Warehouse, West Wing
description: The hallway comes to an abrupt end, marked by a large, smoking torch set into the middle of the western wall.  A long, black, sooty smudge runs up the wall above the torch towards the ceiling, a quiet call for soap, water, and determination.

title: Bay's Watch, Rocky Path
description: A well-kept stone path leads down the bluff at the base of the watchtower, splitting to double back along the bluff and continuing down to the rugged shore to the east.  The bustle of the city above fades as the sound of crashing surf echoes from the stone.

title: Bay's Watch, Rocky Beach
description: Whitecaps crash against the rocky shore, filling the air with sea spray and the scent of the bay.  The bluff rises above the scattered boulders, home to the nests of countless seabirds that swoop down from the watch above.  In the distance, merchant ships pass in the bay, their colorful sails moving across the horizon.

title: Bay's Watch, Promontory
description: A jetty of waterworn stone juts out into the shallow water of the river delta.  The water is calmer here, but the steady breeze brings with it the scent of the open bay.  Gulls swarm around the end of the promontory, searching for meals in the shallow water, and small cargo ships pass into and out of the river's mouth in a steady stream.

title: Bay's Watch, Shore
description: The path winds along the edge of the bay, cooled by seaspray from the surf that splashes on the rocky shoreline.  Several cottages are clustered in an open area near a sturdy wooden dock that extends out into the blue water, surrounded by racks of drying nets and floats.

title: Bay's Watch, Shore
description: The narrow expanse of sand between the jagged shore and the rocky bluffs above is filled with scattered boulders and lines of seaweed and debris left by the high tide.  Small shacks and cottages are set up against the shadow of the bluff, out of reach of the highest water.

title: Bay's Watch, Shore
description: The shore curves to the south here, bordering the mud flats that stretch out into the water.  Merchant ships pass in the deeper water, their sails bright against the horizon, and the shallows are busy with flocks of seabirds noisily scavenging for food.

title: Bay's Watch, Eastern Shore
description: A rocky trail leads up the shore of the bluff, which is capped by a stand of pines that have scattered needles and a few cones even down here in the sand.  The current laps softly at the shore, and a brisk bay breeze blows in, bearing the cries of seagulls and the spray of salt air.

title: Bay's Watch, Bluffs
description: The fresh sea breeze combines with the scent of the towering pines that line the bluffs, filling the air with a light, brisk scent.  Gulls screech and dive over the water below, occasionally stopping to roost on the rocky edge of the bluff.

title: Bay's Watch, Bluffs
description: A row of tall pines forms a barrier separating the bluff from the town above, their needles rustling softly in the sea breeze.  Several cottages stand back from the bluff in the shade of the pines.  The air is filled with the soft sound of the bay surf rushing against the rocks far below.

title: Bay's Watch, East Bluffs
description: A boulder as big as a house rests near the edge of the cliff, its rugged edges and sharp angles too inhospitable to climb.  Far below, merchant ships pass through the bay, their sails and banners colorful against the blue water.

title: Bay's Watch, Eastern Shore
description: A few rocks dot the sandy shore, and trees grow near the bluff that rises steeply into the pine woods.  The mud swirls in the shallows, stirred by the wakes of passing ships, and gulls gather to screech and squabble over bits of food.

title: Bay's Watch, East Bluffs
description: The trail winds back from the edge of the bluff through a stand of tall pines.  A soft carpet of needles covers the ground, and a fresh hint of sea breeze fills the air.  The passing sails of boats can be spotted through the trees in the distance.

title: Bay's Watch, East Bluffs
description: Several huge grey boulders along the edge of the bluff provide a vantage point from which to enjoy the fresh air and the view of the bay and the shore below.  Windswept pines shade the area, and a path leads down the rocky slope to the sand.

title: Bay's Watch, Eastern Shore
description: The trail ends here against an outcropping of rock that extends into the bay, blocking passage south.  A jetty of sand, piled against the stone over the years, extends into the water, and a path leads up the stony bluffs to the woods above.

title: Bay's Watch, East Jetty
description: Rocks and sand, deposited over the centuries by the flow against the stone barrier, extend into the water, forming a spit of dry land.  Gulls flock everywhere, feasting on the bounty of the shallow waters and screeching raucously.

title: Bay's Watch, Bluffs
description: The trail winds along the stone bluffs above the rocky shore some thirty feet below.  Gulls and other seabirds nest in the rocks at the edge of the cliff and in the rafters of the small houses built along the rim.

title: Bay's Watch, Overlook
description: The sheer wall of the watchtower rises above you, casting a shadow over the rocky ledge overlooking the bay.  Seabirds circle the tower, occasionally descending to roost on the crags or dive into the expanse of blue water below for a meal.  A strong sea breeze whistles over the rocks and against the tower, drowning out any sounds of the town nearby.

title: Bay's Watch, Dock
description: Seaside cabins stand clustered at the base of the weathered wooden dock extending out into the surf on barnacled stone pilings.  Flocks of gulls invade the dock, squalling at visitors and soaring overhead in a pattern of shifting white and grey against the blue sky.

title: Grocer's, Tidbit Shop
description: This room contains all sorts of foodstuffs and refreshments to delight the hungry or thirsty adventurer.  Smiling young clerks trot past every so often, their faces flushed from the constant exercise.  Occasionally, one of the youths grabs an item from behind the wooden counter stretching along one wall, then darts away to serve another customer.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Sunny Path
description: Underbrush gives way to thick meadow grass where the trail begins a steep ascent.  A tall hill fills the southeastern horizon, its gentle slopes adorned with patches of green and gold pasturage.  Dwellings are visible, nestled on the slopes in colorful groups, their sod roofs blending with the hill's thick mantle of grass.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Grassy Knoll
description: The trail turns, giving egress to a wide plateau, which is bejeweled with a pond that sparkles in the sunlight.  Birds wheel overhead, diving occasionally to alight near the water.  Cottages cluster in groups around the pool, some boasting picket fences and most decorated with gardens and brightly painted shutters.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Sunny Meadow
description: The trail splits, each branch offering an opposite perambulation of the pond.  Halflings saunter by on their short legs, calling greetings to the open windows of houses as they pass.  A gaggle of ducks is clustered on the grassy bank of the pond.  The birds waddle in and out of the water, intent upon duckish pursuits.  One brown duck guards a little cluster of ducklings, and the chicks' adamant pips constantly harangue the mother.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Pond Stroll
description: The cobblestone walk parallels the bank of Hummingbird Pond, edged with a lush border of red and white zinnias.  Cottages line up side by side, with flowers blooming on their sod roofs like blossoms woven into a halfling's hair.  Access to the buildings is gained through doors that are perfectly round, giving the homes a slight ambiance of surprise.

title: Hummingbird Pond, North Bank
description: Hummingbird Pond's north bank is lush with flowers and ferns.  A large blackberry bush sits right next to the water, its surface covered with a shifting, fluttering cloud of butterflies.  Honey bees visiting the thick patches of clover growing around the prickly bush provide a constant hum.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Pond Stroll
description: The cobblestone road courts the edge of Hummingbird Pond, then veers deceitfully away to follow the slope of a hummock.  Quaint cottages camp alongside the avenue, sending delectable aromas wafting from open windows.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Bridgeunder
description: An arched bridge spans the avenue.  Halflings crossing overhead stop occasionally to peer down over the rail in curiosity.  The underside of the bridge is decorated with a painted mural depicting a festival of some sort, celebrated with a bountiful feast.  Halflings munch cheerfully on all sorts of roasted meats and pastries.  Houses crowd next to the bridge's elegantly carved pilings, lending charm to the bridge's belly.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Bridgeunder
description: The cul-de-sac is dominated by the ornate bridge arching overhead.  Beneath it, a cluster of houses grow like mushrooms at the foot of the pilings, every square foot of ground around them planted with flowering gardens.  Honeysuckle vines climb the ladder of the bridge's underpinnings,  spicing the air with their sweet perfume.

title: Locksmith, Salesroom
description: The walls of this shop are covered with keys and locks of all colors, shapes, and sizes, from large iron padlocks to bone-white skeleton keys.  A white-hot coal fire burns steadily under a pot of molten metal over which stoops the locksmith's apprentice.  Forms for keys and lock parts sit wedged in sand on a wood work table nearby.  To the north, a dimly lit doorway recedes into the shadows.

title: Locksmith, Backroom
description: The backroom of the locksmith's shop is stark, and lit by a single tallow candle.  A blob of wax secures the candle atop a locked case that provides the only seating in the uncomfortable room.  A tall cabinet secured with a sturdy padlock occupies the far wall.

title: Alchemist's House, Consignment
description: Blackened from a previous mishap with fire, the wooden table in one corner of the room has a rickety bench tucked beneath it.  Lining the back wall of this spacious room, sturdy oak planks serve as bookshelves housing over a dozen thick, leather-bound tomes.  Directly opposite the bookcase stands an oval-shaped glass counter, completely empty except for a lantern capped with a multicolored glass globe.

title: Alchemist's House, Commodities
description: Carpets in a variety of somber shades are tossed haphazardly across the floor.  Patterned in the center of each rug, in a brilliant gold thread, are interlocking spheres of assorted sizes.  Pushed against the wall of the chamber, holding an assortment of alchemical paraphernalia, stands a sturdy solid oak table.  Several clear-globed lanterns hang high overhead to provide adequate lighting for the various accoutrements available for purchase.

title: Wehnimer's Exterior, Pine Path
description: The path beneath your feet has been strewn with fragrant pine needles.  Before you stands an arch of pine and spruce boughs, with wildflowers intertwined among them.

title: Wedding Glade
description: You are in a large glade, ringed by tall and majestic oaks.  At its farther end, two of these venerable trees stand entwined as a living symbol of two souls bonded in matrimony.  In the pale moonlight, the oaks almost look like lovers hugging, renewing their special bond.  A small rosewood altar is set before the large oak trees, and an arch of modwir pine and spruce boughs leads to a shady path.

title: Wehnimer's, Outside Dance Tent
description: To one side of the wedding glade, a large tent of dark velvet has been erected.  You stand near the entrance flap through which you can see a large open space set aside for the evening's dancing and festivities.  From time to time, happy couples flushed from dancing and the warmth of the interior come out to cool themselves or to seek a quieter spot for a moment's kiss.

title: Wehnimer's, East of Tent
description: Here on the east side of the tent is a quiet shadowed spot removed from the noise and bustle of the party.  Off to one side, a group of trees provides a deeper shade over a mossy spot even more removed and private.

title: Wehnimer's, Shady Bower
description: This tree shaded bower seems miles away from the noise and bustle of the party within the tent nearby.  A thick cushion of dry leaves and soft moss beckons you to rest your weary feet and relax for a time.  Songbirds high up in the branches overhead provide a gentle harmony to the strains of music from the party.

title: Wehnimer's, West of Tent
description: Here on the west side of the tent, it is quieter.  Somehow the sounds of the revelry within are muted by the heavy fabric of the tent.  A copse of trees provides a quiet, shady spot even more removed from the noise and heat of the dancers.

title: Wehnimer's, Mossy Bower
description: A semi-circle of rocks covered thickly with moss makes a private retreat from the hubbub of the merrymaking within the tent nearby.  A gently rounded stone shelf serves as a bench made by some long forgotten craftsmen or a kindly nature.  The noise and strife of adventuring seem far away and almost forgotten in this island of tranquility.

title: Cleric Guild, Courtyard
description: Flanked by several lush trees, a large and elaborate building stands to the north, its golden dome glinting in the sunlight.  Small benches are placed throughout the thriving courtyard, and small colonies of flowers have sprouted around them.  A narrow pathway of pure white cobblestones leads toward the structure and stretches back to a smaller building to the south.

title: Gemcutter's, Salon
description: Set aside from the hustle and bustle of the front room, this cozy salon has an atmosphere of luxury and comfort.  A warm fire crackles in the hearth, and thick, colorful carpets cushion your steps.  Sparkling display cases show off the finest gems, exquisitely crafted and faceted to catch the warmth and brilliance of reflected light.

title: Gemcutter's, Commodities
description: Scattered around the room are colorful carpets with thick borders around the edges.  In the center of the shop, a gold veined marble counter holds a collection of objects, including a tiered jewelry stand.  Small shelves along the back wall hold an assortment of magical vessels.  On the opposite side of the shop are two tables, one holding figurines and the other holding miscellaneous items.  Nestled between the tables is a crystal stand resembling blocks of ice pieced together to create different levels upon which items are carefully arranged.

title: Wizard Guild, Courtyard
description: A few fireflies flit around the large courtyard of lush green grass.  The faint scent of twisted rose bushes wafts with the night air.  A dark glistening obelisk rests upon a pedestal in the center of the courtyard and a few lanterns light the doors to the guild foyer.

title: Wizard Guild, Foyer
description: Thick plush carpets cover the flagstone floor and rich tapestries depicting the exploits of wizards of old hang from the walls.  A large mithril chandelier hangs from the arched ceiling, the numerous candles lighting up the entire room.

title: Wizard Guild, Courtyard
description: Across the expansive courtyard are scattered colorful lanterns that light up the well tended flowers and shrubbery.  At the center stands a magnificent fountain with water that catches the colorful light and sparkles as if a river of gemstones were pouring into the pool.

title: Wizard Guild, Day Room
description: The long broad room is dimly lit by the light coming from the few occupied tables that hold lanterns.  A few candles are set up near the middle of a long counter that runs along a good portion of the opposite wall.

title: Wizard Guild, Study Room
description: Set within the southwestern tower, the rounded walls of this spacious study are obscured by several tapestries.  The large banners depict images of wizards clad in grandiose garb casting several spells of a classical elemental nature.  The soft sounds of the tapestries fluttering and the occasional quiet shuffling sounds of a student's feet mingle with each other, creating a peaceful background for contemplation.  A few chairs and tables stand scattered throughout the room.

title: Wizard Guild, Private Room
description: A brass candelabra and small fireplace light up the small comfortable room.  A few comfortable chairs and a small sofa are arranged to catch the warmth of the fire that dispels the night chill.  Except for quill and ink, there is only a brass lamp upon an otherwise immaculate desk.  The floor is covered with plush carpets and the walls with rich tapestries.

title: Wizard Guild, Stairway SE
description: The narrow stairs wind their way up into the dark tower far higher than one would expect, only to dead end at the top with a door.  Spaced out along the walls are eonake sconces that hold glowing torches that provides more than enough light to see by without any visible flame.  An occasional cool night breeze sneaks through the few open narrow windows.

title: Wizard Guild, Master Office
description: Open windows let in faint moon and starlight along with an occasional cool night breeze.  The sparsely furnished room only has a few comfortable chairs and a big heavy desk.  A mithril chandelier that glows brightly without any sign of flame provides more than enough light along with the large fireplace.  One large plush carpet covers the flagstone floor from wall to wall.

title: Wizard Guild, Library
description: Enormous book and scroll cases reach all the way to the ceiling and run along all the walls of this large room.  The chandeliers and large candelabra flanking the numerous tables burn with a bright inner light that illuminates even this immense room well enough to easily read by, but none show signs of candles or open flame.  Scrolls and books are stacked haphazardly on the tables, and even though there are more tables than wizards it still isn't enough room even at this late hour.

title: Wizard Guild Annex, Locus
description: An offshoot of the courtyard, this small piazza is open to the sky and bounded by a circle of pillar-supported arches.  A cobblestone walk leads east and west, while smaller flagstone paths radiate outward in a semi-sunburst pattern from a centrally-located marble birdbath.  Covering the ground between the walks, creeping phlox creates pale lavender and white wedges of foliage above which night moths flit from flower to flower in the moonlight.

title: Annex, Water Workshop
description: Walls of sea foam green are illuminated by diffuse rays of moonlight that saturate the room through frosted glass windows acid-etched with the alchemical symbol for water.  Crafted of gnarled natural driftwood, wall sconces cradle pillar candles whose flickering flames glitter off bits of colorful sea glass inlaid in the aqua ceramic tile flooring.  The musical tinkling of a wind chime can be heard from high above the brushed steel workbench as gentle breezes trickle in from the piazza.

title: Annex, Wind Workshop
description: Walls painted the subtle hues of a desert sunset, and overlaid with wind-blown cloud wisps, are illuminated by diffuse rays of moonlight that saturate the room through frosted glass windows etched with the alchemical symbol for wind.  Resembling metal box kites, wall sconces cradle pillar candles whose flickering flames glitter off eagle feathers inlaid in azure ceramic tile flooring.  The musical tinkling of a wind chime can be heard from high above the brushed steel workbench as gentle breezes trickle in from the piazza.

title: Annex, Lightning Workshop
description: Storm grey walls, painted with jagged lightning bolts and ominous dark clouds, are illuminated by diffuse rays of moonlight that saturate the room through frosted glass windows etched with the alchemical symbol for energy.  Stark white tree branches, oddly singed and naked of bark, form wall sconces whose flickering candle flames glitter off gold flecks in the ebon ceramic floor tile.  The musical tinkling of a wind chime can be heard from high above the brushed steel workbench as gentle breezes trickle in from the piazza.

title: Annex, Ice Workshop
description: Walls of pale ice blue, painted with silver snowflakes, are illuminated by diffuse rays of moonlight that saturate the room through frosted glass windows etched with the alchemical symbols for water and cold.  Crafted of walrus tusk, wall sconces cradle pillar candles whose flickering flames glitter off cut crystal tile flooring that resembles blocks of ice.  The musical tinkling of a wind chime can be heard from high above the brushed steel workbench as gentle breezes trickle in from the piazza.

title: Annex, Earth Workshop
description: Sand-colored walls, lined half-way up with woven rattan matting, are illuminated by diffuse rays of moonlight that saturate the room through frosted glass windows etched with the alchemical symbol for earth.  Crafted of unfired clay pottery, wall sconces cradle pillar candles whose flickering flames glitter off tiny bits of quartz inlaid in the umber ceramic tile flooring.  The musical tinkling of a wind chime can be heard from high above the brushed steel workbench as gentle breezes trickle in from the piazza.

title: Annex, Cauldrons
description: Several training rooms completely equipped with cauldrons, beakers, measures, and other supplies, are accessible around the perimeter of this room, their arched entryways carefully positioned so that no room looks directly into the entrance of another.  A bundle of dried herbs is hung above each archway.  Rippling in each entryway, the air wavers and dances, as if thicker in the archways than elsewhere.

title: Annex, Fire Workshop
description: Walls of smoky grey, painted with lambent red, yellow, and orange flames, are illuminated by diffuse rays of moonlight that saturate the room through frosted glass windows etched with the alchemical symbol for fire.  Crafted of half-charred wood, wall sconces cradle pillar candles whose flickering flames glitter off bits of volcanic glass inlaid in the crimson ceramic tile flooring.  The musical tinkling of a wind chime can be heard from high above the brushed steel workbench as gentle breezes trickle in from the piazza.

title: Annex, Reagent Room
description: Dwarfing the broad fel worktable in the center of the room, row upon row of polished steel shelves line the walls.  Each wall shelf, as well as several additional cabinets and shelving units, is filled to near capacity with a diverse array of cork-stoppered flasks and bottles.  Though most are meticulously labeled, the lettering on some has long since faded.  Mortar and pestle sets, funnels, droppers, and assorted laboratory utensils are conveniently located on the tabletop.

title: Annex, Equipment Room
description: Amid the cobwebs of this dark and musty storeroom are a number of lockers and cabinets, some secured by large padlocks or ominous runes.  Disorganized piles of equipment lie strewn across shelves and heaped in corners with seemingly little effort given to care or cleanliness.  A free-standing modwir closet, missing its door, holds brooms, some heavy iron dust pans, and other cleaning supplies.

title: Annex, Cauldron
description: An enormous cast iron cauldron with thick, hinged ring handles dominates the training room.  Sturdy metal hanging arms attached to a trammel are positioned above the fire pit, ready to adjust the height of the cauldron.  Rough wooden stirring paddles, spyders, pokers, and hooks are neatly arranged along the wall, within easy reach.

title: Wizard Guild, Study Room
description: Dark modwir tables gleam softly in the pale blue light cast by several small crystalline orbs set in the center of the tables.  A quiet thrumming sound is heard every few moments from the dark spheres as they occasionally dim and then glow stronger.  The subtle, rhythmically-shifting illumination provides a peaceful atmosphere for relaxing study.

title: Wizard Guild, Meeting Hall
description: The hall is so large that the lanterns along the walls and chandeliers hanging from the vaulted ceiling only manage to cast the room in a dim light.  Despite this, a gilt lectern on the far side of the room glimmers in the faint light and almost seems to shine.  Countless rows of benches and chairs arrayed about the hall are like huddled shapes in the dark bowing down before the light of the lectern upon the raised floor.

title: Wizard Guild, Study Room
description: The first floor of the northeast tower is a spacious study, yet small for a single room in a tower of this size.  A large slab of black slate has been framed in oak and fastened to the wall and used to display symbols and runes.  A few well worn tables and chairs are scattered about the room and some steep stairs spiral high up into the tower.

title: Wizard Guild, Stairway NW
description: The narrow stairs wind their way up into the dark tower far higher than one would expect, only to dead end at the top with a door.  Spaced out along the walls are bronze sconces that hold glowing torches that provides more than enough light to see by without any visible flame.  An occasional cool night breeze sneaks through the few open narrow windows.

title: Wizard Guild, Observatory
description: The top of the tower is open to the elements and a cold steady wind tugs at you.  A few glow globes spaced about the low tower wall barely provide enough illumination to see by, but you can clearly see the glowing designs of the star charts and constellations inlaid in the granite walls.  A tremendous, gleaming telescope pointing towards the starfilled night sky dominates the center of the tower.  Far below you can see the street lanterns of Wehnimer's Landing spread out like a crystal latticework.

title: Wizard Guild, Stairway NE
description: The narrow stairs wind their way up into the dark tower far higher than one would expect, only to dead end at the top with a door.  Spaced out along the walls are eonake sconces that hold glowing torches that provides more than enough light to see by without any visible flame.  An occasional cool night breeze sneaks through the few open narrow windows.

title: Wizard Guild, Workshop
description: The spacious room has a large worktable set up in the center, above which floats a large clear crystal orb that glows, sending light sparkling off the alabaster walls.  Arcane runes and symbols are inlaid in the black polished floors, which gleam with no trace of dust to be seen.

title: Wizard Guild, Stairway SW
description: The narrow stairs wind their way up into the dark tower far higher than one would expect, only to dead end at the top with a door.  Spaced out along the walls are iron sconces that hold glowing torches that provides more than enough light to see by without any visible flame.  An occasional cool night breeze sneaks through the few open narrow windows.

title: Wizard Guild, Atrium
description: The star-filled sky shows clearly through the clear-cut crystal that covers the top of the tower, yet keeps out the cool night air.  The room is warm and humid and the air is heavy with the scent of tropical flowers.  You can hear the trickle and splash of water from somewhere in the dark dense foliage, filling the broad room with all manner of dark, monstrous shapes.

title: Henty's Depot, Entry
description: The walls of the warehouse are left unpainted, their rough-hewn plank sides apparently made of pine, given the fragrance.  The warm, pale color of the pine siding indicates the newness of the building.  A small office sits to the west while a steady stream of townsfolk and shoppers head due east.

title: Henty's Depot, Permit Office
description: Pale blue carpet covers the floor in this tidy little office.  Wooden models of buildings crowd the surface of a stained oak cabinet that is nestled between two plant stands.  Resting on the corner of the polished oak desk is a glass oil lamp.  The flame of the lamp dances across neatly stacked papers which are bound by a thin cord on the desk.

title: Henty's Depot, Facades
description: An assortment of tables and counters have been arranged in orderly rows based on size.  Entrepreneurs shuffle around the bulky merchandise in search of a piece to fit their invidual needs.  The scratched wooden planks of the floor bear the scars and wear of the store's constant foot traffic.

title: Henty's Depot, Roofs
description: Curious passersby press their faces against the windows, gazing the wonderful displays on the floor.  Evenly spaced along the walls are brass sconces that illuminate this corner in a soft, golden light.  Several patrons pause to rest on decorative seating beside a pair of glass-topped tables.

title: Henty's Depot, Ceilings
description: A massive ramp runs along side some stairs connecting the first and second floors of the building.  Stacks of sealed crates have been marked with red paint, gathering dust while awaiting transport up the ramp.  Beside an open window with a clear view of the street, a varnished maple stand holds a thick tome listing the store inventory.

title: Henty's Depot, Floors
description: Rows of beautifully carved stands have been arranged against the wall, their polished veneers gleaming in the sunlight.  A shop clerk occasionally patrols the long aisle and adjusts the pricing of the wares, tearing off the old tags and disposing them in an iron wastebasket.

title: Henty's Depot, Walls
description: Amid the bartering of merchants, the furniture showcased in this section of the store all reflect deep, rich earth tones.  Lingering in the air is the faint scent of leather, although there is no apparent hide in this area.  Gold-accented plaques proudly display the artisan who created each piece.

title: Abandoned Trail
description: Overgrown almost to the point of non-existence, a continuing gap between the trees to the southeast seems wide enough for wagons to have passed that way some years ago.  To the northwest a rockfall blocks what must have been the route in that direction.

title: Abandoned Trail
description: The gap between the older trees continues downhill to the southeast where it enters a ravine overgrown with ferns.  The ravine appears to cut due east.

title: Abandoned Trail
description: Ferns crowd the bottom of this ravine, where a small stream trickles down its center.  The floor of the ravine slopes gradually downhill to the east, and then disappears where the cattails and reeds begin and the ground becomes spongy underfoot.  You also see the western mouth of the ravine.

title: Abandoned Trail
description: Taller grasses and small trees are all that mark a strip of high ground that runs southeast through the cattails and reeds.  Peering over the tops of the marsh plants in that direction is the squat shape of a stone building with a gabled roof.

title: Gryphon Holding
description: Marsh grasses and bracken almost hide a half dozen wooden gravemarkers on this slope of the hillock.  The stone tower looms at the top of the rise, but to the south the slope of the hillock appears less steep.

title: Gryphon Holding
description: The stone tower rises above the surrounding marsh, narrow window slits and a battlement about the gabled roof giving it an almost sinister appearance.  To the north, east, and west, the slope of the hillock descends sharply and is quickly lost beneath the reeds and cattails.

title: Gryphon Holding
description: Eight apple trees stand here in two rows of four, competing with the heather and gorse that cover the gentle southern slope of the hillock.  To the northeast the stone tower is plainly visible.

title: Old Noralgar Road, Cliffs
description: Granite cliffs tower overhead, their faces marked with a wealth of striations and their peaks bearded with slowly drifting clouds.  A small door is cut into the stone, with seams that are joined so cleverly they are almost invisible.  To the west, the escarpment meets an imposing castle perched against the protective rock, while a glassy lake stretches from its foot into the foggy distance.

title: Land Tower West, Dining Room
description: This large open room serves as a combination dining and recreation room for the guards stationed in the two land towers.  Although the room is empty, the long wooden tables are set for the next meal.  In the corner, a wooden ladder leads to the upper levels of the tower.

title: Land Tower West, Ladder Room
description: A long wooden ladder connects this floor to the floors above and below.  A couple of crates and some old uniforms hanging on wall hooks are the only items in the room.

title: Land Tower West, Roof
description: A small overhang on the south side of the tower provides the on-duty guards with some shelter from the elements.  From there, you can see the roofs of the town buildings to the south and southeast.  Directly south, you can see a large open square among the buildings.  Your view east is blocked by another guard tower.  To the north, you can see the road that leads to the main gate of Wehnimer's and beyond it, to the shoreline.

title: Land Tower East, Dormitory
description: This room contains several wood cots with rough woolen blankets.  You can hear noise from the area outside the gate through slit-like windows on the northern wall of the room.

title: Land Tower East, Roof
description: A small lean-to on the south side of the tower provides the on-duty guards with some shelter.  You can see the roofs of town buildings to the south and southeast.  To the east you can see two more guard towers, apparently sitting on either side of the river.  To the northwest, you can see the road that leads to the main gate of Wehnimer's and, beyond it, to the shoreline.

title: The New Look, Haircuts
description: An old chair with a wobbly leg takes up most of the space under this crooked awning.  A string has been tied from the side of the tent to a post stuck in the ground, and dangling from it are dull-looking shears and carving knives.  Drifts of shorn hair cover the ground, forming hummocks and valleys of blond and brunette.

title: The New Look, Hairdressing
description: Here in the back corner of the pavilion a makeshift station has been set up to wash, dirty, curl, straighten, braid, loosen, and otherwise fuss with all kinds of hair.  Jumbled together in a crate are bottles of olive oil, combs, ribbons and pins.  Wood-handled irons are propped over a small fire pit, and the smoke has started to fill the enclosed space.

title: The New Look, Hair Adornment
description: In this shaded walkway between the three tents is a round iron table supporting a jar of brushes and a few pots of dye.  A cedar box full of bone hairpins and narrow strips of leather has been left right on the ground, in danger of being kicked over by a clumsy foot.

title: The New Look, Skin Care
description: Wooden screens divide this large tent into smaller spaces, but they don't block the howls of agony coming from every corner.  A raised pallet partially obscured by a thin gauze curtain rests conveniently near a set of freestanding shelves.  Stored haphazardly therein are cyclamen roots, a bowl of birch sap, some sheep dung, a bottle of lemon juice, and a tub of quicklime.

title: The New Look, Nasal Sculpting
description: This small corner has been festively decorated with sketches of noses, illustrating a wide variety of shapes and sizes.  The cheeriness is broken, however, by the display of instruments used to achieve these many effects.  A chest full of neatly-rolled bandages and a basket of brown eggs sit at the ready.

title: The New Look, Eye Enhancements
description: Lancets, needles, razors, and scalpels have been laid out in tidy arrays atop a narrow chest of drawers.  A solid oak chair fitted with many leather straps is pushed up against the flimsy wooden screen.  The sole nod to cleanliness appears to be a bowl of wine used to soak the instruments between uses.

title: The New Look, Eye Colors
description: The rivulets of blood trickling down the legs of a crude operating table give some indication of the unpleasantness of this procedure.  Thick glass jars are stacked three deep, each one packed full of preserved eyes with their optic nerves still attached.  A very sharp-looking scalpel has been left at the foot of the table, ready for further use.

title: The New Look, Short and Tall
description: Here inside the tent, the light wicker frame that provides support is just visible between the wool blankets used to help muffle sound.  A massive apparatus bearing a strong resemblance to a stretching rack is dwarfed only by a device whose purpose seems to involve a great deal of crushing and compacting.  Stuck into the ground is a tall pole marked off at intervals with red paint.

title: The New Look, Facial Repair
description: A series of shaped wooden frames with adjustable metal screws have been fixed at head height in front of a row of straight-backed chairs.  They all face the near wall of the tent, where inspirational phrases have been painted in bright, cheery colors.  A few of the protruding screws still show traces of former users.

title: The New Look, Distinctive Marks
description: The strange emptiness of this portion of the tent gives it an even more ominous feel.  The only object is an upright wooden box just large enough to contain one person.  Its narrow door latches solidly on the outside.

title: Wehnimer's, Festival Grounds
description: Brightened by daylight, a broad swathe of cultivated meadow grass is crisscrossed with small footpaths and dotted with the occasional tree.  Tall hedges enclose the festival grounds, the only visible openings a red-bricked pathway and an ironbound gate.  A moss-covered, riverstone fountain burbles in one corner, surrounded by a bright splash of roses.  A copper-banded, riverstone marker rests beside the red-bricked path.

title: Upper Trollfang, Path
description: A path meanders through large tree trunks encrusted with moss and lichens.  Underfoot, a thick carpet of leaves mutes footsteps, its soft brown tones spotted here and there with small dots of deep purple where woodland violets bloom.

metadata.source: Kestrel's Perch, outside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Shanty Town, Inside Hut
description: You are inside a one-room hovel.  A worn quilt patched together from hundreds of tiny scraps of fabric is folded neatly in the corner.  A fat candle, melted down to a waxy stub, rests atop a warped crate in the center of the room.

title: Temple, Altar
description: The altar is plain, and bears only onyx bowls of smouldering incense and smoking paraffin.  Draped behind it is a cloth banner, appliqued with an ancient mystical pattern.  A legend is embroidered along the bottom.  On the far side of the room at the end of an aisle, you see two pillars.

title: Town Well
description: The old well is made of flat stones built up around a circular opening.  A slate roof overhangs the opening, keeping the drinking water clear and refreshing.  Several skin water buckets, with long ropes attached, are scattered on the hard-packed earth surrounding the well.

title: Moot Hall, Storage Room
description: This anteroom houses benches, tables, podiums, portable altars and special items that regular users of the hall pay to have stored here.  There is very little space, this being more of a closet than a room.

title: Moot Hall, Assembly Room
description: In this large assembly room meetings are convened to deal with the affairs of the town, and the locals hold their religious and social events.  There is ample room for benches, long tables and other furnishings befitting special occasions.  Sconces for torches, chandeliers holding many candles, and broad windows impart a warm, friendly glow of good fellowship to this space.

title: Lower Trollfang, Small Cottage
description: You find yourself in a dense wooded area in front of a small cottage with stone steps leading up to the front door.  Two large, well tended flower beds on either side of the steps contain a huge variety of plants of differing colors and sizes.  The night air is cool and refreshing and you hear the muffled sounds of the unseen wildlife in the trees surrounding you and from the river beyond.

metadata.source: Kodos' Cottage, outside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Moot Hall, Waiting Area
description: The crowds waiting to pay their debts mill about, some heading east and some heading west.  The carpet underfoot is worn from years of footsteps but it still shines a soft green in the bright light.  Several benches line the walls, functional, yet comfortable enough if you wish to rest your feet for a bit.  A few still seem to be unoccupied.

title: Moot Hall, Debt Collector's
description: This is the office of the Debt Collector of Wehnimer's Landing.  An old, wizened clerk is sitting behind a desk, poring through yellowed record ledgers.

title: Moot Hall, Debt Collector's
description: This is the office of the Debt Collector of Wehnimer's Landing.  An old, wizened clerk is sitting behind a desk, poring through yellowed record ledgers.

title: Wehnimer's Courtroom
description: The courtroom is uncomfortably chilly and plainly furnished.  Several benches are lined up to face a raised platform at the far end of the room.  The town magistrate dispenses justice, swiftly and summarily, seated in the straightbacked chair behind a simple table on the platform.  An armed guard leans against the wall, next to the door, looking casual but ready for trouble should it arise.

title: Wehnimer's Real Estate
description: Variegated maps of mixed depth, detail and scale plaster the walls of this office.  Pins with little scraps of paper are affixed to the maps, identifying properties for sale or lease.  Not surprisingly, the musty smell of old parchment perfumes the place.  Behind the clerk's desk is a large cabinet honeycombed with tiny compartments, each stuffed with dozens of scrolls, most likely deeds for homes and property.

title: Ceraleth's Cartage
description: Tall wooden crates, reinforced with crossed planks and sealed with heavy hinged locks, stand in rows in this large room.  Workmen stuggle in pairs, or groups of four, handling the big crates with care as they move them in or out.  The stone floors are meticulously kept and there is not a speck of dust to be seen.

title: Calradian's Contracts
description: A large maoral desk, polished to a deep red sheen, rests across one corner of the room.  Precisely placed quills and a careful arrangement of dry ink pots give the desk an unused air.  By contrast, a library table in the center of the room is strewn with piles of contracts and lists of figures.  Thick wool carpets and velvet-draped windows muffle the sounds of passersby on the street outside.

title: Surname Registry
description: Tall shelves crammed with dusty books leave but a narrow corridor to the low desk at the far end of the room.  A faded green velvet curtain falls halfway across a large window, the rippled glass casting watery patterns on the oak floor.  A lone fly buzzes in the very center, describing drunken circles in the heavy air.

title: Moot Hall, House Clerk's Office
description: This is the plain office of the Head Clerk of the Cooperative of Houses of Elanthia.  Behind a small desk sits a rather harried civil servant.  His quill pen is never at rest as he records and updates every detail needed for the efficient administration of the houses of Wehnimer's Landing.  The main features of note are the long velvet curtains on the wall behind the desk, that seem to rustle slightly.

title: Paupers, Outer Grounds
description: A weathered stone building is nestled low among tall modwir and weeping willow trees.  A gleaming vultite plaque is affixed to the dark, wrought iron fence which surrounds and defines the grounds, through which formally clipped hedges and an elegant fountain in the midst of a rose garden are visible.  Beyond the wrought iron gate, a red-carpeted walkway covered by a long, narrow awning leads up to massive double doors.

title: House of Paupers, Inner Grounds
description: To either side of the carpeted walkway, you see rows of neatly clipped hedges and shady trees.  Vibrant roses in every imaginable hue surround you with their delicate, pleasing scent.  Nestled within the shelter of proud modwirs and softly swaying willow trees, the massive double doors beckon you to enter the House of Paupers and forget the hustle and bustle of the Landing just outside the gate.

title: House of Paupers, Entry Hall
description: Deep fur floor covering cushions your feet as you walk past opulent portraits of distinguished explorers and huntsmen dressed in stiff, formal attire.  The far end of the room is dominated by a plush comfortable sofa and several overstuffed chairs near tables on which lie scrolls of Wehnimer Edition.  You approach a large oaken desk, behind which sits a poised, elven receptionist who looks up just as you glance through the ora door to her right.

title: House of Paupers, Commons
description: More books and scrolls than you've ever seen in one place line the walls of this spacious room, the central focus of which is a massive fireplace with a mahogany mantel in which fragrant cherry wood crackles and pops.  Trophies, busts and sketches of prominent local citizens are in evidence.  Large floor cushions and comfortable armchairs invite you to relax, read or enjoy conversation at an immaculately polished table in one corner.  The gleaming mahogany bar is well-stocked with only the finest libations.

title: House of Paupers, Vault
description: Light from several torches flickers over silver sconces fastened to the walls.  Legend has it that this heavily carpeted, soundproofed vault once successfully protected a king's ransom from an attempted siege by rampaging barbarians.  Few have attempted to breach the security of the members' steel-reinforced storage lockers in modern times, for tales of the consequences abound and are not for the faint of heart.

title: Paupers, Hallway
description: This short, carpeted hallway ends at a brightly lit room filled with wooden tables.  Many odd-looking trinkets and knickknacks are mounted on the walls, covering all available shelf space.  Someone at one of the tables has apparently taken it upon himself to try and explain each and every single item in the room, and his droning voice indicates no sign of stopping.  On one wall is a curtained opening and on another you see a curtain that looks out of place.

title: Paupers, Vault
description: Light from several torches flickers over silver sconces fastened to the walls.  Legend has it that this heavily carpeted, soundproofed vault once successfully protected a king's ransom from an attempted siege by rampaging barbarians.  Few have attempted to breach the security of the members' steel-reinforced storage lockers in modern times, for tales of the consequences abound and are not for the faint of heart.

title: House of Paupers, Lounge
description: You hear the sound of muted conversation and laughter coming from the Common room, though the thick carpets which cover the floor seem to absorb some of the sound.  The walls are paneled in polished mahogany and are decorated with several silver candle sconces which shed their warm light onto the tables scattered about the room.

title: House of Paupers, Crystal Room
description: An abundance of overgrown hanging plants and excessive humidity encourage you to shed your inhibitions along with your clothing to participate in the water sports played in this enormous area covered by a translucent crystal dome.  In one corner you see a steaming hot tub surrounded by rocks and lush greenery.  The plants release aromatic vapors which relax your senses.  An expansive swimming pool sparkles as it reflects the moonlight.

title: Hummingbird Pond, West Bank
description: The trail follows the pond's bank, while sending a branch up the hillside where more cottages cling to the slope like colorful patches on a jester's doublet.  Thick beds of blossoms line the avenue, attended by bees and butterflies, all competing for the ample nectar within the blooms.

title: Hummingbird Pond, South Bank
description: Cottages line the road, their backs tucked neatly against the hillside. A collection of mussel shells suspended from thin silk threads hangs from a garden arch, which spans the cobbled entrance of one of the homes.  As the wind caresses them, the shells make a pleasant melody.

title: Hummingbird Pond, South Bank
description: The walk turns, following the pond's kidney-shaped circumference.  A gentle breeze kicks up low swells on the pond's surface, which sparkle in the sunlight.  Diverging from the avenue, a smaller track quickly disappears between two cottages.

title: Hummingbird Pond, East Bank
description: A dense hedge boasts a thick mantle of bright yellow blossoms.  It follows the road for a piece, then turns to run beside a cottage with shutters painted a shade of yellow that rivals the flowers.  Sitting on a pole anchored in the ground rests a flat platform of wood, filled with seeds and nuts.  Birds cluster around it, chirping at each other in an effort to gain control of the feast.

title: Hillside
description: The track meanders up to a door set into the vertical face of an immense boulder buried in the hillside.  Mighty hinges are bolted into the rock sill, supporting the heavy oak of the portal.  Occupying the door's center is a large bronze knocker cast in the shape of a bee.  It launches out, wings outstretched, as if it had been frozen in mid-flight.  The insect's expression looks ferocious in such an exaggerated context.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Beehive Trail
description: Perched on the ample shoulder of the hill, the trail skirts the incline, passing between cottages blessed with an expansive view of Hummingbird Pond as well as an impressive expanse of the surrounding countryside.  Further up, a collection of bee hives is visible, and beyond, the forest reclaims the hillside.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Hillview Lane
description: Hillview Lane curves past a cottage set into the pronounced slope.  The road is bolstered in places with stone walls, where the incline drops away.  Vines cling to the rock, offering a riot of blossoms to disguise the stone supports.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Hillview Lane
description: The lane circles into a sharp turn at the gate of a peculiar dwelling.  It is built in cantilevered sections, which skirt the hillside in flagstone wings.  A brook bursts from its underground course and cascades over a ridge of large natural rock beside one of the residence's balconies.  The home appears to float in space above the waterfall, intimately related to the hillside which gives it a foundation.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Beehive Hill
description: A group of beehives sits on the hillside, each one surrounded by a peppery-looking cloud of bees hovering around it.  Two or three halflings toddle back and forth tending the apiary, wearing netted headgear to protect them from their charges.  A small grove of aspen trees grows behind the hives, their swaying branches lending a dappled pattern to the supers.

title: Hummingbird Pond, East Bank
description: The cobblestone walk veers toward the pond, following it so closely, one misstep will leave the unwary pedestrian ankle-deep in pond water.  A cottage sits on pilings sunk into the pond's mud floor, its gardens composed of water lilies.  Raised stones offer a walkway to the cottage's round door.  Baskets of blooming jasmine hang from the eaves, spicing the air with exotic perfume.

title: Hummingbird Pond, Bridgeover
description: The avenue halts at the foot of a bridge, which lifts over the road in an exaggerated arch.  The span is painted in a rainbow of color, each curl and turn of wood calling for its own unique pigment.  Blossoms and vines are carved into the wooden handrails, rivaling the authentic lace of vines clinging to the bridge in detail and beauty.  The cottages below add color to the scene with the flowers blooming on their sod roofs.

title: A Faint Path
description: In the distance, you can make out a black, ominous tower.  It looms over the hills like a dark sentinel, the walls shimmering faintly despite the absence of light created by the stormclouds above.  A faint path winds towards the tower, almost completely hidden by brambles.

title: A Faint Path
description: Thorns and brambles line the path, tearing at the clothing of all who pass.  To the southwest the trail opens into the rugged, rocky terrain of the Sentoph mountains, while to the northeast it widens into the barren landscape around the tower.  Loose stones tumble onto the path, dislodged from the jagged boulders that rise to either side.

title: A Faint Path
description: Only a few scattered rosebushes remain in the magic-scarred waste, bearing roses as black as the tower that rises in their midst.  The graceful obsidian walls of the dark edifice are smooth and seamless, and no entrance is visible.  The air here in the tower's shadow crackles with a dark energy that seems to crawl along your skin.

title: Mountain Path, Ledge
description: You are standing on a narrow ledge jutting out from the sheer, rocky slope of the canyon.  The odd runes carved into the rock here that first attracted your attention are close enough to read now.  You realize they are inscribed above a foot-high vertical fissure recessed into the rough stone.

metadata.source: Ye Oddity Workshop, outside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Ye Olde Candle Shoppe
description: A multitude of scents and colors fills the tiny, cozy wagon.  The room is lit by the warm flames of dozens of flickering candles reflecting shimmering light on the colorful brocade tapestries that line the walls, and the air is filled with the smoke of exotic incenses.

title: Blacksmith, Front Yard
description: A horse is tied to a hitching post in the open yard of Iron Jack's.  Near a well in the middle of the yard, the horse's owner is haggling with one of the blacksmiths over the price of new horse shoes.  Now and again, one of the apprentices comes running out of the forge area to get a piece of metal from one of the several stacks of metal around the yard.

title: Blacksmith, Forge
description: Iron Jack's boasts four well-sized forges, three of which are currently in operation.  Several new apprentices are gathered around one, learning the finer points of Smithery, while the blacksmith's eldest son is crafting a large sword at another.  At the third forge, two older apprentices are working on shorter blades suitable for knives.

title: Blacksmith Yard, Walkway
description: Spanning the short stretch of yard between what appears to be a slate-roofed merchant's stall to the north and Iron Jack's forge, a narrow walkway of paired flagstones runs north to south.  Beyond the stall, the south wall of the city stable forms the backdrop for a row of small, stone-chimneyed sheds.

title: Public Workshops Supply Stall
description: A tin-clad counter occupies the center of the stall, and a large sign hangs from the main post that rises in the stall's center.  An almost grim faced half-elf, with broad shoulders and muscled biceps, stands behind the counter, a polished mithril toothpick held in her teeth.

title: Edwina's Lockpick Repair
description: A small counter has been placed in front of a curtain that divides this small attic space into two.  Edwina, Larton's ex-wife, bustles about her shop constantly cleaning and eyeing prospective customers.

title: Ye Old Magick Shoppe
description: This room is dark and filled with the acrid smell of smoke, ozone and brimstone that rises from a glowing black iron brazier before you.  A few stools are grouped around it.

title: Ye Old Magick Shoppe, Lab
description: The shop of the ancient archmage Pherantyr seems out of step with the times, or rather timeless in its decor.  All the shelves are lined with items gathered from the remote corners of the world, each with an aura of strong magic about it.   Near the back, a dark shimmering veil covers what must be a back workroom.

title: Twilight Hall, Grounds
description: The tall shadowy-grey walls of this fine fieldstone house are carved with intricate runic markings.  The lush green lawn is home to several varieties of plants and flowers which border the walls, and young saplings promise a shady rest spot in years to come.

title: Twilight Hall, The Remembrance
description: Slabs of multihued, enruned marble line the surface areas of this sizeable octagonal room.  The fragrance of flowers and incense immediately places your spirit at ease.  Sparingly lighted, the region appears to be caught up in a never-ending dance of shadows.
