Rising from the center of the room is a dominating, non-symmetrical block of carved volcanic glass, known as the Weeping Stone.

title: A Guard Tower
description: Large cut blocks of stone, mortared with a dry gray paste, climb high enough here to rise above the walls surrounding the town.  A wooden stair runs around the circumference of the tower and leads to an opening in the ceiling.  Daylight filters through the squat doorway leading out into the heart of the town.

title: Observation Tower
description: The stone walls are bare, save for a raised mural on the north facing wall, which depicts in great detail the surroundings of Wehnimer's Landing.  Resting on a dais mid-center of the tower, a hand-carved obsidian chair captures the eye.  Deep gouges mar the surface of one of the steps which leads up to the surface of the platform.

title: Merchant's Guild, Foyer
description: You stand in the middle of a high-domed foyer at the entrance of the merchant guild.  From the wooden arches which form the dome hang banners representing the various crafts that participate in the Merchant's Guild.

title: Merchant's Guild, Anteroom
description: This small antechamber has a desk with several important-looking documents scattered across its surface.  An oil lamp burning provides some dim light.

title: Merchant's Guild, Records
description: The only sound in this lavishly appointed room is the ticking of a wood clock.  The floor is covered with a rug of Velnalin pelts, the walls decorated with ornate stencils depicting various sorts of business transactions.  You notice a series of bookshelves, a rich mahogany desk, and an iron-bound chest.

title: Merchant's Guild, Council Room
description: A long table stretches the length of this room.  At each of the two dozen place settings, you notice a pitcher of water, a scrap of parchment, and a quill pen.

title: Merchant's Guild, Cloakroom
description: Wooden pegs line the walls of this small room.  From one of them hangs an old coat that someone left behind after a hasty departure from a protracted guild meeting.  Other pegs contain various neglected or forgotten belongings dangling from them.

title: Grocer's, Front Room
description: The front room of the grocer's is filled with shoppers toting bundles or hefting sacks over their shoulders.  Young lads swarm around, offering to help carry your goods for a few spare coppers.  From the west wafts an aroma of fresh foods, meats, cheeses and breads that causes your mouth to water.  Off in a secluded corner you see an area where a table has been surrounded by some partitions, affording some privacy for customers who choose to dine here.

title: Wehnimer's Travel Office
description: The front room consists of a few wooden benches around the perimeter and a small podium near the back.  The walls are painted white, though the scant lighting does little to help brighten the room.  Behind the clerk's podium is a narrow red curtain, leading south toward the lounge.

title: Wehnimer's Travel Office
description: The small back room is painted bright white and three wrought iron candelabras provide ample light.  Travelers converse and mingle, discussing geography and history in hushed tones.  On either side of a red curtain leading north is a red-cushioned bench and a small cart containing refreshments.

title: Wehnimer's, Shop Cellar
description: Wrought iron candelabras occupy opposite corners of the room, casting a series of flickering shadows along the ceiling and walls.  Multicolored throw rugs patterned with interlocking spheres are scattered throughout the basement.  An oddly shaped table and a single ladder-back chair rest in the far corner of the room near an old pot-bellied stove.

title: Wehnimer's Shop, Waiting Area
description: Cushioned ladder-backed chairs surround a plush, snow white bear rug.  Affixed in the eye sockets are a pair of brilliant dragonsbreath sapphires and long, slightly yellowed pieces of ivory serve as the fangs.  Edged in gold braiding, the tapestry on the back wall depicts several males encircling a kneeling individual as they work together to wrestle an object from his grasp.

title: Courtyard South
description: Stubborn clumps of grass grow between the cobblestones on the walkway that traverses the courtyard.  You hear an odd splash from the large fountain that sits in the center of the circular walkway; as you peer over the edge of the lowest tier, you spot several large, fiery red and orange fish lazily swimming about.

title: Courtyard East
description: Loose strands of ivy drape down from the white lattice arbor above you and trail over the cast-iron gate.  A cobblestone walkway circles a large, six-tiered fountain that gurgles and splashes soothingly.

title: Courtyard North
description: This corner of the courtyard lies within the shadows of the surrounding buildings, creating a cool haven.  A large wooden bench painted with a vibrant mural sits before the six-tiered fountain that squats in the middle of the courtyard.  A flock of pigeons scavenge about for crumbs and seeds, their dun colored heads bobbing as they walk.

title: Courtyard West
description: Sunlight filters through the mass of ivy upon the white-painted arbor above you, tinting everything with a cheery, slightly green light.  A six-tiered fountain sits in the middle of the courtyard with a cobblestone path skirting it.  Sweet floral scents drift from the water lillies in the fountain.

title: The GlassWorks
description: Large display windows have been set close to, but not touching, the walls of this plush showroom.  Thick, plush carpets line the floors, encouraging the casual shopper to stay a bit longer and admire the wares.  Oil lamps have been placed between the windows and the walls, providing colorful backlighting and showcasing the high quality works.

title: The Glassworks Annex
description: A variety of glass tables made of various colors and designs clutter the display portion of an apprentice glazier's workspace.  Heat from a kiln in the corner of the workshop is a reminder of the dangers in making fine glass products.  Bits of broken glass and small buckets of colored sand are kept far away from the display tables, for the safety of the shoppers.

title: Walls of Silk
description: Thin strips of dark wood separate a vast variety of wall styles on display.  Panels of fabric wallcoverings, finishes and papers are arranged vertically between the wood strips, so the discriminating shopper can choose just the right finish for his home.

title: The Brocaded Window
description: The truly well dressed window comes with drapes and curtains, and the samples in this displayroom show how to add drapes with style and flair.  Curtains and drapes line false windows, offering a variety of colors and materials to choose from.

title: Big Game Hunters
description: The furs and hides from many rare and exotic creatures have been tanned and carefully turned into fine rugs.  The rugs and skins are spread so thickly, its hard to tell what kind of flooring lies beneath them.  A few finer examples of craftsmanship are mounted on the walls as trophies.

title: Big Game Hunters
description: Dozens of life-like, stuffed animal heads have been carefully posed and mounted on the rustic timbered walls.  The work is so finely done, several of the trophy heads seem to be staring right at you, as if sizing you up for a snack.  A few specks of sawdust have managed to escape from their trophy prisons and reach freedom in the plush rugs covering the floors.

title: Anzil's Artifacts
description: A slightly musty smell fills the shop, hinting at the great age of the goods here.  The curtains are all drawn and the room is dimly lit by candles, to better protect the delicate antiques and rugs from the ravages of sunlight and the fading it would cause.

title: Kindle's Braziers and Stoves
description: In contrast with the rest of the store, this area is warm and cheery.  The braziers and stoves here are fully functional, and several are in use to prove it.  Flickering firelight reflects off the surfaces of the stoves and adds an almost festive feel to the showroom.

title: DreamSpinner's Haven
description: A multitude of ancient beds, from the delicate to the sturdy and the simple to the ostentatious are set between several objects de art displayed on the walls.  Several comforters lie off to the side, ready to show alternative touches that can be added to the beds with just a bit of work.  A faint, dusty odor is partially masked by a brazier burning lilac-scented incense.

title: Lippin's Chairs
description: Clearly a showroom decorated with pride, this room features samples of chairs that have been arranged in attractive seatings, to promote better sales.  Accessories and pieces of art further enhance the groupings, making it easy to visualize what they might look like in a home setting.

title: The Hidehunter
description: Heads and hides of many ferocious beasts cover the walls and floors here, carefully tended by the store owner.  A pair of bear heads, one as dark as the other is light, contrast sharply with one another.  Off in one corner, a pile of previously stuffed heads await mounting.

title: Bedelia's Sleeping Gear
description: Blue and white stripes are painted in careful, tiny rows down the plastered walls of this tiny shop.  Pictures display a small selection of beds and cots, depicted in beautiful, hand colored prints.  A small wicker chair with a soft blanket draped on its back rests in the corner.

title: Orliane the Stonecutter
description: Motes of dust hang in the air, gently floating down, only to be stirred with each passing footstep.  Great chisels and cloth-covered hammers lie across unfinished hunks of marble, slate and other raw materials waiting for the stonecutter's hand.

title: Tatiana's Tables
description: Tremendous slabs of roughly hewn stone lean precariously against the walls of the shop.  Finished and unfinished stone tables are jumbled together in the narrow room, creating a maze for patrons to wander through as they view the shopmistress's wares.

title: Ollie's Oddities
description: Dust-covered displays of various shapes and sizes are scattered haphazardly about the room.  Unique arrangements of weapons have been assembled, just the perfect sizes for hanging upon a wall.  An old warrior shuffles about the room, lovingly touching this blade and that.

title: Grafton's Fireplace Shop
description: A wide variety of fireplaces fills this small room.  Tucked inside each fireplace is a thick wooden log, surrounded by crumpled bits of yellow and red tissue paper.  The obviously fake fires only highlight the exceptional quality of the stonework.

title: A Way With Woods
description: The sharp scent of freshly cut wood fills the air.  Square samples of finely carved walls and flooring are neatly stacked, one atop the other, throughout the room.  A chandelier suspended from thin silvery chains provides excellent lighting for the shoppers who come for the master carver's quality woodwork.

title: Harris's Tablecraft
description: Wood shavings curl amongst the dust in the corners of the room.  The wall beyond the display of hand-carved tables is hung with a wide variety of woodcutting tools.  Each tool is polished to a good-as-new gleam that reflects the pride of their owner.

title: Pasquielo's Tiles
description: Neat stacks of tiles are sorted by size, color and material in wooden bins along the walls.  Jars of paints are lined up on an oak plank table beneath the shop's window.  Brushes sit up-ended in clay pots, remnants of old color still clinging to their wooden handles.

title: Mosaics by the Apprentice
description: Barrels filled with bright bits of tile line the walls.  Salvaging broken pieces and odd-sized tiles, the apprentice has filled the rest of the shop with a wide variety of decorated tables.

title: Lute's Liltings Music Shoppe
description: This small but lovely shop is packed full of display stands, each one housing a different instrument.  The maoral walls have been waxed to a warm golden hue, and a beautifully woven blue carpet covers the floor.  Sunshine floods in from framed glaesine windows that line the panelled walls at regular intervals.

title: Bard Guild, Courtyard
description: Three walkways lead from openings in the ornately decorated cast-iron fencing, all converging upon the grand entrance to the Bard Guild Theater.  Well-tended lawn and bountiful flower beds intermingle with overarching trees.  Star-shaped paving stones create an expansive terrace below the marquee, framing the large, delicately carved doors.  Above the marquee, on a gilded sign hanging from a pole and supported by black chains, shine the words "Terrace Theater."

title: Bard Guild, Theater Lobby
description: The chamber is shaped like a crescent moon, and within the curve of the arms, cascading tiers of steps lead down to arches opening into the auditorium beyond.  Heavy velvet drapes and thick rugs, all a rich shade of dark crimson, give the room a hushed ambiance, rendering footsteps almost soundless and conversation into a muted buzz.

title: Bard Guild, Performance Hall
description: The auditorium is cavernous, and every inch of the curved ceiling appears to be covered in vividly colored frescos.  The walls are a combination of polished mahogany and painted panels that equal the ceiling in decoration.  Tiers of seats descend toward a stage at the hall's far end, their ranks upholstered in crimson velvet that matches red carpet runners traversing the aisles between them.  A row of small lanterns illuminates the front of the stage.

title: General Store, Salesroom
description: All manner of goods are piled high on long flat tables and sturdy shelves here in the general store.  The smell of leather mixing with that of candle wax, the gleam of metal reflecting the sheen of silk and the feel of wood and ivory makes this room an interesting assault on your senses.

title: Wehnimer's, Treehouse
description: This sturdy wooden platform, built of planks and wedged into a fork of the oak's trunk, provides a place to sit and rest in the shade of an overhanging branch.  A glance through the foliage affords a bird's-eye view of the town square below.

title: Town Well
description: The rough flagstone court winds around the old stone well, shaded by the overhanging branches of the nearby oak.  Tufts of grass sprout between the stones, fed by the moisture from below.

title: Town Well
description: An old wooden bench rests in the shade next to the well, nearly covered by a low-hanging oak branch.  A few townspeople and merchants relax and chat in the cool, shaded air, taking a break in their errands or simply wasting time.

title: Town Well
description: Sunlight streaming through a gap in the great oak's branches casts a bright spot on the flagstone court around the old well.  A few flowering weeds thrive in the shadow of the well, adding a splash of color to the city corner.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Cozy Nook
description: Sheltered from the traffic and patrons of the dining room by stained partitions topped by colored paintings, this table for two still gives you a view of the dining hall. The candle at the edge of the table creates flickering shadows which dance hypnotically alongside the walls. Linen napkins have been folded on the tablecloth, and a single wild rose sits freshly picked in a tiny vase.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Party Room
description: This room is festive and cheery compared to the rest of the Thrak.  Decorations of foil and brightly colored parchment adorn the walls, and streamers hang from the large wrought iron chandelier.  Tables and trays laden with good victuals, fine drinks and novel items fill the room.  The clamour of rambunctious, good-spirited adventurers echoes through the chamber.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Front Desk
description: A polished wooden desk sits to the side of the staircase, and bears the placard of the Thrak's proprietor.  At the top of the creaky wooden stairs are the establishment's guest rooms.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Hallway
description: You can look down this hallway to the other end of the building.  Doorways lead right and left off it.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Narrow Room
description: This narrow spartan room contains all the basics of sleeping quarters, but only the basics.  A sleeping cot sits against one wall, while a line of hooks run along the opposite wall under a plain wood shelf.  You can hear noise from the tavern below and from people tramping the stairs outside.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Garret
description: A narrow passage winds through the attic among stacks of ancient crates and boxes.  An expansive but dusty window is set in the west end of the garret, looking out over the streets below, and an old velvet-upholstered sofa has been dragged out of storage for the residents to sit on and enjoy the view.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Hallway
description: You can see more doors in either direction down the length of the hallway, but are prevented from continuing further north by a rope firmly tied across the hall.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Meeting Room
description: This appears to be a public meeting room of sorts.  A wooden table is surrounded by several chairs.  In the corner is a small narrow table, probably for holding food.  A blackboard hangs on the wall.

title: Raging Thrak Inn, Suite
description: Heavy velvet curtains are partially drawn in this room, allowing some light to filter through the sheers behind them.  Near the window is a small sitting area containing a sofa, a chair, and a writing desk.  Just inside the carved maoral door, a feather bed stands next to a double-doored wardrobe closet.

title: Wehnimer's, Narrow Alleyway
description: This narrow, dead-end alleyway runs from town square to the south, up to a bare wall at the north end.  To the west, partially hidden behind teetering stacks of boxes, you see a weatherbeaten door with paint peeling off of it.

title: Landing Hall, Garden
description: This tiny garden niche provides an oasis from busy city traffic.  A few small trees lend shade to the polished granite bench that rests underneath.  Shrubs and flowers have been placed strategically, their colors blending together in perfect harmony.  In the center of everything resides a large granite fountain, its clear blue water falling in intermittent gusts and sprays.

title: Confectionary Shop, Alcove
description: Standing in the center of the room upon a finely polished wood floor is a table carved in the shape of a crescent moon.  A thick white cloth that is embroidered with tarts and berries done in shimmering forest green thread covers the uniquely shaped top.  Scattered throughout the anteroom are low-backed vine-carved chairs that feature masterful ivy scrollwork.  A domed skylight above allows the sunlight to fill the room.

title: Wehnimer's, Constabulary
description: The front room of the local constabulary contains the desk of the town constable.  The oaken floor is scuffed by countless feet dragged across it, obviously most reluctantly.  Behind the desk is a weapon rack.  A strong, ironbound door with a narrow, barred grate leads east.

title: Temple, Monks' Room
description: Several humble cots are arranged around this chamber, a dormitory for monks and clerics from outlying districts who come to visit town and its temple.  You see a rack hung with robes and bedrolls stowed atop it.  A stairway ascends to the southeast.

title: Temple, Storeroom
description: This seemingly abandoned storeroom is dusty and filled with cobwebs.  There appears to be nothing of material value here, yet a sense of power and otherworldliness fills the room.  Although there are no windows, all is suffused with a shimmering, shifting light.  A stairway leads down.

title: Temple, Graveyard
description: The scent of rich earth and wildflowers touches your nose.  Rows of small grey marble gravestones stretch off to the north and west, sharing the small fenced plot with daisies, violets, and wild roses.  Townspeople wander amid the graves, filing in and out of a small wrought-iron gate.

title: Temple, Graveyard
description: A Wehnimer's guardsman stands before one of the graves, talking in low tones to the headstone.  As you listen, he tells a humorous story about the time he sat in the tavern and his friend poured ale on his head.  A gentle feeling of sadness washes over you as you realize that his friend now lies in the grave.

title: Temple, Graveyard
description: A large white marble monument stands watch over this quiet tree-lined bower.  The air is cool, and the silence is broken only by the rustling of leaves in a breeze.  A feeling of peace blankets the area, and the soft earth seems to invite you to sit and contemplate.

title: Temple, Graveyard
description: A small group of people stands around a newly-covered grave here in the Temple's shadow.  A priest, dressed in solemn clothing, leads the people in a soft song.  While the key is minor, the words rejoice that the departed one now rests beyond the hardships of life, safe within Lorminstra's grasp.

title: Temple, Graveyard
description: Here, the graveyard sits in the shadow of the Temple.  Velvety moss grows against the headstones, and the earth smells damp and cool.  A little elven girl kneels before a grave, placing a small flower upon the ground in a simple gesture that brings tears to your eyes.

title: Temple, Behind Pillars
description: The floor here is littered with dust and a few dry leaves, swept inside by eddies of wind.  Very little in the way of decoration relieves the stark feel of this plain, austere anteroom.

title: Silverwood Manor, Courtyard
description: Surrounded by a pristine white stone wall, the rear of the courtyard is shaded by the boughs of numerous trees.  A multi-colored stone path leads west, guiding students to the main courtyard of the manor.  Short boxwood hedges line the edge of the path.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Sunflower Way
description: Narrow cobblestone lanes wind in several directions, bounded by neatly trimmed hedges and beds of colorful flowers.  Morning glories and flowering vines cover the wooden fence that surrounds the neighborhood.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Sunflower Way
description: Bright sunlight filters through the branches of the linden trees that line the lane.  Sunflowers grow in a row behind the low stone wall that lines the cobblestones, their faces turning to the light.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Sunflower Way
description: A small marble fountain, carved with a symbol of Imaera, gurgles in the corner of the lane.  Bright roses in shades of pink and red bloom in the gardens of the thatched cottages, contrasting with the blue of the morning glories that grow along the wooden fence.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Clover Lane
description: Several wood and brick cottages stand around a gaily flowering dogwood tree, their neat lawns joining to form a parklike space filled with lush grass and the blossoms of wildflowers and clover.  A low brick wall bounds the lane to the west.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Clover Lane
description: Small verdant lawns dotted with patches of clover and dandelions surround the rows of neat thatched and shingled cottages along the lane.  Dogwood and linden trees provide a bit of shade and a home for finches and sparrows that fill the air with their twittering songs.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Circle Bower
description: A tall fence of painted white wooden latticework winds along the road in a circle, covered with a variety of flowering vines and buzzing with bees and glittering hummingbirds.  Beds of roses and lilies border the outer side of the circle.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Circle Bower
description: Lush bushes of peonies are planted along the tall latticework bower, their huge pink blossoms forming splashes of color against the green.  Wood and stone cottages are arranged around the circle of the road, their lawns dotted with daisies and marigolds.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Circle Bower
description: Brilliant red and green hummingbirds buzz around the flowering vines that cover the white wooden bower that lines the road.  A sleek grey cat stalks along the flowerbeds, chasing some elusive prey.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Circle Bower
description: Splashes of colorful blue and yellow blossoms cover the vine-covered white latticework bower that forms a circular fence along the inside of the lane.  A bed of roses and white lilies forms a border around the lawns of the cottages that line the road.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Daisy Lane
description: Linden trees hug the lane, filtering flickering shadows over beds of daisies and violets that border it.  A hummingbird buzzes among the blossoms, bright feathers glistening in the shifting light.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Daisy Lane
description: The golden blossoms of marigolds and daisies fill the flowerbeds that line the cobblestone lane beneath the filtered shade of linden trees.  Thatched and shingled cottages stand in a row between the trees, and a sweet smell of tarts baking somewhere nearby mingles with the scent of the flowers.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Sunflower Way
description: Lindens shade the bright green lawns of the thatched cottages along the street, and bright sunbeams shine between them, speckling the cobblestones with golden light.  Bees and small birds flitter around the beds of sunflowers and lilac bushes that line the lane.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Sunflower Way
description: A low stone wall bounds the lane on one side.  Sparrows and finches flutter down to roost on the wall, searching the rocks for fallen seeds from the bright yellow sunflowers that rise above the stones.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Violet Lane
description: Bees buzz around the ceramic planters atop the brick wall that lines the flagstone lane on both sides, feeding on the colorful blossoms.  Flowering dogwood trees shade the lawns of the small cottages that rest behind the gaps in the wall.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Violet Lane
description: The narrow lane is paved with dark grey flagstone here and bordered by a three-foot brick wall on both sides.  Ceramic planters cover the top of the wall, bearing hundreds of bright blue and purple violets.  Gaps in the wall lead to the front doors of two neat rows of cottages.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Gardenia Lane
description: Carefully tended ceramic flowerpots are set along a brick wall.  Beside the cobbled lane are the yards of thatched cottages, each bearing an assortment of fragrant gardenias and violets.  Linden and maple trees shade the lane from direct sunlight.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Gardenia Lane
description: A dwarven gardener bends over the brick wall that bounds the lane, reaching into his grass-stained apron for his tools as he tends the cultivated flowers.  The heady fragrance of gardenias and fainter floral scents fill the air.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Garden Wall
description: An ancient maple tree shades the stone wall that bounds the central gardens, its seed pods scattering on the cobblestone cul-de-sac.  Beds of white and orange lilies and golden marigolds line the wall, and a stone gate leads into the garden.

title: Florist's, Front Counter
description: Freshly cut flowers, wreaths, and garlands are displayed in all their multicolored glory in large, earthenware pots and upon wide, wooden tables covered in soft, white cloth.  The spritely florist, Tessie Brinn, smiles as she weaves a crown of Blaeston blossoms to adorn a maiden's hair.

title: Florist's, Workroom
description: Delicate blossoms, sprigs of greenery, snippets of pink and purple ribbon, and a pair of sharp shears are scattered across the top of a low, wooden workbench.  Here, Tessie Brinn and her assistants craft breathtaking floral arrangements to order for the citizens of Wehnimer's Landing.

title: Baker's Shop, Front Room
description: This store is fragrant with the mouthwatering smell of fresh-baked bread.  Long, flat loaves of gnollish lichen bread cool on racks behind the tidy counter.  On wooden shelves lined with parchment beside the counter are spicy muffins filled with berries and nuts, and cookies frosted with designs of elves, gnolls and sprites.  The jolly baker, in an immaculate white apron, beams at you while you try to decide on your selection.

title: Quaeta's Fletcher Shop
description: Panels of wood cover the walls, stained rich and dark.  Shelves seem to grow from the wood, varnished in lighter tones.  Upon these rest bows of all shapes and sizes.  Some are intricately carved, others are unadorned, but all are of the highest quality.  Crossbows hang from hooks on the walls, and bowstrings dangle from the ceiling.  A counter sits against the west wall, displaying an array of arrowheads.

title: Dari's Clothiers, Salon
description: Wooden forms in the main room of Dari's Salon display a variety of cloaks, robes, trousers, shirts, and other garments of woven fabrics.  Dari Sulka, the designer and proprietress of this trendy establishment, has draped herself atop a stool between the counter and the wall.

title: Dari's Clothiers, Workroom
description: Bright oil lamps overhead provide light for a tailor and seamstress busy at work.  Bolts of fine cloth, sequins, bone and ivory buttons, thread and needles fill several open cupboards around the workroom.  On a sewing table, a piece of soft rolton wool is marked with the chalk outline of a fashionable woman's cloak.

title: The Thrak's Booth
description: The smell of sour small beer assaults your nose as you enter this rather cramped and hot booth.  Half-cured pelts of exotic creatures line the walls and a chair made of yellowed troll king bones sits in a half shadow in one corner.  Seated in the chair is the ruined hulk of a man, his potbelly, bulbous red nose and cracked leather armor show that he has long since given up caring for his appearance.

title: Shanty Town, Sewage Outlet
description: The stench is overwhelming, rising from the soppy mud and refuse around the opening of the sewer outlet like a malevolent fog.  Piles of trash trap stagnant eddies in the flow, their surface mottled with floating debris and the occasional dead fish floating white belly up.

title: Shanty Town, Waterfront
description: Waves lap at lines of sewage, which edge the beach like foul lace.  Hovels sit disconsolately in the mire, occasionally visited by lean, stray dogs drifting through them.  The buildings jut up out of piles of odorous debris like crooked, half-rotten teeth in the mouth of a troll.

title: Shanty Town, Waterfront
description: The lane comes to a sorry end at the edge of a nasty-looking beach, ambling between a cluster of mean hovels loitering along the water's edge.  Old cans, broken boxes and the corpses of rats defile the mud tracks in haphazard piles, and the beach appears to grow more polluted the closer it comes to the bay.

title: West Bank, Dock Street
description: The cobbled street extends along the riverbank, overlooking the continual traffic of merchant boats that pass to and fro.  Colorful sails and gaily painted cargo ships fill the river, and banners and flags in an equal variety of colors are hung from wooden poles along the road.  A set of weathered wooden stairs leads down to a bustling pier below.

title: West Bank, Dock Street
description: Tall wooden poles hung with colorful banners are set along the street, fluttering splashes of color in the river breeze.  A trimmed hedgerow separates the road from the pier below, where locals and visitors alike relax and enjoy the waterfront.

title: West Bank, Dock Street
description: Seagulls walk along the cobblestones, squawking at passersby as they search the crevices for morsels.  The breeze from the river flutters the banners hung along the road, and the colorful blossoms of the flowers planted around the townhouses overlook the water and its traffic of passing boats.

title: West Bank, Dock Street
description: The cobblestone road ends in a neat circle around a tall modwir tree that seems to be home to a few squirrels that roost on the branches, chittering as the leaves stir in the river breeze.  The riverbank slopes up to a grassy, tree-lined area above, and down to the shore below.

title: West Bank, Riverside
description: A slight curve in the riverbank forms a narrow sand beach, bordered by a neatly mowed grassy area.  Several houses are situated among the trees that circle the parklike area, and a wooden picnic table and benches stand near the strip of sand.

title: West Bank, Under Bridge
description: The stone arch of the bridge over the Locksmehr passes above the road here, shading the cottages set along the riverbank.  Fish swarm in the cool water, schooling around the barnacle-studded pillars of the bridge and glistening as they dart into the depths to avoid passing boats.

title: West Bank, Dock Street
description: Deep green hedges line the west side of the cobblestone road, bordering the wooden townhouses that overlook the river.  Gulls squawk from their nests along the edge of the bridge to the north, complaining at the ships that pass below.  A painted wooden boardwalk lies along the water to the east, and a side street leads west up the riverbank.

title: West Bank, Schooner Lane
description: The narrow lane is lined with neatly kept homes that enjoy a view of the river and the east bank in the distance.  To the north, a constant stream of town traffic passes over the stone bridge.  The high wooden wall that bounds the street to the west is painted with a colorful seascape of a sailing ship riding the waves.

title: West Bank, Schooner Lane
description: Climbing vines cover the wooden fence that separates this quiet lane from the town streets to the west.  Well-kept flowerbeds are set around the houses that overlook the river far below.  A small dog scampers among the cobblestones, chasing the stray seagulls that occasionally alight on the road.

title: West Bank, Schooner Lane
description: The lane ends in a small cul-de-sac which looks down over the river below.  A neatly painted wooden fence separates the lane from the bustle of the town streets to the west.  Brightly blooming rosebushes surround the cul-de-sac, their fragrance blending with the fresh air of the waterfront.

title: West Bank, Dock Street
description: A merchant barge, hung with colorful banners and weighed down with crates of goods, passes slowly down the river below.  Locals and residents stroll along the cobblestones past the rows of neat townhouses, some waving to the sailors as they go by.

title: West Bank, Dock Street
description: The cool breeze from the river blows in, rustling the hedges and fluttering the decorative flags and banners strung along the street.  A narrow bed of irises and violets has been planted along the row of townhouses, filling the air with a flowery scent.

title: West Bank, Dock Street
description: The street ends in a cul-de-sac, surrounded by neat trimmed hedges and freshly-painted houses.  The cobblestones form a circular pattern around a pedestal on which stands a statue of a human sailor, hoisting his gear as he extends an eternal salute to the passing ships on the river below.

title: West Bank, Boardwalk
description: A young elven boy sits by the whitewashed railing, gazing out over the river as he casts his fishing line.  The wind gusts, whipping through the ropes and sails of ships passing on the water and stirring the colorful blossoms planted in pots and flowerbeds along the row of homes next to the boardwalk.

title: West Bank, Boardwalk
description: A canopy of white canvas has been suspended over part of the boardwalk on brightly painted blue poles, allowing a bit of shade over a wooden table and benches in the fresh air.  Seabirds perch on the boardwalk railing, diving for their dinner in the river then returning to preen and squawk on their perches.

title: West Bank, Boardwalk
description: A sturdy wooden boardwalk, painted with a fresh coat of whitewash, runs along the side of the river.  Wooden benches rest along the bright blue railing along the edge, providing a place to relax and fish or just watch the merchant boats pass by.  Houses have been built along the boardwalk, surrounded by colorful potted plants and decorative fishing nets.

title: West Bank, Park
description: This grassy area is bounded by a tall wooden fence that separates it from the bustling town streets to the west.  The sails of passing boats on the river below can be glimpsed through a row of neatly pruned trees, and children scamper and play in the open area amidst the houses set among the greenery.

title: Paupers, Dark Landing
description: The air in this dark, cramped room is cool and musty.  Tattered cobwebs hang in the corners of the ceiling.  The narrow wooden stairs look rather rickety.

title: Paupers, Diving Tower
description: The tall, rickety wooden ladder sways slightly under your weight.  The rungs show the wear of many sweaty hands.  Sunlight glints brightly off the water in the pool below.  The pool looks rather small from this height.

title: Paupers, Diving Tower
description: The very tall, very rickety wooden ladder sways considerably under your weight.  Below you the pool looks very, very small.

title: Paupers, Diving Tower Platform
description: The narrow platform sways wildly under your weight.  Far below the pool seems nothing more than a bright, insignificant speck.  A short distance above you is the dome of the crystal ceiling.

title: Paupers, Pool
description: Your skin tingles as the cool, sparkling water envelops you.  There is plenty of room for swimming brisk, refreshing laps, playing games with friends, or simply relaxing.

title: Paupers, Rose Garden
description: Nestled amidst towering modwir and willow trees is an expansive rose garden that stretches across one entire side of the grounds.  Surrounded by wrought iron fencing and trimmed verdant hedges, the garden embodies soothing tranquility as it mutes the sounds of the town.  Lines of rose beds border a curving path that leads to the edge of a deep blue pond and a small wooden fishing dock.  Tucked in near some shady trees is a worn wooden bench facing a bubbling rose quartz marble fountain.

title: House Sylvanfair, Courtyard
description: A majestic tree stands before you, larger than any other tree in the entire Landing.  The bright green leaves are bigger than a giantman's hand, and the branches appear to cradle whole rooms in their gigantic embrace!  A soft light glows from the various knotholes and windows set in the tree.  A door set under a large archway formed from living wood leads into the trunk.

title: House Sovyn, Courtyard
description: Fragrant herbs and flowers grow under fruit trees around a small hillock where empaths and clerics see to those in need.  A fountain rests in the middle of the hillock where a crystal wind chime sways in the wind, hanging from a willow tree.  A large house, ordained with silver spires and twined ivy, is accented by a crystal tower on one side.  Double doors carved in rich pinewood give entrance to the house.

title: Liabo Circle, Koar's Way
description: The trees are neatly trimmed and of equal height, slightly taller than the large wood-and-stone homes lining this serene street.  No raucous noises disturb the air.  Even the cobblestones look polished.

title: Liabo Circle, Koar's Way
description: A triangle of grass has been cut out of the middle of the intersection, a small, shrub-lined park.  In the middle is a gaming board, at which two aging elven priests stare intently.

title: Liabo Circle, Koar's Way
description: A dignified old halfling couple walks deliberately down the street, finely dressed and holding hands.  Off to one side of the road, some giantman children play at a game involving a ball, some string and lots of giggling.

title: Liabo Circle, Ronan's Way
description: A horse-drawn carriage waits in front of one stately home, its driver leaning back in sleep.  The animals stare placidly ahead, ignoring a small dog sniffing curiously at their hooves.

title: Liabo Circle, Ronan's Way
description: The grass to either side of the street is trimmed as neat as a carpet.  A young elven couple takes advantage of this, walking barefoot and arm-in-arm.  You can't quite make out the words of the song he sings softly to her.

title: Liabo Circle, Ronan's Way
description: An enormous dwarf walks his dog down this tree-lined, cobblestone street.  The dog is tiny, barely even a cat, but looks quite jaunty with a big, bright pink ribbon around its neck.

title: Liabo Circle, Phoen's Way
description: The street bends sharply here, the outside edge running along a small pond.  The dark, still waters reflect the skies, redoubling the day's beauty.

title: Liabo Circle, Phoen's Way
description: In the center of this three-way intersection is a black marble fountain, water spouting up from the middle and splashing merrily down.  A fat, white pigeon glares out from the bowl, daring any to disturb her bath. To the west, you see the beginnings of a wide wooden bridge.

title: Liabo Circle, Niima's Way
description: This wooden bridge stretches over a pond filled with deep, clear water.  On the lilypads below, a few small frogs bask in the sun, occasionally hopping from one pad to another, as better spots become available.  A cat on the pond's edge watches this with intense interest.  Narrow wooden walkways lead off the bridge to the snug private homes on the shore.

title: Liabo Circle, Niima's Way
description: This is more a bridge than a street, extended over a long pond which continues to the east.  Though the waters are clear, you cannot see the pond's bottom.  A school of silvery fish races about, incredibly agile and fast.  Narrow wooden pathways lead off the bridge to a few homes built on the water's edge.

title: Liabo Circle, Lumnis' Way
description: A flower garden is planted in the center of this intersection -- white roses, blue tulips and brilliant yellow carnations ablaze in the sun.  On the eastern side of the street, the beginnings of a wooden bridge are flanked by tall, proud fel trees.  Beneath them, a finely garbed halfling snoozes in the sun, occasionally wriggling his toes with some dreamy pleasure.  He keeps a tight grip on his pipe, though.

title: Liabo Circle, Lumnis' Way
description: Tall modwir trees, thick-limbed and lush-leaved, arch over the street.  The serenity of the perpetual gloom below is unbroken, save for the soft cooing of a dove hidden somewhere in the dark bowers.

title: Liabo Circle, Lumnis' Way
description: Soft strains of the lute and a subtle soprano blend and float on the breeze down the street.  They seem to come from an open window on the second floor of one elegant home.  On the opposite side of the road, a white cat naps in the sun.

title: Liabo Circle, Phoen's Way
description: The sides of the road are planted with huge yellow flowers, neck high to a giantman.  Opposite this forest of land-bound sunlight are several elegant homes.

title: Liabo Circle, Voln's Way
description: Along the side of the street is an odd monument in brass, iron and stone.  It looks like nothing more than a ten foot tall cube with a sneering face on each side.  Several pigeons have shown their own love of art in the manner of connoisseur birds.

title: Liabo Circle, Voln's Way
description: A white marble statue of Voln stands beside the road, arms and face raised up toward the sky.  A group of children stare up at it, listening to their fat, half-elven teacher.  Two of the students near the back of the group whisper to each other, giggling softly.

title: Tiger Court Lane
description: Neatly cobblestoned lanes extend off in three directions, lined by rows of thick shade trees that filter dappled light onto the varicolored stone.  Cottages of brick and wood line the streets, bounded by colorful flowerbeds and neatly trimmed bushes.  A large calico cat rests in a patch of sun at the end of a shaded path between the trees.

title: Tiger Court, Calico Lane
description: Stately elms line both sides of the narrow lane, shading the trimmed front yards of the quiet cottages along the way.  A pair of small striped tabby cats scamper in a raked pile of leaves by the side of the cobblestones.

title: Tiger Court, Mouse Alley
description: Small cottages clustered closely together line this narrow lane.  The grey flagstones beneath your feet have been etched with carvings of scampering mice and rats being chased by playful felines.  A hedge of lavender lines the street, filling the air with its soft fragrance.

title: Tiger Court, Tabby Lane
description: The branches of tall oaks on both sides of the lane shade the road, throwing patches of shifting light on the cobblestones.  Small flowerbeds filled with a bright array of blossoms adorn the yards of the cottages, adding splashes of color to the lane.

title: Tiger Court, Tabby Lane
description: Butterflies flutter around a bed of bright tiger-lilies that grow along the hedge.  The lane is quiet but for a songbird whistling a melody somewhere in the thick branches that shade the cobblestones and gardens.

title: Tiger Court, Tabby Lane
description: Sunlight filters through the oaks, forming patterns of light on the hedges and cobblestones.  A striped kitten explores among the hedges, darting in and out as it chases insects and sunbeams.

title: Tiger Court, Tabby Lane
description: An old oak tree stands at the corner of the lane, its leafy branches shading the neatly kept cottages.  Morning glories wind around its massive trunk, their blue blossoms bright in the filtered sunlight.

title: Tiger Court, Corners
description: A black cat crouches on the rim of a small stone well, tail flicking as it gazes into the flickering light on the water.  A narrow flagstone path leads into a shaded garden to the southwest.

title: Tiger Court, Lynx Circle
description: The cobblestone road circles around a carved stone fountain to the east and south, branching off into a narrow lane to the west.  Gaily colored beds of lilies and petunias are planted by the side of the lane and around the fountain, and neatly trimmed hedges surround the cottages arranged around the circle.

title: Tiger Court, Lynx Circle
description: A large stone fountain surrounded by a shimmering pool forms the center of the circle, carved of pinkish-grey granite into an elaborate sculpture of a band of wildcats gracefully bringing down an unfortunate velnalin.  Spring water gurgles merrily from the top of the fountain, filling the air with a fresh, moist scent and feeding the beds of snapdragons and lilies that grow around the pool.

title: Tiger Court Lane
description: Several well-maintained brick and stone homes are arranged around a small cul-de-sac at the corner of the lane.  A circular flowerbed occupies the center of the corner, filled with a mass of brightly blooming orange tiger-lilies.

title: Tiger Court Lane
description: Oak trees stand on both sides of the lane, their leafy branches arching above the stones.  A sleek grey cat paces back and forth across the branches as if waiting to pounce on something below.  Fallen oak leaves scatter as the breeze kicks up, swirling in circles around the trunks.

title: Tiger Court Lane
description: The red, grey, and brown cobblestones which pave the lane have been arranged in a mosaic pattern of a huge striped tiger, its claws outstretched beneath your feet and its tail curving somewhere farther down to the east.  Small landscaped lawns surround the neat little cottages on both sides of the lane.

title: Tiger Court, Firecat Lane
description: A bed of flamestalks and roses runs along the low brick wall that bounds the sides of the street, the bright red and orange blossoms making fiery splashes in the shade.  Leafy branches arch over the lane, rustling softly in the breeze.

title: Tiger Court, Firecat Lane
description: A large, tiger-striped tomcat stalks along the top of the low brick wall, ignoring passersby as he concentrates on some invisible prey.  Flamestalks wave softly in the light breeze, flashing bright orange in the sunlight that filters through the trees.

title: Tiger Court, Tabby Lane
description: A sleek black cat crouches in the shade, its tail flicking as it eyes the colorful birds that play around a small stone fountain in the corner of the lane.  Neatly trimmed hedges line the shaded cobblestones, bordering the small yards of the cottages beneath the oaks.

title: Tiger Court, Calico Lane
description: Filtered light streams through the oaks and elms that shade the lane, throwing flickering patterns on the cobblestones.  Songbirds flitter and roost among the branches, avoiding the felines that roam the hedges below.

title: Tiger Court, Lynx Circle
description: A group of kittens of various colors play among the hedges that surround the neatly kept yards of the cottages, darting in and out of the greenery.  Flowerbeds line the cobblestones and the edge of the granite fountain, filling the air with the fragrances of various blossoms.

title: Tiger Court, Lynx Circle
description: Colorful lilies and snapdragons grow around the base of the circular fountain that forms the center of the circle.  The branches of shade trees whisper in the slight breeze.  A grey kitten plays at the edge of the fountain, splashing playfully in the water.

title: Wehnimer's, Courtyard
description: A wooden gate framed by a high wall covered with ivy encloses the small, sunlit courtyard on all sides.  The ivy's dark green leaves create a dense cover that blocks out almost all of the noise from Wehnimer's busy streets.  Flagstones are set into a path passing under a lattice arch, which offers an avenue out of the picturesque enclosure.

metadata.source: the Garden Cottage, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Flagstone Terrace
description: A flagstone terrace is ringed with tall trees and beds of flowers, each competing to outshine the others with an abundance of blooms.  The walk meanders, from a wooden gate framed by a high wall covered with ivy, to a shingle-clad cottage.  The dwelling is settled into its array of gardens like a jewel, the trees overhead dappling its curved roofline with shade and keeping the interior cool and comfortable.  A deep violet door opens into the cottage.

metadata.source: the Garden Cottage, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Lobby
description: The spacious lobby is furnished with old but well-kept chairs and couches in a variety of deep-toned upholstery.  Several residents and locals lounge around the quiet room, reading and drinking coffee or bottles of ale.  An expansive carpet woven with the image of an ancient dragon bordered in elaborate mystical patterns covers the floor.  A polished wooden staircase leads up.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Hallway
description: The cozy hallway is panelled in dark, polished wood that seems to have been installed centuries ago.  A thick burgundy-colored carpet covers most of the stone floor, worn by many years of passing boots but still soft under your feet.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Hallway
description: The hallway is dimly illuminated by faintly glowing oil-lamps set in brass sconces on the wood-panelled walls.  A pile of mops and brooms and buckets of greyish water stands in the corner.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Hallway
description: A colorful braided rug covers a worn patch in the deep wool carpeting where the hallway turns.  Hanging on the wall is a gold-framed portrait of a chainmail-clad warrior standing over the corpse of a huge bear.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Hallway
description: The faint glow of the oil-lamps fills the hallways with a faint yellowish light. An open door casts a shadow along the deep red woolen carpeting.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Second Floor
description: The carpet here is a deep emerald green, and it seems to have been replaced at least some time in the last decade.  Brass chandeliers hang at intervals from the ceiling, filling the hall with dim candlelight.  A polished wooden stairwell leads up and down.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Second Floor
description: A darker patch on the thick green carpet lies under the small window that looks out on the street below - apparently the residents have neglected to close it when it rains.  The brass chandelier on the ceiling is missing a few candles, but the window provides plenty of light to find the doors.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Second Floor
description: The remains of a few colorful streamers hang from the brass chandelier, left over from some past celebration.  An old brass shield has been nailed up on the oaken wall, with two hooks that look to have once held some ornamental weapon below them.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Second Floor
description: Footsteps on a hard floor echo from somewhere above, but the deep green carpeting here is soft under your feet.  An unidentifiable but appetizing aroma of someone's dinner cooking wafts through the air.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Second Floor
description: A dwarven workman stands atop a ladder in the center of the hall, changing the candles in one of the chandeliers.  His movements throw flickering shadows on the deep green carpet and polished oaken walls.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Second Floor
description: A small glazed window looks out on the nearby buildings and the patch of weeds that passes for a backyard below.  An ornately framed landscape of a typical woodland scene hangs on the panelled wall amid numerous old nail-holes where other paintings have hung over the years.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Third Floor
description: The floor here is bare hardwood, polished to a sheen by generations of passing feet.  Large wax candles set in sconces along the walls cast a yellowish light along the hallway.  A polished wooden staircase leads down.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Third Floor
description: A small window provides a view of the nearby rooftops and the street below.  The slight breeze from the window causes the candle-flames to flicker, casting odd shadows on the painted walls. A narrow staircase leads up into the ceiling.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Third Floor
description: Faint footsteps echo on the hardwood floor from somewhere around a corner.  A gold-framed painting of a rotund but not unattractive human woman reclining on a couch in a state of semi-undress is mounted on the beige-painted wall.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Third Floor
description: A small metal bucket has been set in the corner to catch a drip of water from a leak in the ceiling.  One small section of the wall appears to have been recently repaired, and a faint smell of paint is noticeable.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Third Floor
description: The hardwood floor of the hall looks to be recently waxed, but worn by generations of footsteps.  A small pile of empty chests rests in the corner, waiting to be taken out with the trash.  A large wax candle flickers in a sconce on the wall.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Third Floor
description: The walls here have been plastered and recently painted over in a lovely shade of deep beige.  Candles set in sconces along the walls provide flickering illumination.

title: Frith's Inn, Second Floor
description: You are on the second floor of the inn.  As you lean over the polished modwir railing that surrounds the open landing, you see the front room below.  The stairway continues up and down here.  To the east is an oak door and to the west a teakwood door bearing a brass plaque.

title: Frith's Inn, Boudoir
description: This boudoir is lushly appointed with curtains and bedclothes of red velvet and black satin.  A large brass bed dominates the room.  Beside the bed is a richly carved nightstand with a gilt frame on it.

title: Frith's Inn, Bedchamber
description: The welcome sight of a roomy cot bedecked with a featherbed mattress, ice goose down quilt, and plump pillows greets you.  Any weary traveller would gladly rest and restore body and spirits alike in this comfortable, airy chamber.

title: Frith's Inn, Loft
description: Shards of shattered glass crackle as you make your way across this loft of the inn, which appears to have been plundered and left unrepaired.  A rope ladder dangles from the skylight above.  There is no longer anything here of value, only cobwebs, rain-warped floorboards and the odor of rotting wood.

title: Frith's Inn, A Private Booth
description: Off in this cozy corner booth you are treated to a bit more privacy by high wooden partitions, but afforded a good view of the bustling saloon hall. The small oil lamp on the table provides a warm and steady glow of light. The noises of the crowds out there seem far away from this perfect little spot for a quiet dinner, while you watch the patrons and the innkeep go about their evening's business.

title: Beldrin's Game Hall, Reception
description: From the southwest, the clatter of dice, the clicking of ivory, and the shuffling of cards is heard.  Looking around the reception area, you see a faded sofa upon which sits a young couple, passing the time in pleasant self-involvement.  To the north is a black door guarded by a shifty-looking dwarf.

title: Beldrin's Game Hall, Main Room
description: This is the main gambling den of the hall.  The air is rife with the perspiration of nervous intensity.  The lack of distractions indicates this is the domain of serious gamblers.  A dice table, some card tables and a gaming table have players and kibbitzers clustered around them.  Looking about, you try to sort out the winners and losers.  The cry of a hawker and excited shouts from players can be heard from beyond a narrow arch on the far side of room.

title: Beldrin's Gaming Hall, Wheel
description: This small room seems even smaller because of the tremendously high ceiling here.  Nearly cutting the room in half is a large counter.  Behind the counter and hanging on the back wall is the Wheel of Chance.  Keeping a watchful eye on the entire proceedings is a large man, the hawker.  The only exit is through the narrow arch that leads back to the main gaming hall.

title: Beldrin's Game Hall, Office
description: This is Beldrin's office.  Though alone, the uneasy feeling that your movements do not go undetected persists.  A portrait of Beldrin hangs over a desk, depicting him flatteringly in the style of the Elanith masters.  A decanter of traesharm berry liqueur and two accounting ledgers, both labeled with identical dates, are atop the desk.

title: The Merchants' Emporium
description: Customers wander through this room, headed into and out of the various shops.  Lazing against a nearby wall, a merchant takes a break from the bustle of his work.

title: Barbley's Beds
description: Multitudes of beds in a huge variety of styles and finishes lie stacked haphazardly around the shop, some tilting precariously.  Small pathways wind between the items, giving customers just enough room to view the floor samples.  At one end of the showroom, a collection of stately four-poster beds enjoys a more spacious display area and the benefit of subtle lighting.

title: Mreeth's Quality Walls
description: The walls and floor of this salesroom are covered with a mismatched patchwork of polished woods in a variety of finishes and hues.  Each gleaming piece of wood fits precisely against its neighbor, an impressive demonstration of the skill of the craftsman who decorated the shop.

title: Drumble's Oddities
description: Drumble's dimly lit shop is piled to the rafters with a tangle of tables.  From each tottering pile protrudes a strange combination of plain and polished and white-painted table legs, the item to which they belong quite indiscernible without close inspection.  Drumble himself leans casually against one particularly diverse stack, grumbling quietly to himself every time a customer requests a deeply-buried item.

title: Rhynnde's Exquisite Rugs
description: Elegant candelabra laden with fat beeswax candles softly illuminate this charming shop and the pleasant, smiling features of its proprietor.  A highly-polished floor of rich-hued maoral complements and enhances Rhynnde's impressive collection of thick woolen rugs and elegant mats, their deep colors and varied textures inviting customers to linger deliciously over the extensive selection.

title: Lianedra's Hangings
description: Various wall hangings flutter from the rafters, wafting in the tiny breeze created by shoppers moving beneath.  Displayed prominently on the rear wall, a large hanging depicting the symbol of Koar glows beneath a softly focused light.  The scent of incense drifts gently in the air.

title: Firenna's Fireplaces
description: The walls and much of the floorspace in Firenna's sizeable showroom are lined with hearths and stoves of every imaginable variety.  Ranging from the simplest stone firepit to the most ornate and elaborate marble fireplace, there is something in her catalog to suit every taste and budget.

title: Flaygeyl's Flooring
description: The sweet, dry fragrance of freshly sanded wood permeates the air in this spacious shop, combining comfortably with the smell of deep orange polishing oil.  Spread across the floor and proudly propped on sample racks around the walls, Flaygeyl's diverse selection of wooden floorboards await the purchaser's home decorating whimsy.

title: Sprytea's Window Shoppe
description: The pale, varnished wooden floors and whitewashed walls of Sprytea's store are designed to show off her merchandise to best advantage.  Glinting window displays hang from white oak beams high in the lofty ceiling, lending the sophisticated air of an art gallery to the cool, quiet shop.  Only the occasional murmured transaction or footstep on floorboard breaks the soft silence.

title: Orc's Nest Road
description: The narrow cobblestone lane leads east and west, winding between rows of humble wood and stone houses.  Smoke rises from many chimneys, filling the air with smells of burning wood and cooking food and more than a little haze.  A life-size stone statue of a grinning orc stands by the gate, keeping watch as workmen and visitors pass to and fro.

title: Orc's Nest Road
description: An open stone fireplace stands by the side of the road here, between the cottages in the shade of a small oak tree.  Judging by the rough wooden benches arranged nearby and the lingering smell of roasted meat, it probably serves as a neighborhood barbecue of sorts.  A narrow dirt lane leads north.

title: Orc's Nest Road
description: A low wooden fence lines the cobblestones, surrounded by tufts of colorful weeds.  Small gates in the fence lead to the entrances of cottages along the way.  A faint haze of smoke from chimneys and cooking fires permeates the area.

title: Orc's Nest Road
description: The high wooden wall that borders the road to the east is covered with sun-faded paintings of orcs and trolls, the caricatures grinning down on the shingled cottages that rest in its shade.  An aroma of apple pie wafts from an oven in a nearby cottage, and faint sounds of revelry can be heard from an inn somewhere beyond the wall.

title: Orc's Nest Road
description: The cobblestones end here at a low stone wall that bounds a group of small cottages.  Sunflowers poke their heads over the wall, turning to face the light, and a small dog pants lazily in the shade of the stone.  A dirt road leads off to the west.

title: Gnoll Street, Garden
description: A vacant lot between two cottages is home to a thriving vegetable garden, filled with cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, and the green tops of what look like onions and carrots.  A calico cat stretches on the wooden fence surrounding the garden, watching passing pedestrians with a bored expression.

title: Gnoll Street, Dead End
description: The road ends at the back wall of an inn that rises two stories above you.  Clinging vines of ivy climb the stone wall, thriving in the shade and spreading onto the nearby cottages, and patches of flowering weeds and grass grow thickly in the corners.

title: Troll's Way
description: Low stone walls border the cobblestones on both sides, broken by gaps in the wall in front of the thatched stone cottages.  Set atop the wall at intervals are carved stone heads, their troll-like visages grinning at you as you pass.

title: Troll's Way, Rock Garden
description: An army of carved rocks stands in the heat, each statue throwing a shadow over a miscellany of smaller stones in its lee.  Rock buildings ring the central tableau, like an audience watching a sport of combat.  Curtains in the windows reveal the buildings to be residences, although the exteriors more resemble roadside huts.

title: Troll's Way, Gnome Corner
description: The jumbled lane ends in a sorry excuse for a cul-de-sac.  Buildings stand haphazardly around a disjointed turn in the road.  The homes are built of stone, with roofs thatched in scanty shrub.  A lively group of small statues stands in one corner of the circle,  carved as a trio of prancing, bearded gnomes.

title: Troll's Way, Golem Corner
description: A grove of large boulders throws a little shade over a cluster of buildings.  Rocks stand around, some half-carved, most just positioned, creating a haphazard walkway between the dwellings.  One large stone, certainly the most dominant one of the group, is carved into the image of a golem, its heavy features somber with thought.

title: Orc's Nest Road
description: Wooden wagons stand parked along the lane, some empty and some packed with goods brought from market.  A few children carry on a game of stickball on the cobblestones, kicking up clouds of dust that hang in the air.  The thatched cottages that line the street are not luxurious, but lace curtains in the glassless windows and occasional flowerpots lend an air of civility.

title: Orc's Nest Road, Intersection
description: The lane curves along the back of a row of old warehouses, forming an intersection with a smaller dirt road that leads north.  Clotheslines have been hung between the cottages and the warehouse walls, and a variety of colorful but simple garb flaps in the intermittent breeze.  A circle of stones in the intersection surrounds a poorly tended flowerbed that sports more weeds than roses.

title: Manticore Lane
description: Thatched cottages bounded by small yards that are more dirt than grass line the narrow lane.  The marks of countless wagon-wheels have been worn into the hard dirt surface of the road, and a bit of water from the last rainfall remains in the ruts, providing refreshment for neighborhood dogs.

title: Manticore Lane, Cul-de-sac
description: The dirt road ends in a small cul-de-sac bounded by a circle of flowerbeds that contain a variety of blooming weeds.  A small stone well stands at the center of the road, and passers-by lower the bucket for a drink or to carry a pot of water back to their home.  The pleasant voice of a woman singing a familiar Dwarven drinking song echoes from a nearby cottage.

title: Manticore Lane
description: A larger-than-life wooden statue of a snarling manticore stands on a block of stone by the side of the lane, overseeing the passing wagons and playing children as they go by.  Patches of grass and flowering weeds grow along the dirt thoroughfare, and the various odors of cooking and firewood fill the air.

title: Goblin Road, Intersection
description: The road widens here, branching off into a dirt lane to the south and ending in a cobblestoned cul-de-sac to the east.  A circle of stones in the intersection surrounds a bright patch of flowering weeds.  A faint haze of smoke from numerous chimneys fills the air.

title: Goblin Road, Alleyway
description: The cobblestones turn through an area of tightly clustered cottages set across from a high wooden fence that borders the street, forming a narrow alleyway.  Some local artist has painted the fence with a fanciful mural of a group of trolls and giants engaged in some bloody sport.  Clumps of grass and a few weeds grow along the fence and between the old cobblestones.

title: Goblin Road, Mound
description: The road curves as it rises over the mound of a low hill that is little more than a large bump in the road.  Thumps, clangs, clatters and the shouts of workmen can be heard from the warehouses to the west.  Crows roost on the thatched and shingled roofs of the cottages, squawking at passing residents.

title: Gnoll Street, Muddy Bend
description: The dirt road dips into a small depression as it turns, and the wagon-wheel ruts are filled with muddy water.  A patch of bright flowers, nourished by the relative dampness, thrives around a fence that borders a small group of cottages.  The discordant sound of someone engaged in much-needed practice on a fiddle echoes in the air.

title: Gnoll Street
description: A larger-than-life carved wooden statue of a gnoll stands beside the dirt road, its colorful paint faded by the smoke and weather.  Long ruts made by countless passing wagon-wheels stripe the road, a few stray tufts of grass sprouting between them.

title: Goblin Road, Cul-de-sac
description: A dog yelps from someone's back yard, keeping up his barking until a half-dozen neighborhood mutts join in the chorus.  A stone bench circles a small tree in the center of the cul-de-sac, providing a shady place to chat amid the cobblestones and dust.  The mouthwatering aroma of roasting meat wafts from a nearby window.

title: Wehnimer's Historical Society
description: Ribbon-tied scrolls bearing the wax seals of different guilds are piled eight and nine layers deep on the broad mahogany desk that sits under a dust-speckled window.  Nailed to one wall is an old map bristling with colored pins.

title: Wehnimer's Historical Society
description: Built into the simple pine plank walls are towering shelves overstuffed with old books.  Most of the volumes hold bookmarks, torn scraps of paper, or even small twigs.  If this is a reference library, there is no discernible order to its contents.

title: Wehnimer's Historical Society
description: A plain rosewood table draped with a narrow white linen cloth rests in the center of the room, its only decoration a polished silver bowl lit by a falling shaft of sunlight.  Placed reverently before the table is a straight-backed dark teak bench.  The floor is bare and scrubbed clean to the very corners.

title: Wehnimer's Historical Society
description: The most notable aspect of this room is the imposing blackboard which takes up the entire eastern wall.  Stationed in front of it is a slightly canted lectern dusted with ancient layers of chalk.  The only available place to sit is at a cramped little desk with a leaking inkwell.

title: Wehnimer's Historical Society
description: Many toys in various stages of repair spill out from a large stamped tin chest to colonize the polished floor.  The long vertical planks of the wall are painted in an alternating rainbow of primary colors, with some additional charcoal decoration in the lowest portion.  Stacked on a little oak table are several sheets of parchment and a selection of drawing tools.

title: Engraver's Shop, Atelier
description: Weapons and armor, intricately engraved, etched and damascened, line the walls of this impressive, cluttered workshop.  Apprentices and students hunch over benches, lavishing ornamentation on finely forged arms.  Overseeing it all from one corner is Karl Owntafeet, Master Engraver.

title: Helga's, Dining Hall
description: Unlit oil lamps hang in iron sconces along the smoke-stained walls of the low-ceilinged room.  Several tables and an oaken sideboard, bearing traces of the previous day's meals, are flanked by a long wooden bench and a few smaller chairs.  A leaded glass window, its dusty panes half-covered by filmy curtains, lets a little filtered light into the room, and a brick hearth smolders against the north wall.

title: Helga's, Pub Room
description: The narrow, dimly lit room is cluttered with rickety, ale-stained tables and chairs.  Candle stubs mounted in earthenware ale flasks offer the only light, their yellowish glow making the room seem more decrepit than it actually is.  Several dockworkers converse around a table in hushed voices, between sips of grog and puffs of strong pipe tobacco.  A low wooden stage, no more than a small platform, stands at the far end of the room.

title: Helga's, Back Alley
description: The narrow alley, shaded by the overhanging eaves of the stone and wood buildings that rise on all sides, is full of debris, piles of rags and filth.  A broken wooden chair, an old crate and a trash barrel are piled to either side of the smoke-stained oaken door that leads into the back of the building to the south.

title: Helga's, Kitchen
description: Puffs of foul-smelling steam rise from a pot of simmering, scum-covered liquid resting atop an ancient cast-iron stove, condensing on the formerly whitewashed walls to form dripping, greasy smears.  A stained wooden counter stands along one wall, a row of iron hooks hanging above it, and a heap of filthy rags and aprons in the corner occasionally twitches with the explorations of hungry vermin.

title: Local Warehouse, Dry Storage
description: The wooden floor groans in protest at your weight.  Sacks of wheat, rye, and other grains are stacked high against one wall.  You notice ants marching in the cracks between the floorboards.

title: Local Warehouse, Stowage
description: This chamber's high ceilings accommodate an array of equipment designed for loading merchandise between ships and the dock.

title: Local Warehouse, Entry
description: You watch as crates, boxes and assorted other goods come though the entrance into the warehouse.  The local merchants who own the goods are also here checking each item as it is stowed away.

title: Local Warehouse, Office
description: A gaunt cat glances up at you as you look around this unkept office.  The desk, made of a piece of wood across two crates, is overflowing with documents related to the inventory of items in the warehouse.  You see a small sign on the desk, and a trunk with a lock in the corner.

title: Herbalist's, Laboratory
description: This room resembles nothing so much as an exotic greenhouse.  The air is heavy, warm and humid, with a constant stream of steam rising from a kettle in the corner.  Trailing vines, velvety mosses, and woody herbs grow in pots along the floor.

title: Kilron's Pawnshop, Stash Room
description: You slip behind the rack and are startled to see all manner of precious gems, ora and mein jewelry, and sacks of coins piled on the floor. Tempted to help yourself, thinking a missing sack might go unnoticed, the narrow exit and the pawnbroker in the outer room make you reconsider.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: Traffic in and out of the neighborhood flows through a stone gateway, the road surface changing from hard-packed dirt to rock at the property line.  Several merchants hawk their wares from carts just outside the entrance, hoping to land a big sale from the well-heeled Lords and Ladies passing by.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: Sunlight bounces off the red brick used for the chimneys in the surrounding houses, giving it a slight orange cast.  Cattails poke out of a small lily pond, waving gently in the breeze as small tassels puff away from the tops of their stalks.  The airborne seedlings waft away, so thick they look like a gentle snowfall.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: The shafts of broken lances were cleaned up and trimmed to create the fencing around the cabins here.  Butterflies fly about lazily enjoying the beautiful day.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: An intricately carved marble birdbath stands companion to a birdfeeder suspended from a tree branch overhead.  A gentle breeze rustles leaves, cooling off the warm day.  A wagon wheel with the spokes taken out of it hangs from a rope tied to another branch in the tree near the bath.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: An immense oak spreads its large branches out over the roadway, shading a wide expanse that includes some of the houses in the area.  Several benches are set in the cooler space, huddled together in a circle.  Up in the boughs of the great wood, a treehouse overlooks the goings on below.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: Cobblestone Court's great circle is paved with granite cobblestones, each with the name of a family donating money or goods to help construct the neighborhood.  Masons carefully set the stones, then sealed them with a moisture-resistant resin to preserve the inscriptions.  Gutters run the circumference of the curving road, taking away excess rainwater.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: Coachlights hang suspended from lengths of wrought iron carefully curved into long 'S' shapes and bolted onto homefronts.  Four-paned windows welcome the light pouring into the houses.  Carefully tended flower gardens line the fronts of the buildings, filled with bright colors.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: A broken wagon wheel lies right where it fractured, in the middle of the road across a large beam it partly shoved away towards the side of the street.  Open yards come right up to the edge of the pavement, large rounded bushes marking the corners of each property.  Several houses sport bird feeders and birdbaths out front, and several feathered guests take advantage of the thoughtfulness.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: Sunlight glitters off a reflection pool in a small park populated with young children with fishing rods.  Dogs run playfully around, barking at the butterflies flitting from flower to flower.  The shadows of large golden fish are visible underneath the surface of the water in the pond.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: A brick kiln puffs black smoke along the back wall of the development, hard at work firing pottery for use by the citizens of the town.  A drying rack sits next to the massive oven, covered with plates and vessels of every description.  On the other side of the structure, pieces of china await final touches before being taken to market for sale.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: Thick, brightly colored paint brings some life to an otherwise unremarkable shed situated between two homes on the south side of the road.  Stars ranging in size from tiny to an entire wall cover the exterior of the building, meeting at a waning sliver of a moon on the front.  A stack caps the roof, thick black smoking belching out of it.

title: Cobblestone Court, Circle
description: A field of clover and dandelions rolls out to the southeast, bounded by the crumbling walls of a once-proud keep.  Bright yellow flowers spot the green expanse, sunflares against the darker background.  An overgrown vine climbs one wall, forming a natural backdrop for the open grassland.

title: Cobblestone Court, Square
description: A few park benches sit around a small square, taking advantage of the shade trees stretching out over the plaza.  The central focus of the clearing is an elegant wishing well, complete with decorative roof.  Children beg their parents for coins to flip into its inky blackness, hoping for their planned extravagance to come true.

title: Cobblestone Court, Garden
description: Twin evergreens pruned into three-dimensional spirals stand as a gateway to the well to the south.  A formal garden of carefully groomed bushes and domestic flowers fits into curving geometric shapes, the walkways trailing the outer edges of the arcs.  A high wall sets the exquisite garden off from the rest of the neighborhood.
