title: Cobblestone Court, Garden
description: A quiet lily-covered pond is surrounded by a bed of wildflowers and exotic groundcover.  An occasional golden fin breaks the surface sending tiny ripples across the surface, making the pads undulate slowly on the top of the water.  Small bees buzz busily from flower to flower, then ferrying it back to their hive high up in the trees.

title: Cobblestone Court, Fortune Lane
description: Carefully inset into the stone, a coin on the ground just outside the front door of each home along the lane.  Legend has it that families observing this custom will give good luck to those passing through the portal.  The constant hum of crickets in the background recalls times spent in the wide open grasslands, far away from civilization.

title: Cobblestone Court, Fortune Lane
description: Wide red brick walkways lead up through wooden gates to intricately carved front doors on the homes in the neighborhood.  Each door on this street bears some charm for luck, ranging from a simple rabbits foot to the unusual four-leaf clover.  A family of ducks makes its home in a small pond behind one of the residences.

title: Cobblestone Court, Fortune Lane
description: Flecks of gold and silver glitter brightly from the sunlight striking the embedded metals in the cobblestone street.  Crickets and frogs chirp and croak loudly, adding to the rich environment surrounding the houses.

title: Cobblestone Court, Kismet Lane
description: An enterprising young child set up a lemonade stand on the streetcorner, with business so brisk that he had to leave to make more.  An empty jar sits on the counter of the stand next to a box of glasses.  Some of the neighborhood animals mill about, waiting for the boy's return and perhaps a tasty handout.

title: Cobblestone Court, Kismet Lane
description: A mound of dirt looks to have been created from the hole in the ground off to the side of the roadway.  The source of the digging is most likely the large hound chained to a tree in the front yard of one of the houses.  The dog has quite a collection of bones piled near the tree, their origin a mystery.

title: Cobblestone Court, Kismet Lane
description: Thatched roofs cap cozy homes along the length of Kismet Lane.  Birds warble in the trees, flitting back and forth in search of the perfect perch.  Lightly planted yards surround the quaint buildings, while vegetable gardens sit in between.

title: Wehnimer's, Middle Dock
description: Laboring dockworkers and strolling seamen mingle here on the weathered planks of the dock, between the hulls of large seafaring merchantmen.  The groan of ships pulling at hawsers, the clatter of feet upon gangplanks, and the swearing of the dockworkers mix with the cries of seabirds and the cadence of waves against the pilings.

title: Lanai's Warehouse, Cargo Room
description: Coming upon a cavernous space, you see bags, crates, and barrels filled with items worth being shipped on the great merchantmen that ply their trade to and from the port of Wehnimer's Landing.

title: Lanai's Warehouse, Crate Room
description: Immense crates are stacked several high, creating a maze of sorts between their myriad piles.

title: Lanai's Warehouse, Clay Jars
description: Sealed clay jars lie neatly stacked against the western wall of the warehouse.  They seem to be given a wide berth by the warehouse workers.

title: Lanai's Warehouse, Granary
description: Full bags of grain are stacked ten feet high in this far corner of the warehouse.  A few of the bags have punctured, leaving a scattering of grain in small mounds upon the floor.

title: Paspartu Moving Co., Lobby
description: A thin layer of sawdust covers the floor, marked by the footprints of a legion of shuffling feet.  Sturdy wooden benches line the walls, wedged between stacks of crates.  A stone fireplace is built into one wall and the lingering scent of burnt wood fills the air.

title: Paspartu Moving Co., Office
description: Tidier than the lobby, the office is arranged quite professionally.  A well-crafted dark rug covers the wooden floor and a small, charcoal etching is framed on the wall behind the desk.  Stacks of crates labelled with various destinations are arranged neatly in a corner.

title: Wehnimer's Exchange, Inside
description: The inside of the booth is brightly lit.  Clerks in smart uniforms greet customers with a smile, inquiring about the voyage and the wonders found on the other side of the sea as they exchange your funds.  The air of the place is one of salutation, bidding you a cheerful welcome home.

title: Wehnimer's, South Wharf
description: Dockworkers curse you and each other as they carry their loads from the great trade ships to the warehouses of Wehnimer's Landing.  Intermixed with the dockworkers are the crews of ships from various exotic and faraway ports.

title: Wehnimer Travel Office
description: This ticket office appears to be nothing more than a remodelled fishing shack.  On one of the unevenly boarded walls is a mural of some island scene, beneath which a slogan reads, "Teras Isle:  Voyages Daily!"

title: Wrenrick's, Main Chamber
description: Dim light diffuses through the main chamber of Wrenrick's Storage.  Unlabeled crates are neatly stacked to the south, bags of dried bread lichen to the east, while barrels and casks with varying contents line the western and northern walls.  In the distance, the war cry of a cat signals the impending death of a would be inhabitant.

title: Wrenrick's, Trunk Room
description: This small room contains trunks of all sizes and shapes.  Sturdy shelves from floor to ceiling increase the number that may be stored here.  A pulley and rope is attached to the high ceiling.

title: Wrenrick's, Office
description: A small desk and a crickety wooden chair almost fill this small office at the back of the warehouse.  From the half-solid white substance in it, you suspect the bowl in the corner once held milk for the cat.

title: Reignbeau Caverns, Tunnel
description: Splotches of color cover the walls, dripping down onto the floor.  Your feet stick a bit with every step and their soles must surely be turning every color of the rainbow.  More disgruntled dwarves lounge about, trying to avoid getting their tunics covered with clay.

title: Warehouse, Musty Room
description: A large open area surrounds you.  The musty odor of items stored too long in one place fills the room, and the floor is coated with dust and traces of vermin.  Sacks, crates, and barrels are stacked haphazardly around the room.  You somehow feel uneasy even though it appears that this warehouse has not been active for quite some time.  In the corner, a wooden ladder with a broken rung leads up.

title: Warehouse, Loft
description: You are in a loft above the warehouse.  The low ceiling causes you to hunch over.  The floor is spread with filthy straw, as though bedding for a vagrant or squatter.

title: Wineshop Salesroom
description: A wide variety of wine is on display within the hand-carved case, many of the vintages appearing to be quite rare.  A tall, well-dressed clerk attends to the bottles, quite busy as he moves about the room checking inventory.  He seems to be paying far more attention to the wine than to the customers.

title: Wine Shop, Lounge
description: Large candles resting upon elegant brass stands illuminate this richly appointed chamber, the candlelight soft and inviting.  While the bookcase along one wall is not completely full, the numerous tomes arranged within provide ample variety for those interested in a bit of reading.

title: Wine Shop, Cellar
description: Floor-to-ceiling iron racks house row after row of wine bottles, the shelving covering nearly every inch of wall space.  Dim flickering light coming from a single dusty sconce dances off the glassy surfaces of the bottles, the kaleidoscope of reflections all warped in similar fashion.

title: Cozy Shack
description: This is a cheery little shack, filled with light, the sound of birds outside and the heady scents of the herbs and flowers surrounding it.  A small fireplace burns brightly in the far wall.  White lace curtains adorn the windows, and a high fourposter bed sits invitingly in the corner.

title: Brewery, Entry Hall
description: The organic, musky smell of fermentation fills this large entry hall.  Here the famous ales and beers of Wehnimer's Landing are brewed.  Deliverymen scurry by with sacks of grain, wheelbarrows filled with hops and casks of spring water.  A corridor lies ahead to the north.

title: Brewery, Office
description: This is the brewmaster's office.  A long table by the window holds some corked bottles of pale golden liquid and crockery mugs.  An impressive fireplace occupies the major part of one entire wall and seems to demand closer scrutiny.

title: River Tower East, Roof
description: A small, roofed structure provides some weather protection on the open top level of the guard tower.  The view north across the bay affords a valuable vantage point, looking out towards the island of Glaoveln, home port of the warlike Ice Krolvin.  To the west and south, the blue rivers and rocky slopes of the Lower Trollfang region provide a breathtaking vista.

title: Observation Platform
description: All manner of gadgets presents themselves for manipulation.  A crystal eyepiece mounted on a spring arm can be raised and lowered on a whim by use of a horizontal and vertical cranks and a lever made of invar.  The rotating chair swivels easily around, showing great views of the surrounding area through vertical-slit windows that traverse the walls.

title: Black Wolves Manor, Courtyard
description: Tucked away from the bustle of town, the courtyard is awash with the warm light that streams through the manor's windows.  Cascades of cool water glint in the moonlight as they tumble down from a white marble fountain.  Flower-laden gardens are nestled under trees, curving around benches, and running alongside the creek stone path that leads to a large manor.  Above the manor's door hangs a brilliant red banner emblazoned with the head of a great black wolf.

title: Curious Thrak Table
description: Scented smoke drifts upwards from a low brass lamp, curling toward the ceiling before dissipating.  The table top is etched with letters in several different styles, from roughly hewn initials to lightly flowing elven lettering.  Carved into the table is the phrase: "R. Thrak is a big fat...."  The scrawl ends in a dark brown stain resembling a thrak shaped like a question mark.

title: One-eyed Thrak Table
description: The largest knot hole you have ever seen is right here on this table.  It has been filled with a chunk of modwir that doesn't match the rough pattern on the table top.  A pale lace doily has been placed on the knot hole, but fails to cover it entirely.

title: Tipsy Thrak Table
description: The table wobbles a bit here, sloshing the drinks set down upon it.  Someone thoughtfully tried to even it up by placing a broken dagger blade beneath one of the table legs.  The table surface is darkened with age and spilled ale, but the painting of a thrak can still be seen:  it is sitting on its rump, a flagon of ale in hand and balanced upon its comical pot-belly, with stars and birds flying about its head.

title: Wizard Guild, Shop
description: Shelves, display cases, and boxes of all sizes line the walls of this little shop.  Most anything an apprentice needs to start a profession as a wizard can be found here.  At the ends of long strings of twine, shards of crystal dangle from the ceiling, emitting a dull glow that illuminates the shop.

title: Card Playing Thraks Table
description: A soft green fabric, threadbare in many places, has been draped across a section of the table.  A bowl of candy sits near the center of the shabby cloth covering.  One chair is tipped over on its side, as though its occupant had made a hasty exit.

title: Gateway Tower
description: A tower of red sandstone rises above the forest in proud defiance of the trees that crowd against it.  The massive rock faces carved high on each side of the edifice direct their gaze to the black and trackless forest beyond, their enigmatic smiles and lowered eyelids revealing nothing and suggesting much.  Dark soil dusts the flagstones that lead past a pair of thick pillars and through an arch in the tower's base.

title: Causeway
description: Laterite flagstones polished to the dull sheen of watered silk span the stretch of low ground from the southern tower's arch to the steps of an opulent temple north of here.  The building's marble inlays and ornate bas-reliefs glimmer in the moonlight and graceful statues, males on one side of the bridge and females on the other, uphold a balustrade worn smooth by time and pilgrims' hands.

title: Temple Steps
description: The roots of cyclopean fel trees have forced some of the steps from their horizontal planes.  The great trees have grown over the smaller outbuildings of the temple complex, their trunks assuming fantastic shapes stolen from the stones they have covered.  Wide landings allow visitors to pause and admire the sight of the temple's conical towers reaching toward the stars.

title: Temple Entrance
description: A closer examination of the temple's walls reveals nature's dual role of destroyer and consoler.  Vines have torn apart some of the more delicate carvings, but moss has healed the breaches in the stonework.  Friezes of stylized flames and lotus flowers that span the length of the facade are almost hidden in the shadows, but the sandstone figure of a kneeling woman on the lintel above the entrance is plainly visible even in the faint moonlight.

title: Temple Vestibule
description: The reek of corruption is barely detectable beneath the sharper, cleaner scents of ginger and temple incense that pervade the air in this circular chamber.  Walkways inlaid with chalcedony and malachite extend to your east and west.

title: Hall of the Marred
description: Part of the north wall has succumbed to the spreading roots of vegetation growing along its outer surface, allowing a glimpse of starry sky and the courtyard beyond.  The mural's colors are still visible in the flickering candlelight even where the elements have spoiled some of its detail.

title: Hall of the Marred
description: Moonlight silvers the leaves of vines that press against the artistically pierced teakwood shutters of the windows that line the hall.  The sound of dripping liquid echoes from somewhere nearby, complementing the subject matter of the vivid mural on the north wall.  The air seems to be growing more humid the farther west you travel.

title: Temple, Bathing Chamber
description: Water droplets condensing on the hollow-tiled ceiling above the central bath grow gravid in the steamy air and return to their source with a quiet splash.  Silver ewers and vials of scented oil are within easy reach of the communal bath, their tarnished surfaces reflecting the flickering candlelight dimly.  A large window on the western wall appears to serve the dual purpose of allowing bathers to admire the night skies and to put themselves on display.

title: Temple, Bath
description: The bath has apparently been built over a natural hot spring, its murky waters steaming hot but not quite to the point of discomfort.  The cloyingly strong smell of incense doesn't quite conceal the faint mineral tang in the air.

title: Hall of the Impure
description: So many of the statues along this hall have yielded to the depredations of vegetation and looters that it's impossible to tell what dubious pleasure they once represented.  A piece of the vaulted ceiling has collapsed, and the rubble has lain for so long that it too wears a verdant cloak of moss that thrives in the moist atmosphere.

title: Sleeping Quarters
description: Whoever lives here seems not so much to scorn privacy as to be completely unfamiliar with the concept.  Communal satin cushions and fur throws are strewn haphazardly on the floor in lieu of beds.  Inspirational tapestries flank the arched rosewood door to the south, while a pair of mirrors on the east and west walls reflect soft moonlight into every part of the chamber, leaving nowhere to hide.

title: Temple Courtyard
description: A low sandstone building crouches in the center of this expansive courtyard, its mass a dramatic contrast to the gracefully tapering towers that surround it.  Carved benches wide enough for two are connected by walkways made slippery with moss that grows lushly in the interstices between the flagstones.

title: Temple Courtyard
description: The sound of trickling water from a recent rain should be relaxing, yet in time the monotony of the noise begins to wear at the nerves as the water itself has worn the stone wall of the courtyard.

title: Temple Courtyard
description: A pair of curving stone pillars flank the candlelit archway to the inner reaches of the building that occupies the center of the courtyard.  The walkway leading to the arch is almost completely overgrown by a variety of vines and mosses.  Bells atop the squat building chime in the night breeze.

title: Temple of Ivas, Inner Sanctum
description: The room is bare except for thick crimson rugs that cover the stone floor apart from a wide ring around a central dais.  Candles set in niches carved into the walls of this sunless chamber cast their flickering light on frescoes, making the painted figures seem to writhe.  The massive jade statue of Ivas crouched upon the dais is a commanding presence despite her lowered gaze.

title: Temple Courtyard
description: Water from a recent rain trickles from the eaves of the colonnaded hall to your northeast and splashes against the greenery below.  Carp in a nearby pond snap greedily at flying insects unfortunate enough to land on the rushes near the water's edge, their movements sending scatters of reflected moonlight dancing from the surface of the pond.

title: Hall of the Eternal Dance
description: As a river smoothes the rocks of its bed, the haut-relief sandstone carvings of temple dancers that line the hall have been worn to a shine in spots by the passage of countless worshippers.  The dancers' contorted limbs are braceleted here and there with vines that have taken advantage of cracks in the masonry.

title: Refectory
description: Despite the spaciousness of this circular refectory, the air feels close and thick with the odor of past meals.  Trestle tables bear wine stains and other flaws from less recognizable sources.  Candles in etched red glass holders cast a ruddy, yet somehow unsavory light on the surrounding tapestries.

title: Hall of the Feast
description: The too-sweet smell of rot grows stronger to the east and mingles with the scents of cinnamon, cardamom, and clove.  Beeswax candles set in bronze sconces cast a fitful illumination on the mural, the flickering light giving the painted figures the illusion of movement.

title: Hall of the Feast
description: Moonlight streams through cutwork teak shutters to cast lacy shadows on the polished stone floor.  A mural lit by flickering candles stretches the length of the hallway.  The muted chime of temple bells is a reminder that despite the nature of the paintings, this place is holy to some.

title: Wayside Inn, Chamber
description: Tables and chairs of all shapes, sizes and states of disrepair fill this large, undecorated chamber.  Seated at many of the tables are groups intent on serious card games.  From the far side of the room you hear the noisy cheers of a ragtag group of spectators rooting for the underdog in a wristwrestling match between the local blacksmith and an overfed member of the Wehnimer's Citizens' Militia.

title: Bard Guild, Green Room
description: The Performance Hall green room is not a formal room, but instead an area nestled amid the curtains and scenery flats.  Ropes and pulleys hang down from a couple of catwalks overhead that span the expanse of the stage.  An additional array of ropes is contained in an intricate wooden frame, controlling the stage curtains.

title: Wehnimer Travel Office, Lobby
description: Modest attempts have been made to make this place seem upscale.  Swathes of red velvet are hung with silver nails as a ceiling border and a pair of iron candelabra are bolted to the floor to either side of the giant, red velvet davenport.

title: Halcyon Hills, Ancient Trees
description: Here in the shadow of the mountainside, ancient conifers crowd a narrow trail.  At one end, the sunshine-glimmering deep blue Lake Eonak beckons, while at the other end a grove of trees stands dark and tall.

title: Hearthstone, Balcony
description: Lining the edge of this balcony, which overlooks the main lobby below, a polished oak railing glows in the soft moonlight emanating through windows high on the southern wall of the lobby.  Rich burgundy carpet underfoot softens the echo of voices drifting on the air.  To the east a fieldstone staircase curves down out of view, an alcove tucked into the wall at the top step.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Clearing
description: The path divides at the edge of a clearing serenaded by a waterfall.  The water cascades over the edge of a granite bluff guarding the north edge of a small lake, its confluence fed by a stream which meanders away into the forest.  Water birds feed serenely on the lake's bank, their elongated legs giving them an exaggerated gait, as if they are moving in slow motion.

title: Silvergate, Front Desk
description: You are standing at a massive and well-polished desk made of ancient modwir.  A sheet of clear glass covers part of it and tucked neatly underneath is an elegantly penned scroll.  Standing behind the desk is the concierge, a cheerful and well-dressed man.  Hanging on the wall behind him you see a small key rack.

title: Tower
description: A rough angled ceiling of thin iron plates arcs overhead, supported by thick poles of iron that continue down to the ground that is far below.  Planks of wood make up the sturdy albeit rough floor, and a few small notches are cut into the dark metal walls.  The countryside expands out beneath you, its terrain easily visible from this high vantage point.

title: Troll's Head, Barroom
description: Stone walls give off a cool respite from the heat reflected off rock outside.  A large boulder has been outfitted as a bar, its surface carved down into a semblance of a level counter.  Stone tables are surrounded by flimsy wooden stools.  Obviously, the priority in this establishment does not rest with fly-by-night furnishings fashioned from wood.  A figurehead mounted above the bar appears to be the moth-eaten, stuffed head of a troll.  Its dusty countenance is disgusting.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Trail
description: The trail winds through ash and sycamore trees, their feet cloaked with underbrush.  The sycamores' bark is mottled in a yellowish grey, with irregular patches peeling from the trunks in curling sheets, which resemble parchment.  Mourning doves, hidden from sight in the thick foliage, coo to one another occasionally in their distinctive style.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Rocky Shore
description: Fog drifts off the slate-grey surface of Lough Ne'halin in thick clouds like ghostly behemoths.  A few lights twinkle through the mists from the scythe-shaped shore stretching around the lake's western shoulder.  The booming of bull-frogs echoes across water, erupting intermittently from within tufts of grass along the bank.  A trail winds through the reedy grass which grows to the lake's edge.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Castle View
description: A clearing opens between the scrub trees and thick water-loving grasses which crowd the lake's edge.  Rising up from the turf on the clearing's western edge is a bluff, its shoulders cloaked with willow, pine, oak and redbud trees.  A line of taller oaks stands on the ridge of the bluff like a dense crown, their foliage poking up from the drifting fog.  Across the water to the east, the spires of Castle Anwyn rise out of the mist.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Bluff Face
description: A ring of cottonwood trees shelters quaint houses nestled beneath their boughs.  Here and there, beams of light break through the mist, shining down in stark rays which coax drops of dew to glisten.  A bluff rises from the sandy loam, its face incised with a course of steps cut into the granite in a lazy curve that offsets the steep cant.  Above, a rooftop or two can be glimpsed through the thick mantle of trees.

title: Grocer's, Secluded Corner
description: Here in this secluded corner you find a small table covered with a red checkered tablecloth.  It is kept spotless and clean.  Gathered fabric covers portable screens that have sectioned off this area from the sales area of the store, and serve double duty by muffling your conversation.  Your vantage spot here allows you to spot anyone approaching your table.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Attic
description: A dusty skylight admits a faint glow of moonlight to the cramped attic passageways, and a draft from some crack in the wall sends dust-motes glimmering in the dim beams.  Boxes, crates, old paintings and rolled carpets fill the attic, and a space has been cleared for a few old pieces of furniture to serve as a sitting room.

title: Gemcutter's, Back Room
description: This small room seems to be some sort of closet.  A black robe is draped from a tall rack in the corner.  You see a sturdy cabinet with a lock on it.

title: Hearthstone, Foyer
description: Dark flagstone floors extend in a gleaming river of darkness beneath thick, handwoven crimson rugs in this spacious foyer.  To the north, banners of purple, blue, green, and yellow flutter from a balcony railing some fifty feet overhead.  A granite archway sweeps along the length of the western wall, and a magnificent fieldstone staircase curves upward to the east.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Lakeview Bluff
description: The elevation of the cliff offers a panoramic view of the lake, with the mist-cloaked castle hulking at the far end and a pencil thin tower rising out of thick fog to the north.  Oaks dominate the ridge, with pine trees tucked around the feet of the taller trees with their lacy foliage of needles.  The scent emanating from cottage hearths mixes with the aroma from the pines in a fresh, spicy perfume.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Dunes
description: Dunes crowd the northern perimeter of a clearing, with cottages perched in their eddies and upon their crests.  Candles in the windows are lit against the perennial dusk rendered by the drifting fog.  Thick scrub grass grows around the bases of the stilted buildings, flourishing like a dense carpet.  A line of trees border the villa to the west.  The smell of the lake is damp and loamy, and rich with the sound of frogs and crickets.

title: Silverwood Manor, Vestibule
description: The polished mahogany of the high, arching ceilings in this chamber is a stark contrast to the alabaster stone of the reinforcing ribbed vaults.  Dangling from the center vault is a gleaming chain of silver links, suspending a softly glowing globe of crackled glass.  A silver-threaded tapestry hangs next to a spindly black willow table that is pushed against the wall.  Opposite the entry door, the area widens considerably to allow space for a dramatic staircase of silver-flecked white marble.

title: Silverwood Manor, Great Hall
description: The vaulted ceiling of the hall rises to a spectacular height, and the smooth stonework is punctuated by elongated oval skylights that admit slanting rays of moonlight.  Natural light combined with the candles burning amid dozens of filigree sconces set into the walls causes the ivory-veined grey marble floor to gleam.  Soft velvet curtains in various hues of blue and grey drape the northern wall and are tied back in the center to display a polished granite arch.

title: Silverwood Manor, Dining Hall
description: The northern wall of this hall is entirely occupied by a massive picture window that affords a dramatic view of the Manor grounds.  The remaining walls are covered with soft alabaster silk, a stark contrast to the gleaming pitch black marble floor.  A silver refectory table spans the length of the room from the east end to the west, with several long cream suede benches lined up neatly on either side.  Towering silver candelabrum, each holding dozens of burning white candles, stand in each of the four corners.

title: Library, Collected Lore
description: Three walls of this room are occupied by massive floor-to-ceiling bookshelves of gleaming mahogany.  In the middle of the room, a tall podium holds a large catalog.  The area is lit by a massive glass globe filled with darting fireflies, perhaps in an attempt to protect the library's precious contents from fire.  Sunlight falls in slanting rays from the passage created by a spiraling wrought iron staircase.

title: Library, Reading Tower
description: The bare stone walls of this tall tower room rise to meet a massive dome of crystal clear glass.  Sunlight floods the area, leaving no corner untouched.  Centrally placed is a large black oak table surrounded by some long padded benches, suitable for reading as a group.  Flanking a large potted plant is a cream-colored suede chair and a soft blue chair.  A wrought iron staircase leads back down to the Collections room.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Selkie Clearing
description: A ring of ash trees circles a small clearing encompassing a pond.  Leaves float upon its mirror-like surface like tiny ships manned with sprites.  Wild thyme crowds the pool's bank, adding perfume to the still air.  At one side stands a bronze sculpture, cast in the form of a selkie emerging from its skin with lithe glory.  The few houses sit demurely within the trees and meld with the surroundings like stones along a river bank.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Hillside
description: Quaint houses are nestled against the hillside, their slate roofs complimenting the wild heather cloaking the slope.  A few large boulders jut out from the incline, the surfaces laced with a rich mantle of lichens.  One alder tree rises in the center of the circle of cottages, its branches thick with leaves and full with song from the birds residing in its protection.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Pine Grove
description: Dunes wrap around the feet of a grove of tall pines on the north edge of a clearing.  Moss, sage and heather grow rampantly to the tree-line, scenting the air with their tangy perfume.  Small waves hitting the shore of the lake provide a background melody to the call of birds skimming the water off-shore.  A few homes rest in the peaceful solitude of the clearing, adding the flicker of a candle or two to the magic of the scene.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Creekbank
description: A small stream cuts through a grove of pine and low dogwood trees.  Cottages squat in the copse with a thick, aromatic carpet of needles scattered around their foundation.  The melody of the brook is echoed by the soft sound of waves from the lake's edge.  Large stepping stones offer a natural bridge on which to cross the water.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Creekbank
description: A lush bank of ferns crowds the edge of the stream, their fronds fanned out in elegant green arcs.  Overhead, pine boughs are thick with aromatic needles, and cottages beneath them are roofed in both needles and tiles.  The creek burbles and sings, sending sprays of white glistening in the air about the boulders that serve as a walkway across the water.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Fir Darig Bluff
description: A misshapen boulder in the center of the clearing gives the place its name.  Wind and elements have chiseled the stone into a form that resembles a gnarled goblin.  To the west, the hillside rises, dotted with small stands of whitethorn trees.  They stand at an angle to the hillside, coaxed into a vertical stance by the light.  Homes huddle in a grove of pines back-lighted by the grey lake to the east.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Awyllion Hedge
description: A hedge grows up beside the trail, its spiny branches thick with foliage.  Wildflowers grow at the base of the hedge, ringing the lane with bright blue flowers.  The lake stretches away to the east, silent and mysterious with its cloak of drifting mist.  A row of houses stands facing it, as if mesmerized by the water's lullaby.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Aspen Copse
description: The trail ends at a stand of quaking aspen, their distinctive leaves fluttering although little breeze is evident.  Grass has reclaimed the ground from the pine needles, and it grows in a lush green carpet studded with small mushrooms.  A few cottages ring the clearing, their edges blurred by the mist drifting off the lake.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Asrai Dunes
description: Tall dunes rise from the grass, their sides dotted with hardy wildflowers.  The hillside stretches away to the north, angling east to border the lake in a sheer cliff.  Within the protection of the beach and bluff sit a few cottages, constructed in a quaint style that melds gracefully with the dramatic landscape.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Merrow Beach
description: The trail peters out, overtaken by sand and thick clumps of gorse bedecked with yellow flowers.  Thistle claims ground in spots, its regal blooms adding splashes of purple to the scene.  Beach houses stand before the lake, their faces turned to the water to capture the misty panorama.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Lakeview Bluff
description: Along the edge of the bluff, cottages compete with oak trees for the spectacular view of Lough Ne'halin.  A dense mixed-wood forest guards the trail's western edge, with cottages set into the trees in a haphazard array.  Wild flowers add tiny dots of color to the landscape, their pin-points of color peeking cheerfully out of the drifting fog.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Aspen Thicket
description: The trail meanders through a stand of aspens.  Beds of clover flourish at the foot of the trees, accented with wild violets in full flower.  A row of cottages lines the path as it turns to follow the bluff, the way marked with stepping stones set into the loam.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Pine Bluff
description: The bluff drops away in a sheer cliff, offering a spectacular view of the lake over the tops of trees in the lee of the hillside below.  Oaks grow tall along the hillside, reaching up hundreds of feet into the air.  At their feet, cottages nestle in the protection of the trees, bordered by thick beds of ferns and rhododendrons.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Lichen Trow
description: The trail turns, blocked by a stream which falls over the cliff in a vocal waterfall.  Oaks lean over the precipice, as if they are watching the water's progress.  The edge-row of cottages thins out somewhat, bullied from the area by thick forest.

title: Lough Ne'halin, Caerphily Creek
description: Caerphily Creek sings a pretty melody as it trips over the stones and bits of broken logs in its headlong rush toward the lake.  Moss and watercress add touches of green to the clear water, mirrored by thick ferns growing on its banks.  One cottage occupies the clearing formed by a ring of oak trees around the stream.  A trail of stepping stones leads to its door, the way bordered with edges of primroses.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Birch Trail
description: A thick stand of birch trees shelter the trail as it meanders through their midst.  Here and there, cabins sit beneath the trees, the wooden shingles of their roofs dyed a soft green by the forest mists and dew.  Chickadees flutter through the branches of the trees, making the hanging catkins tremble and setting the tapered leaves to fluttering.

title: Registrar's Office, Booth
description: You've entered a space which is wedged between two rows of filing cabinets and sectioned off by a heavy brocade curtain.  In it is a simple modwir desk with an elderly clerk sitting behind it, peering over the mounds of paper which surround him.  He snorts to himself once, mutters something under his breath, then returns to work.

title: Cavernfast, Tunnel
description: A low-roofed passageway hewn from solid rock twists quickly out of sight.  Braziers wrought of mithril shed pools of light in the gloom, while curiously they emit no smoke.  The walls and floor are quite uneven, however, the surfaces are satiny smooth to the touch as if each one has been polished with care.

title: Cavernfast, Grotto
description: A squat cavern is ringed with carved granite beasts, which consist of a wolf, a lion, and a bear, that sit between the mouths of tunnels leading away into the underground gloom like silent sentries.  The fantastic statues are exquisite examples of stone cutting, each one displaying a lifelike demeanor.  Almost below a level of hearing, the low susurrus of rushing water provides an undercurrent of sound in accompaniment to flickering mithril braziers along the stone walls.

title: Cavernfast, Hot Springs
description: The ceiling arches high over a set of three interlocking circular pools.  Light shines up from beneath the pools' churning water, sending sparkling reflections off a mosaic of crystal embedded in the stone above.  The aqua water shimmers in the light, as if trying to outdo the crystals, and glistening droplets lofted by the water's agitation dance in the air above like tiny sprites.

title: Cavernfast, Mithril Workshop
description: The huge chamber is filled with detritus of all kinds, from large complex contraptions to a thick conglomeration of bits and pieces, all of which defy identification.  Chains in a variety of thicknesses hang in a loopy tangle from the ceiling, snarled with an array of ropes and pulleys.  A long workbench covers the far wall, strewn with tools of every description.  The most notable thing about the whole mess is that everything, barring the rope, is made of mithril.

title: Cavernfast, Mithril Trench
description: The low ceiling of the tunnel is flecked with mithril, which glistens in the shadowy twilight of the labyrinth like precious jewels.  The Ne'halin river emerges from its own course through the mountain and runs along beside the travel path, its dark swells revealing a strong current.  Large stones break the water's rush, spaced evenly across the cataract.  Their tops are rough to provide a safe footing on the wet granite.

title: Cavernfast, Mithril Overlook
description: A small courtyard sits beside the river, giving a lovely panorama of the carved stones zigzagging across the confluence, and the starry host of twinkling braziers that follow the water's course through the caverns.  Groups of dwarves pass by, falling into single-file to cross the stones almost without breaking stride.

title: Cavernfast, Mithril Workshop
description: The floor in this part of the workshop is clear, leaving a large open area.  Deep ruts are worn in the stone, implying years of use as well as some respectable weight resting there.  The southern wall is empty of the heavy carving on almost every available surface elsewhere in the tunnels of Cavernfast.  A pair of chains flank the wall, hanging down on either side of the bare area. Their diameters are easily as thick as a dwarf's belly.

title: Cavernfast, Mithril Workshop
description: The chamber's ceiling is high above, lost in shadows from which hang ropes and chains like vines drooping below a thick forest canopy.  Across the eastern wall sits a low workbench, its top overlaid with golden oak.  The wall above the bench is covered with tools, and around each one a silhouette is carved, marking its place.  Even the pegs on which the implements rest are fashioned seamlessly of granite, implying that the whole face of the wall was hewn away, leaving the small pegs extending.

title: Cavernfast, Mithril Trench
description: The Trench turns, each subtlety of the curving face of rock lovingly adorned with elaborate spirals and interlocking designs, rendered by hands so skilled, one would think the unforgiving rock was as pliant as canvas.  Colors range from dun brown to rich sienna, and greys so alive, they defy their humble origins of black and white.  Mithril flecks in the stone are ever-present, catching the light shed by the braziers lining the walls like minute stars.

title: Cavernfast, Rubblestone West
description: The avenue passes through an open area where the ceiling reaches high overhead.  Rubblestone Pool borders the walk on the east, and beside it, a bank of lush ferns crowd into a spotlight created by a single ray of sunlight shining down from a crevice above.  Small groups of dwarves stroll around the Pool, talking quietly in a heavy dialect that sounds like all consonants and no vowels.

title: Cavernfast, Mithril Clinch
description: The cavern path hooks here, earning it the epitaph of 'The Clinch'  A subtle waft of incense, exotic and musky, clings to the air, underscoring the antiquity of these tunnels.  This effect is amplified by an arresting design carved into the south wall, the meaning of its intricate swirls and spirals lost in time.

title: Cavernfast, Rubblestone Crook
description: A lake touches the edge of the walk, extending into a shadowy pool rippled by concentric wavelets prompted by drops of moisture falling back into the arms of their origin.  A rim of jumbled rock forms a frame around the lake, and lights cast by braziers on its opposite shore send reflections dancing across the dynamic surface.

title: Cavernfast, Mithril Circle
description: The tunnel widens into another of Cavernfast's charming courtyards, this one dominated by an exquisitely fashioned fountain.  Water arcs above a statue of a brace of fawns, falling over their slim forms and into a pool ringed by a mosaic-covered rim.  A glance into the pool reveals its bottom is covered with a glittering carpet of coins.

title: Cavernfast, Ne'Halin River Turn
description: A granite bridge traverses the headlong rush of River Ne'Halin, its arched form tall and elegant.  A row of bas-relief carving follows the bridge's curve on either side, depicting herds of antelope leaping and galloping along.  The two herds stampede in opposite directions like streams of wagons passing on two sides of a road.

title: Cavernfast, Ne'Halin River Way
description: River Ne'Halin courses swiftly beneath an arched bridge constructed of beautifully veined granite.  The bridge is wide, although the handrails are quite low.  Two carved lions stand sentry on each side of the span's entry, their expressions alert, one with a full mane and the other, obviously a lioness.

title: Cavernfast, Rubblestone South
description: The dark surface of Rubblestone Pool undulates in response to an endless parade of rivulets, each concentric ring chasing the one before it in ageless courtship.  Legend holds that the pool is bottomless, and a glance into its depths doesn't lend any evidence to the contrary.

title: Cavernfast, Stonestep Clinch
description: 'The Clinch' is a busy intersection, garnering its name from an elaborately carved set of steps giving access to the north.  Rock benches offer ease to pedestrians wishing to spend idle moments contemplating either Rubblestone Pool to the south, or the rampaging River Ne'Halin coursing its subterranean canal to the northeast.

title: Cavernfast, Gurglestone Edge
description: The tunnel opens to offer a view of River Ne'Halin.  Bordering the water is a small courtyard set with a group of low tables and chairs.  They offer a lovely spot to dine accompanied by the river's song.  To the north, the graceful silhouette of an arched bridge spans the current, its sides a filigree of stonework.

title: Cavernfast, Rubblestone East
description: The Gullet converges with the blossoming tunnel, which opens to meet Rubblestone Pool.  Ne'halin River's near presence adds its chorus, as well as a brisk current which sends an intermittent spray of water over the walk.  The mithril braziers burn seamlessly, rendered immune to the occasional mists by thick crystal panes held securely in the lamps' filigree.

title: Cavernfast, Ne'Halin River End
description: A large courtyard overlooks Stonestep Clinch.  On the plaza's north edge, a low granite wall serves as the only boundary preventing a plunge down into the dark water of River Ne'Halin.  A mosaic inset with colorful stones covers the courtyard's floor, depicting an intricate pattern of knot-work that circles a central spiral.  A full yellow moon sits in the nucleus of the design, reigning proudly in its own firmament of tiny stones.

title: Cavernfast, Riverwalk Point
description: The tunnel opens, offering a view of River Ne'Halin, which lends its chorus to the carved walls in a gentle harmony.  The water glistens in the soft lamplight, its roiling surface reminiscent of a great serpent arching its back just beneath the surface of the swift river.

title: Cavernfast, Gullet Rock Turn
description: The rough floor of the tunnel bleeds away from colored stones inset ingeniously in the rock, to a carved pattern of stepping stones.  As the corridor twists and turns, the patterns carved into the walls change, flowing from spirals that hint at ocean waves, to a more spherical design, which is its own logic and reason.  The light from the ever-present mithril braziers set high on the walls enhances the changing patterns, giving them depth and drama.

title: Cavernfast, Gullet Rock Walk
description: The Gullet turns sharply, its contortion made more pronounced by the wealth of carving upon it.  The patterns collide in an echo of waves bludgeoning against rocks on a rugged shore.  The floor is remarkable, a rich mosaic composed of colored stones, which portray an ocean floor.  The subject is startling in its incongruity with the caverns hewn deeply within the granite cliffs, yet they are breathtaking in combination with the mystery and movement imbued in the carved walls.

title: Cavernfast, Gullet Rock Walk
description: The tunnel leans in a northeasterly direction, its wall carvings coiling into eddies of closely rendered designs.  High in the shadowy ceiling (and the ceiling is the tallest here in all the caverns), a dwarven artist, perhaps longing for a view of open skies, has carved a flight of birds in bas-relief.  The avian images whirl and turn in lifelike abandon.  Dim light afforded at that height lends distance to the birds, making them seem as real as if they are traversing the actual firmament.

title: Cavernfast, Gullet Rock Walk
description: 'The Gullet', as dwarven locals are frequently heard to dub it, becomes both narrower and taller than the tunnels in other parts of the citadel of Cavernfast.  The wall carvings assume a likewise elongated appearance.  Elegant swirls begin in compact rings, burgeoning into a wave-like pattern, which bears north in an unbroken cascade.

title: Observation Platform
description: The rotating chair swivels easily around, showing great views of the surrounding area through vertical-slitted windows that traverse the walls.  All manner of gadgets presents themselves for manipulation.  A crystal eyepiece mounted on a spring arm can be raised and lowered on a whim by use of a horizontal and vertical cranks and a lever made of invar.

title: Cavernfast, Ne'Halin River Turn
description: The tunnel constricts, becoming little more than an alleyway.  Its length is hung with brightly patterned banners, swaying one after another in a festive parade of color.  Fantastic beasts decorate some, rendered in the strict conventions of posture and vantage point.  Doors sit beneath each device, the sills painted in matching tones.

title: Dakris's Furs, Workroom
description: Lifting back the leather curtain, you enter the furrier's workroom.  Scraps of pelts, untanned hides, and tools for scraping, dressing and joining skins are spread across a workbench.  Several stools with rush seats are pushed up against the wall.  A half-finished rabbitskin robe is draped across one of the stools.

title: Hearthstone, Pub
description: Quieter than its neighbor to the west, the pub is filled with comfortable oak tables and chairs.  Muted moonlight from a large leaded glass window on the north wall highlights the gleam of polished oak flooring.  Deep green, plastered walls provide a backdrop for several murals depicting life in a country village.  A large fireplace on the western wall promises warmth on the chilliest of winter nights.

title: Blacksmith, Shop
description: Scattered haphazardly around the room are various weapons and items for sale.  Most patrons of Iron Jack's find it easier to order from the sale list written on a chalk board hung beside the sales counter than to rummage through the room.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Fern Path
description: The trail rounds an extensive growth of ferns.  Their vivid green fronds arch in all directions, like an army on the march with scimitars raised.  Overhead, the limbs of birch mix with those of dense pawpaw trees, creating slanting beams of light which shine through the shade in distinct rays and highlight the delicacy of the ferns' leaves.  Although hidden by foliage, the sound of the waterfall can be heard close at hand.

title: Tiger Court, Garden
description: The garden is covered in cats.  They come in all shapes, sizes and colors, making the small plot of land a sea of particolored fur.  They rub against each other or bathe in the dirt, busily lazy in the warm sun.  The plants have certainly seen better days, however, as each bears a mark of some feline's tender mercies.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Fern Path
description: A break in the trees to the northeast offers a view of the waterfall cascading over the rocks and into the clear, aquamarine water of the lake.  Cottages stand along the path, turned to take advantage of the lake's panorama.  Ferns grow right up to the doors of the homes in thick masses, surrounding them with a verdant carpet and framing the paths which give them egress.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Oak Grove
description: The trail winds through a stand of stately oaks, their lowest branches high above even the tallest of giantmen.  Rhododendrons crouch at the feet of the mighty ones, their foliage a green so dark, it appears black in shadows.  The ground is covered in a deep carpet of leaves, which the elements have rendered into a subtle and beautiful mottle of colors.  A few cabins blend seamlessly with the landscape, nestled within the protection of the oaks.

title: Silverwood Manor, Events Hall
description: Decorating the walls of this passageway are a few tapestries depicting Silverwood events of the past.  One piece in particular seems dedicated to some kind of death-by-cookies game, while others are a simple representation of the sharing of knowledge.  An oak arch inlaid with silver scrollwork stands at the end of the hall, and a heavy pine door with a wrought iron handle interrupts the wall between a framed bit of aged parchment and a silver filigree-framed portrait.

title: Silverwood Manor, Arena Room
description: A layer of sawdust covers the floor of this rather bare area.  A few long benches, sitting on risers against the wall, provide seating for spectators.  There are no windows, and the singular door is reinforced on the inside with heavy steel rivets.  At one end of the room is a large, plain oak cabinet.

title: Silverwood Manor, Blue Room
description: Constructed entirely in the round, the walls of this room are covered in deep blue watered silk.  The ceiling overhead is draped with sheer silver gossamer, and from the center of the swathes hangs a pale blue mithglin chandelier.  Large velvet pillows in shades of white, blue, silver, and grey have been scattered about the cozy space, providing a comfortable place to rest.

title: Silverwood Manor, Awards Hall
description: The northern wall of this rather long hallway is lined with plaques and framed squares of parchment, with clear glass sconces strategically placed to allow for perfect illumination.  Opposite the display is a massive stone doorway inlaid with silver scrollwork.  Thick carpeting is designed to muffle even the heaviest of footsteps, giving this area a somewhat hushed, reverent atmosphere.  Marking the termination of the hallway is a pair of stained glass doors.

title: Silverwood Manor, Quiet Garden
description: A pair of stained glass doors open directly into the garden, where a well-manicured carpet of verdant grass is surrounded by a circle of stately haon trees.  The strong trunks and layered green leaves create a quiet area of insulated serenity.   Moonlight glints on the waters of a perfectly round pond at the center of the area, the surface dotted with glowing white votives.  Daisies sprout at the base of an elaborate polished marble statue.

title: Silverwood Manor, Map Room
description: The curving walls of this room are painted with an intricate mural that depicts the sprawling world of Elanthia.  A circular couch scattered with soft pillows sits in an outward-facing fashion, allowing one to view the mural while relaxing.  Overhead, an elaborate light fixture illuminates both the mural and the room.  A mithglin sign has been affixed to the interior side of a massive stone doorway.

title: West Wing Corridor
description: This corridor is quiet, and the decorations here are minimal.  A soft carpet woven with several hues of complementary summery shades matches the lacquered golden haon of the walls.  A red iron door stands between a pair of triple-pronged candelabrum affixed to the walls, and opposite is an ora-inlaid golden mithril door and a grey-green vultite door.

title: Silverwood Manor, Cleric Room
description: Silver and crystal girandoles reflect the flickering flames of hundreds of beeswax candles.  On the floor in front of a plain altar, several crewelwork prayer rugs invite deep meditation.  Antique alms boxes and collection plates fill a tall etagere.  Covered in soft white velvet, a circle of oversized pillows are piled onto a fine black sable rug.  Affixed to the wall above a brushed silver table is a white vultite sign.

title: Silverwood Manor, Paladin Room
description: Grey marble floors are cool underfoot, and the room is illuminated by a large silvery vultite fixture hanging from the ceiling.  Against the far wall, a trio of small steps leads to a nondescript clear glaes altar.  A pair of crossed white ora broadswords hangs above a resplendent golden tapestry, directly opposite a pair of crossed black ora broadswords hanging above a majestic shadowed tapestry.  A silver mithril sign is affixed to the wall above a simple white table.

title: Silverwood Manor, Warrior Room
description: Long wooden racks holding several armors for display stand opposite the doors, while a variety of weapons are affixed to the plain stone walls.  Several long ebonwood benches, all padded with natural linen cushions, are arranged around a large map of Elanthia that has been painted on the floor.  A vultite sign is affixed to the wall above a sturdy ironwood table.

title: West Wing Corridor
description: This corridor is quiet, and the decorations here are minimal.  A soft carpet woven with several hues of complementary springtime shades matches the sage green silk covering the walls.  An oak door stands between a pair of triple-pronged candelabrum affixed to the walls, and opposite is a folded bamboo door.

title: East Wing Corridor
description: This corridor is quiet, and the decorations here are minimal.  A soft carpet woven with several hues of complementary autumnal shades matches the polished cherrywood of the walls.  A golden haon door stands between a pair of triple-pronged candelabrum affixed to the walls, and opposite is a scorched monir door and an oak door inlaid with jade vines.

title: Silverwood Manor, Ranger Room
description: Detailed maps are painted onto the walls of this room, the stone varying in hue to delineate vegetation, terrain, and water.  Occupying much of the space is a circular hunter green couch, perfect for a comfortable discussion in the artistic surroundings.  The hardwood floor is inlaid with an enormous compass rose, decorated around the edges with various flora and fauna.  A thanot-framed sign is affixed to the wall above a petrified modwir serving tray.

title: Silverwood Manor, Rogue Room
description: Delicate tendrils of light fade into shadows as they reach for the dark corners of this room.  A large, perfectly square ebonwood table is surrounded by a set of long benches covered in soft grey velvet.  A low glass display counter runs the length of one wall, and above the counter is a vaalin-framed sign.

title: Silverwood Manor, Bard Room
description: Streaming from a central point in the ceiling are lengths of sheer silk in a variety of bold colors.  The silk is embroidered with musical notes in fine golden thread.  Several stands hold scores of music for both instrument and voice, and a crystal display case is filled with practice instruments.  Opposite the rehearsal area is a beautifully carved maoral bar with a deep green marble top, and affixed to the wall behind the bar is a silver-framed sign.  Some bar stools provide a comfortable place to rest.

title: Silverwood Manor, Atrium
description: Pearly moonlight streams in through the glass walls and ceiling, picking pale blossoms out of the shadows formed by the lush vegetation.  The rich fragrance of tropical blooms rises in the night air, along with thin wisps of mist from the wide oval pool.  Occasionally, the chirping or clicking of a nocturnal insect adds music to the quiet setting.  Barely visible in the corner is a spiraling silver staircase, and a pair of glass double doors lead outside to the grounds.

title: Silverwood Garden
description: A carpet of tussocky green grass is surrounded by tall cypress trees.  Moonlight filters in through the branches, and an octagonal white gazebo sits in the center of the area.  Surrounding the gazebo is a flourishing multicolored flowerbed boasting dozens of floral varieties.  Rather apart from the trees that encircle the space, a stately mahogany stands alone next to a bench and a burbling grey marble fountain.

title: Silverwood Garden, Treehouse
description: A wide platform, free of railings or restraints, has been erected among the strong branches of this tree.  A few soft sage linen cushions are tossed casually about the smooth surface, and layers of vibrant green leaves smattered with tiny white flowers provide the only walls.  Rays of moonlight slip through the twisting limbs, causing patterns of light to dance across the area with the slightest breeze.

title: Silverwood Garden, Gazebo
description: Cream linen cushions striped in hues of terra cotta and sky-blue cover the benches that line the walls, save for a small doorway leading back into the garden.  The open sides of the gazebo are draped with sheer gossamer netting, through which the shadows of eager moths are visible.  A faceted crystal lamp hangs from a silver chain, the lit pillar candle within casting a warm glow over the area.  Centrally placed, a low white table painted with vines and flowers bears refreshments.

title: Silverwood Manor, Observatory
description: A short wrought iron railing encloses this space, which is little more than a flat tower roof.  Open to the night sky above, the expanse of the heavens appears without limit.  A polished oak table holds a few charts, which are open and held down with glass paperweights.  A long divan covered in pale blue linen provides a comfortable place to rest, and a copper-banded spyglass sits upon a silver stand, ready to observe the night sky.

title: Silverwood Manor, Parlour
description: Walls covered in black watered silk blend seamlessly with a curving black willow bar.  The light in this room is low and the atmosphere is intimate, with warmth emanating from the flames in a gold-flecked onyx fireplace.  Scattered on the rug in front of the fireplace are a few red velvet-covered cushions, and a large grey sable couch is placed against the opposite wall.  Hanging a safe distance from any seating area is a multicolored dart board.

title: East Wing Corridor
description: This corridor is quiet, and the decorations here are minimal.  A soft carpet woven with several hues of complementary wintry shades matches the lacquered white monir of the walls.  A soulstone-inset door stands between a pair of triple-pronged candelabrum affixed to the walls, and opposite is a rose-carved white willow door and a black ironwood door.  The hallway terminates here, where a polished mahogany arch leads further into the manor.

title: Silverwood Manor, Library Foyer
description: Opposite the entry arch of this spacious room is a curving mahogany desk.  Dozens of pillar candles, placed in clusters on outcroppings of the rough stone walls, cause fickle patches of light and shadow to dance about the area.  Affixed to the wall behind the desk is a large silver-framed sign.

title: Silverwood Manor, Wizard Room
description: The very air seems alive as traces of static streak between the dark blue glaes lamps hanging from the ceiling.  A mottled marble worktable covered with wands and potions stands against one wall, next to a black willow podium bearing an ancient tome.  A safe distance from the work area, a grey suede divan and a soft black sable couch are arranged around a silver-threaded silk-tasseled rug.  Affixed to the wall above a silvery tray is an engraved electrum sign.

title: Silverwood Manor, Empath Room
description: A series of life-size sketches hang on the walls, each detailing the body and the various types and degrees of wounds that can be sustained.  Bandages and herbs are neatly stacked on a long monir table, while a large book sits open next to them.  Several velvet chairs face a cozy alabaster fireplace, and a blue wool rug is soft underfoot.  A silver-framed parchment sign is affixed to the wall above a white willow tray.

title: Silverwood Manor, Sorcerer Room
description: Four torches, burning with eerie blue flames, are anchored to the floor in each corner by onyx intaglio demons.  A sleek black marble table raises bubbling alembics, odd crucibles, and spell books within easy reach.  Opposite the table is a small lounging area, featuring a low witchwood serving table centered on a fluffy white polar bear rug scattered with oversized black velvet cushions.  Highlighted by scarlet despanal mosaic tiles, a polished obsidian sign is affixed to the wall.

title: Silverwood Garden, Fishing Hole
description: A short dock extends partway into the serene waters of a small pond.  Miniscule waves lap against the pylons, stirred only by the most gentle of breezes.  Moonlight sparkles on the water, and the tall grasses surrounding the pond sway in unison with the flitting of the fireflies.  On the shore just beyond the dock, a small fire pit containing a well-maintained blaze is surrounded by granite slabs.  A few paces away is a small wooden shack.

title: Silverwood Manor, Grove
description: A clustered grove of young aspen trees shelters a small marble shrine.  Garlands of flowers in varying hues of red are draped from the trees, and red petals are sprinkled about the soft carpet of grass underfoot.  Fireflies dance through the leaves of the trees, causing tiny patches of illumination to come and go like the twinkling of the overhead stars.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Winding Path
description: Tall oaks slowly give way to a thick growth of hemlocks.  The thick, scaly trunks of the conifers peek through the foliage here and there, their color a brown that appears more purple-grey when the light changes.  To the south, the trail angles toward an immense oak, which is just visible through foliage and a couple of cottages standing along the way.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Clearing
description: A huge white oak towers above, dwarfing the surrounding hemlocks and sycamores.  Its widely spreading branches reach out around it in an expansive diameter.  The top must reach up more than 130 feet.  The bark is a pale shade of grey, deeply fissured with age.  A stair is built against it in matching oak wood, wrapping around the massive trunk in an elegant spiral.  It leads up into the lower branches where a platform is visible.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Tree Branch
description: A polished platform is positioned within the embrace of a couple of the host oak's substantial branches.  It gives access to a door leading into the tree's interior.  A round window is beside the door, its oak sill polished to a deep golden color.  Lobed leaves of the huge tree drape elegantly around the entrance,  its frame carved with a border of oak leaves and acorns.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Fern Amble
description: Primroses compete with ferns alongside the trail, as it meanders beneath a grove of red alder trees.  Their ovate leaves flutter in a teasing breeze which sets them to shimmering in the gentle light.  Cabins sit in the crevices between branching trails, the paths leading to their doors edged with more of the colorful primroses.

title: River Tower West, Pay Master
description: The first level of the tower is lit by torches mounted into the log walls.  The dirt floor has been packed down by years of human traffic.  A long table, covered with tariff payment vouchers, is set to one side.  A cache of weaponry is stored here for the defense of the city.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Water Reeds
description: The path curves around the boggy edge of Moonlight Pool, its edge marked by tall water reeds.  Bull frogs and lesser amphibians sing a mixed chorus from the protection of the grasses.  Cottages built along the curved bank sit contemplating the mirror-like surface of the water, dotted intermittently with loons swimming at the far end.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Waterfall
description: The waterfall sends a spray of mist across the clearing at its base each time the breeze gusts.  A bluff of granite cuts off the trail on the north, its pitted surface rich with moss and ferns growing in crevices.  Cabins are tucked in a semi-circle beneath a grove of pecan trees to the west.  The lake stretches away to the east, a mirror to catch the reflection of the rising sun each morning.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Moonlight Pool
description: The trail veers close to the bank of the lake, drawn by a spectacular view of the falls just across a narrow arm of Moonlight Pool.  A few carved stone benches are positioned along the bank, offering a place to sit and regard the beautiful cascade.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Willows
description: A thicket of willows edges the lake, their elongated branches dipping seductively into the water.  Loons swim in and out of the camouflage of the willow leaves, their unique song harmonizing with that of frogs and crickets.  Houses sit on a ridge above the boggy feet of the trees, their backs nestled into a stand of aspens.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Falls View
description: A clearing on the bank of Moonlight Pool offers a superb view of the falls across the lake.  The bank is carpeted in dense grass, and a large willow growing next to it arches over the water with long draping branches skimming the lake's surface.  Cabins sit peacefully in the clearing, silhouetted by light reflected off the lake.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Fern Amble
description: The path branches, leading north toward the lake and another arm leading toward the sound of a stream gurgling to the northeast.  A monstrous oak is visible guarding the trail to the west.  Thick banks of ferns surround the crossroads, their fronds waving languidly in the breeze.  A couple of cabins sit in the midst of the ferns, small patches of flowers planted around them.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Brookside
description: A brook trickles through a clearing, its crystal water polishing the smooth stones in its way.  Cottages sit in a circle around the clearing, sheltered by a canopy of sycamores.  Their dotted white trunks provide a striking contrast to the green of their leaves and the mossy banks of the stream.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Trillium Trail
description: Trillium plants bloom profusely in the deep shade beneath tall black oaks.  The trees stretch graceful limbs across the path leading through the hollow, a few cabins nestled into the lee of their reach.  Brightly painted shutters on the homes add a festive accent to the native colors.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Tall Trees
description: A tall stand of black oaks shelter the cabins built at their feet.  Red bud and dogwood trees grow around the feet of the taller woods, their leaves a graceful second canopy beneath the taller oaks.  Thick hedges of holly create a hedgerow to the north, bedecked with bright red berries.

title: Noralgar Hollow, Stream Bank
description: A ridge rises on the opposite bank of a stream rushing through the forest.  Oaks crowd around it, as if nurturing it and protecting it from harm.  Boulders, mottled with lichen and rich with veining, frame the singing brook on each side.  Quaint cabins dot the nearer side of the watercourse, sheltered by the oaks and serenaded by the stream.

title: Wehnimer's Museum, Grand Foyer
description: White marble columns, set halfway into the walls, serve as both decoration and structural support for the high ceiling.  Set between them are some colorful velvet settees that offer respite for weary patrons.  The cool marble floor is interrupted by a pale gold carpet that leads up an expansive staircase.  In the center of the western wall is a green marble arch, while the eastern wall sports a white marble arch.  Across the room from a gold marble arch, a large platinum plaque and a rectangular white sign are displayed beside the oaken double doors that lead outside.

title: Gryphon Holding, Barbican
description: Dark grey stone blocks arch overhead in a barrel vault that supports the tower above, and brass lanterns hang high in the corners, glowing in warm invitation.  The stone floor is barely visible beneath a thick layer of heavily tamped sawdust and sand.  A narrow passage continues northward through an arch leading toward a verdant bailey.

title: Hearthstone, Rose Garden
description: Dappled moonlight falls on slate pavers underfoot.  Iris beds, their normal colors turned to various shades of grey under the moon's illumination, edge a shallow pool in the center of the garden.  An ancient willow overhangs a limestone wall to the south, its branches rustling in the warm breeze.  Benches nestle in the graceful curves of the wall.  Climbing roses frame the windows and doors of the western manor wall, their sweet scent drifting on the breeze.

title: Hearthstone, Walkway
description: Beams of moonlight trace patterns across yet another brick walkway near an old fieldstone wall that meanders along the eastern edge of the manor property.  Honeysuckle vines cling to the ancient wall, lending fragrance to the gardens.

title: Hearthstone, Rose Room
description: An oak framed double bed rests along the north wall, crisp white linen sheets and a soft knitted cotton spread adorning its feather mattress and pillows.  Glowing lanterns rest on nightstands at bedside, spreading their cheerful glow around the room.  Under a small, open window in the west wall is a loveseat.  Cotton curtains patterned in rose and pale green flutter in the breeze which carries the sweet scent of roses to fill this room.

title: Hagga's Hut
description: The hovel, sewn from the skins of countless felines, reeks of decaying meat and the acrid smell of blood.  There are no windows; a torn leather flap provides the only way in or out.  A small cooking fire centered in the room provides a dim illumination, and a dried mat of what appears to be krolvin skin is stretched out on a rack very close to the ground.  A large variety of bone and skull fragments are strewn haphazardly around the rack.

title: House Sovyn, Crystal Garden
description: The flowers, trees and plants in this area of the garden seem to be made of colored crystals which chime as the wind rustles through them.  A crystal tower rises above the garden.

title: House Sovyn, Paladin's Lounge
description: Lustrous silvery-grey mistwood walls rise to meet a vaulted ceiling with ironwood beams lending a sense of austerity and devoutness.  Prismatic battle standards representing each of the Arkati line the walls leading to a massive black glaes altar set against the back wall.  Slightly translucent, the altar reflects the light cast by numerous candles placed upon its broad base.  Adeptly crafted wooden stands and racks, displayed at orderly intervals, present a diverse collection of armors and weapons.

title: Woodlands, Forest Path
description: Branches cross overhead, shading the path as the forest becomes thicker.  Despite the heavy growth of trees, the path seems well-kept and the underbrush has been trimmed back, revealing occasional small houses set among the trunks. Looking through the trees, you see the edge of a rocky ravine falling off just to the north, and the path continues to the northeast.

title: Woodland Glade, Pool
description: A small pool dominates the clearing, casting reflections off its mirror-like surface.  Trees arch over it, their boughs creating enough shade to define the light into bright beams, which strike the surface of the water like magical energy flowing down in a stream from above.  Ferns crowd the water's edge, stretching in a lush green carpet from the bank, up to the doors of cabins built discretely within the trees around the glade.

title: Dragonsclaw Arms, Back Yard
description: The unpainted stone wall of the building bounds the yard on one side, and a tall wooden fence on the other.  A large trash bin rests against the fence, and clumps of weeds and unmowed grass are scattered around a few squatters' shacks that occupy the corners of the unkempt lot.

title: Wayside Inn, Garret
description: Quiet laughter and subdued conversation punctuate the otherwise peaceful atmosphere of this little room tucked beneath the garret of the inn.  The smoke-blackened wooden beams meet at an angle, cradling a brass fixture with candles that bathe the room in a soothing glow.

title: Uxbri's Flammable Firewood!
description: A massive pile of split logs dominates the back of the small tent, and the pleasant smell of freshly chopped wood fills the air. Sawdust and chips of wood cover the floor, and small footprints lead out of the tent.

title: Meadowlands, Gates
description: A wide dirt trail, worn by the wheels of passing wagons, leads up to a large heavy wooden gate.  A stone wall curves to the north and south, enclosing an expanse of green pasture and rustic wooden buildings.  Tall wild grass grows on both sides of the trail, and clusters of bright wildflowers grow around the base of the wall.

title: Meadowlands, Shepherd's Way
description: Thatched cottages stand along the sides of the well-kept dirt road that runs along the inside of the stone wall, surrounded by patches of flowerbeds and small vegetable gardens.  Several docile roltons roam the grass beyond, grazing peacefully in the sunlight.

title: Sleeping Dragon Pub
description: A huge, elaborate wooden carving of a peacefully sleeping dragon stretches on the shelf behind the long, brass-railed bar from one end to the other, dominating the room.  The pub is all dark wood and polished brass fixtures, and the cozy booths are upholstered in well-worn red leather that must have once been luxurious.

title: River Tower West, Guard Room
description: This story of the watchtower is dimly lit only by the sunlight from the arrow slits by day or by a few oil lamps at night.  The oak flooring creaks slightly as you walk about the room.  The alert guard on duty is peering north through one of the slits toward the bay.

title: River Tower West, Roof
description: You are atop the northwest guardtower that watches over the waterway into Wehnimer's Landing.  Across the river to the east, you see the matching tower with its four guards watching the boat traffic and the threatening waters of Darkstone Bay, which lies to the north.  A few errant vines climb along the south side of the tower.

title: Wehnimer's Historical Society
description: This room is tiny, and looks suspiciously like it might have once been a broom closet.  A spindly half-round table serves as a desk, though all it supports at the moment is the remains of a mincemeat pastry.  Genealogical charts paper the walls, some of the family trees more convoluted than an oxbow-riddled river.

title: Tiger Court, Garden
description: Neatly-kept cottages circle a small landscaped garden, its beds brimming with orange tiger-lilies and roses of various hues.  A sleek tabby cat stalks through the lilies, its eyes flickering green at every movement of the blossoms in the breeze.

title: Tiger Court, Cul-de-sac
description: A low stone wall circles the cul-de-sac, occupied by several cats of various sizes and colors who have found comfortable places to lounge in the filtered sunlight.  Gaps in the wall lead up to small cottages surrounded by patches of trimmed grass and colorful flowerbeds.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Rose Garden
description: Rose bushes fill the garden with pure whites, brilliant reds, golds, and blues as dark as night.  They are planted in geometric beds around the stone benches, which provide a place to sit and rest.  The bright blossoms of violet plants, beds of snapdragons and lilies, jasmine trees and other types of smaller flowers line the stone wall, and lilac bushes grow along the shaded bowers that extend off from the sunny garden.

title: Cothinar Gardens, West Bower
description: Beds of marigolds and lilies line the base of the modwir bower that arches over the path, and blue blossoms of morning glory dot the latticework.  Flagstone paths lead to the doors of the garden homes, and a stone bench provides a resting place under the cool bower.

title: Cothinar Gardens, Shaded Bower
description: Bushes of jasmine line the base of the dark wood bower that arches over the flagstones, filling the air with a heady scent.  Mournblooms and lilies stand along the side paths that lead to the quiet yards of the homes around the garden.

title: Cothinar Gardens, North Bower
description: A vine-covered latticework bower arches over the grey flagstones of the path, shading a carved stone bench and a small marble fountain that trickles merrily in the filtered light.  Side paths lead off to the small manicured yards of garden homes.

title: Wehnimer's Museum, History Wing
description: This is the wing housing the Historical Society of Elanthia and its artifacts.  A tall partition blocks off the area where an upcoming exhibit ins in the process of being installed.  Centered in this massive anteroom is a low onyx pedestal, upon which sits the Society's newest acquisition.  Next to an ornately-carved archway, there is a discolored area on the wall where a large sign or portrait was removed.

title: Wehnimer's Museum, Nature Wing
description: The Natural History wing is in the process of being completed.  A few crystal cases contain some unfamiliar specimens.

title: Museum Member's Suite
description: This reception area is restricted to use by members, patrons, donors and the elite of Wehnimer's Landing, to gather and entertain like-minded culture mavens.  The marble floors and walls are highly polished, reflecting the limpid light that filters through the stained glass skylight overhead.

title: Liabo Circle, Shaded Path
description: The path curves through a grove of willow trees.  Some snug wooden homes have been built beneath their long, flowing leaves.  A gentle breeze from the west stirs them into whispering motion.

title: Liabo Circle, Meditation Garden
