At one end of the auditorium lies a crescent-shaped dais of silver-veined alabaster flanked by three large marble columns, each housing brilliant scarlet owl sconces, which cast a warm glow.  The banners of Twilight and the CHE hang in tandem from the translucent ceiling.

title: Twilight Hall, Great Hall
description: A huge hall stretches before you.  The high walls of cherry mahogany reach upwards to a vaulted ceiling made of marble the color of shadows on a cold winter's evening.  A tiled floor of fine Lysierian slate etched with a magical pattern catches your eye.  You feel drawn towards a pulse of power coming from somewhere nearby.

title: Twilight Hall, Mystic Library
description: Comfortable chairs line the walls of this library, which is filled with rows of shelves littered with musty vellum tomes and illuminated manuscripts.  Warm and brightly lit, this is the perfect place to hide from a cold, damp and otherwise dreary night -- suitable for both research and contemplation.

title: Twilight Hall, Back Porch
description: The polished black marble floor reflects the dim glow of several orbs of light that look like faint suns suspended in the black night sky.  Several tables have been arranged around the room, covered with black silk tablecloths.  The chairs are made of black-stained tanik wood cushioned with jet black velvet, which would be hard to see if not for the candles placed on some of the tables.

title: Twilight Hall, Warble's Parlor
description: The west end of the great hall opens up into a bright, airy parlor.  As you step into the room, your eyes are immediately drawn to an ancient elven harp set up on a small dais.  A plush snowcat rug covers the floor in front of a white marble fireplace, and white cushions made of the softest Arachnian silk lie scattered about the room, inviting you to relax and enjoy yourself.  A spiral staircase in one corner leads both upstairs and downstairs.

title: Twilight Hall, Magical Workshop
description: Crystal towers ward the four corners of the workshop.  Mana crackles and hums as it arcs between the orbs placed atop each, sending out tempestuous tendrils of energy writhing to and fro.  A table, littered with dozens of odd-shaped tools and potions, shimmers in the pyrotechnic display.

title: Twilight Hall, The Weaving Room
description: Mystic patterns form in the air before you, whispering to you of secret places and powers untold.  Stepping further into the room, tendrils of mana seem to form before you, each ringing with a tone of magic.  Reaching out with your senses, you feel compelled to weave the tendrils together into something greater, something that defines you.  A spiral staircase leads both upstairs and downstairs.

title: Twilight, West Tapestry Room
description: This is a small antechamber that leads to the House Lockers.  An ornate tapestry takes up one entire wall, and there are several chairs scattered about the room.

title: Twilight Hall, Manny's Kitchen
description: Warm and inviting, the fragrance of freshly baked bread lingers in the air of this spacious kitchen.  A small boy sits near the fire slowly turning a series of steel spits, while the Head Cook and her assistants bustle with the activity required to feed the membership.  Pots and kettles line the walls, and canisters of pungent spices stand atop the long counters.  An ebonwood pantry nestles amid the counters and various kitchen accoutrements.

title: Twilight, Chamber of Darkness
description: Dark and cavernous, your eyes take a moment to adjust to the minimal light of the chamber.  Shadows huddle in far recesses, cloaking mysteries that have never seen the light of day.  A quiet stillness pervades the chamber, allowing your senses to rest in peace.  In the center of the chamber stands a velvety black malachite altar that pulses with ebon light, while an unlit brazier stands behind it like a brooding sentinel.  A spiral staircase leads upstairs.

title: Twilight Hall, Founder's Hall
description: The hallway is panelled in a rich, dark wood and illuminated at one end, drawing your eyes to an exquisite painting.  A spiral staircase leads both upstairs and downstairs.

title: Twilight, Kyrion and Warble's
description: Warm and relaxing, the room looks quite comfortable -- a small wooden table and two soft chairs sit next to a large bay window that looks out over the lights of town.  One wall is completely taken by a fireplace framed by a marble mantelpiece, and you can see a cauldron simmering over bright orange flames within the hearth.  Piles of neatly organized maps rest neatly on one arm of a long sofa, and a broken harp string is draped carelessly over a wooden cabinet that stands next to it.

title: Twilight Hall, Manny's Room
description: At first glance, this room appears to be nothing more than a warm and comfortable study.  Materials are strewn about in various piles, and a small unmade bed lies in a corner next to a wooden footlocker.  A tiny potted fern sits next to a wall relief of a shackled demoness with deep red eyes that seem to follow your every move.

title: Twilight Hall, Kyrion's Refuge
description: Tall vine-covered walls rise around the lush setting of the Refuge.  A stone path wends its way in sinuous patterns through verdant greenery that fills the area. Bushes trimmed in the shapes of various animals both real and legendary line the path, with benches placed in secluded areas for conversation and contemplation. A small artificial waterfall to one side cascades into a pool that beckons one to slip into its cool embrace.

title: Twilight Hall, Grotto
description: The pool is deep enough here to cover the shoulders of a halfling.  Enclosed on all sides by stone, the damp wall shimmers from the light of dozens of candles sitting on outcroppings of varying heights.  An effusive glow comes from the water, further lending to the gentle ambiance of the grotto.  Ledges line the edge of the pool, offering a convenient place to kick back and relax.

title: Twilight Hall, Neighborhood
description: The path angles away from the Hall for a small distance, until it opens upon a tree-lined square surrounded by quality acreage and four fieldstone longhouses, each with several unique doors.  At the center of the square, a fountain topped with a statue of a man gesturing as he casts a spell cascades into its marble pool.  A wide spiral staircase can be seen descending around the base of the fountain.

title: Twilight Hall, A Wizard's Room
description: A soft, warm glow fills the room, generated by floating orbs of light that seem to recede from you no matter which direction you approach from.  Comfortable furniture and tomes of magic fill every nook and cranny, and it becomes obvious the glowing orbs were created for the sheer pleasure of reading.  The most striking impression, however, is the ceiling.  It appears as a breathtaking surreal vista of the night sky, with magnificent comets and brilliant stars seeming to pulsate down at you.

title: Twilight Hall, Rose Garden
description: Roses in full-bloom entwine themselves around ornate trellises, their petals shifting softly in the whispering breeze.  The pathway spirals inward, its edges lined with countless bushes, each offering up a unique flower unlike any other in the garden.  Lilies, tulips, roses and daisies all combine to offer up a heady aroma that soothes the soul.  In the center of the garden stands a large gazebo, inviting you to stay a while.

title: Twilight Hall, Gazebo
description: Light and airy, the gazebo's tall ceiling has a large, slow-moving fan that is powered by an intricate pulley, rope, and gear system off to one side, and several cherry wood-framed silk screens, painted with natural scenes, help block some of the elements from reaching the gazebo's interior.  From this vantage point, the moon-shadowed garden surrounding the gazebo reveals a carefully crafted pattern designed to restore harmony and balance.

title: Twilight, Kaikeyi's Bedchamber
description: The dim lighting provided by numerous candles puts you immediately at ease, and you gaze around the room at the cozy furnishings.  A large bed dominates the center of the room, and a luxurious bearskin rug lies at its foot providing protection for your bare feet from the coolness of the floor.  A fragile modwir desk takes up one corner of this cozy bedchamber.

title: Twilight Hall, Tarin's Room
description: A menacing gargoyle is the first thing you see as you enter this sparsely furnished room.  The mein creature is perched on a pedestal near the door, and you can almost feel its baleful glare like an icy touch.  Black and silver banners drape the walls in a pleasing manner, lending a breath of nobility to the room.

title: Twilight Hall, Frayo's Room
description: Warm colored light shines through stained glass windows set in the tall circular walls.  Fragrant trails of incense linger with the smoke from an eight-candle chandelier.  A magnificent shrine to the goddess Lorminstra dominates the center of the room, her statue standing with hands outstretched to meet the fallen.  A snifter of fine cognac rests on a rosewood desk near the shrine.  Standing at the back of the room is a regal four-posted bed.  A sense of warmth, peace and order gently surrounds you.

title: Twilight, Rayyne's Hideaway
description: The crystalline walls of this spherical chamber glow softly with a subtle radiance, and a hint of perfume permeates the air.  Fresh black orchids are strewn across the floor and around a hot tub set off behind a spidersilk screen.  The mistress's eclectic interests become apparent as you survey the room - sumptuous gowns, leather pants, ancient tomes, and numerous objects d'art.  Nestled among comfortable cushions scattered about the room are a magnificent orb and a lustrous thanot box.

title: Twilight Hall, Graeval's Room
description: The high-ceilinged room is bright and cool with a fruity aroma.  A low haon-topped table, a brown leather sofa and two overstuffed blue chairs sit before a cozy fire in a stone fireplace.  In one corner is a neatly made bed with oaken wine casks as corner posts and an elaborately carved haon headboard depicting young maidens harvesting grapes from vines entwined about long rows of fences.  There is a small orchard in pots in front of a wide window through which streams sunlight and a pleasant breeze.

title: Twilight, Lower Environs
description: Illuminated by eight freestanding copper fire pits, these environs are meticulously clean and dry.  Light from the pits dances about the area, providing a warm, almost cheerful, glow.  The faint sound of flowing water echoes through the cavern, although no obvious source exists.  Carved into the bedrock are numerous chambers, many carefully fitted with secure frames and doors for privacy.  In the center of the cavern, a wide column rises up to the ceiling and beyond, a spiral staircase carved into its bulk.

title: Twilight Hall, Rylandor's Den
description: Rich, bone-white carpeting serves as a foundation for this luxurious and inviting den.  A grand bookcase dominates the right wall, storing an impressive collection of tomes.  Situated against the left wall are an antique desk and a liquor cabinet.  A lifelike statue of a hooded figure stands in the center of the room, seemingly scrutinizing all who enter the room.  Against the far wall a plush, black leather couch offers respite to weary feet.

title: Twilight Hall, A Healer's Haven
description: As a place to escape from the outside world, the dominating theme of this room is comfort.  A large soft bed waits for its owner's return.  Colorful, yet tastefully selected room furnishings compete with each other for your attention.  An inviting spotted puma throw lies in front of a modest fireplace.  You suspect this is a pleasant place to pass some time and are tempted to do so.

title: Twilight Hall, Krakii's Room
description: Carved into the very bedrock of the town, this room has obviously been crafted by skilled dwarven hands.  A small shrine sits almost unnoticed near the door, and the sleeping quarters are squirreled away in the back, almost hidden behind a craggy stalagmite.  Most visible, however, are a fireplace burning what looks like a young forest, a surprisingly well-stocked bar and several implements of death and destruction hanging within easy reach.

title: Twilight Hall, Tens' Study
description: The soft light in this study faintly illuminates a large coiled golden serpent that has been inlaid into the grey slate floor.  The serpent spirals gently inward from corner to corner, its massive head rising from the floor in the center of the room to provide a suitable base for a black glaes-topped worktable.  A small stone fireplace is set into the far wall of the study, surrounded by comfortable leather chairs and ottomans, and a crystal globe stands in the far corner.

title: Twilight Hall, Chamber of Light
description: As you enter the chamber, your eyes are drawn upwards to the cathedral heights of the crystalline dome.  A warm luminescence cascades about you, its hues dancing and shifting in a rainbow of patterns that leave you with a feeling of tranquility.  A fresh herbal scent lingers from the multitude of lush, verdant plants that hang along the walls.  A glimmer of understanding washes over you as you notice a simple stone altar resting in the center of the chamber.  A spiral staircase leads downstairs.

title: Twilight, Kyrion and Warble's
description: Thick heavily stitched hangings cover the windows, leaving this room bereft of natural light.  Dozens of candles in wall sconces and silver candelabra cast a soft glow across the room.  A large four-poster bed with a hanging silk canopy occupies much of the room, with an altar sitting in one corner.  A fine bow is mounted on one wall in a place of honor, above a nightstand containing several scrolls dotted with musical notes.

title: Twilight Hall, Labyrinth
description: Several identical passageways intersect here.  An uneasy feeling overtakes you as you begin to realize that this maze wasn't necessarily designed to keep you from finding your way in.  Perhaps it was made to prevent the escape of something within.

title: Twilight Hall, Mystic Pool
description: A shallow, shimmering pool in the center of the floor of this dim, darkened room casts a reflection on one wall which seems to contain a message of some kind.

title: Twilight Hall, Summoning Area
description: A tinge of ozone lingers in the air as you look around this dimly lit room.  Scorch marks and rust-colored stains, possibly from experiments gone awry, adorn the area.  Your attention is drawn to a mysterious circle etched into the center of the floor, and your mind whirls as it tries to interpret the significance of the design.

title: Twilight, East Tapestry Room
description: This is a small antechamber that leads to the House Lockers.  An ornate tapestry takes up one entire wall, and there are several chairs scattered about the room.

title: Twilight Hall, Lockers
description: Several sturdy lockers line the walls here, decorated with elegant golden leafwork and intricate etchings.  Your locker has been removed from the shelf above and sits ready for you on a sturdy counter.

title: Half Moon Table
description: The black silk tablecloth is embroidered with very small silver half moons.  On the table is a silver plate shaped into a half moon which holds a flickering candle.

title: Twilight Hall, Oven
description: Roomy enough to hold a whole pig for roasting, the fit inside the oven is a bit snug for anything much larger.  Feeling the heat still radiating from the floor, you're glad the oven has been allowed to cool for a while.

title: Golden Star Table
description: A golden plate in the shape of a star serves as a base for a small candle which illuminates the table.  The tiny gold stars embroidered on the black silk tablecloth catch the candle light and reflect it back in a warm glow.

title: Ronan Table
description: Unlike the other tables, you notice this table doesn't have a candle.  The black silk tablecloth is embroidered with black swords which are only visible by their texture.  On the table is a figure of Ronan, all dressed in black and with eyes that reflect the light of the nearby tables.

title: Black Sword Table
description: A black imflass plate shaped in the form of a sword serves as the base for the candle.  The black silk tablecloth is embroidered with small silver swords.

title: Sheru Table
description: This is the darkest table in the room, not only because it's lacking a candle, but because it is the furthest away from any source of light in the room.  The black silk tablecloth is plain and devoid of embroidery.  On the table is a figure which represents Sheru, a black furred jackal's head with yellow eyes that shimmer with a light of their own.

title: Backstage
description: Dusty stacks of boards, crates, and piled tapestries fill the corners of the cramped, dark room.  A cracked mirror resting against one wall reflects the dim light through a layer of sooty grime.

title: A Narrow Passage
description: This small, dark space between the buildings allows barely enough room to squeeze through the gap in the rough walls.  Sounds of the city street echo from beyond an outcropping in the stone.

title: Courtyard
description: A tall, yellow brick wall totally encloses this grassy area.  The expanse of wall is only interrupted by a pair of open gates.  A neatly cropped, dark green privet hedge rises about five feet, following the wall around its entirety, above which evenly spaced torches burn to brightly illuminate the area.  Centered in the lawn is a glowing silver portal.

title: Empath Guild, Hub
description: Huge green hedges ring this large open area.  The hedges rise nearly fifteen feet and intertwine tightly, preventing passage through them.  At all eight points of the compass, however, openings wide enough to walk through appear in the hedges.  A torchlit marble fountain in the center of the area sprays a steady stream of water upward, falling back to cascade down several tiers to the large pool at the bottom.  Near the northeast corner, a glowing silver portal stands.

title: Guild Master Laurel's Area
description: The grass in this area is heavily trod and has a few patches missing.  A round wooden table seems to be the focus point of several wooden chairs, and a canvas covering has been stretched between four poles to both shade the area from the sun and protect it from rain.  A single freestanding torch placed a bit out from the overhang provides ample light.

title: Training Garden
description: The acre of lawn extends both north and west, bordered by tall thick hedges with southern, southeastern, and eastern exits.  Chestnut and walnut trees shade several sections of the area.  Quiet instruction, often punctuated by the ring of metal on metal, takes place under several trees, with the focus appearing to be the improvement of physical and combat abilities.  In contrast to the rounded deciduous trees, two upright sugar pines stand near the western hedge, with a long table under each pine.

title: Training Garden
description: A roughly rectangular acre of moonlit lawn spreads out to the north.  Tall dark green hedges define the area's border, with the closest exits being openings in the southern and eastern directions.  Various workstations for the improvement of martial arts, weaponry, and bodybuilding occupy positions under spreading walnut and chestnut trees.  Several unlit torches accompany each station.  Nearby, sandbags lie haphazardly piled under one particularly gnarled chestnut tree.

title: Empath Guild, Training Foyer
description: Intricate marquetry of naturally hued woods, incorporating palest pine, purple-grey haon, vivid red cedar, and dusky ebonwood, forms the walls of this grandly proportioned foyer.  Assorted training rooms and their attendant equipment can be glimpsed further inside the training annex.  The dry, herbal scents of cedar and sandalwood fill the air, the aroma more intense near the lamps set along each wall.

title: Aroma Therapy
description: A tight rattan mesh arcs overhead to form a nearly impenetrable dome supported by the tall hedges all around.  The dome's thickness reduces this glade to near darkness.  Hundreds of steel cylinders, one foot in diameter and polished to a mirror-like sheen, support a single candle each at heights ranging from ground level to above a giantman's head.  Fifty of the candles are of various shapes and sizes, only one of which is lit at any one time.  The rest are tall white candles that blaze brilliantly.

title: Library
description: The tall hedges hem in this long, narrow area.  Thick poles deeply implanted just in front of the hedges support a roof of rough-hewn timbers.  A thick layer of grey gravel winds among tall bookshelves situated to form quiet nooks with lamp-lit desks for study.  Interestingly, the majority of the shelves appear to contain information on honing one's will, meditation, martial arts, and weaponry rather than healing arts.  Openings allow exit to the north, east, and west.

title: Relaxation Garden
description: Rounded light grey shrubs randomly placed provide a counterpoint to the dark grey hedges that surround this peaceful enclosure.  Metal rocking chairs lounge at various points across the area, with one blazing torch accompanying each chair.  Crickets and frogs call happily from underneath the protective foliage.  Openings carved through the dense towering shrubs lead north, northwest, and west.

title: Infirmary
description: An array of small cabinets huddles under a wooden overhang in this slightly constricted area.  Dark green hedges tower overhead, standing uncomfortably close to the torch-lined walkway that winds throughout.  A mannequin, barely recognizable under all the bandages, splints, and tourniquets, leans against the hedge in one corner, and a few white canvas cots stand side-by-side in another corner.  Someone has neatly trimmed openings in the hedges to the north, west and south.

title: Meeting Garden
description: A level expanse of lawn holds rows of padded silver chairs, all of which point toward a raised marble dais.  Behind the dais, banners fly from each of four flagpoles, and torches burn at strategic points to illuminate the entire area.  Tall dark green hedges surround the meeting garden and rise to block the line of sight into adjacent areas.  Openings have been cut through the hedges in the western, southwestern, and southern directions, with each opening flanked by a pair of columnar junipers.

title: Potion Garden
description: Tall dark green hedges border this area, blocking the view of the surrounding countryside.  Openings lead to the west, south, and east.  Several low stone tables hold a variety of bottles, beakers, ingredients, and herbs.  Lit torches stand beside each bench, and a soft carpet of closely cropped bluegrass blankets the entire area, providing a comfortable cushion on which to sit or scamper barefoot.  Bright silver canvas has been pushed under some of the hedges.

title: Empath Guild, Nexus
description: Finished in crisp white monir paneling trimmed with mistwood, the walls of this chamber are set with a series of open doorways.  Miniature trees and petite flowering shrubs fill large red clay pots that are spaced evenly around the room.  Tall candles in golden sconces illuminate the area, casting long shifting shadows on the numerous plants below.

title: Empath Guild, Pothinir Workshop
description: A large round skylight bathes the room in pale moonlight, washing over the broad monir workbench and flowing outward.  Covering the top of the workbench is a thick slab of blue-veined marble, pitted and marred in several spots.  The walls are plain and bare, except for a stylized painting of pothinir grass, underscoring the utilitarian nature of the area.

title: Empath Guild, Haphip Workshop
description: A large round skylight bathes the room in pale moonlight, washing over the broad monir workbench and flowing outward.  Covering the top of the workbench is a thick slab of blue-veined marble, pitted and marred in several spots.  The walls are plain and bare, except for a stylized painting of a haphip tree, underscoring the utilitarian nature of the area.

title: Empath Guild, Ephlox Workshop
description: A large round skylight bathes the room in pale moonlight, washing over the broad monir workbench and flowing outward.  Covering the top of the workbench is a thick slab of blue-veined marble, pitted and marred in several spots.  The walls are plain and bare, except for a stylized painting of ephlox moss, underscoring the utilitarian nature of the area.

title: Empath Guild, Reagent Storage
description: Brimming with bottles, canisters, jars, and containers of all sizes, rows of thick shelving nearly obscure the pale white paneling on every wall of this small cubicle.  A squat oval worktable occupies the center of the room, making maneuvering difficult.  Assorted mortar and pestle sets, clean and ready for use, are scattered amidst miscellaneous glassware and other equipment atop the table.

title: Empath Guild, Calamia Workshop
description: A large round skylight bathes the room in pale moonlight, washing over the broad monir workbench and flowing outward.  Covering the top of the workbench is a thick slab of blue-veined marble, pitted and marred in several spots.  The walls are plain and bare, except for a stylized painting of calamia fruit, underscoring the utilitarian nature of the area.

title: Empath Guild, Bolmara Workshop
description: A large round skylight bathes the room in pale moonlight, washing over the broad monir workbench and flowing outward.  Covering the top of the workbench is a thick slab of blue-veined marble, pitted and marred in several spots.  The walls are plain and bare, except for a stylized painting of bolmara lichen, underscoring the utilitarian nature of the area.

title: Empath Guild, Acantha Workshop
description: A large round skylight bathes the room in pale moonlight, washing over the broad monir workbench and flowing outward.  Covering the top of the workbench is a thick slab of blue-veined marble, pitted and marred in several spots.  The walls are plain and bare, except for a stylized painting of an acantha plant, underscoring the utilitarian nature of the area.

title: Empath Guild, Equipment Room
description: Considering the amount of cleaning equipment stored here, one might expect a great deal of dust and disarray, yet not a single object seems out of place.  A stout open-front locker holds brooms, copper dust pans, and other janitorial tools, each hung or stacked neatly within.  Along each wall of the spacious room, equally sturdy cabinets and cupboards store cauldrons, alembics, and large pieces of equipment.  Every item is carefully nestled in its own clearly labeled partition.

title: Moot Hall, South Corridor
description: Rich merlot carpet muffles footsteps through the southern corridor of Moot Hall.  Two long wooden benches sit on each side of a carved wooden door, while a lone giantman guard stands watch over a modwir arch.  A small wooden placard hangs on the wall above an ivory-handled door.

title: Moot Hall, Chamber of Justice
description: Two high-backed, elaborately carved chairs face the imposing, burnished oak bench where members of the official Town Council convene to decide matters of solemn importance.  A narrow stairway leads up to a low balcony that surrounds the chamber, providing ample seating for interested visitors to observe the proceedings.

title: Moot Hall, Observation Balcony
description: Several rows of hardwood benches line the balcony, each row a bit higher than the previous one in order to provide a view of the proceedings below from every seat.  A polished oak railing forms the front barrier of the viewing area, and a narrow stairway leads down.

title: Moot Hall, Council Chambers
description: The walls of this cozy little room are lined with shelves laden with leather-bound volumes of legal and cultural reference.  Deeply-cushioned leather chairs and bright lamplight provide a comfortable place for study and thoughtful reflection.

title: Moot Hall, Storage Hall
description: You are in a darkly lit hallway which runs north-south.  On the east wall is a curtained opening, and to the south you can see what looks like an intersection leading out of the storage area.

title: Drung's Weaponry
description: Enclosed by glossy mistwood walls, the shop features a well-pruned lemon tree in the center of its mahogany floor.  A tattered merchant permit hangs under the wooden ceiling.  Right near the front is a vine-carved mahogany table and a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet.

title: The Anointed Blade, Rose Room
description: Mahogany paneled walls rise from an enameled hardwood floor.  Just above a sphere-topped black marble fountain hangs a brilliant peacock painting, and a vaulted ceiling completes the picture.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet stands in the middle of the room.

title: Ebonstone Manor, Sprawling Lawn
description: Well-manicured lawns dotted with majestic weeping willows and lush rose bushes are demarcated by trimmed hedges.  A tall hawthorne hedge, broken only by an ivy-lined marble walkway, separates the lawn from the grounds beyond.  A stately manor caps one end of the lawn, the exterior of dark granite and ash-veined black marble polished to a gleaming luster.

title: Ebonstone Manor, Foyer
description: Full-length windows fill the spaces between the pairs of stately pale white marble columns deeply veined with ebon that flank the oversized cherrywood double doors.  Across from the entry, an elaborately carved door sits off to one side of a wide staircase leading to a carpeted landing above, then further up and out of sight.  The sound of splashing water in a small marble fountain echoes across the foyer.

title: Woodlands, Blackberry Patch
description: The trail bends from the north to the west through a sunny clearing that breaks the deep woods.  Tangles of blackberry bushes grow around the trunks of the scattered trees, their brambles extending into the small paths that lead to homes in the underbrush.  A flock of blackbirds have stopped to rest in the branches of a nearby oak, filling the clearing with their cries.

title: Woodlands, Shady Trail
description: The forest grows deeper to the south, and the thick canopy of branches overhead allows only a filtered golden light that streams through the trees in scattered places, catching dust-motes and flitting insects in its beams.  Small paths have been cleared to houses set back among the trees.  A twig snaps nearby as some forest creature makes its way through the brush.

title: Woodlands, Hillside
description: The underbrush thins as the canopy of branches above grows thicker.  The trail bends along a sloping hillside, and you can hear the faint trickling of a stream somewhere nearby.  A carpet of leaves covers the dark soil of the forest floor, and squirrels scurry about, digging through the debris for acorns before rushing back up into the oaks.

title: Woodlands, South Hillside
description: Thick branches cross overhead to create deep shadows within the woodlands.  Cabins sit beneath the expansive overhangs, half-concealed by foliage.  Squirrels chase each other through a vast labyrinth of leafy thoroughfares, making their distinctive 'chuck', which sounds louder than possible from such small animals.

title: Woodlands, Hillside Trail
description: The gently sloping hillside is thickly wooded here, and footsteps fall silently on the dark, leaf-covered soil.  Tall ferns thrive in the shade between the trees, their fronds speckled deep green in the filtered light.  The walls of the town are visible in the distance through gaps in the woods, but only the sounds of the quiet forest reach here.

title: Woodlands, South Hillside
description: Small houses are set along the edge of the woods here, where the town walls are clearly visible past the grassland to the east.  Patches of wildflowers grow along the trail, brightening the way with splashes of purple and yellow.  The path curves west around the hillside back into the shade of the deep forest.

title: Woodlands, Forest Path
description: The path turns to the east and rises up the wooded hillside.  Dappled light streams through the branches, forming shifting patterns on the leafy forest floor.  Blackberry bushes grow along the path, and a red wooden bird feeder hung high in a tree near a small cabin adds a touch of bright color.

title: Woodlands, Ravine Path
description: Thick underbrush and craggy rocks cover the steep slope down into the ravine, cleared out in narrow paths leading to residences nestled into narrow ledges and outcroppings.  Golden light filters through the tall modwirs that take root on the stony slope, sparkling on a small stream that trickles below.

title: Woodlands, Ravine
description: The floor of the ravine opens out into a mossy expanse around a tiny stream that trickles merrily across the stony ground and disappears into a hole in the slope.  Squirrels, chipmunks and an occasional fox scurry in and out of the underbrush to drink, and woodland birds twitter in the branches overhead.

title: Woodlands, Pine Trail
description: The trail moves through a stand of tall pines on the sunny hillside, sloping down to the west and turning to a steeper path upwards to the north.  The underbrush is sparse here, and the ground is covered with a soft blanket of fragrant pine needles.  A carved stone bench rests at a gap in the trees, providing a quiet lookout over the walls of the town in the distance.

title: Woodlands, Pine Trail
description: Squirrels cavort among the pines, leaping from branches to scurry down the needle-carpeted hillside.  The trail curves along the slope through patches of sunlight and shadow, past cabins and small houses arranged between the trees.  A faint whiff of sea breeze joins the scent of the pines, and the blue waters of the bay can be seen in the distance past the merchant road.

title: Woodlands, North Hillside
description: The forest is sparse here, and tall grass carpets the slope between the trees, swept by the breeze from the bay.  Wildflowers in shades of yellow and white grow in patches along the trail, and songbirds flitter among the branches, filling the air with their music.

title: Woodlands, North Hillside
description: A deep ravine opens to the west, a narrow trail leading down into its shaded depths.  The path slopes gently up the hilltop to the south, winding amid stately modwirs and patches of bright wildflowers.  Bees and other insects buzz among the flowers and underbrush, their steady hum echoing quietly in the otherwise silent woods.

title: Woodlands, Ravine
description: A small stream bubbles up from a spring between the stones, winding through the mossy floor of the ravine to the south.  Overhanging branches of trees rooted in the steep walls filter the light into flickering green and shadow.  A small path leads up the stony east wall of the ravine.

title: Woodlands, Hilltop
description: The path curves along the crest of the hill, amid scattered trees and boulders and a few small houses that enjoy a view of both the bay to the north and the woodlands to the south.  Berry bushes and wildflowers grow lushly in the grassy patches between the trees, and the sound of a woodpecker tapping away at his business echoes from somewhere nearby.

title: Begetting Besiegers, Front Room
description: A large glass window takes up an entire wall of the shop, moonlight gleaming through and shining on a length of shelves where numerous miniatures have been setup for display.  Two glass-paneled cabinets hang on both sides of a wide lacquered door, while the center of the room is occupied by a huge ironwood table.  A high archway is set behind a curved maoral counter where two faded copper bins rest to the side.

title: Stone Baths, Entry
description: The room opens up into a large antechamber surrounded by walls of pale limestone, brightened from silver moonlight streaming in through glass windows.  A long navy blue rug stretches from a brass-trimmed door to a circular front desk where a female elven clerk smiles warmly.  The sound of clanking glasses is heard coming from a brass archway and glowing candles illuminate a broad hallway.

title: Stone Baths, Nexus
description: The dimly lit hallway opens up into a wide spherical chamber with a smooth, dark slate floor.  Maoral-framed paintings enhance the russet-hued walls, and arched windows provide a profusion of silvery moonlight.  Ceramic pots of white gardenia rest between a silver arch, a brass arch and a gold arch.

title: Marble Bath
description: The flames from tall silver candelabras cast a warm glow on the water of a small pool in the center of the room, bubbles rising up along its surface.  The floor is made from polished black marble and piles of large white pillows are scattered about, providing ample comfort for the weary.

title: Cherrywood Bath
description: Moonlight barely passes through small opaque windows, set high into the wall.  A warm pool of water is enclosed within a half-circle of smooth stone benches.  The floor is crafted of burnished cherrywood with large black bearskin rugs strewn about.

title: Cypress Bath
description: Fan palms stretch overhead, partially obscuring the aqua and verdant domed ceiling.  Steaming hot water cascades along a fall of riverstones, carefully pieced together to end in a natural stone pool.  Tiny square tiles in varying shades of greens, blues, greys and blacks form a swirling kaleidoscope across the floor.

title: Rosewood Bath
description: Burnt sienna walls washed with deep crimson give the quaint room a warm and sensuous feel, while bright moonlight pours in through tinted glass windows.  A round pool filled with crystal clear water is set into the floor and covered in pearl pink sand.  A stone-wrought basin on the far wall gushes fresh, cool water that spills into the pool while a linen hammock hangs suspended from adjacent walls.

title: Sandstone Bath
description: Irregular slabs of tawny sandstone surround a small round pool sunken into the northeast corner of the room.  The ochre streaked floor easily holds the natural warmth seeping from the pool.  Candlelight flickers merrily from frosted glass sconces along the wall.  A simple cane-backed settee with scrolled arms and leather cushions occupies the southwest corner.  A cylindrical vase holding a bouquet of dried lavender sits on a small oval table near the settee.

title: Stone Baths, Hearth
description: The hearth room is dimly lit by brass lamps mounted along the dark mahogany walls.  A trio of deep blue cushioned chairs faces a grey sandstone fireplace in the corner, while a slate-topped bar runs the length of an entire wall.  A cluster of dark oak tables rests in the center of the room, not far from a brass archway.

title: Begetting Besiegers, Backroom
description: Windowless and dim, it's a wonder how the artisan gets any detailed work done.  A small leather-padded stool rests between two paint-stained tables, easily affording the craftsman an ample amount of space.  Short shelves and stands hold an assortment of half-finished miniatures, many still colorless or missing limbs.  Tart crumbs are scattered about the floor.

title: Stone Baths, Upstairs Hall
description: Mahogany-hued carpeting runs the entire length of the hall, brightened by silvery moonlight streaming in through a large arched window.  A series of painted doors line each side of the walls, while at the end of the hallway a sturdy ladder leads up to a wooden hatch in the ceiling.

title: Stone Baths, Woodland Dreams
description: Occupying most of the room, a large bed flanked by a pair of small unusual tables sits atop a mottled moss green and tan rug, a velvet-covered bench at its foot.  A woodland mural wraps around the room and up to a vaulted ceiling.  Moonlight streams through a large circular window set high in the wall, reflecting off leaves of potted plants and giving the room an impression of a forest glade.

title: Stone Baths, Gossamer Veil
description: Pale blue-washed walls and minimal decor lend an air of serenity to the expansive room.  Raised on a pallid oak platform in the corner, is a large canopied bed draped with gossamer white curtains which match those billowing at a partially open window.  A soft light emanates from a myriad of glowing sea glass globes hanging on gilt chains from the oak beamed ceiling.  The centerpiece of the room is a low glass-topped table, around which heaps of pale cushions are scattered.

title: Stone Baths, Ebon Embrace
description: Polished ebonwood floors softly glow beneath a rich wine-and-black antique silk rug centered in the open room.  In one corner stands a large black walnut four-poster bed, regally draped in deep wine-hued velvet.  Black obsidian hexagonal tables flank each side of the bed and match a nearby ornately carved armoire.  An elegant tapestry hangs above a large fireplace while a writing desk separates tall velvet-draped windows.

title: Stone Baths, The Simple Oak
description: Spacious and practical, the windowless room is illuminated by a myriad of candles resting upon tiered felwood shelving.  A large circular table dominates the center of the room and is surrounded by high-backed wooden chairs.  Light flickers on the plush plum carpeting and is reflected onto a comfy bed, nestled against paneled maple walls.  A glass-fronted solid oak dresser occupies the space beneath one of the shelves.

title: Stone Baths, Rooftop Garden
description: Brass handrails rise up along the edges of the bathhouse's stone rooftop, enclosing a wide flat surface that is mostly dominated by vivid flowerbeds, brightened by the moon's silvery rays.  The view from the garden is expansive, revealing the shadowy streets of Wehnimer's Landing and the dark forests beyond the town.

title: Stone Baths, Theatre
description: A large wooden stage extends across one whole side of the room, where heavy, deep blue curtains have been pulled aside to reveal numerous wooden sets and props.  Arrayed before the stage are several rows of cushioned chairs, while small brass sconces along the walls provide a dim glow to the theatre.

title: Theatre, Backstage
description: The area behind the stage is in disarray, with wooden props scattered about the floor while fanciful costumes are overflowing from iron-bound chests.  Bins of old paint rest near a few discolored wooden sets, their transformation still incomplete.  A few stools rest before a row of vanities, and a dim passageway leads back to the theatre's auditorium.

title: Cholgar's Cavern
description: The walls glisten as water slowly drips down, creating a musty aroma to the shadowy cavern.  Corroded black lanterns provide a soft diffused glow, faintly illuminating a cracked crystal fountain resting between a stack of old crates and a waterlogged bookcase.  A broken chain snakes around a cluster of tarnished bins which are positioned next to a pile of rubble.

title: Museum, Hall of Technology
description: Smooth white marble flooring stretches across this room, uninterrupted save for a large, gear-shaped silver inlay in the center of the room.  Matching gears in silver, gold, bronze, and steel adorn the walls, each one polished to a mirrored sheen.   A black sign in the corner, directly between the adjacent hallways, bears an explanation of the room.  Framed portraits hang between the varying gears, while a gold marble arch leads out.

title: Museum, Cabinet of Curiosities
description: This small room is crammed from floor to ceiling with shelves and cases.  All varieties of artifacts rest on their surfaces.  A row of goblin skulls on a high shelf transitions from prehistoric to modern day, and several bulbous eyeballs in clear glass jars glint from the shelf below, reflecting light from the glass-paned oil lanterns that dot the room.  On the north wall, a narrow door rests between two tall cabinets, while to the south, a bloody tapestry ripples slightly in an occasional cold draft.

title: Temple, Behind Pillars
description: Your footsteps echo hollowly in this oddly chill room set into the thick outer wall of the Temple.  The air here is still and cold, with a faint hint of corruption and decay.  Death is an old friend here it would seem, as you gaze at shelves laden with canopic jars decorated in the styles of eras long gone.  Unguents and ointments, potions and wrappings fill other shelves and it is clear to you that this chamber has oft been used for the preparation of the dead.

title: Wehnimer's Museum, Lobby
description: Surrounded by darkly paneled walls, this second-floor lobby mimics the opulence of the one below with its expansive marble floor and intricately painted ceiling.  Hallways lead to the east and west, while a neatly printed sign directing visitors to their destinations rests near an expansive staircase.  Across from the landing, a mahogany arch with a bas-relief floral design leads to the north.

title: Museum, Hall of Knowledge
description: Mahogany-paneled walls encapsulate this small room.  Low bookshelves dot the pale gold marble floor, their dark mahogany surfaces polished to a shine and adorned with astrolabes, compasses, and various other objects.  A solid oak door with a small gold plaque resides between two tapestries depicting scholars at work studying tomes and scrolls.  On the opposite wall, an onyx arch leads to another room.  Standing between the two exits is a white metal sign on an iron stand, while on the south side wall, a mahogany arch with a bas-relief floral design leads to the second floor lobby.

title: Museum, Fine Arts Wing
description: Pale ivory walls rise from the mottled green marble flooring to meet a lofted matte gold stucco ceiling where a crystal chandelier encompasses much of the space.  The warm golden light from the chandelier reflects in the crystals, sending fragmented rainbows dancing around the room.  Scattered along the walls, several crystal vases stand on pedestals, each one filled with dozens of vividly hued roses.  On the western wall, a stained golden oak door stands between the adjoining hallways.

title: Wehnimer's Museum, Gift Shop
description: Tall potted plants made of jade green silk rest in the corners of this quiet room.  Thick, dull gold carpeting muffles any footsteps of patrons perusing the items for sale that rest on numerous displays.  A glass-fronted oak cabinet rests against the wall opposite a long marble-topped counter, behind which stands a portly man in a woolen vest.  A stained golden oak door is centered between two additional potted plants, their vivid green silk leaves accenting the pale ivory hue of the walls.

title: Fine Arts Wing, Around Town
description: Ivory-hued walls frame this portion of the long hallway that comprises this wing of the museum.  Hanging on one wall is a reversed white eonake greatshield, a landscape scene covering its concave surface.  Flanking the shield are two oak-framed paintings interspersed with ensconced oil lanterns that light up the room.  On the opposite wall, a leaf-etched rosewood-framed painting hangs beside a long teak-framed portrait.  Beneath the artwork, some short cast bronze otter statues and their accompanying sign rest on the pale mottled-green marble floor.

title: Fine Arts Wing, Local Heroes
description: The pale ivory walls are broken halfway up by oak paneling along the bottom half of this section of the long hallway.  An expansive mahogany-framed painting is flanked by a verdigris-veined copper figure standing to one side, and a carved marble memorial on the other.   Hanging opposite, a series of gold-framed portraits lines the wall, interspersed with wrought iron oil lanterns that cast their golden glow on the room.

title: Fine Arts Wing, On the Shores
description: Stretching to the east and south, the walls in this portion of the long hallway are painted a pale sky blue.  In the center of the floor stands an ornately detailed sea nymph statue on a carved lapis lazuli and jade base that resembles an ocean wave.  Hanging on the wall is a cedar-framed dark watercolor seascape, an onyx-framed landscape painting, and a monochromatic ink stipple drawing.  Crafted of pale green sea glass, several oil lanterns lend their subtly tinted light to the room.

title: Fine Arts Wing, Heat of Battle
description: This short section of the hallway has dark oak-paneled walls and a pale marble floor striated with crimson.  In the center of the floor, a carved monir cockatrice statue is displayed on a circular silver base, adjacent to a small translucent block that sits on a carved oak pedestal.  On the western wall, an expansive watercolor painting obscures the oak paneling, while a panoramic oil-painted landscape encompasses the wall opposite.

title: Fine Arts Wing, Festivities
description: Cream-hued walls flank the room on both sides as the hallway stretches off in two directions.  A dusky rose-hued marble floor houses a statue of a man and woman dressed in finery.  A large oak-framed painting hangs between two copper ensconced oil lanterns that add their flickering glow to the ambiance of the room.  A series of small oil paintings lines the wall opposite, their canvases remaining unframed.

title: Fine Arts Wing, Invasions
description: Rising up from a pale marble floor speckled with flecks of glittering mica, two forest green walls flank this portion of the hallway.  Hanging between several flickering torches are a detailed rubbed charcoal sketch, a large teak-framed painting, and an inverted mithril tower shield.  Centrally located on the cool floor is an expansive abstract sculpture made of pure kelyn.

title: Fine Arts Wing, Into the Wild
description: The sepia-veined green marble floor is dominated by a carved ebonwood sculpture in the center.  Hanging in evenly spaced intervals on the two pine green walls are an old tattooed animal pelt, an oak-framed oil painting, and a gold-framed forest painting.  Flickering brass oil lanterns dot the walls between the artwork, casting their light on the room.

title: Museum, Wehnimer's Gallery
description: Honey oak-paneled walls support a plain white ceiling.  The paneling is adorned every few feet by an artificial window or door.  The rustic style mimics the streets of Wehnimer's Landing where the facades of buildings press in on the cobblestones, of which the floor of this room is comprised.  On the eastern wall, one such fake door, between two real arches, sports a simple white sign.  Centrally placed in the room, a scale model encompasses the surface of a wide wooden table.

title: Landmarks, Graveyard
description: A replica massive bronze gate stands at the edge of a diorama sporting crumbling gravestones and wax figures.  In the remaining half of the room, a model granite crypt rests on the grey pebbled floor, surrounded by green silk weeds that encroach on the dilapidated structure.  A miniature black altar and a replicated marble monument sit on either side of the pale green rug that traverses the clear pathway through the room, ending with a carved modwir arch.  The sounds of wind whistling eerily and the mournful creaking of a metal gate can be heard every so often.

title: Legends Wing, Healing Arts
description: Centrally placed is a large wooden oak tree, painstakingly carved to replicate its living counterpart.  The branches meld with the ceiling to create a lush, green silk and oak branch canopy overhead.  On the cobblestones beneath the tree, three wax figures rest in various poses on carved juniper bases.  Two black-framed paintings hang on the trunk of the tree, while a carved stone bench sits nearby.  Glass-paned oil lanterns dot the muted blue walls, illuminating the room with a golden glow, while a bas-relief image of a woman hangs nearby.

title: Legends Wing, Magical Arts
description: Vivid splashes of paint splatter the walls, as if a group of children had a paint fight.  Amidst the chaos, several black-framed paintings of various sizes cover up some of the splatters on the walls.  Orbs of colored glass mounted on sconces hold tiny candles, each casting the faint hue of their glass prison on the room.  A pair of wax figures figures dominates the pale grey marble floor, their countenances reflecting subtle colors from the room around them.

title: Legends Wing, Physical Arts
description: Painted on the walls is a dense forest scene, the trees so close together that the canopies overlap.  The ceiling is covered with a thick layer of silk leaves, as if the mural on the walls has spilled over into the room itself.  Expansive tree stumps sit in a circle on the grass-green marble floor.  Resting on the each of the tree trunks are wax figures in various poses, while a a double-sided wooden easel in the center of the ring displays several paintings.  Standing in opposite corners are a glass display case and a gilt-edged rowan pedestal.

title: Hall of Knowledge, Laboratory
description: The room is dim, a faint luminescence emanating from a single shelf mounted on the wall that houses several glowing potions under a glass case.  There are small plaques on the shelf in front of each potion, their metal surfaces gleaming in the half-light of the room.  Centrally located, a simmering cast iron cauldron over a magical blue flame sits adjacent to a mortar and pestle that rest on a small pedestal.  A gnarled ebonwood arch leads to the northwest, while an onyx arch leads southwest.

title: Hall of Knowledge, Library
description: Bookshelves encompass all the remaining wall space that is not taken up by doors, and a plush pale gold rug covers the floor.  Wooden tables, flickering oil lanterns set on their surfaces, and cushioned chairs offer areas to spread out and read or study.  Scents of parchment, glue, and dust permeate the room.  The well-manicured librarian stands behind a low wooden checkout desk, its surface littered with folios, quills, and jars of ink.

title: Hall of Knowledge, Magic Relics
description: The expanse of green marble floor is interrupted by a long glass-fronted cabinet with several shelves that stands against one pale, cream colored wall.  A velvet-lined display case rests on the opposite wall, its contents glittering in the light of several ensconced candles that dot the room.  In the southeastern corner, a gnarled ebonwood arch offers a limited view of darkness from the next room, while on the southwestern corner a carved modwir door resides beside a large gold-framed painting.

title: Landmarks, Melgorehn's Reach
description: The room is designed so the center is raised sharply, mimicking a mountaintop completely covered by a replica of a tall dark tower with its labyrinth of passages, bridges, ledges, and tunnels.  Spread out before the sprawling structure down the mountainside is a grassy plain, and one large boulder with a single flattened side lays near the base of the slope.  A metal sign on an iron stand and a small oak pedestal rest beside the three-dimensional exhibit.

title: Landmarks, Danjirland
description: A mural of a forest scene, with thick trunks spaced close together, covers all four walls, lending itself to the primordial ambiance of the room.  A thick grass green rug covers the floor, its expansive surface interrupted by a replica wooden obelisk and a weatherbeaten sign.  On one wall a panoramic painting in a knotty oak frame blocks the mural of trees behind it and resting below the artwork is a glass-fronted oak case.

title: Nature Wing, Town Specimens
description: The whole room is set up to resemble a street at the brink of a town's protective barricade, which is built into the museum wall and depicted standing wide open, giving a glimpse of the surrounding countryside in a detailed landscape painting.  Amidst the replicated buildings are specimens of Wehnimer's Landing's most interesting fauna.  A replica shaggy mutt sits on the street, head cocked to one side.  Near the Furrier's facade, a stuffed tiny kitten crouches, frozen in the act of pouncing on a perfectly preserved giant rat.

title: Nature Wing, Cave Specimens
description: Darkness surrounds this room akin to the inside of a cave.  Stalactites descend from the ceiling and the sound of dripping water can be heard at a regular interval.  A maze of differently sized stalagmites juts up from the floor, leaving enough space to walk.  A greenish glow emanates from a substance on the surface of the protrusions, allowing enough light to see.  A glass wall divides the patrons from the exhibit, the beady eyes of its occupants glinting in the half-light.

title: Nature Wing, Forest Specimens
description: Thick trees carved from fallen brethren stand like sentinels on the mossy floor of this room.  The ceiling is painted to resemble the green, leafy canopy of a real forest.  The sound of birdsong in the trees and the smell of patchouli enriches the experience of just having stepped into a vast forest.  Several specimens stand in individual glass cases amidst the trees, each labeled with a small bronze plaque.

title: Nature Wing, Meadow Specimens
description: A glass wall divides the room in half, protecting the exhibit from the patrons passing by, but affording them an optimal view of the lush grasslands and its creatures spread out behind the glass.  On this side of the divider, several more animal specimens are displayed on individual pedestals, their countenances forever frozen in death.  The soft sound of bleating emanates from nearby at random intervals, its pitch changing each time it is heard.

title: Nature Wing, Aquatic Specimens
description: Two panes of glass set only inches apart and filled with blue-tinted water hug three of the walls of this room.  The openings to the north and east allow passage into other areas of the museum, and sand dunes decorate the fourth wall, depicting the beaches of Wehnimer's Landing.  The underwater theme is continued with replica seaweed sprouting from the sand-hued stone floor and aquatic animal specimens on thin steel rods jutting up from the floor, each captured in a motion of swimming or crawling up onto the beach.

title: Nature Wing, Mountain Specimens
description: A winding path leads through this room which has been utterly transformed into the rocky terrain of a steep mountainside.  Perched on a nearby crag is a stuffed mountain ogre in a glass case, while on the opposite side of the path, a similarly protected humpbacked puma suns itself on a rock.  Watching all from the peak of the replicated mountain stands a lone mummified reiver.  The path leads through the mountain and down, leveling off before the next room.

title: Nature Wing, Arctic Specimens
description: It seems colder here than the neighboring areas, though the snow and ice covering the space are not real, merely a fabrication that resembles reality.  The diorama for this climate resides behind a glass wall, protecting its inhabitants collectively instead of in individual cases.  A low moan and a high pitched shriek sound through the room at odd intervals, imitating the fierce winds across the arctic terrain.  Several silver-framed paintings adorn the wall opposite the glass, showcasing more denizens of the glacier.

title: History Wing, Griffin Sword
description: The far wall is painted to resemble the exterior of the large temple of Wehnimer's Landing.  Darkly hued, a wrought-iron gate is depicted in the foreground.  To one side of the gate, a replicated glowing white stone rests on the grey marble floor, while on the other side a pillow-topped gold pedestal stands alone.  On another wall, two gold-framed paintings hang above a glass-topped display case, its contents glittering in the light of ensconced lanterns set along the walls.

title: History Wing, The Founding
description: In the center of the room, an elaborate diorama has been set apart from the walkway by velvet ropes.  Against one darkly paneled wall, a long glass case houses several artifacts from the founding of Wehnimer's Landing and related events of that era.  Glass-paned oil lanterns light the room from their hooks on the walls, affording the space a cozy golden glow.

title: History Wing, Vvrael War
description: Mist grey walls encompass this small room where a mountainous diorama takes up one corner.  Across the walls, stylized crimson raindrops fall toward a white marble floor where red streaks in the stone resemble rivulets of blood in the snow.  Two silver-framed paintings hang on the wall opposite the diorama, with matching plaques to describe them.  Everything is bathed in the light of several flickering torches that dot the walls.

title: History Wing, Jantalar
description: Artifacts and paintings litter this room, the metal bits glittering in the light of several oil lanterns mounted to the walls.  A life-sized wax figure stands in the center of the room, while a scale model of the Glaesen Star rests off to one side.  One particularly well-preserved painting with an imflass frame hangs on the wall near a velvet-lined display case.

title: History Wing, Reiver Invades
description: Blood red walls surround this room.  The space is bare save for a plain white sign in the center of the black marble floor.  Although the room is bare, intermittent sounds can be heard emanating from somewhere nearby.

title: History Wing, Estrion and Sarl
description: Painted an eggshell white as a base, an elaborate mural encompasses the entirety of the wall space to the east, west, north, and south.  Centered in the floor is a large golden puma statue that rests on a shiny, black marble pedestal.  In the middle of the room, near the statue, a gold-lettered plaque rests on a black marble podium, describing the scenes in the room.

title: History Wing, Krolvin War
description: The walls here are painted a deep maroon hue that contrasts markedly with the white baseboards and ceiling.  In one corner, a mannequin stands in a cylindrical glass display while in the opposite corner, a long glass case holds several ancient weapons.  Hanging on the wall in between the two displays is a panoramic painting on an extra long canvas, framed in burled oak.  The opposite wall is blank save for three, evenly spaced oil lanterns dangling from black iron hooks.

title: Hall of Technology, By Air
description: The entire ceiling is taken up by the underside of a large replica flying dirigible.  A thick rope ladder attached to the metallic hull hangs down to the floor.  Two scale airship models are docked at a miniature terminus.  All four walls are painted in swaths of a pale blue with wisps of white, transforming the room into a mid-summer sky.  Near the connecting hallway, the painted sky burns red, caught in a forever sunset.  In the opposite corner, a glass-fronted mahogany cabinet holds a few glittering trinkets.

title: Hall of Technology, By Land
description: Earthy rocks and rubble carpet the floor of this room, accenting the dark grey marble flooring with a layer of brown.  Crags and caves dot the roughly hewn walls giving the appearance of being carved directly out of the rock.  The focal point of the room is an enormous mithril vehicle, the floor around it littered with broken boulders and dirt.  On top of a particularly wide stone, a glass cover protects an artifact resting there.

title: Hall of Technology, By Sea
description: The sound of crashing waves permeates the room, with the occasional high-pitched cry of a gull.  The walls are divided a third of the way up by curved wave caps, the water painted in deep blues, greens, and purples.  The upper portion resembles the sky, with puffy white clouds and a seagull in flight.  Sunk into the ocean-blue floor so only the top sections show, a replica five-masted sailing vessel sits near a model pirate ship, its tart-over-crossbones flag unfurled.  A glass-covered mahogany pedestal rests at the edge of the room.

title: Begetting Besiegers, Sky Arena
description: High walls rise up to encase this open arena in a solid cover, muting the sounds of the town to a quiet muffle.  Sunlight from the open sky glints off the surface of tall flag poles, their banners stirring slightly with the breeze.  The arena itself is a circular stretch of scuffed dark slate, surrounded by a set of wide stone steps which lead up to an observation deck.

title: Begetting Besiegers, Watch Deck
description: A sturdy wooden observation deck stretches out in a half-circle providing ample room for spectators.  A carved ironwood railing provides some leaning comfort to onlookers while they view the arena below.  The tops of flagpoles rise up from the sides of the deck and stretch up into the open sky above.

title: Wehnimer's Museum, Basement
description: Lined on both sides by flickering torches, this room is part of a tunnel beneath the museum.  A set of stone steps leads upward toward a brighter light, while the enclosed passage stretches on to the east and west, its rough walls crafted from timber braces and mortared stone.

title: Museum, Basement Tunnel
description: A draft gently blows through the room at odd intervals, causing the torches that dot the walls to gutter and flare with each passing breeze.  The rough walls are crafted of timber braces and mortared stone, allowing the room to remain cool even in the summer.  An open archway in the north wall leads to an adjacent room, while a similar arch in the south wall has been bricked up with a contrastingly lighter color than the wall around it.

title: Museum, Basement Storage
description: This expansive room is cluttered floor to ceiling with canvas-draped objects that rest in storage.  The timber-braced mortared stone walls are almost completely obscured by piles of artifacts, paintings, statues, and relics that dwell in this subterranean room.  Flickering torches high in the walls cast their light on the covered objects below, and a glimpse of reddish fur peeks out from beneath an askew canvas cover.  An old and musty tapestry hangs on the south wall beside an open archway that leads out of the room.

title: Museum, Basement Tunnel
description: The slow plinking sound of water dripping from somewhere above echoes through this subterranean room beneath the museum.  Unfinished, the walls are crafted of timber braces and mortared stone, with pale lichen growing in the cracks.  The space is partially illuminated by flickering torches set into the walls that reflect off shallow murky puddles on the rough stone floor.  An open archway in the north wall leads to an adjacent room.

title: Museum, Basement Storage
description: The timber-braced mortared stone walls of this large storage room are almost completely obscured by the stacks of canvas-draped objects piled against them.  The vague outlines of rectangular frames, tall statues, and other odd shapes stand like ghosts beneath their canvas covers.  Beneath a flickering torch, several paintings have been uncovered and leaned against the wall as if for a better view.  A hint of gold glints from beneath an askew canvas cover.  An open archway leads out of the room.

title: Wehnimer's Museum, Planetarium
description: The black walls are circular, creating a dark cylindrical space.  Domed, the ceiling is riddled with tiny holes and lit from behind.  The light shining through the holes mimics the starlight on a cloudless night.  All the constellations well-known to the local area can be seen among the stars.  A narrow stone staircase leading up and a set of spiral stone stairs leading down rest against one curved wall, while four constellation tapestries hang an equidistance from each other on the rounded walls, their contents illuminated by the starlight from above.

title: Wehnimer's Museum, Observatory
description: All four walls are open to the surrounding area, and yet protected from the elements by the domed ceiling supported by carved columns that rise from a matching white marble railing.  A large brass-fitted telescope against one railing peers up into the heavens.  In the center of the room, a black cast iron brazier rests beside a basket of sticks.  Situated in a circle around the fireplace are several sofas, settees, and armchairs.  A low polished oak table sits between two chairs, its surface laden with refreshments.  A narrow stone staircase leads down.

title: Scribe, Front Room
description: The walls of Jenkin the Scrivener's office are honeycombed with scroll and book shelves, all empty.  A thin layer of dust covers the room.  An elegantly penned note hangs from the upper edge of a writing desk in the middle of the room.  Through the archway north, a very large screw-like contraption can be seen.

title: Scribe, Press Room
description: A large wooden contraption takes up most of this room.  It resembles a grape or clothes press, with a heavy chain and padlock preventing anyone from raising the upper part of the press.  Beneath a workbench are several large wood blocks carved with words and pictures.  On top of the workbench are several smaller blocks similarly carved.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Crude symbols have been scratched into the rocks along a tunnel wall here.  Nearby, a crude wooden ladder leads up to a hinged trapdoor.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The ground is bumpy, full of jagged stones and misshapen clods of dirt.  A bat hangs from a wooden rafter, its dark wings folded tightly around its body.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Loose gravel crumbles along parts of the walls, exposing many small cracks along the dirt and rock.  A shattered lantern hangs from a splintered wooden rafter.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Dried blood stains have formed a large smear in the ground, surrounded by shattered pieces of glass.  Shadows flicker in the distance, originating from the faintly-lit sconces along the walls.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A cavern nexus extends out, with many different tunnels leading in every which direction.  The ground is worn and flat, firmly matted beneath frequent travel.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tunnel curves dramatically here, twisting in and out of darkness.  Small fiery embers flitter up from torches set along the walls.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The dark hallway is narrow, hugged tightly by jagged walls of earth and stone.  Torchlight causes shadows to dance along the walls like incorporeal puppets.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The underground channel descends, as the heat of the torches work to fight off the cold air of the greater depth.  Small embers of fire twirl up from the torches as the flames rise and ebb.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tapered walls give way to a greater area, as the distance between torches stretches, expanding the cover of darkness.  Two old barrels sit to the side of the tunnel, their labels faded, but depicting an image of a skull and bones.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The channel here is wide and large enough to fit a wagon through.  The thick lines of wooden wheels in the dirt are clear evidence of its plausibility.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The extensive tunnel stretches far, with small brass sconces lighting the way in both directions.  Propped against a wall is an old wagon wheel, with two missing wooden spokes.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The fractured remnants of an animal's skull lie amidst a pile of dusty bones in a corner of the tunnel, where it opens into a wide turn.  Nearby, a crude wooden ladder leads up to a hinged trapdoor.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The cavern is spacious, with huge wooden rafters running along the stony ceiling above.  A row of crates, barrels, and bolts of cloth line an entire length of a wall.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Huge in size, the underground chamber is set with blazing torches along every wall.  Old wagons have been pulled to one side of the pathway, all of them in need of serious repair.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A narrow path winds through darkened rocks, their edges jagged and jutting out dangerously.  The walls of the burrow glisten slightly, their surface slick with moisture.  Strange, glowing green lichen clings to the walls, creating an eerie viridian glow throughout the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The air in the dark cavern is heavy with humidity, as tiny rivulets of water trickle down between cracks in the rocky walls.  The sound of lapping waves can be heard nearby.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A single torch has been wedged into a crack in some rocks, its orange light causing the water along the walls to glint with a fiery glow.  Small waves from the sea come rushing through a large gap up ahead as the cold black water blankets the ground.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The ground is smooth and flat here, clearly traveled frequently.  The area is dimly illuminated by a few lit sconces set into the dirt walls.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A broken cask rests up against a tunnel wall, old ale stains along its shattered casing.  A faint, hazy smoke lingers in the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Two sconces hang here, one unlit and leaving much of the area in darkness.  Of the portion of the wall that is lit up, the misspelled message  "Breware"  has been smeared in blood.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Along an earthen wall, the skeletal remains of a humanoid are partially visible, half-buried within the hard-packed dirt.  High above, a wooden rafter appears to be cracking along the ceiling.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Shadows hug the walls of the tunnel, broken up only by the dim spheres of torchlight stretching down the corridor.  An old rodent skull lies to the side of the path, partially crushed in on the side.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Webs engulf the rafters along the stone ceiling, tiny black bugs trapped within their netting.  A few sconces along the wall are broken, casting much of the tunnel into darkness.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The ground is irregular here, cluttered with rusted debris, broken glass, and old blood stains.  A corpse is slumped up against a wall, garbed in a tattered and dirty Wehnimer's Militia uniform.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: At the edge of this warren, only a single torch burns, its light barely pushing away any darkness.  The faint sound of rodents skittering about can be heard close by.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The underground tunnel twists sharply here, turning right before a dirt-packed wall broken up by jagged rocks.  Faint light glows from both ends of the passage.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: A giant spider web dominates a corner of the tunnel, its silk glistening against the light from nearby torches.   Trapped within the spider's snare, is a humanoid form.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The walls here are thick, formed mostly of rock.  Beads of water slowly drip down the walls, causing them to glisten from the pale torchlight.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Half-formed cobwebs cling to the far corners of the tunnel ceiling, collecting more dust than bugs.  Nearby, a crude wooden ladder leads up to a hinged trapdoor.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Part of the tunnel has collapsed here, as evident by the pile of boulders blocking part of the path.  From beneath the rubble, the bony fingers of a skeletal hand can be seen.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The walls are comprised of packed earth, supported along the tunnel by solid oak beams.  The sound of scattering rodents can be heard from within the shadows.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tunnel is narrower here, with the earthen walls more jagged along their surfaces.  Darkness continues to dominate a majority of the area.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Tiny, beady-eyed rodents scamper about the uneven ground.  The marmots gnaw and snap at insects darting between cracks.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
