description: The faded light of nearby sconces causes a number of cobwebs among the rafters to shimmer slightly.  Trapped among the silk, a tiny black bug squirms uselessly to try to avoid the shared fate of the insect husks next to it.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Shadows creep along the dirt-covered walls, threatening to engulf the pale light given off from the few sconces set about.   A pair of old, tattered gloves lies off to the side of the passage.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Empty wooden crates line an entire wall of the tunnel, discolored labels marking them as property of the Wehnimer's Landing Museum.  Because of the partial blockade of chests, the passageway is narrower here.

title: Guttin' Goods, Stock Room
description: A number of featureless and weathered mannequins clutter two corners of the backroom, their bodies sporting an array of fishing attire and accessories.  A few empty ale mugs and some grimy dice rest on top of a stack of unmarked crates.

title: Guttin' Goods
description: Two circular windows provide an ample view of the dark wharf outside, with a handful of dockworkers laboring late into the evening.   Moonlight from the open doorway casts a sliver of silver light across the shop's floor, while dim lanterns supply a sufficient brightness to the area.  A scruffy half-krolvin shopkeeper leans upon a driftwood counter and seems to doze off more than once.  The weak scent of sea salt lingers in the shop.

title: Begetting Besiegers, Basement
description: Narrow wooden steps lead down from the trapdoor in the ceiling, ending in a wide underground chamber.  Old rusty sconces cast a dim glow along the earthen walls, creating thick pockets of shadows that partially conceal a flimsy wooden door.

title: Underground Arena
description: Crude wooden benches ascend in a semicircle around a smooth dirt arena where old blood stains have darkened the ground in many patches.  Lit torches are scattered about the room casting flickering shadows along the stone walls.  A pile of dismembered siege miniatures have been haphazardly left in a corner.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tunnel here is almost entirely engulfed in darkness, and the walls are jagged and stained.  An old, musty smell hangs heavily in the air.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tunnel here is almost entirely engulfed in darkness, and the walls are jagged and stained.  An old, musty smell hangs heavily in the air.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: While most of the tunnel is shrouded in darkness, this section is aglow from the orange light of several torches set into the earthen walls.  The passageway is warm from the burning torches, and half a dozen troll skeletons litter the ground.

title: Zephyr Hall, Entry Garden
description: Nearly spilling over their knee-high granite borders, beds of colorful flowers of myriad varieties line a cobblestone pathway leading to a pair of rustic ironwood doors, the entrance to a large, granite-faced lodge.  The lodge's upper floors of massive, rough-hewn oak logs sport small balconies backed by large sheets of glass.  Hedges of laurel and boxwood march across the building's front.  Their branches, while not blocking the views from any windows, have an air of wildness about them.

title: Zephyr Hall, Common Room
description: Highly polished wood floors are covered with woven wool rugs, providing splashes of color in the large, chandelier-lit foyer.  A burled maple doorway resides in the eastern wall, and a sweeping grand staircase leads to the second floor.  In the opposite corner, a dimly lit hallway leads to the interior of the lodge.  Several burnished leather sofas and chairs, facing a low stone hearth, invite rest, while a a wide gold-chased table is placed between them.  Beside the entry doors a small golden depository sits against the darkly paneled wall.

title: Zephyr Hall, Hallway
description: Completely paneled in polished pine planking, the walls hold elaborate antler sconces.  Several doors lead off to the east, and the nearest one rests ajar, revealing shelves of linens and cleaning supplies.  A carved pine door leads to a dimly lit room, while a faint glow emanates from a curved mottled green doorway.  The granite floor is polished to a gleam, its mica flecks sparkling as the candles gutter and flare.

title: Zephyr Hall, Transport Room
description: Gold-trimmed, dark green walls surround this small room that is little more than a spacious closet.  Leaning up against one wall, a small table stands beside a curved mottled green doorway that leads out of the room.  Nearby, a young attendant stands ready to serve.  The focal point of the room is a swirling green and gold portal framed by an oval of wrought silver.  Intricate foliage has been etched into the metal, the vines intertwining to form a complex lattice pattern.

title: Zephyr Hall, Game Room
description: Lit by a single candle that rests atop each of several tables, the room is dim and wreathed in a thin veil of smoke that obscures the darkened corners.  A plush burgundy rug covers the hardwood floor and muffles the sounds of footfalls.  Scattered atop the rug are a few grey velvet settees, each one paired with a carved mahogany end table.  On one side of the room, a carved pine door leads out into the hallway, while opposite, a polished satinwood archway offers entry to the bar.

title: Zephyr Hall, Barroom
description: Walls of cherry-stained satinwood surround deep leather chairs with claw-footed tables alongside.  The eastern wall is completely taken over by shelves of liquor, from the common to the exotic, arranged in neat rows behind a long wooden bar, while tall carved-legged stools offer a place to sit at the bar.  A stuffed brown otter stands on a pedestal in one corner, its fur a bit tattered where numerous hands have rubbed its belly.  An ivory chandelier illuminates the area, and a red satinwood archway leads to a dimly lit room.

title: Zephyr Hall, Landing
description: Dark red satinwood paneling covers the bottom half of the walls, while the top half is painted a pale cream hue.  Sconces of polished brass hang on the wall, and a hammered tin ceiling displays an elaborate scene of hunters cornering their quarry.  A long runner of animal hides pieced into a repeated compass rose pattern ends at each of the three doors opening off of the area, while the staircase is left bare for its craftsmanship to shine.

title: Zephyr Hall, Office
description: Barely decorated, this small office is encapsulated by ivory and pale blue striped walls, and is utterly cramped with furniture.  An expansive oak desk that looks to have barely fit through the door, its matching oak chair, and a tall bookcase have been placed so as to allow the best use of the space.  One wall is dominated by a square calendar marked with barely legible notations.  The opposite wall sports a glass-paned door, which serves as the only exit.

title: Zephyr Hall, Gecko Room
description: This spacious room is dominated by several oak-framed divans covered in quilted sepia suede.  Two overstuffed chairs flank a heavy, brass-studded side table under a panoramic curtained window.  The pale yellow walls are painted in a pattern of ochre-colored geckos climbing towards the ceiling, interrupted to the south by a wide oak door.  One delicate gold chandelier hangs from the intersection of two beams of oak underneath exposed rafters.

title: Zephyr Hall, Sitting Room
description: Vivid lace coverlets gird the muted furniture in the room, adding a touch of color to the room.  Airy, cream-hued curtains have been tied back from some windows with rose-tufted sashes.  A plush couch holds a pale green hue, and a blown-glass vase of wildflowers sits on a low table next to one of the polished knotty pine walls.  A brass-inset door leads back out to the landing.

title: Zephyr Hall, Library
description: Leather-bound books neatly stacked on built-in shelves line the walls of this room.  Close to the window sits a scrivener's desk and tall chair, while a few small reading tables are fronted with leather chairs.  To one side, a dessert table holds a tray of drinks.  Two opposite walls of shelves are interrupted by a burled maple doorway and a set of double doors carved with fanciful figures from Elanthian history.  A dimly lit hallway leads deeper into the building.

title: Zephyr Hall, Restaurant
description: Opening onto a vista of gardens and forest, floor-to-ceiling windows expand the space of the dining area.  A long maoral sideboard against one wall boasts refreshments.  Snowy white linens and fine porcelain adorn rosewood tables, some out in the open, while others are more private, behind square wooden columns holding the enormous exposed beams of the rafters.  Stuffed hawk-owls and eagles peer down from their perches in those rafters, while a woven runner carpets the hallway from the restaurant into the library.

title: Zephyr Hall, Back Lawn
description: Providing both a rustic and elegant backdrop to a stately lodge, tall birches grow along a large expanse of finely-trimmed, emerald green lawn bordered by a thick pine forest.  To the east, the trees are more sparse, the ocean just barely visible through them.  A long, rectangular reflecting pool stands in the center of the lawn, bordered by two thin strips of brightly hued flower beds.  Resting on the lip of the pool is a small earthenware bowl that holds a handful of birdseed.

title: Zephyr Hall, Kitchen
description: Bustling kitchen staff work in organized harmony, rotating about cooking stations dedicated to everything from roasting whole animals to piping the frosting on desserts.  The smells of baking bread, roasting meat, and sweet fruit compotes permeate the area.  Wide double doors make up the west wall, allowing the wait staff entrance to the restaurant.

title: House Sovyn, Foyer
description: This spacious foyer is enhanced by a large glass skylight which reflects colored lights about the room and among many of the plants.  Comfortable chairs near a pinewood bar invite you to relax before returning to your duties.  Against one wall, a small walnut counter sits beneath a blackboard, and a silver arch, a green arch, and a white arch lead out of the foyer.

title: House Sovyn, Workshop
description: In this room you feel energy and power flowing all around you.  You are amazed that you can see the courtyard from the inside, while from the outside you cannot see in.  There are myriad crystal shelves and cabinets containing many rare magic items, strange powders and colored vials.  A large crystal workbench with a red stone imbedded in it rests in the center of the floor.  The moonlight that surrounds you is coming from the walls and the high windows in the tower.

title: House Sovyn, Khyle's Room
description: The floor and walls of this peaceful room are covered with white marble veined with silver that sparkles from the moonlight of an open window.  Upon a desk under the window sits a variety of reading materials, a painting of Amaltea in a heart-shaped frame and a small silver framed painting.  Two steps lead up to a landing which supports a large, four-poster bed with white silk sheets and pillows.  A tapestry hangs on the opposite wall of the bed.

title: House Sovyn, 1st Floor Hallway
description: A plush, sea blue carpet runs the length of this hallway.  The walls are done in a patterned paper that reminds you of sea foam.  Two giant seashells flank the staircases.

title: House Sovyn, Derek's Room
description: This spacious but cozy room is lined with bookcases containing tomes on every aspect of Elanthian life.  A wooden four-poster bed covered with a white quilt stands against the back wall, a massive misty glaes trunk at its feet.  Several paintings stand displayed on a modwir nightstand next to the glowing fireplace that brings a sense of warmth to the room, and a small shrine stands near the door.

title: House Sovyn, Hallway
description: A plush, dark brown carpet runs the length of this hallway to a pair of statues which stand flanking the staircases.  The walls are paneled in oak and lightly stained so the grain is still visible.

title: House Sovyn, Pond
description: Winding through patches of herbs and flowers, a narrow footpath comes to an end at the edge of a small wooden dock, which extends out over a crystal blue pond.  Several trees surround the pond, shading most of its shores.  Large lily pads float across the surface of the water, providing ample resting spots for any nearby frogs.  Nestled underneath a tall oak tree is an ornate wooden bench flanked by a bed of sovyn bushes.

title: House Sovyn, Library
description: Floor to ceiling bookshelves of highly polished rowan wood and stacked with ancient tomes line the walls of this room and the balcony above.  Well-lit window seats offer a comfortable place for reading one of the many volumes lining the shelves.  Upon a pedestal in one corner sits an enormous globe, while centered in the room is a massive linden wood table with matching chairs.

title: House Sovyn, 2nd Floor Hallway
description: Soft spring green carpet runs the length of this hallway.  The walls on either side are painted with scenes of inviting forests.  Miniature trees in gold pots flank the staircase.

title: House Sovyn, Blue Suite
description: This suite for house members is decorated in cool shades of blue.  A sea blue couch runs the length of one wall, with a long low glass table supported by two giant shells in front of it.  Several comfortable chairs are grouped around the table providing additional seating.

title: House Sovyn, Ruriko's Room
description: The elegance of this room reflects the personality of its owner.  The walls are done in a soft white silk patterned paper.  An ebon wood bed rests against the far wall while under a circular window an ancient ebon wood cabinet sits with a crystal and gold butterfly mobile on it.

title: House Sovyn, Sune's Room
description: The sweet scent of cothinar flower and a brilliant, gold light assail your senses.  In the center of the room is a comfortable-looking, carved rowan bed, draped in white spidersilk hangings and stacked high with emerald silk pillows.  Across the room, over a stone fireplace, your eyes are drawn to a painting hanging above the mantle.  On a far wall, in front of a window, a cothinar plant sits atop a table.  Across the ceiling, a glowing mural spans from wall to wall.

title: House Sovyn, Bede's Room
description: Elaborately carved oaken doors open up into this small bedroom.  Most of the room is taken up by ancient tomes.  A glint of silver from a scroll amongst the tomes catches your eye.  Above a massive hearth hangs a venerable golden rolaren scabbard, the size of a claidhmore.  An adjacent alcove holds a silk-draped altar.

title: House Sovyn, Dining Room
description: Soft laughter and the sounds of silver on china are heard as people gather for meals.  Delicious smells fill the air as meals are served by smiling footmen.  The tables are set with fine china and crystal and the polish of the tables creates an air of relaxation among the exotic, delicious food.

title: House Sovyn, Kitchen
description: This warm inviting room is filled with the wondrous smells of flavorful dishes.  A huge open hearth fireplace and brick oven dominates one wall with smells of freshly baked bread filling the air.  Bright copper pots and crystalline vessels hang by hooks above a large counter.  On a small side table, plates of fresh food wait to be prepared.

title: House Sovyn, Nursery
description: You hear the soft sounds of a lullaby being sung nearby.  In one corner a rocking chair rocks as if it has just been vacated.  Walls of a soft blue, painted with scenes of unicorns, rabbits and deer frolicking, catch your eye and you swear that one of the deer winked at you.  Small cribs line one wall with a changing table sitting by the window.  A huge toy chest, overflowing with colorful toys to delight any youngster, draws your eye from the corner of the room.

title: House Sovyn, Rooftop Garden
description: A carefully cultivated carpet of rich grass grows, high on top of House Sovyn.  A multitude of different-sized flowers grows amidst low trees giving you the sense of being in the middle of a small forest.  Unobtrusive benches are placed around the garden allowing one to sit and relax.  Directly in the center of the roof several large stone pillars sit in a circle and a small covered stairway in the corner leads back down into the house.

title: House Sovyn, Temple of Light
description: This small open-air shrine is dedicated to all the Gods and Goddesses of Light.  Twenty-one pillars circle the inside of the shrine.  Each pillar is engraved with the symbols of a different god and a scene depicting the sphere of control for that individual god.  At the foot of each pillar is a small offering bowl.  Resting in the center of the pillars is an altar made from the tree stump of a lightning-struck oak.

title: House Sovyn, Green Suite
description: Stepping into this room is like stepping into a jungle.  Exotic trees and plants abound, and you only catch glimpses of secluded groupings of benches and chairs among the greenery.

title: House Sovyn, Leianna's Room
description: A soft glow of candlelight casts shadows throughout the room, blurring the lines between reality and illusion.  An intricately carved oak bed dominates one wall, piled with midnight blue and grey silk pillows.  Across the room, a deep grey chaise lounge sits invitingly next to a small oak table.

title: House Sovyn, Sinn's Room
description: Cool air surrounds you, permeating your being.  Candles on a seven-sided altar provide the only light in this dim room.  Shadows cast by the flickering candlelight shift in a macabre dance over the floor-to-ceiling bookshelves lining the walls.  Papers and opened tomes are strewn on a desk in organized disarray.

title: House Sovyn, Hugo's Room
description: Paintings of trees and flowers hang on the brightly painted walls, although some outlines of what look like animal hides still show through the new paint.  A mountain snowcat hide rests in a place of honor by a stone fireplace and a huge weapon rack hangs on the wall above.  A small altar with the symbol of V'tull painted on it is one corner, and in another rests a giant four-poster bed complete with royal blue drapery.  A haon dresser sits beside the bed holding small items.

title: House Sovyn, Sun Room
description: Large glass panes form the walls and roof of this room, providing ample sunlight during the day and a perfect spot for the blossoming plants to grow.  The ground is covered with bricks and several tables are placed among the foliage.

title: House Sovyn, Hallway
description: A vibrant red carpet lines this dim hallway.  The only light comes from two large brass braziers flanking the staircase.  Flickering shadows turn the silk patterned paper on the walls into shimmering pools of red.

title: House Sovyn, Music Room
description: Strains of soft music are heard from one of the many splendid music boxes on display as you enter this room.  The highly polished oak floor reflects light from crystal shaded lamps hanging from the high ceiling, while comfortable chairs and couches are grouped around a beautiful golden harp.  Musical instruments are displayed on top of a cabinet, and a splendid set of bagpipes hangs above it on the wall, just waiting for a spirited player.

title: House Sovyn, Brown Suite
description: This suite is tastefully decorated in rich shades of brown.  A golden brown couch runs the length of one wall, with two tables flanking it.  On each table sits a vase with flowers in it.  Numerous chairs are spread around the room to provide additional sitting space, making this a fine place for quiet conversation.

title: House Sovyn, Eillie's Room
description: This cozy bedroom smells of sweet incense with an undertone of chocolate.  The lovely rosewood and maoral floor is uncovered, while the walls are liberally draped with silk from the palest green to the deep verdant hues of the forest.  A large comfortable bed rests in a corner next to a full length mirror.  Above the bed hangs a large painting.

title: House Sovyn, Stormy and Jynxd's
description: The sheer simplicity of this room seems to welcome you with open arms.  A comfy leather couch sits against one wall, with a portrait next to it.  In one corner, you see a stack of well-thumbed anatomy books next to a small shrine.  In the other corner is a statue.

title: House Sovyn, Cru's Room
description: You are in a rectangular stone room which contains a glowing cobalt obelisk emanating a soft humming sound.  Under an intricate stained glass window is a statue of a half-elf cleric on horseback.  On the far side of the room stands a luxurious bed covered with soft furs and jewel-colored silken pillows.

title: House Sovyn, Cavern
description: This large subterranean cavern is lit only by torches set in sconces spaced evenly around the perimeter of the cave.  Natural crystals in the walls refract the flickering light creating beautiful rainbow patterns.  Water pours from an opening high above the ground, forming a waterfall, and splashes into a stream that winds its way between huge stalagmites that rise from the ground to meet large stalactites hanging from the ceiling way above you.  The light is too dim for you to see across the stream.

title: House Sovyn, Cavern
description: Rough stones cover this end of the cavern, encircling the deep pool of water.   Off to one side the stream widens into a bubbling mud pool.  Steam and bubbles indicate the presence of thermal heat generated by hot springs nearby.  The lichen on the rocks lighten the area and turn it into an inviting relaxing retreat.

title: House Sovyn, Hot Springs
description: The hot water from the natural springs bubbles around you and along with the rhythmic gurgling of the stream, relaxes you, putting you completely at ease.

title: House Sovyn, Mud Pool
description: This small area off the Hot Springs is darker, the walls slick with the condensation coming from the steam arising off the mud.  The thick mud oozing over you at first makes you squirm, but then the heat and mud seeps into your body relaxing you.  The bubbling mud seems to revitalize you, bringing a smile of contentment to your face.

title: House Sovyn, Underground Vault
description: Oil lamps hang from the tips of stalactites in this small natural cavern, sending shadows scurrying across the rough-hewn stone as they sway.  Some intricately carved chests are nestled between the matching stalagmites and appear rooted to the stone.  Rich brocaded tapestries of green and silver cling to the eastern and western walls, adding a touch of color and warmth to the otherwise stark vault.

title: House Sovyn, Temple of Darkness
description: The darkness is oppressive as you step behind the waterfall into a small cavern.  The rock walls are completely black from being scorched by some untold intense fire.  A large body-sized onyx altar dominates the center, liquid still fresh on its surface.  The absence of any gods' names or visages shows that the disciples of these gods respect their desire for anonymity.

title: House Sovyn, Game Room
description: The air of friendly competition is felt in this room as people gather around the tables to watch and play.  Games from every land stand ready or in boxes, while stacks of cards, piles of colored stones and dice wait on the many shelves lining the walls.

title: House Sovyn, Red Suite
description: This suite is decorated completely in pure white.  The floor is strewn invitingly with large soft white pillows covered with fresh blood red rose petals -- the scent of roses is intoxicating.  In the center, a large circular white marble hearth stands burning merrily.  The light from the fire turns everything in the room into a pure flaming red.

title: House Sovyn, Benerio's Room
description: The conflicting tones of black and white assail your senses as you gaze around the room.  Your eyes are drawn to a sculpture in the corner that seems to be turning.  The cool onyx and white ora floor is offset by a warm snowcat fur rug in front of an onyx bed.  Along one wall stands an altar in contrasting patterns of black and white ora.

title: House Sovyn, Jeulen's Room
description: This small room is sparsely furnished.  A small bed with a straw mattress is in one corner and a plain wooden table with chairs in another.  Various personal effects, none of which seem particularly interesting, line a small shelf over the table.  In the far corner sits a small stone altar.

title: House Sovyn, Ravenstorm's Room
description: Decorated in relaxing shades of green and gold, everything in this room is scaled to giantman proportions.  The first thing you notice is the large ornate fireplace sending the odor of burning white birch throughout the room.  The plush forest green carpet muffles your footsteps as you walk in and notice the plants growing in all four corners.  A large solid bed rests up against one wall near a solid oak desk.

title: House Sovyn, Tvarr's Room
description: A mural depicting symbols of the changing seasons covers the curving wall of this circular chamber.  The floor is tiled in a swirling circle of half black and half white that matches the painted symbol on the door, lending a sense of peace and balance to the room.  A subtle scent of incense rises from a low table near the door.

title: House Sovyn, Library Balcony
description: The atmosphere on this balcony is quiet and contemplative as people relax with their favorite novels.  The shelves are continued here as an extension of the numerous works held below.  Comfortable chairs are spread across the balcony so that you may read before climbing the stairs to the main library.

title: House Sovyn, Vault
description: This small cave is brightly lit by some sort of glowing fungus which covers all the walls.  A path has been worn out of the stone floor by repeated use.  You also see a curtain leading to a small alcove and a lever on one wall.

title: House Sovyn, Lockers
description: You are standing in a secluded alcove toward the rear of the vault.  One of the lockers has been removed for you and rests open on a stone counter.

title: House Sovyn, Vault
description: This small cave is brightly lit by some sort of glowing fungus which covers all the walls.  A path has been worn out of the stone floor by repeated use.

title: House Sovyn, Lockers
description: This is a secluded alcove toward the rear of the vault.  One of the lockers has been removed for you and rests open on a stone counter.

title: Cell
description: A damp chill rises from the stone floor.  Your eyes slowly adjust to the darkness that embraces you, revealing a small, cramped cell.  The faint glint of moisture glimmers on the walls, and the soft rustlings of animal life fill the musty air.  In the near absence of light you can barely make out an iron door leading out from the room.

title: Underground Cavern
description: Small, unrecognizable creatures scurry underfoot, retreating startled to the shadows to glare out with beady eyes.  Several torches shed an eerie, pale blue light over the roughly carved obsidian walls.  A crude table and benches are set in one corner of the room, opposite the passageway leading out of the cavern.  Set off to the side is a small alcove, almost invisible in the deep shadows.

title: Small Niche
description: The cubicle is dominated by a large, shimmering portal.  It seems to float in mid-air, the surface rippling and undulating like a black sea tossed by a fierce storm.  Light reflects off the rugged obsidian walls and low ceiling, giving them a silvery cast.

title: Guarded Entryway
description: Two tall, lean figures, their features obscured by heavy dark cloaks, stand before a door forged from solid black ora.  Their eyes glint violet from beneath the deep cowls, as if daring you to test their skill with the Dhe'nari whip-blades they carry in their gloved hands.  Opposite the sentinels, a tunnel disappears into the darkness of the caverns.

title: Obsidian Tower, Foyer
description: Black obsidian walls, polished to a sheen that nearly matches that of the tall silver mirror that stands at the west end of the foyer, rise to the vaulted ceiling thirty feet above.  A gracefully curved staircase of black marble winds along the walls, leading upwards into the higher reaches of the tower.  Dark banners emblazoned with symbols of the Dhe'nari castes hang high on the walls, and a set of double doors carved of black ora opens to the south.

title: Obsidian Tower, Stairway
description: The open staircase hugs the wall, providing a dizzying view up into the heights of the tower.  The stair stops at a small landing at which several doors are set into the stone wall, then continues up in a steep spiral.  The glossy obsidian steps are each set with a slightly raised rolaren symbol that provides a safe grip on the slick stairs.

title: Igrak's Room
description: This room has a spartan feel.  A modwir washstand occupies one corner, a small writing table the center of the room under the window.  A dark blue rug is the only covering on the cold flagstones.  Two fel-hafted spears crossed under an Iylari roundshield serve as a wall decoration.

title: Rasulis' Room
description: The vaulted dark mahogany ceiling of this room rises above black marble walls and a thick black carpet, framing a large fireplace by the north wall and bookshelves upon the south.  Several comfortable leather armchairs rest before the fire, facing a portrait hung above the mantel, while a large four-poster bed rests nearby.  The glaes windows are shielded by long velvet curtains, providing privacy for the occupants.

title: Obsidian Tower, Bathroom
description: Oil lamps at the four corners illuminate the bathing chamber with a warm light.  Soft rugs cover the floor, keeping the obsidian dry and safe to walk on despite any water splashed from the huge bathtub.  Towels, soaps and scented oils sit in convenient spots about the room, ready for use by any bathers.

title: Morlain's Room
description: Light from flickering candles drives back the long shadows in this room.  Thick hunter green curtains rustle against partially open bay windows, billowing in a light breeze.  The walls are adorned with large bookcases containing all manner of foreign tomes and official township documents.  Beside the canopied bed are several comfortable reading chairs and a mahogany credenza with a map engraved on its surface.

title: Shiliara's Room
description: Dim torchlight reflects from numerous weapons that serve as both decoration and ready defense.  Ancient claidhmores and sharp swords hang from positions of honor around the room.  Below each weapon is a plaque naming the warrior who once carried it and the manner of their demise.  A solid modwir bed is pushed into one corner, leaving the rest of the room free for practice.  The floor itself gleams in polished patterns, worn by years of bare feet practicing the forms of the Dhe'nari martial arts.

title: Obsidian Tower, Passage
description: A single, unwavering torch illuminates a long, roughly hewn stone hallway.  Flecks of ore and crystal glimmer out from the natural rock walls, and coarse rockdust litters the floor, causing footfalls to crunch softly.  Dark passages lead off to the south and the west, and some rough stairs lead up into yet more gloom.

title: Obsidian Tower, Passageway
description: This hallway is stunningly decorated with a mural of silver beaten into the glossy black walls and ceiling.  The scene depicts a fantastic battle of great dragons and powerful Ur'Daemon, each figure a silver silhouette on a field of obsidian.  Several torches mounted on the walls burn with a strange blue flame, sending an eerie glow of scintillating light reflecting across the room.

title: Obsidian Tower, Council Room
description: The room is a perfect circle carved from the obsidian of the walls and polished to a mirror smoothness.  Blue light dances on the domed ceiling some forty feet above, reflecting from the magical torches burning in their sconces on the walls.  Three steps lead up to the dais in the center of the room, and a heavy, intricately carved door opens into the wall opposite the entrance.

title: Chamber of the Obsidian Council
description: A glaes table sits in a semicircle around the edge of the dais.  Behind the center of the table looms the deep obsidian throne of the Highlord.  Four smaller chairs, one of onyx, one of clear glaes, one of rolaren and one of black ora sit two to either side, making up the five chairs of the Obsidian Council.  An aura of power blankets the room, as if the strength of those who owned the chairs had imbedded itself into the very obsidian.

title: Obsidian Tower, Hallway
description: Silvery rolaren sconces are set at regular intervals along the walls, fine banners representing each Dhe'nar caste hanging between them.  Dominating the east wall is a richly-embroidered silk tapestry depicting three Dhe'nar nobles in a stylized battlefield.  Set into the stone next to the tapestry is a small mithril plaque.

title: Obsidian Tower, Antechamber
description: The thick puma fur carpeting and heavy velvet lining on the walls deadens nearly every sound in this small chamber.  Dark candles flicker quietly in the two onyx sconces mounted on either side of the room, and against either wall sits a dark mahogany bench covered with black velvet cushions.  A heavy velvet curtain hangs from an exquisitely crafted black ora arch.

title: Obsidian Tower, Chapel
description: Dark silken tapestries shroud the walls of this circular room.  From them the eyes of Noi'sho'rah, Tahlad, and other great leaders of the Dhe'nar stare down on you in silent appraisal.  A massive obsidian altar stands in the exact center of the room.  Dark candles burn in onyx sconces set at regular intervals around the room.  Extending six feet out from the altar lies a perfect circle of beaten copper, inset into the smooth floor.

title: Obsidian Tower, Barracks
description: The scents of sweat and oil fill the air.  Gambesons and padded shirts hang over the ends of the bunks that line the walls.  Between the beds, racks are filled with every manner of weapon, gleaming and ready for immediate use.  At the far end of the room, rows of dark leather armor perch on stands, each with a shield hanging behind it from a hook in the wall.  Next to the door, a large workbench sits, with tools and whetstones arranged on it.

title: Obsidian Tower, Forge
description: A stifling heat emanates from the massive stone forge that dominates the center of the chamber.  Ingots of rolaren, invar, and dark ora stand in neat stacks, ready for use.  The ruddy glow of the coals casts flickering shadows along the rough-hewn walls, where half-finished swords and maces cool in the darkness.  A set of dwarven hammers and tongs, well-kept and well-used, lean against the forge.

title: Obsidian Tower, Den
description: Large bookcases, filled with ancient tomes all bound with dark purple seals, stretch from wall to wall.  In the center of the room is a large, circular fireplace, its iron curtain protecting the plush fur throws that are laid out before it.  Chairs set about two large lamp-lit mahogany tables provide a perfect place for late night studies.  About the room rest several large trophies, and a large portrait hangs above the bookcases.

title: Obsidian Tower, Dining Room
description: Silver plates, urns, and utensils glitter from the stunningly crafted shelves and cases lining the walls.  An immense, deeply polished mahogany table dominates the center of the room, covered in a rare black spidersilk lace cloth.  Blue fire torches line the walls, their sconces wrought from pure gleaming silver.

title: Obsidian Tower, Kitchen
description: Servants bustle about this crowded kitchen, covered in flour, sugar, blood from the huge sides of meat roasting, and other ingredients.  Heat from the huge ovens fills the room, as do the wonderful scents of the meals the cooks are preparing.  Trays of pastries and platters of meat sit on a shelf near the door, just waiting for someone to carry them to their destination.

title: Obsidian Tower, Greatroom
description: The warmth radiating from the smokeless blue fires of an enchanted hearth make an excellent counterpoint to the storm-lashed sky the window displays.  Stuffed leather chairs and couches sit about the room, giving the room a homey feel.  Servants in cloaks with deep hoods wander in and out occasionally, carrying trays loaded with exotic culinary delights.  Flashes of lightning highlight the intricately carved motif that covers the western wall, throwing odd shadows across it, and a crystal-paned ebon marble case sits nearby.

title: Obsidian Tower, Changing Room
description: Warm, humid air swirls about you.  Smooth obsidian benches have been carved from the walls, serving as shelves for a few neatly folded silken robes.  A large silver mirror hangs from the wall, coated with a light frosting of steam.  A smoked glaes door sits at the end of a short curving passageway, while a stairway leads downward, away from the portal.

title: Obsidian Tower, Steam Cavern
description: Wisps of steam curl about the cavern, rising from the natural hot springs in the center.  Benches carved from the walls hold towels and folded robes, and several pairs of soft sandals rest beneath them.  A few blue fire torches flicker from the walls, giving the room a gentle glow and illuminating the stairway upwards.

title: Chamber of Remembrance
description: This room is small, lit only by a single blue torch.  A black velvet cloth hangs over a small arch leading into the main chapel, its soft fringe brushing the obsidian floor with a whisper.  Several baskets of herbs sit in the corner.  Opposite the archway opens a black thanot door, runes covering the surface like spiderwebs.

title: Meditation Chamber
description: Darkness cloaks this chamber, lit only by the almost nonexistent glow of the tiny brazier in the corner.  No sound intrudes from the outside, filling the room with a silence so thick as to be nearly tangible.  Several small black pillows sit in the floor, dented in the center by the knees of those who have come to remember.

title: Obsidian Tower, Natural Spa
description: Hot water surrounds you, almost too warm to be comfortable but relaxing nonetheless.  A ledge has been carved below the waterline, providing a convenient place to sit and relax.  Steam rises from the surface, the moisture plastering your hair to your skull and making you sweat.

title: Underground Garden
description: The rough walls of the natural cavern are coated in a glowing green moss.  A trickling stream of steamy water fed by underground hot springs flows through the center of the cavern, feeding the odd indigenous mushrooms and plants found in this humid garden.  In an open bower grows a lush carpet of thick blue moss, providing a comfortable resting place for those wishing to relax and enjoy the strangely beautiful flora.

title: Silvergate, A Small Landing
description: Muffled voices from the lounge barely reach your ears here.  Dimly lit, there is still enough light for you to make your way.  A narrow staircase leads down to the lower levels of the manor.

title: Silvergate, 3rd Floor Hallway
description: Thick carpeting muffles your footsteps and warms this room.  A small window in the western wall overlooks a courtyard far below and the forest beyond.  Simply furnished, there is a single table and a straight-backed chair resting at the window.  A wide carpeted staircase leads back to the lounge far below.

title: Silvergate, Hallway
description: Muffled footsteps and voices from the floor above filter through an air grille high on the end wall and echo in this wide hallway.  It is sparsely furnished, boasting only a wooden bench set opposite a tanned leather curtain which rustles in a draft.  A sturdy iron-reinforced door bars your way to the north.

title: Silvergate, Armory
description: Belying the gentle face elsewhere shown, this is most obviously the Armory of the manor.  Neatly racked weapons and rows of polished armor and well-groomed leather trappings show a House that is not all play and dissipation.  A stout table stands in the center of the room ready to hold gear and other such other preparations as may be called for.

title: Silvergate, Member's Lockers
description: Rows of lockers line the shelves along the walls of this compact space.  An old sturdy table is centered between two sets of shelves, and appears to be capable of holding the contents of any of the lockers you can see.  Your locker has been removed from its assigned niche and sits ready for you on an old sturdy counter.

title: Silvergate Inn, Alcove
description: Scented candles in brass fixtures cast a faint, golden light in this small alcove.  The floor is covered with colorful rugs transported from distant lands.  A curtained opening dominates one wall.

title: Silvergate Inn, Hallway
description: Scented candles cast a faint, golden light in this long hallway.  Plush carpets and decorative rugs gathered from remote Southern marketplaces mute the sound of your footsteps.  A curtained opening dominates one wall.

title: Silvergate Inn, Lockers
description: Rows of lockers line the shelves along the walls of this compact space.  An old sturdy counter is centered between two sets of shelves, and appears to be capable of holding the contents of any of the lockers you can see.  Your locker has been removed from its assigned niche and sits ready for you.

title: Silvergate Inn, Hallway
description: Scented candles cast a faint, golden light in this long hallway.  Plush carpets and decorative rugs gathered from remote Southern marketplaces mute the sound of your footsteps.  A curtained opening dominates one wall.

title: Silvergate Inn, Alcove
description: Scented candles in brass fixtures cast a faint, golden light in this small alcove.  The floor is covered with colorful rugs transported from distant lands.  A curtained opening dominates one wall.

title: Silvergate Inn, Hallway
description: Scented candles cast a faint, golden light in this long hallway.  Plush carpets and decorative rugs gathered from remote Southern marketplaces mute the sound of your footsteps.  A curtained opening dominates one wall.

title: Obscure Orris Table
description: A light dusting of white powder covers the table and chairs.  White orris blossoms stand proudly in a narrow gold vase at the center of the table.

title: Rustic Rose Table
description: The weathered tabletop is carved with faint images of rose vines.  The etching is so skillfully done that even the dewdrops on the rose petals can clearly be seen.

title: Scented Salvia Table
description: A shallow yellow bowl on the table is filled with salvia-scented potpourri.  Two brass candlestick holders, carved in the shape of owls, hold chubby beeswax candles.

title: Tantalizing Tulip Table
description: Tall red and yellow tulips lean towards you as though beckoning you to join them.  The slightest breeze from passers-by sets them in motion, swaying gracefully.

title: House Brigatta, Entry
description: The entry to House Brigatta is panelled and floored in dark oak.  An ornately carved table sits to one side with a small crystal vase standing upon it beneath a brightly polished silver mirror.  On the west wall, a series of shelves and pegs hold various cloaks and garb for the outer world.  To the east, a stairway heads up to the second floor.

title: House Brigatta, Hallway
description: This narrow hallway ends in a blank wall and at the other end a curtained opening.

title: House Brigatta, Lockers
description: This room is small and cramped.

title: House Brigatta, Secret Hallway
description: This narrow hallway ends in a blank wall and at the other end a curtain.

title: House Brigatta, Lockers
description: You stand in a small cramped room.

title: House Brigatta, Common Room
description: The main room of the house is large but cozy.  A pair of settees with matching footstools sit before a massive stone fireplace.  Along one wall, tall bookcases stand alternately with racks, each holding a goodly assortment of their proper objects.  Thickly woven tapestries cover the windows, enhancing the room's feelings of privacy and intimacy.

title: House Brigatta, Lounge
description: A large fireplace of rough-hewn stone, the twin of the one in the Common Room, fills one wall of this comfortable room.  Flickering light from the hearth reflects off a long, brightly polished claidhmore that hangs above the mantle.  Comfortable looking chairs surround several tables that are scattered about the room rest on the thickly-woven carpet.

title: House Brigatta, Back Porch
description: Shade from the tree to the north provides just enough relief from the sun to make this a perfect area for outdoor parties.  Surrounding trees and the walls of House Brigatta itself prevent the noises from the bustle of Wehnimer's from intruding.

title: House Brigatta, Bedroom
description: The walls of this room are almost obscured by trophies of the hunt.  Hides and heads of a score or more assorted beasts of the wild places are mounted to the wall or hung from the rafters.  A plain wooden bed rests between two windows roughly curtained with tanned skins.  The well-stuffed chair sitting before the stone fireplace completes the feeling of rough-hewn comfort.

title: House Brigatta, Hallway
description: This small hallway leads from the Common Room to the interior of the house.  A luxurious wool carpet runner muffles the cold stone flooring and several doors lead to other rooms.

title: House Brigatta, Sitting Room
description: This room is bright and airy.  Varicolored crystals hang in front of the large windows and all the colors of the rainbow dance and flit about on every breeze.  A huge white bearskin rug from the far north stretches out before the polished stone fireplace and a straight-backed chair stands alongside it.  Beneath the windows, a long low couch reclines.

title: House Brigatta, Raistlin's Room
description: Deep wooden shelves cover the walls of this room.  The shelves are crammed with books all bound in a uniform night blue binding.  Where there are no bookshelves, elaborate tapestries covered with mythical beasts picked out in bright colors hang.  The only furnishings are a massive blackwood desk and chair and a curious green orb resting on a golden stand.

title: House Brigatta, Alcove
description: In this alcove, a massive bedstead nearly fills the space.  Several thickly stuffed feather mattresses piled upon each other peek out from beneath an embroidered quilt the color of the noon sky high atop a mountain.  Plump, well-fed pillows laze across the bed, some spilling onto the floor where they lie, intertwined, like satiated lovers.  A light floral scent emanates from a silver vial sitting atop the carved nightstand.

title: House Brigatta, Banyan Tree
description: It is noticeably cooler here than in the other parts of the garden.  A huge banyan tree keeps this area in a perpetual gloom.  There are various mosses clinging to the tree, and all the shrubs seem stunted.  A gardener's shed, almost hidden under a dense netting of moss and flowering vines, is nestled close to the western boundary of the garden.  Running along this side of the house are some doors leading into a kitchen, while a back porch can be seen to the south.

title: House Brigatta, Observatory
description: Looming under a verdigrised copper dome, a brass telescope features a bewildering array of various iron and mithril wheels, cranks, and pulleys designed to rotate the observatory.  Set high on the walls around a copper panel are intricate charts marking the paths of stars and moons in the night sky.  An armillary sphere dominates the rotunda, which is surrounded with several cabinets and racks.

title: House Brigatta, Shed
description: The dirt floor of the shed is packed solid.  Hanging from several hooks on the walls are various tools used to maintain the splendor of the garden.  In one corner are several large sacks that, judging from the smell, contain fertilizer.  On shelves running along two of the walls are many bins containing small packets of seed.  There is a shallow rut from the door that ends at the eastern wall.

title: House Brigatta, Fountain Oasis
description: A fountain sits in the center surrounded by pie-shaped beds of blossoming flowers with just enough space between them to allow one to wander the gardens.  To the west, a huge banyan tree looms, its overhanging boughs partially enclosing the area to form a quiet bower.  This partially shaded retreat provides a silent place of contemplation, where the only distractions are the quick flicks of motion as birds and honeybees flit from tree to tree, or flower to flower.

title: House Brigatta, Workshop
description: The walls are slightly burned in spots where someone's apparently amateurish attempts at magic have gone awry.  Dead center in the room is a heavy marble slab scratched and blackened from the powerful spells which have been cast in the room.  The ceiling is covered with polished copper, the mirrored surface reflecting your movements.

title: Sylvanfair, Rogal-Keli Hall
description: The trunk of this enormous tree is hollow, providing the House with a huge hall of living wood.  Natural knotholes and other openings in the trunk allow light to enter the hall, while layers of carefully arranged branches and bright autumn-colored leaves keep out the weather.  Birdsong fills the air, giving the hall a cheerful atmosphere.  A staircase spirals up around the inside of the tree.

title: House Sylvanfair, Treetop
description: Branches intertwine to form several large benches here, covered with moss and soft pillows.  There's just enough of a breeze to be refreshing, and the songs of the birds and the chattering of the animals that live in the tree provide soft background noise.  One branch, larger than the rest, arches off to the east.  A spiral staircase leads back down into the trunk of the tree, curving around a cunningly carved tangle of branches.

title: Sylvanfair, Lilac Garden
description: The air of this walled garden is filled with the heady scent of lilacs from hundreds of bushes.  Several lilac bushes near the main Sylvanfair tree twine together underneath a stairway leading up to a lilac door.  A large ironwood tree stands in the center of the garden, with a door in its side.

title: Sylvanfair, Grove
description: Enclosed by Sylvanfair's canopy and the surrounding foliage, this grove maintains a peaceful seclusion despite its lack of walls.  From a hollowed branch above, thin streams of water cascade down into a small pond.  Flat stones peek out just above the water's surface, several of which have been arranged to jut out at the edge as a makeshift dock, while others encircle a small fire pit nearby.

title: House Sylvanfair, Workroom
description: A large blackboard forms one wall of this room, held in place by the living wood of the tree.  The rest of the walls are covered with shelves containing various boxes and jars, and no few number of magical experiments in progress.  A large table of slate, stained and pitted, dominates the center of the room.

title: Sylvanfair, Trophy Hall
description: Your eyes are drawn to a large display case that looks as if it was formed by natural growth of the great tree's wood.  A colorful tapestry adorns one of the walls in a place of honor.

title: House Sylvanfair, Library
description: Smooth branches form huge bookshelves that line the walls of this chamber, filled with tomes and scrolls of all descriptions.  Branches and thick roots offer convenient places to sit, and small tables are available for quiet conversation and study.

title: Sylvanfair, Sunrea Hall
description: Sweet scents and curious aromas waft down to you from the drying racks of herbs far overhead.  Mossy benches provide a soft resting place for the ill and wounded, and bundles of warm blankets are stacked against one wall.  A very familiar-looking patient burrows a little deeper under his blanket, obviously quite comfortable.

title: Sylvanfair, Galadriel's Hall
description: Several beat-up wooden figures stand in the center of this chamber.  One of them has been dressed in a tattered black cloak and its head lolls drunkenly every time someone's weapon connects with a loud *THWAP* -- amazingly, the head hasn't fallen off yet.  Wooden and metal practice weapons are racked neatly against the walls, along with suits and pieces of stray armor.

title: House Sylvanfair, Temple
description: A large altar of rosewood stands near one wall of this small temple.  Niches in the wall display statues of the many gods and goddesses of Elanthia -- all deities seem to be represented, both Light and Dark.

title: House Sylvanfair, Ballroom
description: Slender branches arch and twine to form the walls of the ballroom, shutting out the outside while allowing a cooling breeze to enter.  The springy moss that covers the ground begs to be danced upon!  A large window stands open allowing a cool breeze to enter the room and giving access to a large branch outside, and a lilac-twined arch of leafy branches leads deeper into the tree.

title: Sylvanfair, Orc's Head Bar
description: The wood of the tree opens into a large gathering area, with dozens of places to sit formed by tree branches and moss-covered stones.  Next to the bar stands a graceful harp, apparently formed of the same wood as the walls.  Hanging on one wall is a polished walnut dart board carved in the image of an owl and off to one side a counter nestles amidst greenery.  The lilac-twined arch leads into the ballroom beyond the bar, and a modwir door leads outside.

title: House Sylvanfair, Kitchen
description: Here, just outside the tree, is a small walled-in courtyard where several tables and chairs are sheltered beneath the leafy branches.  Mouthwatering aromas of baked goods and other delights lead the way to a pair of large ovens placed safely far away from the tree trunk.  An elderly halfling woman smiles briefly at you before going back to her baking.

title: Sylvanfair, Hot Spring
description: A natural spring bubbles up from the ground here, captured by living wood to form an inviting pool.  It is shallow for several paces on the end nearest the doorway -- then the water deepens quickly.  Several vines hang down over the deeper end of the pool.

title: House Sylvanfair, Pool
description: The pool is crystal clear and you can even see the bubbles as they form at the bottom of the spring and drift lazily up to the surface with small popping noises.  The warmth of the water is relaxing, and you are tempted to stay and soak for a while.

title: Sylvanfair, Meeting Room
description: High, narrow windows provide light in this chamber without sacrificing privacy.  Couches formed of living wood line the walls, and each one is covered with a cushiony layer of soft leaves.  A bear hide rug covers the entire floor and you wonder how many pelts were sewn together to create it.

title: Sylvanfair, Short Hallway
description: This short hallway leads to the private lockers of the House members.  The floor is actually the smooth living wood of the tree, complete with the occasional burl or knothole.

title: Sylvanfair, Locker Room
description: Long branches curl protectively around a narrow counter, and glossy leaves almost hide the locker that sits there.  A burl in one of the walls looks eerily like a staring eyeball.

title: House Sylvanfair, Supply Room
description: Light filters through the branches making up the walls of the Supply Room, filling it with a warm emerald glow.  Above you branches weave together to form a thick green ceiling covered with gently moving leaves.  Every so often the sound of child-like laughter floats down to you from somewhere above.

title: House Sylvanfair, Alcove
description: The leafy ceiling is low here, which doesn't leave much room to move about.  A thin green curtain leads to a small locker room.

title: Sylvanfair, Dressing Chamber
description: This small chamber is decorated with some soothing blue and white tapestries.  Several wind chimes suspended from the branches above fill the room with soft music.  A large footlocker stands beside a comfortable padded chair and an ornate, full-length mirror dominates one wall.

title: Sylvanfair, Grimdahl's Room
description: This chamber is contained entirely within the trunk of the great tree.  Several small glowing globes near the ceiling cast a dim light across a comfortable bed that stands in one corner of the room.  A handsome desk in the corner holds a crystal ball, and beside it stands a perch with a stuffed raven on it.

title: Bowen and Diane's Room
description: The wall farthest from the door is completely open to the gentle breezes from outside.  Looking closely you see that the wall, made of what appear to be translucent leaves, is shuttered to the side allowing it to be closed in case of bad weather.  The furnishings include a large oak rolltop desk with books and papers scattered over it, and a cozy soft beige couch and antique chairs for company.  The floor is covered with a forest green rug made from puma hides edged with the finest gold thread.

title: Lady Lissa's Chamber
description: The warmth of this chamber welcomes you, as the room is engulfed by the sun reaching through the intricately carved openings in the bark walls.  In one corner, a four-posted bed draped with a cockatrice feather comforter invites you to bask in the tranquility of your surroundings.  Below a painting on the opposite wall is an oak desk, covered with scrolls, colorful drawings and maps.  A rug covers the floor near a fireplace in the adjacent corner.

title: House Sylvanfair, Firbac's Room
description: A blaze of sunlight welcomes visitors to this room, streaming in through expansive windows.  The floor is covered with a lush carpet of living grass, giving you thoughts of relaxing for a brief nap.  Growing things spring from every surface and hang from the ceiling.  The air is rich with subtle smells of exotic blossoms, leaving you feeling refreshed and renewed.

title: Sylvanfair, Rose Garden
description: The scent of a hundred different kinds of roses fills the air here.  Bushes and vines grafted into the Sylvanfair tree bear magical blooms of every imaginable color, throughout every season.  A large branch arches off to the west.

title: Davydd and Kerrithan's Suite
description: Wide windows framed by twining gold and silver vines fill this room with light and fresh air.  Sweet rushes on the floor perfume the air with subtle fragrance.  A pair of desks -- one perfectly clean, the other cluttered with papers, inkwells, and pens -- stand side by side against one wall, surrounded by shelves lined with books.  A wide, canopied bed stands against the far wall, with an armor stand and weapons rack on one side and a rack containing a variety of musical instruments on the other.

title: Sylvanfair, Heathyr's Room
description: These spacious quarters are littered with arcane tomes, artifacts and implements of sorcery.  Centered against the far wall, an elegant round bed is draped by a lavish blanket of fire cat fur, with a dramatic painting hanging on the wall above it.  To the left is a modwir dressing table with an oval mirror mounted in its back and framed by two brass sconces.  A curtained window highlights the wall to the right and piles of books and scrolls are scattered below it.

title: Sylvanfair, Morning Glory Room
description: A large window framed by delicately veined morning glory leaves floods the room with light and fresh air.  The walls are covered with carefully cultivated morning glories of delicate violet shades.  A large bed covered with a puma hide blanket beckons from behind a thin ora screen in one corner, and an instrument rack holding a lute and a harp stands against the wall next to a large bookcase.

title: Sylvanfair, Brutii's Room
description: Built along branches of living wood, this suite provides a majestic view of the rose garden.  The plush puma hide rug softening your footsteps seems to accent the natural luster of the living wooden walls.  The room is lit by soft flickers of sunshine streaming through a large aquarium that sits next to a window on the south wall.  A grand canopied bed rests in an alcove on the north wall, which contains built-in shelves lined with various small sculptures and mementos of the McThain family.

title: Sylvanfair, Oakladin Bedroom
description: You are struck by the stark beauty of this chamber.  The oak walls are covered with beautifully formed ivy that catches the light to form intricate shadows.  Your gaze travels upward to a crescent-shaped leaded crystal window left open to the sky.  An impressive white marble bed rests beneath the skylight, in front of an imposing stone fireplace with a greatsword resting upon the mantle.

title: Pixies Table
description: On the polished modwir table stands a lamp made of two dainty silver pixies holding up a candle on their outstretched arms.  The flickering light casts colorful shadows through their stained glass wings.

title: Tree Nymph Table
description: A delicate brass lamp in the shape of a nymph changing into a tree stands in the middle of this table.  The lampshade is made of stained glass to resemble the tree's canopy.

title: Sea Nymph Table
description: Four stained glass panels surround a flickering candle on this round modwir table.  Two opposing panels depict the ocean, the other two show a nymph emerging from beneath the waves.

title: Moonstone Butterfly Table
description: A brass butterfly encrusted with moonstones rests on this modwir table.  A small sweet-scented candle is carefully placed between its colorful stained glass wings.

title: Water Lily Table
description: The brass base of this opaque glass lily is shaped into broad leaves.  The small candle inside the lily casts a soft light across the wooden table.

title: Moot Hall, Orchard
description: A large garden stretches out beneath the shadow of Moot Hall, where rows and rows of apple trees flourish in abundance.  In the center of the orchard stands a speckled dark grey granite fountain surrounded by hand-carved red oak benches.  Thick stone walls rise up behind the building, shielding the area from the rest of the town, and a carved wooden door leads back inside.

title: Moot Hall, North Corridor
description: The northern corridor of Moot Hall is quiet, with every little footstep muffled by the rich merlot carpet.  A silver-threaded tapestry depicting the shimmering water and cloudy skies of Darkstone Bay hangs on a wall near a carved wooden door.

title: Moot Hall, Wedding Hall
description: Lots of big, square windows give this room an open, airy feel, and let in a large amount of light.  Branches and flowers are draped over the windows, and piled around the plain wooden altar opposite the carved door.  Dozens of chairs sit in rows across the floor, with a long narrow table to one side.  On the wall above the altar hangs a double silhouette, a man's face on one side and a woman's on the other, each carved of dark wood and polished brightly.

title: The Wellington Home, Courtyard
description: Several tall, graceful willow trees grow around the airy courtyard, their draping branches hanging low over the fence.  Off to one side, a stack of old books sits next to a large circle of paving stones.  Bright cherry red double doors lead into the two-story gabled building, and set into a thick metal post near the orphanage is a scroll-worked brass plaque.  You also see a series of rope swings hanging from the trees.

title: The Wellington Home, Entrance
description: Each length of the room is coated in pale colors, ranging from yellow to green to blue and lavender.  Along the walls are wood-framed illustrations, each clearly painted by children.  Off the eastern wall, a wide stairway ascends to the second floor.

title: The Wellington Home, Dormitory
description: Stretching the width of the building, and painted in cool blue and green hues, the room is organized with several rows of neatly made bunk-beds.  Two trunks flank each bed for personal belongings, but otherwise the room is scarcely furnished.  A few chairs are scattered about, and a tall bookcase with a small selection of history books stands before the balustrade separating the stairway from the room.  A brightly painted door leads to a large washroom.

title: The Wellington Home, Office
description: The walls are a soft russet hue and decorated with canvas tapestries depicting colorful fields and forests.  A simple oak desk rests before a carved wooden chair, while a shelf full of clay art hangs on a wall next to a paneled wooden door.  Candlelight infuses the office with a warm glow.

title: The Wellington Home, Class Room
description: Brightly lit and painted in warm cream tones, the tidy room is filled with desks, all orderly arranged in groups.  A large chalkboard dominates the far wall, which has been covered in a clutter of writing.  A light grey-robed woman sits at a wide oak desk, flipping through the pages of a thick tome.

title: The Wellington Home, Mess Hall
description: Long bench-style tables stretch across the entire length of the room, each with stacks of plates and cutlery organized on each end in preparation of mealtime.  A slatted swinging door swishes as a number of older children in aprons move about assisting the cooks.

title: The Wellington Home, Study Room
description: Low modwir shelves fill the room alongside some tables with straight-backed chairs.  Lit candles illuminate a series of well-used books along the shelves.  In the center of the room is a raised platform, where a wooden pedestal stands unattended.

title: Town Barracks, Inner Courtyard
description: Stone walls wrap around to form a solid enclosure to the courtyard, the ground smooth and paved with dark cobblestones.  Barely visible beyond the thick iron gate stretches North Ring Road and an expanse of the palisades of Wehnimer's Landing.  A large two-story brick building dominates the far end of the courtyard, its roof topped with a black and grey flag.

title: House Phoenix, Entry
description: The floor of the main entry is of dark flagstone, deeply polished, the walls are of white marble, veined with crimson.  The walls are hung with brightly colored tapestries and filigreed oil lamps are set in bronze sconces to illuminate them.  Standing in even ranks along the walls are many types of armor from half a hundred eras and regions, each seeming to wait patiently for the trumpets of battle to sound, as they ever have and ever will.

title: Phoenix Annex, Courtyard
description: Within this serene courtyard, a variety of young trees and flowering bushes thrive along the flagstone path leading from the archway to the main building.  A small grove of cherry trees provides a shady retreat near some polished wooden benches placed along a grassy bank leading down to a small bubbling spring.  Nestled within the shade of the fruit trees sits a small cherrywood beehive.  A polished cherry dart board inlaid with a rising phoenix hangs from a willow tree.

title: Phoenix Annex, Willow Tree
description: This quiet, leafy bower seems remote from the courtyard below.  The gentle swaying of the tree in the breeze and the susurration of the leaves is relaxing.  Peering down through the willow branches you can spy the natural pool below.

title: Phoenix Annex, Natural Springs
description: The small spring is lined with a brilliant array of colorful stones.  Exotic plants, carefully arranged to provide privacy, grow in profusion along the bank.  A tall willow tree leans gracefully over the spring, as if granting its blessing on the swimmers.  The bottom of the spring is lined with fine sand, oddly warm to the feet.  Air bubbles rush up from below, tickling the bare parts of your skin.  A small waterfall trickles musically down a jumble of rocks, and a small wooden fishing dock juts out from a sandy bank.

title: Phoenix Annex, Fishing Dock
description: The natural springs surrounding this dock start off shallow, but quickly turn deep at its very center.  All around the edges of this small dock are spots to stick a fishing pole, and a weatherbeaten driftwood bench rests at the far end, closest to the deepest part of the spring.  Protected from the elements, a small fire burns, remnants of previous fish fries evident all around it.

title: Phoenix Annex, Hyssopp's Niche
description: A fine mist eddies about your ankles as you enter this quiet niche.  Well-tended herbs and flowers grow in abundance around a pure-white marbled bench, tickling the senses with the scent of hyssop, rosemary, mint and jasmine.  The sound of trickling water draws your eyes to a small grotto cut into a wall of gray rock glistening with moisture.  The grotto shelters a statuette perched upon an ivory altar covered with a pristine sheen of water that drips from an over-hanging rock.

title: House Phoenix, Grand Hall
description: The elegant Grand Hall appears to have hosted many a merry celebration.  Candlelight from faceted ruby and crystal chandeliers casts a warm glow over a grand cherry banquet table and matching gilded chairs.  Mirror-clad arched alcoves on one wall hold small tables for private gatherings.  Marble pilasters with gilded capitals depicting rising phoenixes frame elaborately figured silk tapestries flanking the great white marble fireplace on the eastern wall.  At the west end of the room rests a small bar.

title: House Phoenix, Kitchens
description: Here in the kitchens, a large oven warms the room and fills it with the scent of baking bread.  An ancient iron cauldron bubbles over an open fire, as rich steam billows forth to carry the aroma of rolton stew into the air as well.  The walls of the room are filled with shelves and cupboards stacked high with dried and preserved foods of all sorts.  Piles of fresh vegetables and slabs of finely marbled meats wait for the deft hand of the chef to prepare them.

title: House Phoenix, Library
description: The library of the House is a largish room, with walls completely hidden by bookcases.  A wide selection of reading material can be seen from a cursory glance.  Treatises on science and history stand next to ancient volumes on forest lore and magic.  One rather extensive section seems devoted to arms and armor and the many subjects dealing with the arts of war.  Locked glass-fronted cabinets hold rare tomes and fragile scrolls and even the odd clay tablet.  Scattered around the room are several chairs.

title: House Phoenix, Second Floor
description: A series of paintings hung along the walls here celebrate the founding officers of the House.  Two doors, one painted red, the other gold, lead to guest bedrooms.  To the south is a brightly painted door and eastwards, a solid oak door bars entrance to the Planning Room.

title: House Phoenix, Planning Room
description: An ornate circular table, surrounded by large, upholstered chairs dominates the planning room.  Hanging from the ceiling is a well-polished crystal chandelier.  Banners of red and gold, worked with the insignia of the House, hang from the walls.  An elaborately framed painting dominates one wall.

title: House Phoenix, Guest Bedroom
description: This simple monastic cell is sparsely furnished.  A small bed with plain linen sheets, a single thin pillow, a rough wool blanket.  An unvarnished oak table is flanked by a pair of spindle-backed chairs.  A tall bookcase, filled with scholarly tomes and scrolls, is the only extravagance in the room.

title: House Phoenix, Bedroom
description: A rug of black wool bordered with gold tassles dominates the decor of this room.  Centered on the finely woven rug is a large, life-like image of a blazing phoenix.  Against one wall stands an ornate mahogany bed.  An empty pewter candle holder sits on the nightstand beside the bed.

title: House Phoenix, Wine Cellar
description: This room is used for storage of the House beverage supply.  Large casks, kegs and bottles of all sizes are stacked along the walls or in bins and on shelves.  You recognize labels from places both near and far.  Many labels are old and brown from age but the bottles are sound though covered with dust and cobwebs.  You are tempted to draw a sample or two but decide to wait for a better opportunity.  Some of the best quality vintages are stored in a locked row of bins to keep them from 'evaporating'.

title: House Phoenix, Maruko's Chamber
description: Tendrils of a strange scent assault your nose as you peer around a dimly lit stone chamber.  Fading embers from a fireplace are the only illumination and a cloud of incense forms arabesques above a brazier nearby.  Coarse granite shapes the walls and ceiling and darkly polished marble flooring reflects the feeble light.  A huge grey wolf stands poised near the door and a canopied bed looms near the fireplace.  Odd weapons and strange bits of armor lie scattered about the room.

title: House Phoenix, Caverns
description: The faint whisper of wings echoes through this dark, musty cavern.  A small natural pit holds a pile of debris and ashes.  The air is still and cool.

title: House Phoenix, Lower Hall
description: The few guttering candles provide barely enough light to avoid stumbling over the uneven tile floor.  The stone walls of this narrow hallway are cool and slightly damp to the touch.  The air, heavy and humid, smells slightly of mildew.

title: House Phoenix, Gaq's Dungeon
description: A few small logs burn in the firepit, casting strange shadows that dance against the uneven stone walls of the cavern.  The flickering light illuminates a crude painting on the wall.  A tiny rivulet of water trickles down the stone wall into a crude basin that has been hollowed out of the stone.  The only furnishings are a simple bed of maoral wood and a small matching table.  A statuette stands on the small table.

title: House Phoenix, Hall
description: The few guttering candles provide barely enough light to avoid stumbling over the uneven tile floor.  The stone walls of this narrow hallway are cool and slightly damp to the touch.  The air, heavy and humid, smells slightly of mildew.

title: House Phoenix, Hall
description: The few guttering candles provide barely enough light to avoid stumbling over the uneven tile floor.  The stone walls of this narrow hallway are cool and slightly damp to the touch.  The air, heavy and humid, smells slightly of mildew.

title: House Phoenix, Hall
description: The few guttering candles provide barely enough light to avoid stumbling over the uneven tile floor.  The stone walls of this narrow hallway are cool and slightly damp to the touch.  The air, heavy and humid, smells slightly of mildew.

title: House Phoenix, Hall
description: The few guttering candles provide barely enough light to avoid stumbling over the uneven tile floor.  The stone walls of this narrow hallway are cool and slightly damp to the touch.  The air, heavy and humid, smells slightly of mildew.

title: House Phoenix, Alcove
description: This alcove is plushly floored with thick carpeting that extends up the treads of a spiral stair to the next level.

title: House Phoenix, Observatory
description: Here on the highest level of the building, most of the walls and the roof seem to be formed of a clear glasslike crystal that allows an almost unrestricted view of the sky above and the surrounding townscape.  Various instruments of observation and study stand on a raised platform in the middle of the room.  To the south is a hallway.

title: House Phoenix, Platform
description: From this platform, you gain a magnificent view through the windows and skylight.  The town can be studied easily in relative comfort from this high vantage point.  The sun streaming in warms and relaxes those sitting beneath the skylight.

title: House Phoenix, 3rd Floor hall
description: This hallway ends at a door painted in pale colors.  North is the observation platform and additional rooms.

title: House Phoenix, Wisraith's Room
description: The furnishings in this chamber look comfortable and oft used.  On the east wall, a cozy fireplace beckons you to be seated on the comfortable chair in front of it.  A large bookcase and desk occupy one corner of the room, while a bed fills another.  The oak panelled walls are bare save for a broken staff hanging over the fireplace and white lace curtains around the room's window.

title: House Phoenix, L'Greens' Room
description: The bedchamber of Lord Lythe is comfortable and well kept.  A four poster brass bed, along with a small writing desk serve as the furniture here.  An ornate, hand-woven rug covers the floor in front of the bed and a silvered mirror hangs opposite the desk on one wall.

title: House Phoenix, Waldo2's Chamber
description: This room is decorated in muted earth tones, giving a feeling of peace and contentment.  Obviously, the owner wishes to relax, away from the strife and combat of the wilds.  A solid oak chair sits before an equally sturdy oaken desk.  A plain but comfortable bed is the room's only other furnishing.

title: Phoenix Annex, Foyer
description: This oak panelled room is bare, save for a portrait hanging on the east wall.  The smooth wooden floor has been polished to a high sheen, and your footsteps echo softly as you walk upon it.  Four silver sconces containing white candles are strategically placed on the walls, lending a soft glow to the surroundings.

title: Phoenix Annex, Marble Hallway
description: The marble walls of this hallway seem to glow with warmth as a sense of well being fills you.  Your troubles begin to feel far away.  This hallway is lined with a carpet emblazoned with the House Coat of Arms.

title: Phoenix Annex, Quiet Temple
description: The chamber is peaceful and serene, as if compelling one to speak in whispers out of respect for the holy patrons of this temple.  Large white marble pillars line both sides of the congregation area, a series of beautiful frescoes on the walls between them.  Though the room's scope and beauty is inspiring, the center of attention is a brilliant sapphire altar at the far end of the temple.  Heavy polished maple benches, trimmed in ivory, sit in ordered rows before the altar.

title: Phoenix Annex, North Hall
description: Your footsteps are muffled by a long embroidered rug lining this hallway.  A green crystal chandelier hangs from the ceiling, holding several flickering candles.

title: Phoenix Annex, Guest Room
description: The walls of this guest room are painted a cheery yellow and there is a light scent of cinnamon in the air.  A small window is cracked open just a bit, and the yellow silken curtains billow in the refreshing breeze.  A low bed with an elegantly engraved headboard lies against one wall next to a small wooden shelf.

title: Phoenix, Krisenfest's Room
description: This expansive chamber is roughly triangular, and features richly carved rosewood panelled walls which depict scenes of the Gods of Light.  An antique crystal chandelier hangs from a domed ceiling, illuminating the red-veined white marble floors and a sizable four poster cedar bed in one corner.
