A fireplace flanked by two armchairs fills another corner, while a round malachite-topped cherrywood table surrounded by comfy red pillows stands before a huge shelf filled with books.

title: Phoenix Annex, Catrissa's Room
description: This spacious room is warmed by sunlight streaming in through a window facing east.  A large canopied bed covered by an emerald green down comforter lies against the wall directly beneath the window.  The oak floor is covered by a luxurious snow-white puma fur rug that almost looks as inviting as the bed.  In one corner stands a small bookcase filled neatly with several leather-bound books with esoteric titles.  Occasionally, you hear a faint sound coming from underneath the bed.

title: Phoenix Annex, South Hall
description: The hardwood floor is brightly polished and a thick white tapestry adorns one wall.  A flowering vine grows in a ceramic urn next to the wall, lending a pleasant aroma to the air.

title: Phoenix Annex, Workshop
description: A faint trace of residual magic tingles your fingertips as you cross the threshold of this workshop.  A domed window in the ceiling lets in bright sunlight that shines directly upon a well-worn and slightly charred desk strewn with various parchments and notes.  The walls are lined with shelves and cabinets which contain beakers, flasks, and decanters of multi-colored liquids that sparkle in the light.

title: House Phoenix, Donation Room
description: The brightly polished oak floor reflects the light from a pair of simple silver sconces attached to the wall.  A sweet soprano voice quietly singing an old folk song flows from an archway set in the northern wall.

title: Phoenix Annex, Temple Hallway
description: One wall of this small, well-lit hallway is decorated with a pair of magnificent paintings.  The other is almost completely covered with a grand tapestry depicting a battle scene.  In the flickering torchlight the figures on the tapestry seem to come to life.

title: Phoenix Annex, Sanctuary
description: This tranquil room has been consecrated and dedicated to prayer, contemplation and reflection.  Four rows of pews with kneelers give the room a sense of order and discipline.  Inscriptions, inlaid with silver, grace three of the walls.

title: Silvergate, Bridal Suite
description: Floral patterns in rose and cream velvet frame the windows of this delightfully private chamber.  Enclosed with a canopy and curtains of sheer lace, a large bed rests opposite a fireplace which burns with a cheerful light.  In front of the fireplace, there is a soft fur rug.  A delicately carved oak sideboard stands alongside the gold door.

title: Silvergate, Jungle Room
description: The warm humid air of this tropical retreat invites you to cast away your worries and cares.  Flowering vines creep up the carved posts of a four-poster bed which provides support for a canopy of rustling ferns.  Water trickles from a fountain, cunningly crafted to resemble a waterfall, and fills a small bathing pool near the fireplace.  Several colorful cushions are scattered on the floor near the hearth.

title: Jungle Room, Bathing Pool
description: The warm soothing water relaxes your muscles and the scents of rose and cedar intermingle in the air, leaving you with a renewed spirit.  How refreshing!  Fresh water constantly trickles in from the mouth of a small marble fish statue.

title: Silvergate, Country Retreat
description: Fresh as a country meadow, this cozy room welcomes you.  Pale green linens cover a brass bed, their color echoed in simple cotton curtains patterned with meadow flowers.  Painted carvings of herbs decorate the cream colored walls.  An armoire, crafted of rare varin stands in one corner, complementing the antique nightstands at bedside.  Opposite the bed, two cushioned chairs flank a brick fireplace.  A pot of fresh herbs, simmering over a small fire, fills the air with a fresh scent.

title: Silvergate, Ocean Room
description: Three curving walls of this chamber have been painted with fanciful scenes of merfolk and nymphs sporting among ocean waves and sunswept beaches.  A brilliant sunset depicted on the west wall cleverly frames an arched fireplace.  Midnight blue silk panels, embroidered with tiny silver stars and draped from the ceiling above, sway gently in a warm updraft, creating the illusion of a twinkling night sky.  Centered in the room, a feather bed hangs suspended from the ceiling on cotton ropes.

title: Silvergate, Dragon Room
description: Smelling the fragrance of fresh cedar, you glance up and notice that the ceiling of this simply furnished room has been paneled with the reddish wood.  A simple arrangement of flowering blossoms is displayed in a niche centered in one of the cream colored walls.  The window opposite the door is covered by a delicate carved screen, through which you hear the sound of chimes blowing in the wind.  Thick straw matting covers most of the floor, rising several inches above the entry to this room.

title: Helden Hall, Underground Cavern
description: A frigid blast of air sends a chill down your spine, and the hair on the nape of your neck stands on end from the energies flowing around the cavern.  Light is coming from numerous phosphorescent crystals protruding from the floor and ceiling, in a multitude of colors.  The crystals are connected to each other by strands of pure energy that seem to emanate somehow from an underground stream that flows through here.   Carved into one stone wall is a stone counter, and a few stone bar stools cluster around it.

title: Silvergate Inn, Pool
description: Steam rises from a large oblong pool as the water glistens in the sun.  Crystal oil lamps atop tall silvery poles rise from the polished river stones which cover the ground to the tall evergreen trees that enclose the area.  Small tables rest between pairs of dark wicker lounge chairs with deep green cushions.  A small channel leading off the pool flows to the door of a petite boat house, and a series of glass doors lead into the inn.

title: Silvergate Inn, Lockers
description: Rows of lockers line the shelves along the walls of this compact space.  An old sturdy table is centered between two sets of shelves, and appears to be capable of holding the contents of any of the lockers you can see.  Your locker has been removed from its assigned niche and sits ready for you on an old sturdy counter.

title: Silvergate, Office
description: A tall leaded glass window offers a view of the bustling streets below.  A rose vine-carved pearwood desk sits atop a floral and bird motif silk rug.  The tufted ivory leather chair behind the desk matches the chairs around a polished oblong mahogany table.  Tall pearwood bookcases circle the room, filled with books and small treasures.  A miniature replica of Silvergate Inn is centered on the oblong table.

title: Silvergate, Member's Bath
description: Rosy surfaces gleam in the glow of a soft light.  Sunken in the floor is a luxuriously large marble tub, steam rising from the water's surface.  Sculpted in gold, a naiad rests in the corner, water from her jug ready to warm your bath.  A single wash basin will serve your needs should you have no time to tarry.  Large and small, soft clean towels are neatly stacked in a corner shelf.

title: Silvergate, Marble Tub
description: Immersed in warm and soapy water, you can't help but feel yourself relaxing.  Every so often you find your body sinking lower and lower into the water, your eyelids getting heavier and heavier.  You feel like you could stay in here for hours!

title: Silvergate, Meditation Room
description: Polished oak floors with an inlaid teak border add to the tranquility and elegance of the room.  Centered in the room is a large stone basin with fragrant white water lilies floating in crystal clear water.  Delicate white sheer drapes hang down from an elaborately carved teak canopy that spans the ceiling.  Meditation mats circle the water basin, and tiny crystal prisms hang at different heights from the canopy.

title: Silvergate, Short Corridor
description: Set off the main hallway and quiet, the corridor is well-lit by a small window to the east.  Small portraits line the white walls on either side of the doors.

title: Lady Mistyrose's Playroom
description: In the center of the room a gorgeous brass filigree swing sways slightly. The glass of a large bay window reflects a rosewood bedroom set, a beautiful painting hung over a polished marble fireplace and a breathtaking, solid silver puma which lounges on a bearskin rug. In one corner an antique table is covered with items used for mixing potions. You note several pairs of worn, mismatched bootlaces, and a wand for bubble making peeking out of an ancient elven fishing kreel.

title: Silvergate, Sitting Room
description: This elegant little sitting room is filled with fragrance and color from the fresh flowers arranged in crystal vases placed throughout the area.  Botanical paintings in gilt frames hang on the rosewood-paneled walls, while a soft floral rug cushions every step.  Two ivory damask settees with polished rosewood frames flank a low tea table, inviting relaxing conversation over drinks.  In the corner, a deep green raw silk cushion offers a comfortable resting spot.

title: Silvergate, House Library
description: Bookcases rise from floor to ceiling and nearly encircle the entire room.  Only a heavy oak door and two windows, each rising from a cushioned window seat to the ceiling, interrupt this overwhelming collection of knowledge.  Several comfortable chairs and ottomans are scattered throughout the room awaiting those who care to take a journey through the histories and literature of your Elanthian lands that line the shelves.

title: Silvergate, Smoking Lounge
description: Devoted to masculine pleasures, this dimly lit room is paneled in mellow cedar -- the scent of the wood mingles pleasantly with that of fine pipe tobacco.  The floor is cushioned by a patterned sisal rug, and a large library table surrounded by comfortable leather chairs provides room for a game of cards or for a pipe to be carefully packed.  Flanked by potted palms, an antique ship's bar stands against the far wall.

title: Silvergate, Short Corridor
description: The sun coming through a small oriel window set high on the southern wall illuminates the portraits which line the corridor.  The ash wainscotting is waxed and polished to a gleaming finish.

title: Silvergate, The Retreat
description: Thick draperies of heavy green silk cover the window, shutting out the bustle and haste of Wehnimer's Landing.  The walls, papered with a cream colored brocade, are hung with paintings of local landscapes.  Dozens of sweetly scented candles grace the mantle and flicker merrily from wall sconces.  A delicate bedside table is pulled up close to a large fluffy featherbed.

title: Silvergate, Mystic Room
description: The walls of this cozy room are shrouded in midnight blue gossamer.  Swaths of dove grey silk line the ceiling, drifting down into the corners of the room.  A low brass stand placed near the large bed holds a porcelain incense burner.   Against the opposite wall is a small, crow-footed table on which rests a crystal ball.  Candles, thoughtfully placed throughout the room, cast a soft and exotic glow.

title: Silvergate, Mountain Retreat
description: This small chamber has been lined with rough-hewn stones.  A deep pile of thick pile of thick furs lies before a small fireplace.  A small rack of firewood fills the room with the pungent smell of freshly split wood.  Hung above the fireplace is a gleaming steel-bound shield, backed by a crossed axe and hammer.

title: Silvergate, Ivy Rose Room
description: This room looks like a garden.  Skillfully rendered cloud formations are painted across a sky blue ceiling.  Vines of ivy, intertwined with rare and exotic flowering plants, cling to the posts of a canopied willow-wood bed.  A mirror, nearly lost among the ivy, is like a doorway into a leafy universe.  The deep rug gives the impression of lush, carefully tended grass.  The light reflecting from a crystal mobile suspended from the ceiling scatters colors, like bright tropical birds, throughout.

title: Silvergate, Short Corridor
description: A small oriel window set high on the northern wall illuminates the portraits which line the corridor.  The ash wainscotting is waxed and polished to a gleaming finish.

title: Silvergate, Mapmaker's Room
description: Several leaded-glass windows allow a flood of light into the room, bathing the massive cartographer's worktable in bright light.  Scattered on the table are the tools and products of the mapmaker's trade.  A small, brass-paneled fireplace remains unlit.  An ornate bookcase takes up much of one wall.  The room is brightened by an exotically patterned rug covering the polished parquet floor.

title: Silvergate, Boudoir
description: An enormous antique armoire takes up much of one wall.  Nearby is a mirrored vanity table and a matching chair.  An elegant black-laquered four-poster bed, dramatically draped in swathes of crimson silk, fills one corner of the room.  A five-panelled silk screen sections off the back right corner of the room.

title: Paupers, The Triple Chalice Bar
description: The rich smell of many ales lingers in the air above the tables that are positioned around the room.  The smooth glaes top of a teakwood bar reflects the dim lighting of the room.  Behind the bar is a large mirror and racks filled with strange liquors imported from distant lands.  An elegantly framed portrait hangs above the mantle of a glossy obsidian fireplace.  Sounds of gambling and laughter come from a polished marble archway, and a colorful rosewood runestaff carved in the image of a barmaid serving two ales is mounted over the entry.

title: Paupers, Game Room
description: There is an aura of energy in this brightly lit room.  Empty glasses are scattered about on the various tables.  Cigar smoke drifts lazily through the air.  In the center of the room stands a soft felt-covered table, inviting you to try your luck with the roll of the dice.

title: Paupers, Balcony
description: Gazing out from the balcony you can see the southwest corner of the Town Square.  The bustle and clamor of the town seems blessedly far away.  A rose-covered trellis climbs up to the balcony from the grounds below.  The subtle smell of roses mixes pleasantly with the rich smell of ale from the pub.

title: Paupers, Wide Hall
description: This wide, carpeted hallway is quiet and peaceful.  At the end of the hallway are some wide double doors, above which is a rosette stained glass window.  Sunlight illuminates the glass, casting the hallway in bright colors.  An ornate winding staircase leads up, and a lapis-inlaid plaque hangs next to an ora-bound door.

title: Paupers, Upstairs Hall
description: Sunlight streams through a small dormer window, bathing the hallway in a soft, golden light.  An unlit brass lamp hangs above the winding stairs.  A small, ale-stained, sisal rug covers the floor.  The pleasant smell of ale and the sound of clinking glasses comes from the west.

title: Paupers, Performers' Courtyard
description: This small, quiet courtyard is bordered on the north by the main structure of House Paupers.  To the east are the ornate arches leading to the Hall of Lore.  To the south and west are tall, impenetrable hedges up which a flowering vine has grown.  A riverstone fountain chuckling pleasantly in one corner of the courtyard is shaded by a flourishing apple tree.

title: Paupers, Hall of Lore
description: Many of Elanthia's finest artisans have contributed their talents to create this large amphitheater.  Terraced seating comprised of blue cushions arranged on oak benches descends to the floor in concentric circles.  A raised speaker's podium occupies the center of the hall.  The walls of the amphitheater are adorned with paintings of elaborate landscapes and sweeping vistas.

title: Paupers, Guest Room
description: The sunlight shining through the thick, leaded glass window casts a warm, relaxing light through the room.  An oak bedstead holds a thick feather mattress on which a plump, down-filled comforter has been folded.  A blue vase holds some freshly cut golden chrysanthemums.  A cinnamon-colored wicker chair occupies one corner.  On the wall is a framed oil painting.

title: Storage Hall
description: The hall is dark, lit only by a guttering torch over each of the two doors and a beam of light pouring through a small hole in the wall.  The obsidian walls are unbroken by decorations, and any noises echo loudly off the stone.

title: Locker Storage
description: This room is unremarkable in its plainness.  The walls are of perfect obsidian, unmarked and undecorated.  A single lantern lights the area with a dim glow.

title: Drooling Rolton Table
description: A large painting hangs on the wall.  The painting shows a drooling rolton standing menacingly over the corpse of an infamous lord.  Behind this spectacle towers Melgorehn's Reach.

title: Sneaky Kobold Table
description: On the wall hangs a painting of a kobold lying in ambush behind a tree stump.  A short sword firmly clenched in his fist, the kobold scouts for easy victims.

title: Soaring Blood Eagle Table
description: A copper tablet hangs next to the table.  On the tablet is etched a huge blood eagle soaring high in the sky.  In its claws dangles a rather energetic halfling.

title: Striking Cobra Table
description: On the table stands a brass statue of a coiled cobra.  The cobra looks like it's ready to strike at any moment.  Yellowish fluid drips slowly from its mouth.

title: Ghastly Revenant Table
description: This is a very nice and quiet table, placed over in a far corner.  Strange that people seem to stay away from it.  Stranger still is the creepy feeling that someone is standing next to you, occasionally touching you.

title: Tenacious Wolverine Table
description: Someone with an artistic bent has carved a wolverine and an attacking fighter into the table.  The wolverine has bitten into the fighter's sword and doesn't seem to have any plans of letting go.

title: Charmed Cockatrice Table
description: Someone has left their gorgeous feathered boa draped over a chair.  One of the serving wenches casts furtive glances at it, seemingly quite enticed by the elegant fashion statement it makes.

title: Naughty Monkey Table
description: In the corner next to the wall stands a stuffed monkey.  Its brown fur is a bit on the mangy side, and its paw is stretched pleadingly towards you.  The effect is ruined somewhat by the monkey's frozen, mischievous grin.

title: Hissing Basilisk Table
description: On the table is a yellowed and sooty basilisk skull turned upside down.  A beeswax candle hisses cheerfully inside the skull, casting a warm glow on the nearby patrons.

title: Spinning Spider Table
description: The black-stained yew table is carved into the shape of a giant spider.  On the wall and part of the ceiling hang old fishing nets, no doubt meant to mimic spiderwebs.  A small figurine is bolted into the floor next to the table.

title: Rival Thrak Table
description: On the wall hangs a framed rendering of a fat warrior panting over a slain thrak.  The sweating, big-nosed warrior is all but hanging on his sword.

title: Smelly Manticore Table
description: From the ceiling hangs a small cluster of dried and shrunken manticore heads.  Smoke drifts lazily up from some incense sticks stuck into a sand-filled bowl.  The incense does help a bit.

title: Stunning Grey Orc Table
description: A very lifelike portrait hangs on the wall here.  The portrait shows an old, leering grey orc leaning on a gnarled thanot staff.  Above the orc's head hangs a radiant gas cloud.

title: Hungry Ghost Wolf Table
description: A well-made charcoal drawing of a ghost wolf is tacked to the wall.  Through the wolf you can see the crumbling remains of a once stout tower.

title: Ugly Cave Troll Table
description: The wall next to the table is covered by a tapestry.  The muted scenario shows a group of Faendryl elves being attacked by cave trolls.  The trolls look quite happy to have found some good grub.

title: Pouncing Puma Table
description: The chairs next to the table are draped with golden puma hide.  The soft hide is tastefully embossed with small circular shapes in various sizes.  The edges of the table are beautifully carved into the shape of hemlock leaves.

title: Raiding Krolvin Table
description: On the table stands a small, wooden model of a serpentine krolvin ship.  An intricately carved dragon's head sneers from the ship's bow.

title: Beautiful Vereri Table
description: A heavy, grey marble tablet hangs on the wall.  In bas-relief is carved the image of a hauntingly beautiful woman clad in tattered robes.  A large temple looms in the background.

title: Savage Warcat Table
description: On the wall hangs a large, exquisite warcat hide.  The soft, black fur is complemented by tapering, grey stripes.  In a crystal vase on the table stands a single, black rose.

title: Wehnimer's, A Very Dark Alley
description: Cloaked in pervasive shades of black and grey, nebulous shadows conceal the features of this covert back street.  Any hint of sunlight is mercilessly smothered by the close-set buildings to either side.  Underfoot, the worn cobblestones remain perpetually slick as moisture seeps from the walls, coalescing into thin rivulets of slimy water that feed both moss and algae.  A single sputtering torch looks oddly out of place where its wan illumination dances on the stark brickwork at the alley's dead end.

title: Sagan's Alley, Hideout
description: Warm, dry, and well lit, the pleasant ambiance of this mid-sized chamber belies its seedy, subterranean location.  Despite cobwebs in the corners, the floor is newly swept and all dust has been cleared from the makeshift furnishings, as if in readiness for the owner's arrival.  A small niche has been chipped from the plaster, and some of the lathing has been removed to form a shelf within.

title: Irregulars Barracks, Courtyard
description: The courtyard is large and well-kept, and a small stand of haon trees periodically comes alive with the flashes of greenish light from a large colony of fireflies.  To the north, a marked off area for training is neatly arranged for drills.  Practice dummies and archery targets appear well-used but in good repair.  In the center of the yard, a brass-plated iron alarm bell hangs from an ash A-frame.  Near the double doors leading into the barracks, a single wooden bench sits beside a small table.

title: Schooner Docks, Bait Shop
description: The smell of fish and salty sea air pervades the small building.  Several wooden crates of varying sizes are stacked haphazardly along the back wall near a long counter.  A large barrel holds some of the shop's wares, as well as the robust stench of worms and other bait.  Behind the counter, various goods are stacked upon some long shelves.

title: Twilight Hall, Lockers
description: Several sturdy lockers line the walls here, decorated with elegant golden leafwork and intricate etchings.  Your locker has been removed from the shelf above and sits ready for you on a sturdy counter.

title: Twilight Hall, Lockers
description: Several sturdy lockers line the walls here, decorated with elegant golden leafwork and intricate etchings.  Your locker has been removed from the shelf above and sits ready for you on a sturdy counter.

title: Twilight Hall, Lockers
description: Several sturdy lockers line the walls here, decorated with elegant golden leafwork and intricate etchings.  Your locker has been removed from the shelf above and sits ready for you on a sturdy counter.

title: A Weathered Shack
description: Long modwir shelves lined with various potions, tools, and the unidentifiable remains of plants dominate one side of this relatively large shack.  A simple counter sits near the rear of the room directly in front of a thick wooden door.

title: Alchemist's House, Laboratory
description: The stench of brimstone and sting of ozone hang heavy in the air of the laboratory.  A boiling alembic giving off noxious fumes sits over a brazier on a stained, deal-topped lab table.  Around the equipment are unstoppered vials of brightly colored substances.  It appears the alchemist was called away in mid-experiment.

title: Two-headed Thrak Table
description: Oddly, the chairs at this section of the long table have no arms to them, making them appear smaller than they really are.  A single ivory die seems to be stuck in a knot hole on the table top, right between the two heads of the double-headed thrak painted there.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tunnel ends abruptly at a jagged wall that rises up to a stone ceiling.  Cobwebs shimmer from the light of a nearby torch, which also dimly illuminates a stained steel ladder leading up.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tunnel twists to the north here, and then bends left and right, each passage disappearing into the darkness.  A few broken wooden arrow shafts litter the ground.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tunnel ends abruptly at a jagged wall that rises up to a stone ceiling.  Cobwebs shimmer from the light of a nearby torch, which also dimly illuminates a stained steel ladder leading up.

title: Darkstone Bay
description: Cold waters splash around you, catching you in the midst of waves that slosh about in the Darkstone Bay.  Grizzled workers move along the docks of Wehnimer's Landing, loading and unloading ships lined up along the water's edge.

title: Darkstone Bay
description: The ocean swells rise up high, crashing down in loud splashes of water and foam.  Small bits of kelp float along the surface of the dark waters.

title: Faendryl Enclave, Courtyard
description: Symmetrical rows of lor trees stand as silver sentinels along a gravel pathway that broadens into a circular courtyard.  In the center of the yard, a pair of trees have grown together into a single towering tree, echoing the lofty reach of the alabaster spire rising to their north.

title: Alabaster Spire, Foyer
description: Alabaster slabs thrust upward in the form of a lotus flower, presenting a series of concave walls and hidden conversation nooks.  Reaching twice the height of a pure elf, the tips of the carved stone petals intertwine to form a complex vaulted ceiling.  A despanal-veined pedestal casts a dull scarlet glow from the center of the room.

title: Alabaster Spire, Dining Hall
description: Sconces on the alabaster walls illuminate oil paintings depicting historically significant Faendryl and the officers of the Enclave.  A massive ebonwood dining table set for a formal meal traverses the length of the narrow room.

title: Alabaster Spire, Great Hall
description: Narrow stained glass windows pierce soaring despanal-veined alabaster walls in this expansive hall.  Each window's colorful design casts its own pattern on the barrel-vaulted ceiling to create a complex, kaleidoscopic play of light.  On the east side of the hall, an ebonwood lectern stands at the center of a small stage.  Art-lined alcoves around the room create conversation spaces while leaving a central expanse of inlaid stone open for dancing or large gatherings.

title: Faendryl Enclave, Garden
description: Shielded by verdant hedges, the spire's reflection garden adds a grace note of natural beauty to the building's austere architecture.  A circular pool surrounded by smooth white benches provides a serene focal point for the setting, while artfully shaped topiaries create a private reserve of fanciful beasts along the tranquil garden's periphery.  Flowering vines around a central statue add a note of welcome color.

title: Beacon Hall Annex, Commons Park
description: Shielded by a thick evergreen hedge, this broad expanse of lush green lawn provides a welcome respite from the chaotic world just beyond the arch.  Not many steps away, a large and elegantly drooping willow provides a shady resting place.  Further in and across the way, an open gazebo shelters a rope hammock, several comfortable looking pillows, and a wobbly tea cart.  A pebbled path meanders over to the far corner, leading to a large glass-domed sandstone building.

title: Beacon Hall Annex, Gallery
description: With floor-to-ceiling windows and creamy ivory walls, this room is a showcase of statuary and exhibits.  Stretching across one side, a long glass case protects an array of important and delicate items.  In contrast, displays of battle memorabilia command attention throughout the rest of the room, plush benches scattered between.  A spiral staircase affixed with a sign leads upward, while a guard stationed near a graceful arch prevents casual visitors from further exploration.

title: Beacon Hall Annex, Loft
description: A chandelier provides sufficient visibility while the light plays off the vaulted ceiling.  An iron balustrade spans the wide balcony overlooking the gallery below.  Heavy cherrywood bookshelves span the full length of the wall opposing the balustrade, their repository of texts accessible by a rolling ladder.  The stucco walls are embedded with fragments of colorful sea glass and striated clam shells.  A pair of red velvet chairs, separated by a modest low table, are stowed away at the far corner.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Entry Way
description: Arrow slits ominously line both sides of the wooden entryway leading from the outside to the inside of the Hendoran outpost.  Just wide enough to allow a wagon to squeeze through, the hard-packed earthen floor slopes inward guiding absent feet to the center of the space.  Overhead three trapdoors punctuate the length of the ceiling between a thick oaken gate on one end and a black iron portcullis on the other.

title: Outpost, Outer Courtyard
description: A pair of Hendoran soldiers stand at attention on either side of a black iron portcullis which leads outside the outpost.  Beyond them, the courtyard fills a space between the outer wooden wall and an inner wall made of stone, where a fortified keep rises behind it.  Above, imperial soldiers slowly walk the parapet of the outer wall, their eyes focused on the horizon.

title: Outpost, Outer Courtyard
description: Lines of archery targets line the interior side of the outpost wall and makeshift attack dummies, scarecrow-like figures bound to wooden stakes, join them as tools to keep the Hendoran martial edge sharp.  Several crates of wooden practice swords and shields are neatly stacked along the wall.  A squat building sits off to the side with several bales of hay placed nearby, along with a barrel of lye.

title: Outpost, Outer Courtyard
description: Guards flank the outpost's second portcullis, the entryway into the interior of the Hendoran's compound.  Both soldiers clutch halberds and gaze directly forward from under polished helms.  The inner wall, built of stone, looms up over the entryway with arrow slits running the length of the visible wall.

title: Outpost, Outer Courtyard
description: Four raised garden beds fill the courtyard with a wide crushed gravel path passing through vegetable staples to the Hendoran stables.  The whinnying and neighing of horses continually fill the air and accompany the sounds of uniformed auxiliaries moving about the gardens and in and out of storage sheds built along the wall.  Periodically, mounted Hendorans ride their horses southward to the main entrance of the outpost, while others return from the same direction and disappear into the stables.

title: Outpost, Latrine
description: The narrow interior of the building contains only a bench with several holes cut out along its length.  A strong odor of lye and hay emanate from the holes with just the slightest scent of urine and feces.  Discarded copies of a Wehnimer's Landing newspaper lay within arm's reach of the bench across the floor.

title: Collectibles Shop
description: This cozy little warehouse almost has a boutique-like feel to it.  Individual displays are separated by large hanging tapestries and are individually attended by smartly dressed assistants.  A light perfume hangs in the air, continually refreshed by occasional spritzes from an unseen source.

title: Aznell's Armory, Rooftop
description: The southwest corner of the Town Square expands below the rooftop, as dark alleys snake in between wooden shops and buildings.  Guards can be seen in a ballista tower nearby, eyes scanning the horizon.

title: Moot Hall, Citizen Lounge
description: Two windows, high above a small display case, are set into the far wall, their panels providing adequate sunlight which brightens the room.  The glow from silver candlebras complements the natural light from outside.  A half-circle bar occupies one corner near a few comfortable sofas.  In the center of the room is an oval forest green rug, surrounded by broad russet leather chairs.  An ivory-handled door serves as the exit, flanked by tall wooden bookcases.

title: Baile Dragan, Gateway
description: This long, covered passageway, entered at either end through carved ironwood gates featuring a pair of intricately carved dragons, runs between the road and a large inner courtyard.  The space is lit by rush lamps set into the whitewashed walls, and shadows flicker along its length.  A faint, though not unpleasant, musty odor permeates the night.  Sounds from outside are muffled by the walls and the enclosing darkness.  The faces of those who pass by are barely discernible.

title: Baile Dragan, Courtyard
description: In the center of the courtyard a white tower rises skyward, light flickering in the windows.  Mossy pathways meander among the quiet oak trees leading from door to door in the circular structure that encloses the area.  A small pond, its surface dotted with floating candles, is nestled near some flower patches.  Living sapling benches, formed by intertwining branches near a stone shrine, offer places to sit and enjoy the night air.  Somewhere nearby an owl hoots his nighttime refrain.

title: Baile Dragan, Triskelion Hall
description: This large, open room is filled with successively higher rows of polished ebonwood benches, supported at each end by heavy, dragon-shaped legs of cast silver.  The walls are hung with magnificent tapestries worked in silver thread on a black background.  Each life-sized panel depicts a scene of a mortal and a dragon in some sort of interaction.  At the front of the room is a large dais, behind which the Ord an Dragan standard is displayed.

title: Baile Dragan, The Wyrm's Rest
description: Hazy with smoke from the wood fire and redolent of ale and other spirits, this spacious room is a gathering place for local residents.  In the center of the room, a fireplace with an immense circular hearth provides wanted warmth in winter and a cook-fire year round.  Tables and benches run the length of the room on opposing sides of the fireplace, with more at either end, and the floor is strewn with fresh rushes.  Bundles of fragrant herbs and bottles of brew line the shelves behind the serving counter

title: Baile Dragan, Office
description: An enormous, brick-faced fireplace with an elaborate mantel is the focal point of this warm and inviting room.  Two grey wingback chairs sit before a large desk flanked by tall candle stands, each bearing a triple-wicked candle that shines brightly, allowing business to be carried on well past sundown.  Opposite the fireplace is a large ebonwood bookcase filled with maps and leather-bound volumes of all colors and sizes.  Windows on the inner wall allow an unrestricted view of the night sky.

title: Baile Dragan, Hall of Honor
description: Octagonal in shape, this spacious, domed room is notable for the inlaid silver outline of a large dueling circle on the floor, enwrapped on seven sides by double-wide ebonwood prie-dieux with flame red velvet cushions.  On the eighth side of the room against the wall, is an imposing black iron chair on an elevated platform.  The upper portion of each wall is hung with a thick woolen tapestry woven in brilliant colors.  Several pairs of silver-bladed dueling swords hang on either side of the entryway.

title: Moot Hall, Rooftop
description: Dark slate runs across the roof of Moot Hall, providing solid footing and an impressive view of the town square below.  To the west, the great oak tree in the center of town rises up, partially obscuring the western side of the bazaar.

title: Cooper's, Secret Room
description: This cool and pleasant room brings a calm smile to your lips.  It bears the clean, comforting scent of freshly worked wood, and the floor is covered with shavings of modwir, cedar, oak.  The walls are formed of long, vertical planks, fastened with pegs to the substructure and joined in a dovetailed, almost seamless fashion.  Great care and skill has gone into making this simple storage space.

metadata.source: Pan's Place, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Cavern, Ritual Room
description: The despanal-inlaid summoning circle dominates the center of the cavern.  Mottled veins of liquescent crimson stone bleed outward from the edges of the circle and snake toward the ceiling along the pale cavern walls.  Slick with condensation, hoary clumps of glowing lichen cast a murky green glow throughout the chamber.

title: Alabaster Spire, Lounge
description: A low ceiling and an assortment of overstuffed chairs scattered throughout the room give the lounge an intimate ambiance.  An ornate Faendryl crest hangs above the massive black marble fireplace that dominates one end of the room.  Opposite the fireplace is a dart board fancifully painted with ravens and griffins.  A gleaming ebonwood bar accented with rhimar spans the length of the room, an open humidor left forgotten at one end.

title: Alabaster Spire, Office
description: The solid ebonwood desk and its ornate, high-backed chair dominate the room.  Expansive bookshelves flank the desk and line the walls to the ceiling in orderly rows, but the odds and ends tucked between the leather volumes that belie the rigorous order of the shelves.  Behind the desk hangs a massive tapestry map of Elanith with details picked out in fine silk thread.  Tucked in a corner near the desk is an overstuffed pillow.

title: Alabaster Spire, Training Hall
description: Various weaponry and armor are arrayed on racks throughout a wide room with vaulted windows of colored glass.  Demon and humanoid-shaped practice dummies await attacks from novices and veterans alike.  While the rest of the room contains signs of regular use, the central onyx-bordered circle is free of any clutter.  Tapestries hung between the windows depict military scenes in muted hues.

title: Alabaster Spire, Solarium
description: Curved, transparent sheets of crystal set at an angle into alabaster walls meet high overhead to enclose the top of the tower.  At the dome's apex, the crystal panes become a single lofty spire.  On one side of the crystalline chamber, a gilded arch opens onto a slender walkway that reaches into the sky without rails or supports.  Opposite the arch is a gold-chased telescope near a low table and scattered lounge chairs that invite stargazing.

title: Paupers, Sentinel Hall
description: Several torches in silver sconces are placed about the walls.  Near an ora-bound door sits a supply rack filled with a variety of blades, pole-arms, and shields, and a small sandalwood bar with a gold-threaded tapestry hanging high above it rests in one corner.  The back wall holds three chiseled stone statues near a broad window overlooking the performer's courtyard.  In the center of the room stands a circular ironwood table with cushioned mahogany chairs positioned around it.

title: Paupers, Office
description: An opulent, gentleman's haven greets you as you enter the private control center of the House.  Leather-bound books, oil paintings and sportsman's trophies line the walls, the stuffed head of a fearsome black shambler dominating the wall over a large couch.  Easy chairs surround a richly appointed desk under a window.

title: Paupers, Workshop
description: Hanging tapestries that decorate the four corners of this room accentuate the vaulted ceiling -- the symbols for fire, earth, air and water are all represented in the various designs.  Jagged burns on the hardwood floor and several fingernail-sized gouges in the near wall offer evidence that suggests a powerful explosion, but from the looks of things it must have happened long ago.

title: Paupers, Vault
description: Light from several torches flickers over silver sconces fastened to the walls.  Legend has it that this heavily carpeted, soundproofed vault once successfully protected a king's ransom from an attempted siege by rampaging barbarians.  Few have attempted to breach the security of the members' steel-reinforced storage lockers in modern times, for tales of the consequences abound and are not for the faint of heart.

title: Paupers, Spirits Cellar
description: The smell of fermentation permeates this dusty sub-level of House Paupers.  Kegs of ale are stacked along the stone walls, forming a narrow aisle leading back to huge wine casks, some of which are as tall as a giantman.  Industrious spiders have constructed complex spiderwebs that hang from the rafters down to the casks of wine and kegs of ale.  Three glasses and several drained liquor bottles rest atop one of the kegs, suggesting a recent, spur-of-the-moment celebration.

title: Paupers, Shadowy Corridor
description: The only source of illumination amidst the dark passageway comes from two iron sconces on either side of a jagged opening in one wall.  Despite no evidence of fire, a soft, eerie yellow glow permeates the air about the sconces, providing a hazy light to a small portion of the hall.  Cloaked in shadows, a barely discernable archway lies opposite a worn wooden door.  Set into the wall at the furthest end of the corridor is a thick steel door covered in wards and runes.

title: Paupers, Toy Room
description: Ocean scenes paint the toy box-lined walls, each open box stuffed with toys like treasure chests sunk upon the bottom of a deep blue sea.  Several brightly colored cushions are scattered about the floor, while a lacquered rocking chair rests upon a sand-hued woven rug in one corner.  Multiple driftwood shelves hang upon the wall, flanking a scorched ship's wheel mounted in between.  Judging by the layers of dust along the toy boxes, the halfling-sized wooden rabbit on rockers is a bit newer.

title: House Brigatta, Memorial Garden
description: A small flagstone courtyard sits among the flowers, statues occupying each corner.  With each stir of the air, the scent of lavender and sage from the surrounding flower beds fills the garden, and along the side of the house stands a row of blueberry bushes.  In the center of the courtyard sits a sapphire blue, ceramic receptacle and a long, wrought iron bench with silver inlay.  A square pedestal beside the receptacle bears a large copper plaque, and a garden path leads back to the lane.

title: Hatouk's Weaponry
description: Enclosed by glossy mistwood walls, the shop features a miniature rock-lined waterfall in the center of its oak floor.  A blue watered silk tapestry hangs under the fel panel ceiling.  Right near the front is a gilded maple cabinet and a vine-carved mahogany table.

title: Hatouk's Weaponry
description: A tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls, and a vaulted ceiling rises overhead.  A worn rug sits in one corner of a dark-stained oak floor.  There is a gilded maple table on one side of the shop and a gilded maple cabinet on the other.

title: Melgorehn's Retreat, Meadow
description: Thick forest, interspersed with several varieties of plants and vines, encircles a large meadow.  Wildflowers add a kaleidoscope of color to the lush, green grass on either side of a cedar chip path.  Sunlight glints softly off Lake Eonak through the flora around a modest home on the far side of the meadow.  Melgorehn's Reach rises sharply into the blue sky above the home, the peak wreathed in clouds.

metadata.source: Melgorehn's Retreat, outside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Melgorehn's Retreat, Entryway
description: Rectangular panels of polished witchwood, set with several veil iron sconces, enclose three sides of the room, while the fourth is made entirely of glass.  An enormous window, with its wide bench, provides an unobstructed view of the majestic greens of Melgorehn's Reach and the multichromatic Lake Eonak.  Dark walnut flooring is softened by a thick silk rug, accompanied by several dark leather armchairs.  In a far corner, a set of straight ko'nag stairs lead downward, and through an open doorway a few bar stools against a countertop are visible.

metadata.source: Melgorehn's Retreat, outside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Melgorehn's Retreat, Kitchen
description: Light floods into the airy space through a wall of glass, through which can be seen the large waterfall that feeds Lake Eonak.  In the center of the room is a long, polished white marble counter, inset with a deep double-sided sink.  High above, globes are inset in the ceiling, and a series of leather padded bar stools are lined up against the counter.  Gleaming copper pots and pans hang along the back wall above an elegant mithril stove, and an open doorway leads back to the entry.  The entire western wall is also glass, complete with a floor-to-ceiling sliding glass door leading onto the deck.

metadata.source: Melgorehn's Retreat, outside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Melgorehn's Retreat, Deck
description: Lacquered dark walnut flooring stretches out from the kitchen and across the neatly manicured grass of the hilltop.  The large deck is built to incorporate a narrow brook that runs down the hill to the beach and blends with the sparkling surf of Lake Eonak in the distance.  Thick, dark forests ring the lake, framing its pristine beauty against the backdrop of the Reach's majestic peak.  Several low teak chairs with elongated seats sit snug against the house.  A sliding glass door leads into the kitchen, while a narrow set of stone steps leads down the hill to the beach.

metadata.source: Melgorehn's Retreat, outside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Melgorehn's Retreat, Beach
description: Smooth, pristine white sand gives way to a rippled, slightly darker counterpart as it stretches toward the water's edge.  The gentle lapping of Lake Eonak, along with the soft sounds of local wildlife, enhance the calming surroundings.  Brilliant sunlight glints off several glass windows of the house bordering the northern edge of the private beach.  A narrow set of stone steps hugs the hillside and leads to a deck.  Positioned a safe distance from the lake is a round firepit surrounded by blackened sand, and closeby is a cushioned loveseat suspended from weathered wooden beams by thick chains.

metadata.source: Melgorehn's Retreat, outside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Melgorehn's Retreat, Bedroom
description: Piles of sand lean against the base of the southern and western glass walls, which give a breathtaking view of Lake Eonak's sunlit surface.  The dark witchwood of the eastern wall is bisected diagonally by a set of straight ko'nag stairs.  A low, rectangular witchwood chest with square iron handles sits at the foot of a king-sized bed with a low, flat headboard, and is flanked by a nightstand that rests against the northern wall.  Joining the northern and eastern walls is a fireplace cut from ebon-veined brown marble.  A braided silk rug in muted tones stretches beneath a plush loveseat, positioned between the bed and a glass door that leads to a private beach.

metadata.source: Melgorehn's Retreat, outside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: House Brigatta, Gaming Room
description: Big umber leather-cushioned chairs are scattered about this rosewood-paneled room, some placed near a rough-hewn stone fireplace at the far end.  In one of the corners opposite the entry, a small felted gaming table stands near an oft-used, ebon-framed cork dart board.  A slight haze clouds near the ceiling, the rich scent of tobacco mingled with aged liquor adding a depth to the atmosphere of this comfortable setting.  An oak-framed glass curio off to one side holds various medals and awards won by Brigatta members.

title: Ebonstone Manor, Second Floor
description: At the top of a wide staircase, a smartly dressed steward stands to one side of a corridor lined with ivory paper-covered walls and ebonswood wainscoting.  Ornate silver sconces hang on each side of a polished ebonwood door and a white monir door.  A narrow, cushioned bench rests beneath a glass lunette window dominating the far wall.

title: Ebonstone Manor, Kitchen
description: Two large ovens occupy one wall opposite a wide-arched fireplace, a massive iron cauldron suspended inside.  In one corner, fragrant herbs hang from a tiered drying rack above a heavy worktable fixed with a hefty wooden chopping block at one end.  Steel-banded oak barrels are stacked beside a tall ice chest with a glass door.

title: Black Wolves Manor, Foyer
description: Scenes detailing the history of the Black Wolves Clan are proudly portrayed in magnificent oil paintings that line the walls.  The center of the ceiling houses a rounded crimson skylight that bears the silhouette of a howling wolf.  Moonlight penetrates the translucent image, casting the Black Wolves seal faintly onto the white marble floor below.  Bronze lanterns hang in pairs down the wide hallway, and a few armchairs have been arranged around a small table.

title: Black Wolves Manor, Back Yard
description: Tiny motes of light flash aimlessly as fireflies gather about the landscape.  Two lofty trees stand on either side of the lawn as they guard over a freshwater pond between them.  An ancient ironwood prevails in the eastern half, while a stately haon tree spreads its boughs across the lawn's western side.  A stone path wanders through the yard, curving alongside a large fallen branch under the ironwood, before it reaches a low dock jutting over the pond.

title: A Secluded Gazebo
description: Nestled behind the pond, this covered gazebo offers a quiet retreat while still providing a grand view of the back yard.  Two wicker chairs and a loveseat rest inside the gazebo, letting guests find a natural setting to enjoy some solitude or have a friendly chat.  Copper lanterns hang from the shingled roof, their light swaying gently through the climbing roses and lattice, casting a soft amber glow across the pond while the soothing scent of lavender and the croaking chorus of toads rise from the surroundings.

title: Defender Hall, Auditorium
description: Directly across from the entryway stands a prominent rounded dais set off by an elegant tapestry on the wall behind it.  Ebonwood benches are staggered downwards to the dais curving in a semi-circle to provide a clear view of the speakers.  Trails of crimson carpet line the steps and aisles of a pale grey marble floor, granting quiet and safe travel through the auditorium.  Brushed silver oil lamps encircle the room and reflect their light off the thick glass panels that arch up to form a high domed ceiling.

title: Black Wolves Manor, Lounge
description: Warm and spacious, the lounge offers a cozy retreat with a rich mahogany floor and a high-vaulted ceiling framed by honey oak walls.  A grand fireplace stands against the western wall, and moonlight streams into the room through a pair of wide arched windows that flank its chimney.  A small basket of sticks sits by the fireplace.  Oversized couches and roomy chairs are casually scattered about the room, providing plenty of comfortable seats, and a curved mistwood bar stretches out beneath the loft.

title: The Loft
description: Subtle scents of spice and oils fill the air.  There is a sense of seclusion to the loft even though the lounge below is just a good shout away.  A few pillows are strewn along the overstuffed caramel suede corner couch, and a silky shag rug of ivory wool tipped with silver complements the rich mahogany floor.  Across from an arched window is an oil painting with a pair of spiraled mithglin sconces mounted on each side and a small claw-footed table that has been carefully arranged below it.

title: Black Wolves' Grand Ballroom
description: Shades of sea green and soft white envelop this capacious hall.  Two outstretched chandeliers hang from the ceiling, their upswept arms decked in faceted crystals that cast a multitude of tiny reflections across the room.  Tall, narrow windows draped in gossamer are spaced evenly along the walls and accented by pale gold sconces.  A highly polished teakwood floor beckons dancers, while sofas and chairs covered in crushed velvet surround the dance floor.

title: Black Wolves' Manor, Veranda
description: A cool breeze blows through this covered patio hedged with fragrant rose bushes.  Tall stone columns support the roof, each with ivy twining up its base.  Benches of black granite have been set around the patio, and an ebonwood trellis draped in blue wisteria vines arches over a dark slate footpath.  The light of the night sky casts a gentle luminescence on the a small pond at the path's end, and thriving flower beds abound in this quiet area.

title: Defender Hall, Primum's Office
description: Eight ebonwood chairs surround a great round table of mithril-banded oak.  A round oak and iron wagon wheel set with sconces hangs from the center of the ceiling, keeping the office well-lit day and night.  The eastern wall is adorned with a bold tapestry hung just above an official-looking desk.  In a quiet corner of the office stands a small aquarium, the tropical fish milling about in their watery home, oblivious to the world around them.

title: The Oubliette
description: Dust motes dance in a beam of light that illuminates the seal of the Black Wolves which is set in the center of the rough stone floor.  The faint crackle of magic hovers over a tangle of broken weapons and shattered armor next to a long table placed under some low-hanging shelves.  A painted mural depicting a flight of dragons soaring through a twilight sky climbs the granite walls of the circular chamber, ending at an iron grate set high above.

title: Twilight Hall, Bleeds' Room
description: Walls of gleaming obsidian arch seamlessly into the ceiling of this room to form a smooth, black dome.  Thousands of shiny silver points glimmer in the firmament above, all of them dwarfed in size by a large, eight-pointed star which shines at the zenith.  A web of filigreed silver emanates from the larger star to touch each of the smaller ones in turn, giving the appearance of a large spider's web arching protectively over the heavens.

title: Lowest Environs, Cavern
description: The walls are heavily laden with glowing blazestars of every known color reaching from roof to an unknown depth of the pool.  The waters, while still, are fantastically pure and reflect the light of the many sparkling gemstones.  Carved amongst them in the stone wall are recognizable hand holds leading to a solitary ledge.  On the far end of the caverns you see some flat rocks.

title: Lowest Environs, Flat Rocks
description: The light bounces in from the wider caverns, forming merry colored patterns everywhere you look.  A shifting sands mural has been skillfully rendered upon the walls, adding cheery atmosphere.  The floor is simply a collection of perfectly flat pillars of rock that seem to grow up from the endless abyss of deep water around you.  Although there seems to be no heat source, the temperature of the rocks is consistent and comfortable.

title: Wehnimer's Museum, Alcove
description: Dark-paneled walls give way to a curved expanse of glass, flooding the room with sunlight and illuminating the glittering mica in the marble floor.  Long silken banners hang majestically from the ceiling, eight to the left and eight to the right, beneath which are a series of tall black pedestals.  In the center of the room is a circular wooden bench, ideal for perusing the exhibits or enjoying the view through the window.  A small brass sign hangs next to a black marble arch that leads back to the lobby.

title: Elaraeyn's Boutique, Atelier
description: Filigreed floor-to-ceiling windows reveal a colorful walled-in garden, the flora tended in several terra cotta pots that line the perimeter of the shop.  The floor of the room has been scattered with various paeline pillows, the cushions accompanied by thick blankets of soft fur.  Set against the far wall is a carved silvered haon table, covered in various swatches of fabric and loosely rolled sketches of clothing and jewelry.

title: Lily Manor, Courtyard
description: Dappled moonlight illuminates the spacious courtyard of an elegant, two-story mist grey manor.  Cultivated beds of ivory stargazer lilies line the cobblestone walkway from the base of a gracefully arched gate to the ebonwood doors of the manor.  A sweeping expanse of ancient willow trees dots the landscape, their drooping boughs shadowing several scroll-worked marble benches.  A series of granite stepping stones winds around the side of the grounds.

title: Lily Manor, A Walled Garden
description: Shadowed by modwir trees, a series of granite stepping stones leads into the garden, following the gently curving pathway of a gurgling stream.  Sparkling with dappled moonlight, the water trickles past clumps of verdant moss and wild orchids to disappear under an ivy-covered stone wall.  Terraced beds lush with foliage in varying shades of green edge the walls.  A seating area with polished ironwood benches is positioned near a mistwood-framed tea room with a multi-paneled double door.

title: Lily Manor, Tea Room
description: A quartet of arched vaalin windows affords a generous view of the moonlit garden.  Swathes of plum charmeuse frame each window in billowing pools of silk, the curtains caught and held in place by creamy enamel stargazer lilies.  Glass teardrop vases frame the shadowed room, providing a sense of symmetrical order amidst the simplistic furnishings.  An arrangement of high-backed mahogany chairs circle a low mistwood table, while an elaborate mistwood teacart rests in waiting against a patterned wall.

title: Lily Manor, Foyer
description: An ebony-edged plum carpet runner extends across the grey marble flooring to the base of a grand staircase.  Silver sconces cast flickering candlelight upon the varnished ebonwood walls enclosing the large foyer, and moonlight streams through the arched windows framing the doors.  Shadows play across an expansive multi-hued tapestry serving as a backdrop to some ivory silk-covered chairs, and a linen-covered table rests near a tall archway to the west.

title: Museum of Fashion History
description: Unadorned ebonwood walls enclose the glass cases positioned at various points in the room.  Gathered across the arched glass windows on the eastern wall, plum linen drapes are pulled back with silver cords to allow moonlight to stream through and dispel the shadows of night.  Silvery undertones sweep the grey marble floors, designed to match the unlit silver sconces that line the walls.  The museum continues through the northeastern arch.

title: Oak Tree, Large Branch
description: A small platform with an opening cut in the center has been built on this hefty tree branch.  A twisted rope ladder leads down the opening, back to the meadow.  High above is a ragged hole in the tree with a gnarled rope hanging down.

title: Oak Tree, Dark Hole
description: The gnarled rope has been knotted around a thick iron spike sticking out of a hole in the tree.  Little rays of moonlight that have managed to sneak past the thick green leaves that cover every branch spray down upon the tree, providing illumination to the hole.

title: Oak Tree, Dark Hole
description: Though the moonlight provides illumination at the opening of this hole, as you climb up some wooden pegs visibility diminishes until it is completely dark.

title: Oak Tree, Dark Hole
description: It is pitch black inside the tree now, and the only way to continue moving is to feel around for the next peg to grab on to.  Climbing up the tree this way is a daunting task, as several of the pegs slip under your hands and feet.

title: Oak Tree, Dark Hole
description: From above, a rustling sound can be heard, then nothing.  A split second later, a rush of leaves and debris come flying down the hole.

title: Oak Tree, Dark Hole
description: Up above, there is a tiny speck of light.  It is hardly visible and only the size of a pinpoint.  There are fewer wooden pegs now, making it more difficult to continue climbing.

title: Oak Tree, Dark Hole
description: More light can be seen inside the tree now, which makes climbing a little easier.  Above is another knotted rope, though it is still too far up to reach.

title: Oak Tree, Dark Hole
description: Dangling from a perch constructed at the tree opening above your head is a thick knotted rope.  Since the wooden pegs inside the tree have all but disappeared, this appears to be the only way to continue upwards.

title: Oak Tree, Wooden Perch
description: This well-constructed perch has been situated half inside the tree and half outside.  An ornate carved railing surrounds the edge in a half-moon shape, providing protection from falling.  From this height, the ground is not visible at all.  All you can see is green leaves and branches to all sides.  Off to one side of the perch is a sturdy oak ladder leading up to another platform.

title: Oak Tree, Wooden Platform
description: Built around the entire trunk of the tree, this platform is massive in size.  A wooden railing carved with an intricate knotwork design surrounds the entire platform.  A vibrant bluebird flies by, landing in a nest filled with babies begging for food.  Up above, the cloud-filled sky is finally starting to become visible.

title: Oak Tree, Top of the Tree
description: Atop this gigantic tree, an oak platform has been constructed.  A colorful array of flower petals is scattered over the floor, occasionally whirling about the air whenever a gust of wind rushes through the tree top.  Spread about the platform are several benches, providing ideal locations for contemplation and reflection.  Near each bench is a handcrafted wicker basket filled to the brim with petals.

title: Gryphonwind Ventures
description: Beneath a vaulted ceiling, a faded treasure map hangs on one of the mahogany paneled walls.  A wide knotted oak counter sits in one corner while some puffed raw silk pillows rests on the mahogany floor.

title: Artiminus' Outfitting
description: Enclosed by polished oak walls, the shop features a scaled model of Hearthstone in the center of its oak floor.  A blue watered silk tapestry hangs under the golden oak ceiling.  Right near the front is a jewel-inlaid caddy and a gilded maple cabinet.

title: Hevalt's Weaponry
description: Beneath an uneven wooden ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet sits in one corner while a worn rug rests on the wooden floor.

title: Tolwynn's Treasures, Wanton
description: Beneath a stormy grey marble ceiling, a panoramic war mural spans the entire length of the room's circular walls. Some curvaceous female warrior statuary rings the edge of the room, their oversized weapons braced against the crimson marble floor.  Flanking the entrance at facing angles are a stout iron weapon rack and a sturdy iron armor stand.

title: Cosannie's Magic Shoppe
description: Enclosed by glossy mistwood walls, the shop features a dusky blue cotton rug in the center of its plank floor.  A midnight blue rising phoenix tapestry hangs under the beam ceiling.  Right near the front is a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet and a glass-topped mistwood counter.

title: Helden Hall, Cavernous Corridor
description: The light from the crystals to the east easily illuminate this cavernous corridor, displaying the roughly hewn walls of stone and a large boulder seemingly pushed up against the southern wall.  A small trickle of water from the stream to the east moves to the west, hinting at the subtle sloping of this corridor.

title: Orenda's Outfitting
description: The polished surface of an ivory and rose quartz floor softly reflects the figure of a vaalin-traced ivory maiden statue, a central focal point to a long silver and glass semicircular display near the back of the room.  Lining wainscoted blush-painted walls is a series of full body dress mannequins set in poses that mimic those in an elaborate woven silk tapestry.  The sky motif in a dark walnut box beam ceiling lends a feeling of openness to the room.

title: Helden Hall, Brewery
description: The smells of hops and honeyed brew tantalize your senses, making your mouth water in anticipation.  A small gnomish brewer draped in a huge apron anxiously bustles about checking the fermenting brew.  Large fermenting vats take up most of the room and strange vials and testing containers cover the large table, while sacks of grain and small kegs of finished brew occupy a corner.  The size of the vats attests to the thirst of the occupants of this house.

title: Fleurs' Glowing Goods, Entry
description: Enclosed by polished oak walls, the shop features a subtle arrangement of fragrant pink stargazer lilies accented by tiny white iceblossoms in the center of its oak floor.  A painted silk wall panel hangs under the golden oak ceiling.  Right near the front is a lacquered white rosewood cabinet.

title: Helden Hall, Dark Cavern
description: The lights from the crystals reach this room with a light touch, giving it a soft glow.  The roughly hewn walls extend in a circular fashion, creating a perfect complement for the huge set of heavy oak double doors that adorn the far wall at the base of the slope.  The echoes of cheering crowds seem to resonate within this room.  Next to the double doors and a little to the side, steep stone steps climb upwards.

title: Helden Hall, Training Room
description: Large mats cover the floor of this spacious room.  The north wall is lined with modwir racks filled with every type of weapon imaginable.  The haon racks on the southern wall support several training armors.  Between the racks, sturdy benches offer a place to rest between training matches.  Several pitchers and mugs are on a table near the wall, ready to relieve parched and sore throats.  Sawdust and wood chips are scattered in one corner, awaiting the sweep of a broom.

title: Helden Hall, Dark Tunnel
description: This is a triangular room where the freshly-painted walls come together at the farthest point east.  A reinforced trapdoor has been built into one of the walls here, and a guard keeps watch nearby.

title: Charwiz's Magic Shoppe
description: A tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls, and a mistwood beam ceiling rises overhead.  A worn rug sits in one corner of a dark-stained oak floor.  There is a glass-topped mistwood counter on one side of the shop and a wicker basket on the other.

title: Scarletowl's Weaponry
description: The broad sweep of the plank floor is interrupted by a worn rug.  Halfway to the beam ceiling, a fused sun and moon wall-hanging hangs on one of the smooth granite walls.  A half-open bloodstained iron maiden full of long rusty spikes and a glass-topped mistwood counter are pushed close together in the back of the shop.

title: Valaka Offerings
description: The broad sweep of the oak floor is interrupted by a scaled model of Hearthstone.  Halfway to the golden oak ceiling, a midnight blue rising phoenix tapestry hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A bamboo rack and a flexible willow woven basket are pushed close together in the back of the shop.

title: Seomanthe's Weaponry
description: Beneath a low skylight-set ceiling, a faded treasure map hangs on one of the glossy mistwood walls.  An etched brass bin and a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet sit in opposite corners while a scaled model of Hearthstone rests on a sturdy planked floor.

title: Charwiz's Weaponry
description: Beneath a pebble textured ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A vine-carved mahogany table and a wicker basket sit in opposite corners while a worn rug rests on a dark-stained oak floor.

title: Charwiz's Weaponry
description: Beneath a vaulted ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A gilded maple table and a wicker basket sit in opposite corners while a worn rug rests on a dark-stained oak floor.

title: Drung's Weaponry
description: Beneath an uneven wooden ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the blue watered silk walls.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet sits in one corner while a worn rug rests on the mahogany floor.

title: Artiminus' Outfitting
description: Mahogany paneled walls rise from a polished oak floor.  Just above a pile of striped throw pillows hangs a portrait of Darkstone Castle, and a glossy modwir plank ceiling completes the picture.  A jewel-inlaid caddy and a gilded maple table stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Myharl's Office
description: The broad sweep of the celadon marble floor is interrupted by an ornate bottled ship.  Halfway to the modwir plank ceiling, an elaborate glowbark-framed portrait hangs on one of the polished oak walls.  A book-laden wyrwood-inlaid desk with a brass-framed glowing white orb on one side is pushed to the back of the shop.

title: Gryphonwind Ventures, Vault
description: Blue watered silk walls rise from an enameled hardwood floor.  Just above a pile of striped throw pillows hangs a pearl-handled filigreed mandolin, and a mosaic tiled ceiling completes the picture.  A wide knotted oak counter and a bamboo rack stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Tolwynn's Treasures, Lust
description: Beneath an arching dark mahogany ceiling, some gracefully posed caryatid columns stand braced against the silk-draped green marble walls, lending the room the air of a temple.  A resplendent jade Ivas statue stands central upon a tessellated green wisp-tiled floor, furthering the appearance.  An oversized glaes display case is positioned as altar, surrounded by some exquiste white jade mannequins posed in the midst of a variety of lascivious acts.

title: Tolwynn's Treasures, Avarice
description: A hole blown through a section of airship hull forms the entrance to this room, opening onto a scene of plunder.  A gem-inlaid black glaes ceiling evokes a starlit sky, complemented by the polished dusky glaesine walls.  Some scattered treasure chests rest upon a lushly green carpeted floor, surrounded by some voluptuous female pirate statuary.  In the center of them all stands a scantily clad pirate queen mannequin, positioned to leer at all who enter.

title: Cosannie's Magic Shoppe
description: Beneath a mistwood beam ceiling, a portrait of Darkstone Castle hangs on one of the glossy mistwood walls.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet and a glass-topped mistwood counter sit in opposite corners while a thin gold-edge black runner rests on a mistwood plank floor.

title: Cosannie's Magic Shoppe
description: Beneath a mistwood beam ceiling, a sphere-hilted mounted sword plaque hangs on one of the glossy mistwood walls.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet and a glass-topped mistwood counter sit in opposite corners while a thin gold-edge black runner rests on a mistwood plank floor.

title: Orenda's Outfitting
description: Accenting the long window on the north wall is a rose brocade silk layered valance that pools down onto an ivory and rose quartz floor.  Along the wainscoted blush-painted walls is a long rosewood strip with a series of polished silver hooks, next to which stands a full-length three-panel mirror.  In the center of the room, just beneath the skylight in a straight beam ceiling, a round two-tiered display table draped with soft linen has been set up.

title: House Aspis, Garden Trail
description: A trellised arch of vines and flowers leads people along this trail to and from the cliffs, above the Locksmehr River.  The cries of gulls float on the breeze, along with the salt-smell of the Bay to the north.  The regal silhouette of an outdoor amphitheatre rises to the east.

title: Den of the Dragon, Amphitheatre
description: A garden trail leads up and west away from this exquisite open-air amphitheatre, and marble and silverwood terraced benches are broken into thirds by stairs.  Framing the stage is a dragon, its tail curling around the nearby orchestra pit and the spine rising against the backdrop of glistening waters beyond.  A small, velvet-roped walkway leads to elegant pews at the front, protected from the elements by argent tenting.

title: Den of the Dragon
description: Some open curtains of heavy, dark green velvet drape the vast stage, and argent tenting protects it and the closest pews from the elements without ruining the view of the rest of the audience.  Globes of ethereal, magical lights hang overhead, beaming their glows in strategic directions controlled by a series of overhead ropes and pulleys that disappear behind the dark, backstage curtains.  A shiny silver plaque adorns the front of a podium to the right of the stage and a walkway leads up and out.

title: Fleurs' Glowing Goods, Western
description: A rosewood framed oil portrait hangs on one of the polished oak walls, and a varnished golden oak ceiling rises overhead.  Some puffed raw silk pillows sits in one corner of a polished oak floor.  There is a gilded maple cabinet on one side of the shop.

title: Fleurs' Glowing Goods, Eastern
description: Beneath a varnished golden oak ceiling, a tiny sand bottle display hangs on one of the polished oak walls.  A gilded maple cabinet and a frosted blush pink glass shoe display sit in opposite corners while a potted palm tree rests on a polished oak floor.

title: Scarletowl's Magic Shoppe
description: Beneath a low skylight-set ceiling, a pearl-handled filigreed mandolin hangs on one of the smooth mistwood walls.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet and a glass-covered box case sit in opposite corners while some puffed raw silk pillows rests on a colorful mosaic floor.

title: Scarletowl's Magic Shoppe
description: Beneath a smooth marble ceiling, a fused sun and moon wall-hanging hangs on one of the crumbling brick walls.  A carved haon armoire and a large carved haon counter sit in opposite corners while a set of terra cotta jugs rests on a warped driftwood floor.

title: The Non Prophet, Exports
description: Beneath an uneven wooden ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A glass-topped mistwood counter and a vine-carved mahogany table sit in opposite corners while a worn rug rests on an unfinished wooden floor.

title: The Non Prophet, Imports
description: Beneath an uneven wooden ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A simple wire frame mannequin and a vine-carved mahogany table sit in opposite corners while a pale green bamboo plant rests on an unfinished wooden floor.

title: The Anointed Blade, Vine Room
description: The broad sweep of the wooden floor is interrupted by some puffed raw silk pillows.  Halfway to the wooden ceiling, a detailed landscape painting hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet is pushed to the back of the shop.

title: The Anointed Blade, Thorn Room
description: Enclosed by plain wooden walls, the shop features a mound of silk-covered pillows in the center of its wooden floor.  A detailed landscape painting hangs under the wooden ceiling.  Right near the front is a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet.

title: Valaka Offerings
description: Plain wooden walls rise from a glossy mahogany floor.  Just above a pile of striped throw pillows hangs a blue watered silk tapestry, and a vaulted ceiling completes the picture.  A gilded maple table and a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Valaka Offerings
description: The broad sweep of the modwir floor is interrupted by a stuffed striped rolton.  Halfway to the beam ceiling, a rainbow colored flag hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A glass-topped mistwood counter and a gilded maple table are pushed close together in the back of the shop.

title: Museum of Fashion History
description: Similar to the previous room, tall glass cases are positioned at various points within the room.  Lacking windows, the ebonwood walls are adorned with swathes of silvery gossamer that contrast nicely against the dark hue of the wood.  Silvery undertones sweep the grey marble floors, designed to match not only the gossamer, but also the flickering silver sconces that line the walls.  An arch leads back to the beginning of the museum.

title: Lily Manor, Ballroom
description: Elongated abalone-framed windows line the pale maple walls of this spacious ballroom, their surfaces etched with plumes of floral-accented tracery.  Ornate glass-beaded candle fixtures are suspended at even intervals across the barrel-vaulted ceiling, bathing the room below in a warm, soothing lambency.  An artful mosaic of opaline moonstone tiles forms a stylized stargazer lily that blossoms at the center of the stark ivory marble floor.

title: Lily Manor, Event Hall
description: Accompanied by the subtle scent of lemon oil, the burgundy-draped hall is attended by a dozen neatly arranged round oaken tables.  Matching chairs surround each one, providing comfortable seating from which to observe a raised maple stage at the west end of the hall.  Dulcet lighting emanates from four sets of candelabra suspended from the dome ceiling, casting soft shadows on the pale gold carpet.  A modest selection of refreshments rests upon a hazelwood sidetable.

title: Barakan's Desert Sands
description: Enclosed by glossy mistwood walls, the shop features a woven rolton wool rug in the center of its strewn pine floor.  A pair of crossed bones hangs under the wooden ceiling.  Right near the front is a bamboo rack and a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet.

title: Barakan's Desert Sands
description: The broad sweep of the wooden floor is interrupted by a worn rug.  Halfway to the wooden ceiling, a portrait of Darkstone Castle hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A jewel-inlaid caddy and a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet are pushed close together in the back of the shop.

title: Barakan's Desert Sands
description: Plain wooden walls rise from an unfinished wooden floor.  Just above a worn rug hangs a tattered merchant permit, and an uneven wooden ceiling completes the picture.  A bamboo rack and an engraved copper bin stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Tykel's Arms, Rooftop
description: Citizens pass by below, moving among the multistoried wooden buildings and shops.  A dark alleyway separates the weapon store from the local bathhouse nearby.

title: Wehnimer's Landing, Rooftop
description: The tops of buildings stretch out across Wehnimer's Landing, dwarfed by the wooden palisade walls rising up to enclose the town.  Below the edge, a network of cobblestone roads winds between closely-spaced shops.

title: General Store, Rooftop
