description: Beyond the rooftop stretches the large intersection with South Ring Road, which many travelers and wagons still cross to reach the center of town square.  A few scorch marks run across the center of the old brown tiles.

title: Hendoran Outpost, War Room
description: The room is bare but for a long conference table and a number of chairs pushed under it while not in use.  Situated in the middle of the table is a map of Wehnimer's Landing and nearby environs.  Neatly lined up on one side of the map are a set of miniatures depicting Hendoran troops and potential enemies.  Near a small window rests an empty gilded birdcage.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Upper Hall
description: Two tall Imperial soldiers stand on either side of a set of large wooden doors engraved with a simplified version of the crest of North Hendor.  A hallway leads westward, while the wide stairwell offers an avenue by which to return to the first floor.  Next to each guard is a banner, one showing the crest of the Earl of North Hendor and the other stitched with the name of the House Andrews.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Upper Hall
description: A thick, but plain, carpet runs the length of the hallway, muffling sounds and offering some escape from the hard surface of the building's stone construction.  Two doors face each other, one to the south and the other to the north.  The northern door appears to have magical sigils carved into its surface and runes painted above the entryway.  The opposite, southern door is plain.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Upper Hall
description: A narrow window offers a view of the inner courtyard below and in case of emergency, an archer's perch for the determined defenders of the outpost.  The hallway is divided by a thick brown bearskin rug that runs its length, separating two sets of doors.  A single Hendoran guard stands sentry beside the iron-bound wooden doorway.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Rooftop
description: Stone ramparts line the entire perimeter of the rooftop, each section evenly spaced and fortified to allow equal protection and a staging ground for archers.  Rising from the center of the area is a crisp silver flag emblazoned with a silver phoenix and it flaps with the slightest of wind.  Beyond the highest point of the outpost, the grasslands stretch out far to the south before they disappear into the forest, and the palisade walls and buildings of Wehnimer's Landing expand to the north.

title: Hendoran Outpost, South Ward
description: Arched windows with narrow slits along each wall of this stone room provides ample line of sight on the environs surrounding the outpost.  Racks of spears and javelins are positioned near windows, and hooks jut out from the walls with quivers of arrows hanging from them.  Through the view of a window, a crisp blue banner embroidered with a silver phoenix flaps in the wind.

title: Hendoran Outpost, North Ward
description: Arched windows with narrow slits along each wall of this stone room provides ample line of sight on the environs surrounding the outpost.  Racks of spears and javelins are positioned near windows, and hooks jut out from the walls with quivers of arrows hanging from them.  Through the view of a window, a crisp blue banner embroidered with a silver phoenix flaps in the wind.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Feast Hall
description: A number of tables and chairs are set against the walls of the hall, waiting the next meal or well attended meeting.  At the end of the hallway is a wide stairwell with two Imperial soldiers standing sentry at its base.  Hendoran military banners decorate the stone walls along with flags of defeated enemies, a ragged Nalfein banner among them.

title: Outpost, Inner Courtyard
description: An imposing stone tower stands at the center of the inner courtyard, taking up the majority of the space.  Similar to the build of the rest of the outpost, the windows of the tower are narrow and better designed for arrows and defense than to offer light and a scenic view.  A wing extends from the tower's north side and soldiers continually file northward back and forth from it.

title: Outpost, Inner Courtyard
description: The entryway into the inner courtyard is a mirror image of the entryway into the outpost but constructed of stone.  The use of stone amplifies the sounds of the busy outer courtyard creating the sensation of immersion in the Hendoran presence in the north.  Arrow slits line the walls of the entryway and trapdoors, portals for boiling oil, gaze down from the ceiling.

title: Light of the Godking
description: A warm halo of sunlight filters through the crystalline dome above, each facet of the glass casting a bright golden mosaic along the textured stone floor.  The smooth stone walls of the shrine are enameled with the image of a large golden crown.  A track of worn, ashen grey carpet begins at the double doors and divides the chamber until ending just before a wide stone dais.  Upon the raised platform is a high altar crafted from blood marble, its soft white surface speckled with sanguine motes.

title: Outpost, Inner Courtyard
description: Soldiers sit and stand about the courtyard.  Many are engaged in time wasting activities, reading pamphlets and letters, tossing dice, and whittling pieces of wood.  Others quietly polish their equipment or chitchat about the nearby town or loved ones back home.  A squat wood building, a smaller version of one in the courtyard is built at the edge of the space.

title: Outpost, Inner Courtyard
description: The thick aroma of grilled fish lingers in the air of the inner courtyard near a separate stone building immediately adjacent to the tower.  A covered well is placed in the center of the space and is accompanied by stores for food, such as sacks of oats, and other supplies constructed to hug the inner stone wall's surface.  Hendoran auxiliaries come and go carrying food into the keep or bringing back used plates and containers.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Library
description: The room is small, but filled with a number of book-laden shelves.  Several simple wooden chairs, which fill the room with the scent of fresh construction, offer sitting spaces for those wishing to partake in the library's offering.  A writing desk is set to one side with a stack of clean papers, inkwells, and quills, a station for soldiers wishing to write home to loved ones.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Alchemist
description: A thick wooden table sits beneath a wide wood-framed blackboard and dominates the center of the room, where it is surrounded by a number of locked chests and trunks, many of them labeled with the crest of the Hall of Mages.  Large curtains flank an arched rune-etched window, allowing for the quick extinguishing of light, while numerous candles in various states of melted usage perch from precarious places throughout the room.  The faint aroma of sulphur and herbs lingers in the air of the area.

title: Irregulars Barracks, Mess Hall
description: Six long tables flanked by benches span the length of the room, and the heavy aroma of roasted meat and vegetables permeates the air.  A large sideboard boasts an impressive array of foods and desserts, as well as a rhimar ice bucket containing the chilled beverages.  Hanging on the farthest wall are two paintings.  A pair of large double doors lead out to the courtyard.

title: Irregulars Barracks, War Room
description: This is a large and spacious room, well-lit by numerous spherical iron lanterns hanging from the walls.  Dominating the room is a round red mahogany table, its lustre catching the ambient light and reflecting it.  Matching chairs surround the table, and the walls are papered with maps of the local wilds.  A smooth teak ladder in the west corner of the room disappears through a dark trapdoor in the ceiling.

title: Irregulars Barracks, Dormitory
description: This room is oblong and spacious.  Below a gilt-framed detailed painting, a stone and oak fireplace dominates the north wall, providing warmth to the living quarters.  Overfilled bookcases line the western wall, and a few tables and chairs occupy the floor nearby.  Neatly arranged bunk beds form two rows along the northern wall, each with a heavy foot locker at the end, providing storage for those who reside here.

title: Barracks, Banquet Hall
description: Natural light pours through lancet windows set along the southern wall, transformed into myriad shades of color by the intricate stained glass mosaics of each.  Thick timbers run the length of the ceiling, adding contrast to the warm stone of the walls.  Opposite a long banquet table ringed with lacquered chairs is a small stage framed in grey velvet curtains.  The wide-planked fel floors are polished to a high gloss, reflecting light from wrought-iron chandeliers above.

title: Irregulars Barracks, Offices
description: Several mismatched desks with high leather-backed chairs sit in the center of this small room, arranged to face each other.  A large leaded glass window on the south wall affords a view of the courtyard.  A tall modwir cabinet containing several drawers stands to the side of a large brass door.

title: Irregulars Barracks, Rooftop
description: Abutted against the town wall, the roof of the barracks is at the perfect height to peer over the top of the palisade down to the western road and the forests beyond.  Faint sounds of waves emanate from the dark bay to the northwest, and the combined scents of salt and loam permeate the surrounding air.  A rough teak trapdoor leads back down into the barracks.

title: Wadsworth's General Store
description: The broad sweep of the black marble floor is interrupted by a sphere-topped black marble fountain.  Halfway to the golden oak ceiling, an ancient Tehiri ritual mask hangs on one of the smooth granite walls.  A beveled glass-covered case and a massive granite chest are pushed close together in the back of the shop.

title: Wadsworth's Weaponry
description: Smooth granite walls rise from a speckled black marble floor.  Just above a tiered alabaster fountain hangs an Arkati pantheon painting, and a varnished golden oak ceiling completes the picture.  A glaes-covered ebony display case and a brass treasure chest stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Wadsworth's Weaponry
description: Enclosed by smooth granite walls, the shop features a grey-veined white marble fountain in the center of its black marble floor.  An ornately rendered clan crest hangs under the golden oak ceiling.  Right near the front is a heavy lead glass display case and a giant invar-bound chest.

title: Crystal Clove, Sovyn Shrine
description: Beneath a high solid white ceiling set with a large circular skylight, a Liabo and Lornon painting hangs on one of the smooth white monir walls.  A tall light oak bookshelf and a wide light oak altar covered with a pristine white linen cloth sit in opposite corners while a large silver and white oval rug woven with a clasped-hands design rests on a silver-veined white marble floor.

title: Crystal Clove, Arkati Armory
description: A midnight-hued stained glass mosaic hangs on one of the weathered mistwood plank walls, and a tall wide-beamed ceiling rises overhead.  A pair of combat-locked statues sits in one corner of a distressed dark oak floor.  There is some polished black ash shelves on one side of the shop and some dark grey glaes display hooks on the other.

title: Crystal Clove, Healing Touch
description: A long beech mantel topped with various ointment jars and bandages hangs on one of the faewood-framed clear glass walls, and an arched glass ceiling rises overhead.  An oversized flower pot sits in one corner of a sandstone tiled floor.  There is a tall faewood cabinet on one side of the shop and a spacious silvery beech counter on the other.

title: House Sovyn, Herb Garden
description: A stone walkway weaves its way from the nearby pond and comes to an end at the foot of a large herb garden.  A narrow stone path loops around the garden, with several beds of herbs and flowers surrounding the outer perimeter.  At each corner of the garden, nestled within the plants, is an elegant marble fountain.  Inside the looping path and standing at the center of the garden is a towering faewood tree.  A trio of wooden statues stand at the base of the tree and are surrounded by numerous tiny flowers.

title: House Sovyn, Empath's Lounge
description: In this bright, airy room, a feeling of peace overcomes you.  Some soft comfortable-looking pillows are scattered across the floor near a window looking into the gardens.  Resting above the mantle of a fieldstone fireplace you notice an oddly compelling painting.  An old maoral wooden medicine cabinet stands in one corner of the room.

title: Acantha Table
description: Light filters through the greenery and onto the table.  A hand-painted pot with a flourishing acantha plant decorates the square marble top.  Soft embroidered pillows cushion the surrounding chairs.

title: Imaera Table
description: An ecru tapestry beautifully embroidered with a fruit harvest design covers this table.  A delicate hand-carved image of the goddess Imaera is upon it.  The cushions on the surrounding chairs are hand-stitched with images of plants and wild flowers.

title: Praying Cleric Table
description: The crisp white cloth looks even brighter as it reflects the light that floods through the glass walls.  A hand-carved figure of a kneeling cleric is on the table facing the sunrise, arms outstretched to embrace the morning light.

title: Woth Flower Table
description: A potted, blooming woth plant decorates the small square table.  The medicinal flowers brighten this corner of the room with their delicate violet petals.  The surrounding tapestry chairs are embroidered with leaves and flowers from the same plant.

title: Healer Table
description: Blue scroll embroidery runs along the edge of the white tablecloth.  A hand-carved miniature of a healer kneeling beside a wounded man to tend his wounds decorates the round table.  The tapestry upholstered chairs are also embroidered with the same scroll design.

title: Pan's Place, Low Room
description: A low ceiling painted in exquisite natural colors adorns this room.  A skylight set with panes of clear mica lets in the light to nurture the plants and flowers that line the panelled walls.  Several unpretentious chairs face the warm, inviting hearth of a brick fireplace in the east wall.  Against the opposite wall, a leather sofa with plump cushions beckons, a tempting spot to doze in front of the fire while contemplating esoteric matters.

metadata.source: Pan's Place, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Pan's Enchanting Chamber
description: The walls in this high chamber are painted pure white, but here and there they are scarred with burn marks, acid splotches and traces of powerful reagents and catalysts, as though some of the procedures undertaken did not turn out quite as expected.  The west wall is almost totally covered with a sprawling mural, a swirl of bright images.  A single titanium table stands in the middle of the room, heaped with scrolls and notebooks.

metadata.source: Pan's Place, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Pan's Place, Hidden Garden
description: A constellation of candles in punched metal holders illuminates the narrow garden beside the cooper's shop and the brewery, dappling the grey field stone path and sparkling off the water of a winding stream.  The stream traces the course of the Locksmehr River in miniature, its banks verdant with native rushes and ferns.  A stately oak tree surrounded by a collection of exotic plants stands in the west where Wehnimer's Landing would be on the real river.  To the east, a somnolent buzz points the way to a hidden apiary.

title: Pan's Place, Smuggler's Cavern
description: The faint scent of sea air suggests the far end of this tunnel opens somewhere along Darkstone Bay, but only someone who knew the path well would brave the branching passageways.  A subterranean waterfall conceals a dogleg turn that widens out into a natural chamber.  Within the vaulted chamber, sealed display cases hold delicate treasures, while gold and silver baubles cover the floor in glittering drifts.  A dip in the floor holds a pool of coins that would be deep enough for swimming if the pit were filled with water.

title: House Sovyn, Cleric's Lounge
description: Quietness and meditation prevail here in this simple room.  A mural on the eastern wall depicts the gods of light while the west mural is dedicated to the gods of darkness.  Chairs are arranged about the room so that one can rest facing one's particular deity.  Standing in a corner of the room is an altar of modwir wood with two fragrant candles at either end and a golden bowl in the center.

title: House Sovyn, Gilwen's Room
description: The room is simply furnished with a four-poster bed piled with pillows and a spread of purple silk.  An amethyst vase filled with violets sits on the night table, beside a prayer book.  In a corner, a steaming bath smells of lavender and scented herbs.

title: Ebonstone, Wintertide Suite
description: Glass icicles hang from branches of miniature evergreen trees growing in planter boxes on each side of a wall-to-wall glass window,  the effect creating a framed portrait of an artist-rendered view of the Manor grounds beyond.  Stretched out in front of a stone fireplace, a snowy white fur rug brushes against the tapered legs of a pair of overstuffed white leather chairs, each draped with a snowflake-patterned quilt.  A heavy slate blackboard hangs above a polished spruce-carved writing desk next to a curtained opening.

title: Paupers, Sacrament Chamber
description: Tarnished silver candelabra occupy each corner of the chamber, their fires flickering and casting dancing shadows in every direction.  One whole wall is constructed out of translucent glaes, and near the center of the room an old summoning circle has been carved into the floor, accented with dried bloodstains.  The skeletal remains of a humanoid are wedged firmly into a massive indent in one wall, and a cracked crystal shard rests at its feet.

title: Silvergate, Receiving Room
description: Rich rugs with exotic patterns cover the slate floor, and an overstuffed couch flanked by leather wing chairs is drawn up to the massive stone fireplace.  The walls are paneled in antique cherrywood and hung with fine tapestries depicting heroic battles.

title: Silvergate, Workshop
description: An array of crystals hangs from the ceiling of this room and dazzles you with a rainbow of lights.  As your eyes slowly adjust, you see that they are reflecting the light from the full height windows spaced around the walls of this tower room.  Blinking to clear the last of the stars from your eyes, you notice a circular workbench set in the center of the room.

title: Silvergate, A Narrow Hallway
description: You can barely see a dark opening in the wall next to you, although dim light filters in from underneath a door at the end of the hallway.  The air feels charged with powerful energies, and the musical sound of chimes rings distantly.

title: Ebonstone Manor, Office
description: Gilt-edged frames filled with awards and commendations line the wall behind a large marble-topped desk.  Three crystalline chandeliers hang from the high ceiling, and a brass-banded trunk flanks one side of an ebonwood door.  Stretching from one side of the room to the other, a plush mountain snowcat fur rug covers the polished hardwood floor and offers a cozy respite.

title: Bard Guild, Backstage
description: The backstage area is crowded with scenery flats and miscellaneous props and furnishings.  Overhead, a lattice of catwalks, from which hangs a number of ropes and pulleys, crisscrosses in a dizzy pattern.  Along one wall, beside the fly gallery and the pin rail, an open painted door leads into a vestibule.  A wooden door with a sign on it proclaiming it to be the dressing room nestles in the corner.

title: Bard Guild, Vestibule
description: The vestibule is just large enough to hold a small armchair and still allow space for a door on the west wall leading backstage, and one to the north which leads through a short corridor to the auditorium.  A rug covers the tiled floor, woven with a pattern of interlocking lyres.

title: Bard Guild, Corridor
description: Cloaked in shadow and muted by a thick carpet runner extending along its length, the long hallway features a vaulted ceiling and dark wood-paneled walls.  Its somber atmosphere is anything but quiet, however, as strains of music and snippets of melody create an impromptu backdrop.  Their tones are muffled and the rhythms are haphazard as musicians and singers practice their craft behind closed doors in adjacent chambers.  A sign on a mahogany door reads "Hall of the Ancient Instruments".

title: Bard Guild, Fest Hall
description: The expansive hall is a beamed chamber with paneled walls, their polished wood peeking out from behind a wealth of tapestries hanging on all sides.  Groupings of chairs and stools sit in an array, overshadowed by a large, circular sofa occupying the room's center.  An imposing carved marble bust overlooks all, perched on the pedestal created by the plush sofa's crimson velvet back-cushions.

title: Bard Guild, Corridor
description: Midway down the long hall, a carved wooden arch opens on the east wall.  From there, the chinks of plates and glasses give hints there is a pub at hand.  Delicious aromas of baking bread and roasting meat extend nigh-irresistible invitations to step inside.  Along the walls of the corridor are hung tapestries depicting groups of musicians performing in towns as well as serenading more pastoral denizens in woodland settings.

title: Bard Guild, Corridor
description: The hall stops before a large oak door, with a second almost identical door to the west.  To the east, a flight of steps descends a short distance to a landing below, where a brightly embroidered cloth banner over the doorway reads "Guild Office."

title: Bard Guild, Entryway
description: Halos of light shine from a sconce hanging overhead with ruby red glass enclosing its light source.  The entry is shadowed, its high ceiling lost in gloom and surrounded by dark wood walls with heavily carved bas-relief surfaces.  A stairway leads down with barely enough light to illuminate the carpeted stairs and curved wooden banister, and from below, strains of music drift up in disjointed fragments, like spirits climbing out of the depths.

title: Bard Guild, Practice Room
description: The practice room is small, its walls paneled in dark wood that enhances the quiet ambiance.  The scent of aged wood and years of polish hang heavily in the air, paired with a slight tinge of mustiness, the trademark aroma of older buildings.  Other than a small hearth with a carved mantel on the south wall, the chamber's only furnishings are a chair and a music stand with a lyre-shaped top.

title: Bard Guild, Practice Room
description: The practice room is small and cozy.  A hearth on the west wall offers the company of a cheerful blaze to musicians laboring to please the exacting expectations of their muse.  A chair and music stand provide the chamber's only additional accoutrements.

title: Hall of Ancient Instruments
description: The chamber is redolent with the ambiance of history and art.  Its tall, dark wood walls stand guard over two rows of pedestals facing each other, like queues of dancers lined up for a minuet.  On each of the stands rests a musical instrument, obviously all very old and exquisitely crafted.  Sconces are hung, positioned over the instruments and cleverly crafted to cast a soft halo of light around the priceless artifacts they spotlight.

title: Bard Guild, Taproom Pub
description: Dark wood walls and a low, carved ceiling create a cozy atmosphere in the Bard Hall's pub.  In the room's center is a hearth, open on three sides and filled with a crackling fire that provides both warmth and an aura of companionability.  Small lanterns placed on the few tables twinkle their low light like tiny beacons, reflecting off the highly polished wood of a long bar running the length of the east wall.

title: Taproom Pub, Windrover Table
description: The table is comfortably large and oval in shape.  Its top is beautifully inlaid with a pattern of wind instruments fashioned from the tiny bits of wood.  Beneath, the table's pedestal is carved in the likeness of a set of large panpipes, the longer of the tubes supporting the table's weight.  A small lantern sits on the top, throwing out a merry twinkle from its sapphire-tinted glass sides.

title: Taproom Pub, Stringdancer Table
description: The table is made of teak and its circular top is elegantly carved, depicting the curve of violin necks, the arch of lutes and other graceful instruments played by the caress of a bow.  Below, the pedestal flares as it nears the floor, decorated with black-tinted pegs, as though the structure would need a tuning now and then.  A lantern in the center of the top bears crossed bows above its lyre-shaped base.

title: Taproom Pub, Drumsong Table
description: The Drumsong table has been carved to resemble a large kettledrum, its head fitted with maple in place of skin.  Small drums of various types are depicted in a ring around the edge, all fashioned of tiny pieces of inlaid wood.  A lantern occupies the table's center, casting a cheerful glow through its ruby-stained glass sides.

title: House Brigatta, Kitchen
description: Down a short corridor waits the bustling kitchen, busy with scullery maids and cooks preparing the daily meals.  Doors open at the far end lead out into the garden for harvesting herbs and vegetables, and the back wall is dominated by massive riverstone ovens, set with clay brick trivets, glowing with the fragrant fire from local applewood.  Cupboards and shelves are filled with neatly labeled supplies, and near the entry is a black cast iron stove and a polished copper kettle, for brewing various beverages.

title: House Brigatta, Secret Tunnel
description: The tunnel is quite dry and has a hard dirt floor.  It ends against a blank wall with no way to get out.  At the other end is a curtained opening.

title: House Brigatta, Lockers
description: This room is small and cramped.

title: Private Suite, Alcove
description: Nestled away from the main suite, most of the small alcove is shrouded in darkness.  Two round silver sconces cause shadows to flicker across an array of wooden doors.  A few wisps of steam creep out from beneath a thick black velvet curtain.

title: Stone Baths, Private Suite
description: A soft murmur fills the room as a few patrons mill about, their footfalls dampened by the plush midnight green carpeting.  Bronze half-moon wall sconces project light towards the ceiling, bathing the room in a muted glow.  A white-robed elven attendant stands behind a dark maple desk, occasionally scribbling something on a small stack of parchments.  Spaced evenly around the room are number of large cabinets filled with towels.

title: Stone Baths, Siren Suite
description: The scent of lavender lingers in the air, the source being several dried stalks that have been placed in delicate blown glass vases set around the room.  The stone walls are covered with silken tapestries depicting various scenes of women in repose, while a tiled fireplace along the back wall serves as the focal point for a half ring of overstuffed sofas and divans.  Plush, pale violet carpeting rests beneath the furniture, and a curtained archway to the northeast exudes a floral aroma.

title: Stone Baths, Patron Suite
description: Rich grey-toned walls encompass the men's suite while midnight blue carpeting stretches across the entire floor.  A ring of high-backed chairs occupies the middle of the room with wooden drink stands positioned between each seat.  From behind a marble countertop, a burly human man greets guests while smoke trails up from his thick cigar.

title: House Phoenix, Lockers
description: A stone counter, chipped and scratched, fills half of this small cubicle.  A delicately scented candle cannot disguise the sour smell of mildew.  An airtight, waterproof locker awaits you on the counter.

title: Ebonstone Manor, House Clerk
description: Centered in front of a circular stained glass window, a high-backed leather chair rests behind a mahogany desk crowded with letters and empty teacups.  A sparrow trills inside a brass filigree cage prominently displayed atop a bookshelf, the leather-bound volumes within embossed with gold lettering on the spines.  Across from an arched opening, an illuminated globe of Elanthia casts a radiant blue light across the pale white marble floor.

title: Stone Baths, Office
description: Faint light from outside barely shines through thick opaque windows set high into a wall, casting shadows into a corner.  Hanging brass lanterns emit a soft glow, distributing additional light throughout the office.  A great ebony desk stretches between a lacquered bookshelf and a tall brass-trimmed door.  Two cushioned armchairs rest in the center of the room and a massive woven tapestry covers an entire wall.

title: Patron Suite, Oils
description: The area is infused with a variety of aromas, ranging from musky colognes to flavorful perfumes.  Small windows above provide escape for the oily scents.  Two burnished dark mahogany tables run parallel in the center of the room, each holding a variety of oil pots.

title: Patron Suite, Cold Bath
description: Cold marble floors surround a row of circular pools of still water, their icy temperature chilling the entire chamber.  Tall wooden racks rest in each corner, holding a variety of towels and robes. Light from nearby brass lanterns cast a soft glow in the room.

title: Patron Suite, Hot Bath
description: An immense pool of steaming water dominates most of the room, easily accessible by flat limestone steps.  Long wooden towel racks are mounted on the walls and the air is muggy, yet holds the faint scent of sandalwood.

title: Patron Suite, Steam Room
description: Centered in the vaulted room is a black iron-wrought brazier, where thick steam rises up from hot rocks placed inside. The floor is made of smoothed grey marble and moisture clings to its surface.  A row of sturdy granite benches line each wall, broken up only by a dark mahogany door.

title: Siren Suite, Oils
description: Moonlight from the open windows set high above filters down to the soft emerald-hued rug that covers the stone floor with its luxuriously plush surface.  A long, rose-carved table wraps around three walls of the room, its surface laden with various jars.  Strong scents waft into the air, but a gentle breeze from above keeps the fragrance from becoming overpowering.

title: Siren Suite, Hot Bath
description: The room is almost entirely comprised of a large pool of steaming water, set into the warm stone floor.  Slate steps lead down from all four sides of the pool, while benches under the water's surface serve as comfortable places to relax.  Several glass-paneled oil lanterns hang from the stone walls, releasing a mild soothing fragrance.  Near an engraved wooden door, robes and clothes hang upon some metal hooks.

title: Siren Suite, Steam Room
description: Stone walls encapsulate this large room, and benches of the same material seem to reach up from the floor to beckon weary visitors to rest.  Steam rises from the circular stone pit in the center of the room, created from water poured over the blazing hot rocks inside.  Hooks and shelves on the wall near the engraved wooden door serve to hold the clothing and belongings of bathers, and floral scented oil lanterns hang high above the floor, bathing the room in a flickering glow.

title: Siren Suite, Cold Bath
description: This room holds a chill as the water from the bath evaporates into the air.  No steam wafts up from the surface of the water in the rounded pool.  Benches, both underwater and against the walls, serve as seating for the room.  Oil lanterns that hang from hooks in the wall release the aroma of rain and ozone, the subtle scents giving the room an energizing ambiance.  A shelf near the curved wooden door offers its surface for bather's belongings.

title: Private Suite, Steam Room
description: A speckled marble floor extends across the room, enclosed by four smooth light wood-paneled walls.  Rows of black granite benches form a semi-circle around two large bronze braziers,  steam rising from the heated rocks within.

title: Wehnimer's Cobbling Shop
description: The interior of the small shop is rustic, without much decoration save for a few examples of local craftsmanship displayed in the front window.  A long wide counter runs the length of the room with numerous bolts of fabric chromatically stacked behind it.  Adjacent to the counter is a rack of glass drawers, each one revealing glimpses of colorful buttons and buckles.  A clerk moves casually near three stands, draping fresh hides over their surface.

title: Greystorm Manor, Courtyard
description: A tall mithril gate marks the threshold of a lush, verdant courtyard surrounded by a stately flagstone wall.  Moss, lichens, and lacy green fronds drape over the wall in a gentle welcome into a serene oasis shielded from the bustle of town.  A vine-covered alcove surrounds a marble statue.  Stone pavers traverse through the lawn and spiral around a beautiful marble fountain in the center of the luxuriant grounds.  The path continues toward an expansive grey stone manor, shadowed by the branches of an old knotted oak tree.

metadata.source: Greystorm Manor, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Greystorm Manor, Great Room
description: The room is comfortably furnished and generous in size, with floors of polished oak and large windows that bathe the room in moonlight.  Several leather chairs and end tables have been casually arranged in small groups around the room, and a dark wood-paneled bar rests along a wall.  An imposing stone fireplace stands at the far end of the room, with a carved scarlet-plumed owl perched on the mantel and the Greystorm coat of arms hanging from a tapestry above.  Two overstuffed cognac leather armchairs sit angled before a bear skin rug and the stone hearth.  A curved dark-stained staircase leads up to a rune-inlaid archway.

metadata.source: Greystorm Manor, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Greystorm Manor, Study
description: The expansive study is lined with recessed bookshelves from the floor to the ceiling.  Several sliding ladders provide access to the tall shelves filled with books and scrolls.  A large oak work table occupies the center of the room, scattered with potions and scribble-filled notebooks.  The stars and moon in the night sky provide barely enough light to navigate the room.

metadata.source: Greystorm Manor, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Greystorm Manor, Banquet Hall
description: The room has high vaulted ceilings and large arched windows that allow the moonlight to illuminate the room.  A polished oak credenza is filled with a bounty of freshly prepared fare.  In the center of the room is a long oak banquet table lined with rich velvet-upholstered chairs.  Elegant silk tapestries are mounted along the walls of the room.

metadata.source: Greystorm Manor, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Greystorm Manor, Gardens
description: Rife with vibrant colored blooms, the garden has been designed and manicured with expert care.  Meandering paths weave between colorful flowerbeds and circle the trunks of flowering fruit trees.  Near the center of the garden, an ornately carved stone bench sits next to a small pond.  The surface of the pond is dotted with large water flowers, but occasional ripples reveal the presence of fish and other water-loving creatures.  A vine-covered carved stone stairway with flowering terraces leads to the moonlit rooftop.

metadata.source: Greystorm Manor, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Greystorm Manor, Terrace
description: The rooftop terrace looks out over the luxurious gardens behind the manor and provides an expansive view of the town and the bay.  Large grey paving stones tile the terrace, which is dotted by beautifully groomed shrubs.  Carved stone benches are placed throughout the garden and around a large iron firepit.  A large arched trellis covered in green foliage and tiny purple flowers offers an inviting place to dance or relax under the stars.  In the far corner of the terrace sits a large brass-fitted telescope.

metadata.source: Greystorm Manor, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Sylvanfair, Wizard's Library
description: What a clutter!  Stacks of odd baubles and weirdness abound.  A flame-red curtain hangs across one corner of the room, and odd pulses of light periodically flash across the ceiling.  A pillar of water flows perpetually into the tree from a strange contraption, bringing nourishment to the roots.  Exploring the rest of the library could take years, considering the sheer bulk of odds and ends scattered about.

title: Sylvanfair, Magical Workshop
description: You can feel the magic in the air in this room.  The walls are bare here, even of bark -- the ironwood walls have been blasted clean by past accidents.  A large workbench fashioned from the same ironwood as the walls contains all manner of vials, jars, and papers.

title: Sylvanfair, Summoning Chamber
description: Nestled deep below the trunk of the great tree, this extraordinary chamber exudes a tangible sense of living energy.  Enormous, gnarled roots hold back the sooty earth, glowing eerily with sparse pockets of phosphorescent lichen.  Shadowy nooks and crannies disappear between the roots into inky blackness, hinting at unseen secrets.  Intricate arcane runes have been painstakingly etched upon nearly every exposed surface of the chamber.

title: Sylvanfair, Secret Passageway
description: A roughly excavated tunnel ends here at the back of a heavy wooden bookcase.  Thick, tangled roots crisscross the earthen passageway as it spirals down into darkness.

title: House Sylvanfair, Red Lair
description: Stalactites and stalagmites are scattered about this cavernous chamber within the great trunk, and small glowing veins of mithril and ruby criss-cross the walls, floor and ceiling.  Dwarven-made tools hang suspended from a wooden rack fastened above a small forge.  A trickle of water spills from a hole in one wall, cascading down to disappear into a drain in the floor.  A rainbow of sparkling light reflects off of the miniature waterfall, rewarding your eyes with a dazzling display of color.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Tome Gallery
description: Towering stone shelves have been formed into the very walls of the room, each one occupied by dozens of leather-bound tomes and thick volumes.  Attached to the corners of every book is a mithril chain, keeping the manuscripts never far from their respective spots.  Two slate-topped round tables are positioned in the center of the room, each brightly illuminated by a glowing glaes orb positioned in the ceiling above.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Laboratory
description: Faint shimmering wards run along the black walls of this circular laboratory, while the dark ceiling stretches to a high apex of opaque glass windows which allow for a warm glow from the moon to bleed through.  Situated in one corner is a polished drakar-inlaid crucible, just opposite of a slate-topped workbench.  Two large bookshelves stand like wooden sentinels on each side of a rune-carved steel door.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Barracks
description: Row upon row of bunk beds fills the large room.  Empty beds are neatly made while a few have sleeping Hendorans occupying them recovering from overnight patrols or guard duty.  Racks for armor and gear stand beside every set of beds offering ready access to their wearers.  At one end of the hallway is a letter writing station.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Lower Hall
description: A narrow hallway, underneath the stairwell of the hall, runs north and south.  The sounds of a busy military barrack filter in from the south, while the savory scents of cooking float in from the north.  A single barrel of water is set against the wall.

title: Outpost, Latrine
description: A short wood bench takes up the majority of the space in this small building.  Two holes have been cut in the bench and a stack of old newspapers sits neatly by the entrance.  The smell of fresh hay fills the room.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Kitchen
description: The kitchen is a place of constant movement as the Hendoran cooks and staff continues a dance of constant clean up and preparation for the meals to feed their armed counterparts.  Rich and savory smells flow from various boiling pots and several spits of meat slowly being rotated by small cogs in wheels built next to the kitchen's fires.  Occasionally, an auxiliary disappears with a large plate of food and returns later balancing a number of wooden plates.

title: Hendoran Outpost, Cellar
description: Casks of wine and crates of food are stacked neatly in every corner of the large cellar, and more than a few old dirty footprints are scattered about the earthen ground.  A lit torch protrudes from a wall, throwing a cascade of light and shadows across the area.

title: The Blue Phoenix Pub
description: Grey brick walls comprise the foundation of the spacious tavern, where oak tables and chairs are set up around the common area.  A plump boar is set near a large red brick fireplace, the roaring flames roasting the pig and warming the tavern.  Mounted on a far wall is a huge silver tapestry depicting the image of a rising blue phoenix.  From behind a brass-railed countertop, a scar-faced bartender pours drinks for the guests.

title: Ravenswood, Clearing
description: A grove of old poplar trees lift graceful boughs in an attitude of spiritual meditation.  Cabins sit beneath the branches, graced by the eloquence of the trees.  The paths leading toward the buildings are carpeted in bright leaves, making the ways a patterned carpet of color, as subtle as it is beautiful.

title: Ravenswood, Mausoleum
description: An overgrown mausoleum of flat grey stone dominates the area.  Shadows cling to it like terrified children to their mother, and a few brave plants climb up the walls in a quest to get closer to the sun.  Sitting atop the tomb is an immense raven, glaring down on everyone with unbiased irritation.

title: Ravenswood, Spring
description: A deep, cold pool sits in the middle of a clearing, like a spider in the center of her web.  Dense, lush banks of ferns stretch up from the banks to the feet of quiet residences, their facades as silent as the still water.  Birds occasionally wing through the still grotto, silent as if mindful of the shadowy ambiance.

title: Ravenswood, Yew Garden
description: The ancient trees populating the garden are obviously much older than the park itself.  Branches grow down to the ground, forming attendant yews around a central ancestor.  Legend holds that the yew grows a root into the open mouth of each corpse buried around it.  The garden's rampant growth is disturbing in that context.

title: Silvergate Inn, Art Studio
description: Circular stone steps lead into a room with picture windows set in ivory-painted walls which flood the room with light.  One floor-to-ceiling window opens onto a balcony overlooking a garden.  A large platform holding a velvet-draped divan and a carved teak chair sits before a frame which holds rolled up canvas backdrops.  Shelves holding finished works line the walls and a tall cabinet filled with painting supplies behind glass doors is shoved to one side next to a sturdy worktable.

title: Rogue Guild, Workshop Toolbench
description: The worn weathered surface of the toolbench carries its history of generations of training craftsmen.  Small files and drills lay stacked neatly at one end, while blank scraps are piled at the other.  A small pattern of grooves and scratches leaves the evidence of its constant use.

title: A Dark Corner
description: This dark corner is far enough away from the bustle of the courtyard to provide a little peace and quiet...perfect for reflection and training.

title: Silvergate, Rovvigen's Room
description: Overlapping rugs cover the floor, and sheer drapery canopies overhead flow down the walls in an ethereal haze.  Large cushions are arranged around a small, round table holding a softly glowing orb.  Above a carved stone fireplace that dominates one wall hangs a silver-gilt painting.  In one far corner, a silver scythe encased in a crystal sphere rests atop a stone pedestal.  A faewood curio cabinet's paned glass reflects the ambient light off tiny crystals strung among the canopy overhead.

title: Silvergate, Golden Rose Spa
description: Luxurious silk and velvet divans rest in a half-circle by a set of glass double doors.  White cedar shelves circle the room above gold-washed drawers.  Silk screens painted with golden roses upon wandering vines provide privacy in the treatment areas.  A padded table with pillows and a blanket rests beside a large white porcelain basin set atop a cabinet.  A full length tri-fold mirror with a small stool before it stands in the corner near a golden door, a dressmaker's mannequin waiting nearby.

title: Temple, Dais
description: This dais sits at the end of the Hall of Sacrifice.  A large fountain has been built here which sits flush with the wall above a simple altar.  At the moment, the fount is quietly burbling while reflecting the bronze hues from the flickering candelabras stationed on either side of the fount and altar.

title: Black Hand, Old Warehouse
description: The large double sliding doors open to a poorly lit warehouse with a thick cedar floor covered with dust and scuff marks.  Stacks of crates and boxes occupy several marked locations on the floor, designated for storage and delivery.  Near the rear wall is a simple wooden desk covered in piles of stained paper.

title: Black Hand, Foyer
description: The focal point of the expansive room is a swirled sanguine glaes chandelier, the dim candlelight illuminating the cavern.  Draped decoratively across the walls is tone-on-tone ivory bourde, the fabric framing a black willow sideboard.  Various tunnels allow further passage into the cave, and at each entrance, two large charcoal velvet armchairs sit opposite from each other.  Etched vaalin sconces line the winding slate stone steps as they continue downwards.

title: Black Hand, Grotto
description: A cool draft occasionally permeates the dark stone walls lined with torches, their disturbed flames casting sinister shadows against the barrel vault ceiling.  Some warcat skin rugs cover the cold stone floor to offer some semblance of comfort around a large obsidian table naturally formed out of the ground, the piece flanked by some dark ash chairs.

title: Black Hand, Brewery
description: The air is slightly damp, the silence of the rocky chamber broken by the quiet sound of water dripping far off in the distance.  A tremendous copper drum rises from the floor in the center of the room, tapering to a rounded peak near the ceiling to form a massive still.  Old, iron-banded vats line the walls, forming two rows of oak aisles among the space.  Off to the side, an ebonwood table holds some corked bottles of pale liquid, while a charcoal marble fireplace provides the only light in the space.

title: Black Hand, Draccor's Haunt
description: The energy of the cavern echoes off the walls as patrons are camouflaged under a thick haze of hazelnut cigar smoke.  Sanguine leather bar stools line a sturdy ebonwood bar that curves outward to provide ample room behind the bar for shelves of various liquor from across Elanthia.  The expansive floor plan opens up to reveal a dart board, which receives the only splash of light in the grotto.  A dimly lit inlet in the rock houses a series of sleek cream leather booths creating an intimate atmosphere.

title: Black Hand, Docks
description: The dark cavern's cool air carries a musty scent of damp wood and stone.  Torches along the rough stone walls offer just enough flame to blacken the craggy ceiling above them.  Obsidian black water surrounds a pair of weathered wooden docks that terminate at large fel-framed doors crudely carved into the cavern wall.  An old, tethered rowboat facing the cavern mouth occasionally draws near its anchor post and knocks against it.

title: Black Hand, Kitchen
description: A swinging fel door affords entry into a spacious kitchen, its walls lined with rich mahogany cupboards filled with black glaes dishware, bottles and jars.  The black marble countertops are laden with heavy maoral cutting boards and razor-sharp knives.  Dominating one entire wall is a large bookcase with rows and rows of dusty and worn books.  A gilt-framed picture hangs slightly askew next to the bookcase.

title: Black Hand, Supply Room
description: A plush velvet charcoal sofa wraps around the cavern walls, and large pieces of aubergine ramie silk drape down from the ceiling providing a pop of color and texture to the room.  Spaced evenly in front of the long sofa are rounded glaes tables etched with a tessellated pattern.  Carved into the far wall is a huge steel vault, gems and coins scattered across the stone floor in front.  Silhouettes of different shapes fill the lounge, the shadows dancing in the warm flicker of some vaalin sconces.

title: Black Hand, Botanist Lab
description: The faint smells of tobacco, vanilla, and flora intoxicate the area.  Water tumbles down the eastern side of the cave's wall in a cascading miniature waterfall that forms into a pool surrounded by an array of wildflowers and moss.  A series of intertwining ivy stretches towards a single burst of moonlight that streams through a hole in the ceiling bathing the garden.  Shelves that have been carved into the rock hold an array of vials and flasks, while a burnished kakore table sits off to the corner.

title: Black Hand, Pantry
description: The closet is well lit, but so small that it leaves barely enough space to turn around.  An oversized trunk sits at the base of one wall, while shelves rise to the ceiling lining two more walls.

title: Paupers, Vault
description: This is a secluded alcove toward the rear of the vault.  One of the lockers has been removed for you and rests open on a stone counter.

title: Paupers, Vault
description: You are standing in a secluded alcove toward the rear of the vault.  One of the lockers has been removed for you and rests open on a stone counter.

title: Paupers, Vault
description: You are standing in a secluded alcove toward the rear of the vault.  One of the lockers has been removed for you and rests open on a stone counter.

title: Paupers, Vault
description: You are standing in a secluded alcove toward the rear of the vault.  One of the lockers has been removed for you and rests open on a stone counter.

title: Giantman Village, Clearing
description: The surrounding flora has been cleared to create a sizeable space here.  Tents, lean-tos and other temporary structures cover the area, forming narrow streets through the miniature village.  Giantmen wander amongst the buildings on their way to daily tasks, some with their children in tow.  The children not pressed into labor play happily under the watchful eyes of their mothers.

title: Silvergate Inn, Garden
description: An ivy-covered wall with a wrought iron gate encloses the garden.  Colorful flower beds border the wide expanse of close-cropped grass which surrounds a small lily pond spanned by a fanciful wrought iron footbridge.  Fireflies glimmer around a graceful wooden arbor covered with silver and white tea roses beside the water.  Several trees are scattered across the lawn, a particularly large one rising near the bridge.  Silvery lions mounted on the stone wall hold glowing, cut-crystal oil lamps.

title: Giantman Village, Tent
description: Set off slightly from the rest of the camp in a quiet place, a large, faded green tent sheds a bit of shade.  Sitting in its shadow is perhaps the oldest giantman you have ever seen.  The years and elements have wrinkled and tanned his skin like shrunken leather, and his shaman's braids are thinned with age.  His brown eyes have filmed over, leaving him without vision, but the strong guard standing beside him sees to it that no harm can come to him.

title: Giantman Village, Tent
description: Fashioned of dark green walls, the room is small with a sloping ceiling of weathered leather and rawhide.  Near the entry flap is a simple basket-covered table and a plain wooden bench, while several sleeping furs are neatly arranged near the outer wall.  A hanging lantern casts odd shadows on the floor, which is covered by a thick patterned wool blanket.

title: Giantman Village, Artisans
description: Tents huddle closely about each other, leaning inward as if sharing trade secrets.  The gentle tink-tink-tink of a small hammer on metal rings through the area, echoing over the sounds of the village.  A blast of heat and the smell of burnt metal rises from one of the tents every time the breeze rises, but the open flap of the tent opposite it does seem inviting.

title: Giantman Village, Jeweler
description: Small baskets of handcrafted jewelry sit about the interior of this tent.  Torques, wrought belts, but most especially armbands glitter in the low light, all made by the hands of a master.  The proprietor of the shop sits behind a well-worn bench, painstakingly tapping out patterns on a band of gold.

title: Giantman Village, Pavilion
description: A large number of giantmen, both male and female, gather about a large pavilion.  While mostly warriors, there seems to be at least one member of every profession imaginable present, from housewife to guard.  Each holds a sizeable stein in his or her hand, drinking as they stand about, chatting comfortably.

title: Giantman Village, Tavern
description: The tent is large and airy, smelling strongly of good ale and honest sweat.  Giantmen chat with the barkeep, who seems perfectly happy to talk.  A large group clusters about a barrel in the corner.  As they drain their mugs they dip them into the keg, refilling them with good giantkin beer.

title: Syphaer's Combat Gear
description: The broad sweep of the oak floor is interrupted by a worn rug.  Halfway to the golden oak ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the polished oak walls.  Several white marble shelves and a Vornavian silk-lined display case are pushed close together in the back of the shop.

title: Melgorehn's Crossing, Riverbank
description: A few modwir trees have taken root along the river, growing in between the houses.  A gentle breeze shakes their towering boughs, causing their needles to quiver with a whispering rustle.

title: Melgorehn's Crossing, Riverbank
description: Wooden houses dot the plain, encroaching upon the river.  They would seem to be a hodgepodge of styles, some of them grand and elegant, others small and modest.  Many of them feature gardens splashed with a myriad of floral colors.

title: Melgorehn's Crossing, Riverbank
description: The Locksmehr river sweeps lazily through the grasslands in a series of oxbows, its clear, spring-fed waters gently rolling on towards the sea.  Streamers of aquatic vegetation writhe hypnotically in the slow current, as if they were swimming against it.  A path parallels the western bank of the river, allowing travel towards a clutch of wooden buildings to the south.

title: Melgorehn's Crossing, Glade
description: The sound of nature's symphony wells up around you.  Shoes clatter upon the cobblestones to provide a staccato rhythm to the river's roar, while the occasional birdsong rises above the din to provide a melody.

title: Melgorehn's Crossing, Glade
description: The river widens into a pool, marking the southern boundary of the glade.  Children play in the water, dunking one another gleefully.  Occasionally one will climb a large oak tree on the riverbank, swing out over the water by a rope tied to one of its limbs, and then let go to fall into the pool with a splash.

title: North Shore, Beach
description: Foamy waters lap at the stone jetty jutting out into the waves.  Near its end, a grizzled old dwarf squats on a small barrel.  With a fishing pole in his hands and a pipe stuck in his grin, he looks to be at peace.

title: North Shore, Beach
description: White sandy beach stretches out towards the ocean.  Powerful eddies swirl along the shore churning silt and seashells before rolling back to sea.  Playful seabirds flit through the sky.

title: North Shore, Beach
description: High-banked dunes of light colored sand provide beachgoers private little spots to escape prying eyes. Choppy waves splash against the shore.  Warm trade winds blow bits of sand back from the sea's edge.

title: North Shore, Woods
description: Large evergreens overlook the path leading to the beach below.  The hill continues upward to the east.  Despite the sandy ground and the steep incline, the trees seem to be thriving here.

title: North Shore, Woods
description: The undergrowth has begun to thin out here.  A few tall conifers have crowded out the smaller trees.  The trail continues onward east to west.

title: North Shore, Woods
description: Tall conifers with drooping boughs have flourished in the sandy soil.  Scattered pine needles and browning pinecones carpet the loamy ground.  Winding between the trees the path continues from east to west.

title: North Shore, Woods
description: The trees begin to thin out here.  Underfoot the earth seems sandier and less able to support the towering evergreens indigenous to the area.  Off in the distance, you can see where the tree line ends and dunes of sand begin.

title: North Shore, Bluffs
description: The cliffs overlooking the beach are formed from rainbow colored clay.  Bright colored streaks of pink, red, and blue can be spotted running down the face of the cliff.  Along the edge of the bluff, a few boulders provide places for sitting and watching the surf below.

title: North Shore, Bluffs
description: The cliff edge seems soft and brittle.  Chunks of multi-colored clay from the face have broken off and tumbled down to the beach below.  The ocean stretches outward toward the distant horizon.

title: North Shore, Riverbank
description: Two tall towers guard the river opening, standing ready to repel sea-raiders.  Shipping passes under the watch posts.  Fishing boats troll their nets off in the distance, and heavily laden cargo boats make their way up and down the river.

title: North Shore, Bluffs
description: The pounding surf below crashes up against the cliff, spraying water up the sides.  From up here the large waves rolling in below look small.  A few shrubs have managed to take root along the craggy clay edge.

title: North Shore, Riverbank
description: The river's current is much stronger here and not at all suitable for wading.  Boats moving upstream need to break out the oars or hope for favorable winds.  Fragrant wildflowers poke out of the thick green grass growing along the sides of the banks.

title: North Shore, Riverbank
description: Rich green grass grows on both sides of the river.  Pleasure boats and merchant shipping pass by going up and down stream.  Tall reeds and cottontails have sprung up in the shallow waters by the river's edge.

title: North Shore, Beach
description: Undulating swells pound the ragged shoreline.  Bright colored seashells dot the sand.  Long trails of algae and broken pieces of driftwood bob slowly in the water, floating in and out to sea with the changing tides.

title: North Shore, Bay View
description: The coast below seems to extend out for miles.  The ocean dances and sparkles as its deep waters constantly move governed only by the tides.  Off in the distance ships sail slowly across the horizon.

title: North Shore, Sandspit
description: At Lands End, a long narrow strip of sand curves out providing a natural breakwater for the bay.  Merchant ships pass by in either direction on their way to offload and barter precious cargoes.  Their sails whip in the constant wind blowing in from sea.

title: North Shore, Tide Pool
description: The pounding surf has cut deeper inland forming a tidal pool.  Starfish, scurrying crabs and tiny silvery fish can be found swimming in these clear swirling waters.  The water here looks deep enough for swimming.

title: North Shore, River View
description: The river below burbles merrily along.  A few seaside homes have been built along this vantage point taking advantage of the scenic river and ocean views.  Pleasure boats as well as cargo fluyts can be spotted making their way up and down river throughout most times of the day.

title: North Shore, Tidal Pool
description: Crisp clear water swirls all around you.  Schools of tiny silver-finned fish flit about through the deep waters forming the pool.  The sandy sea bottom underneath is covered with bright colored shells that look close enough to touch but are down so deep that you cannot reach them.

title: Teclys's Magic Shoppe
description: A tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the tattered canvas walls, and a vaulted ceiling rises overhead.  An open-mawed greater vruul statue sits in one corner of an enameled hardwood floor.  There is a vine-carved mahogany table on one side of the shop and a bamboo rack on the other.

title: Banthal's Weaponry
description: Beneath a vaulted ceiling, a pearl-handled filigreed mandolin hangs on one of the mahogany paneled walls.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet sits in one corner while a brass flowerpot rests on the hardwood floor.

title: Greystorm Manor, Amphitheatre
description: The enclosure of the leaf-covered arch suddenly gives way to an expansive, sloped clearing surrounded by a lush grove of towering oaks.  Natural stone benches are carved into the landscape and descend towards a low-rise wooden stage.  Moonlight filtering through the canopy of the trees places a natural spotlight onto the stage, and dozens of lanterns hang in the oaks that border the area.  To the right of the stage sits a beautifully carved oak lectern.

metadata.source: Greystorm Manor, inside the frontier town of Wehnimer's Landing

title: Sphere and Scythe, Cave Garden
description: Enormous stalactites droop from the high ceilings in this massive oval room.  The stalactites have been carved and adorned with various forms of glowing lichens, mushrooms, toadstools, and crystals that lend light to this dark expanse.  The surrounding walls flicker with life as cave moss and glowing lichen cast varying patterns of light across the room in hues of white to green.  Carved into the stone walls are a line of benches.  A detailed plaque is mounted high above the carved stone doors.

title: Sphere and Scythe, Sentinels
description: This sparsely decorated room is obviously designed with a martial theme.  Standing at the western archway of the hall are two sentinels guarding the entry, both clad in full plate armor with adornments and regalia representing Gosaena and Jastev.  The walls are lined with weapon racks which contain nearly every common type of weapon.  The floor itself is completely covered in padded, well-cured leather.  Four training mannequins are set in recessed alcoves in each corner of the room.

title: Sphere and Scythe, Cholen's Pub
description: Music and laughter filter throughout the pub which is lit by glowing crystal globes hanging from the ceiling.  Leather club chairs and small cafe tables ring a stage to the south.  Behind the stage is a large curtain with the embroidered image of a smiling Cholen.  An expansive polished mahogany bar is centered in the room.  Above the bar is a silver-gilded mirror that reflects distorted, comical images of nearby patrons.  A clown face dart board hangs on the pockmarked west wall.

title: Sphere and Scythe, Archive Hall
description: Walls fitted with sturdy oak shelves, scroll tubes, and glass-paned display cabinets line the perimeter of this rectangular room.  An arched entry looms to the south, while a bas-relief of Fash'lo'nae and Lumnis face off against each other in the northern wall, engaged in a spirited debate.  Positioned directly in front of the carving is a gem-inlaid Elanthian globe.  Long tables and chairs line the center of the room, offering ample space for scholars and historians to conduct their research.

title: Sphere and Scythe, Seer Hall
description: Various statues stand in alcoves lining the smooth walls of this round room.  Eviscerating knives, decks of tarot cards, pouches of sand, and various bowls are carefully nested in the outstretched hands of stone seers representing all the races of Elanthia.  Each statue has been masterfully carved from a single piece of various types of marble and stone.  A large round table sits in the center of the room surrounded by plush high back chairs.

title: Sphere and Scythe, Memoriam
description: This perfectly square room expands into the depths of the stone walls that surround it.  In the northern apex a recessed alcove is positioned above two folded wings cradling a perfectly formed crystal sphere.  Engraved above the alcove in detailed script are the words, "With undying love, we commit you to memory."  Three massive tapestries line the remaining walls.

title: Sphere and Scythe, Vision Room
description: A massive silver-framed mirror dominates the southern wall of this small cozy room, the reflections across its surface twisting and writhing into smoke-like forms.  A large pillow is centered in the middle of the room, sized to accommodate a single person and placed directly in front of a small knee-high table.  Cushions are casually placed around the room to be easily moved for comfort and conversation.

title: Sphere and Scythe, Moon Room
description: An expansive dome looms above the space, the curved ceiling reflecting the Winter Constellations marked by glowing green glimaerstones and thin veins of glowing lichen.  Makiri and Tilaok are set in close orbit around Liabo, whose bright glow provides ample lighting for the room below.  A smaller, yet quite substantial Lornon looms darkly in the stone sky above.  A reclining padded circular bench sits in the center of the room allowing visitors to gaze up at the dome above.

title: Sphere and Scythe, Jastev Hall
description: Luxurious panels of black and grey flyrsilk completely line the walls of this small sanctuary.  A massive crystal sphere-shaped chandelier hangs directly over a statue of Jastev that is positioned in the center of the room.  Multiple small black candles inside the chandelier cast dancing patterns of light throughout the room.  A small grey altar painted with a black artist's brush is carefully placed just in front of the statue.  A padded black flyrsilk prayer rug sits at the altar.

title: Sphere and Scythe, Gosaena Hall
description: Luxurious panels of grey and white flyrsilk completely line the walls of this small sanctuary.  A massive scythe-shaped chandelier hangs directly over a statue of Gosaena that is positioned in the center of the room.  Feathered white candles adorn the perimeter of the chandelier, casting a soft glow throughout the room.  A small grey altar painted with a white feather is carefully placed just in front of the statue.  A padded white flyrsilk prayer rug sits at the altar.

title: Giantphang's Outfitting
description: A round mithril-framed window hangs on one of the varnished ebonwood walls, and an ebonwood beam ceiling rises overhead.  A scaled model of Hearthstone sits in one corner of a dark-stained oak floor.  There is some mithril-braced shelves on one side of the shop.

title: Megdaline's Weaponry
description: The broad sweep of the oak floor is interrupted by a bronzed drake sculpture.  Halfway to the vaulted ceiling, a blue watered silk tapestry hangs on one of the polished oak walls.  A gilded maple table and an oval-shaped speckled marble counter are pushed close together in the back of the shop.

title: Megdaline's Outfitting
description: Mahogany paneled walls rise from a speckled black marble floor.  Just above a scaled model of Hearthstone hangs a pearl-handled filigreed mandolin, and a mosaic tiled ceiling completes the picture.  A jewel-inlaid caddy and a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Megdaline's Armory
description: A snarling troll king mask hangs on one of the polished oak walls, and a pebble textured ceiling rises overhead.  An open-mawed greater vruul statue sits in one corner of a polished oak floor.  There is a gilded maple table on one side of the shop and a glass-topped mistwood counter on the other.

title: Giantphang's Magic Shoppe
description: Enclosed by varnished ebonwood walls, the shop features a bronzed drake sculpture in the center of its oak floor.  A round mithril-framed window hangs under the beam ceiling.  Right near the front is some mithril-braced shelves.

title: Giantphang's Weaponry
description: The broad sweep of the oak floor is interrupted by an open-mawed greater vruul statue.  Halfway to the beam ceiling, a round mithril-framed window hangs on one of the varnished ebonwood walls.  Some mithril-braced shelves is pushed to the back of the shop.

title: Neopuron's Armory
description: Ribbed black willow walls rise from a speckled black marble floor.  Just above a pile of striped throw pillows hangs a ruby-eyed grinning skull, and an ebonwood beam ceiling completes the picture.  An oval-shaped speckled marble counter and a jewel-inlaid caddy stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Carrionette's Magic Shoppe
description: Beneath an uneven wooden ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A plain wooden table sits in one corner while a worn rug rests on the wooden floor.

title: Neopuron's Magic Shoppe
description: Ribbed black willow walls rise from a speckled black marble floor.  Just above a handblown double-heart bottle hangs a pearl-handled filigreed mandolin, and an ebonwood beam ceiling completes the picture.  A jewel-inlaid caddy and an oval-shaped speckled marble counter stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Gemaneen's General Store
description: Glossy mistwood walls rise from a dark-stained oak floor.  Just above a mound of silk-covered pillows hangs a blue watered silk tapestry, and a mistwood beam ceiling completes the picture.  An elegant silver jewelry rack and a set of carved felwood shelves stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Gemaneen's General Store
description: Beneath a mistwood beam ceiling, a midnight blue rising phoenix tapestry hangs on one of the glossy mistwood walls.  A glass-topped mistwood counter and a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet sit in opposite corners while a tropical floral arrangement rests on a dark-stained oak floor.

title: Gemaneen's General Store
description: The broad sweep of the sea glass floor is interrupted by a leaping dolphin statuette.  Halfway to the beam ceiling, a silken sea-themed tapestry hangs on one of the warped driftwood walls.  An oversized sea chest and some stained driftwood shelves are pushed close together in the back of the shop.

title: Darconas's Weaponry
description: A tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the celadon marble walls, and a vaulted ceiling rises overhead.  A bronzed drake sculpture sits in one corner of a glossy mahogany floor.  There is a vine-carved mahogany table on one side of the shop.

title: Redforge's Weaponry
description: A faded treasure map hangs on one of the celadon marble walls, and a mistwood beam ceiling rises overhead.  A woven Vornavian silk rug sits in one corner of a glossy mahogany floor.  There is a glass-topped mistwood counter on one side of the shop and a flexible willow woven basket on the other.

title: Saranja's Weaponry
description: Polished oak walls rise from a polished oak floor.  Just above a pile of striped throw pillows hangs a rainbow colored flag, and a varnished golden oak ceiling completes the picture.  A heavy wooden desk and a low wrought iron table stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Symbion's Outfitting
description: Beneath an uneven wooden ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet sits in one corner while a worn rug rests on the oak floor.

title: Saranja's Outfitting
description: Beneath a mistwood beam ceiling, a tasteful rune staff display hangs on one of the glossy mistwood walls.  A glass-topped mistwood counter and a large cherrywood cabinet sit in opposite corners while a large potted fern rests on a mistwood plank floor.

title: Ylandra's Weaponry
description: Enclosed by glossy mistwood walls, the shop features a pile of striped throw pillows in the center of its hardwood floor.  A fused sun and moon wall-hanging hangs under the wooden ceiling.  Right near the front is a bamboo rack and a flexible willow woven basket.

title: Starfrost's General Store
description: Celadon marble walls rise from a dappled celadon marble floor.  Just above a pile of striped throw pillows hangs a blue watered silk tapestry, and a mosaic tiled ceiling completes the picture.  A flexible willow woven basket and a bamboo rack stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Ylandra's General Store
description: Beneath an uneven wooden ceiling, a tropical bloom wreath hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A gilded maple cabinet sits in one corner while a worn rug rests on the wooden floor.

title: Ylandra's Weaponry
description: A tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls, and an uneven wooden ceiling rises overhead.  A worn rug sits in one corner of an unfinished wooden floor.  There is a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet on one side of the shop and a vine-carved mahogany table on the other.

title: Town Barracks, Entryway
description: The stone floor of the barracks entrance expands out in all directions, its smooth surface marred by numerous boot scuffs.  To the east, through an open archway, the glimmer of metal armor and weapons can be seen, while the clatter and chatter of the dining hall echoes in from the south.  A wide wooden stairwell dominates the western wall, rising up to reach the second floor.

title: Town Barracks, Second Floor
description: A wide wooden stairwell begins at the end of the second floor hall, an open banister overlooking the entranceway below.  To the south, a bookcase can be glimpsed through an archway, which stands opposite of a plain wooden door.  A narrow window provides an angled view of the city streets beyond.

title: Town Barracks, Archery Field
description: At the far end of the courtyard lies the archery range, where dozens of well-worn targets have been set into a section of the stone wall.  Near the practice area are a number of racks containing various bows and crossbows, and a small table holding a plethora of arrows and bolts.  Casting a long shadow across part of the area is a huge stone tower.

title: Town Barracks, Ballista Tower
description: From all four windows of the tower, the landscape of Wehnimer's Landing and its environs swell into view.  The palisade walls of the town, the rooftops of shops and homes, and the activity of townspeople moving about can all be seen from the tower's vantage points.  Down below, uniformed militiamen practice at the archery range, riddling the stationary targets with arrows.

title: Town Barracks, Strategy Room
description: Along the western wall stretches a wood-framed canvas map, its details and colors painstakingly illustrated.  Mounted above a thick oak door is a stuffed bluish-grey krolvin head, its mouth eternally pried open in a silent bark.  A wide slate-topped table rests perfectly center in the room, wooden chairs positioned around its edges.  A small shelf hangs in a corner, containing a pile of chalk and some map markers.

title: Town Barracks, Training Grounds
description: The cobblestones here are worn and faded from countless hours of training and weathered by the elements.  Wooden racks and tables clutter a corner of the grounds, providing a wide assortment of training weapons and armor.  Uniformed militiamen carry out practice drills nearby.  A thick oak door leads into a two-story brick building, and on the other end of the square resides a small grey sandstone edifice.

title: Barracks, Command Center
description: A wide maoral-paneled window provides a sprawling view of the training grounds and courtyard beyond, the light of the moon bleeding through the glass to create a faint haze throughout the office.  A pronged wooden rack decorated with militia jackets and swordbelts rests in one corner, while a polished bar sits along the adjacent wall.  A few wooden desks and some warcat hide upholstered chairs have been positioned in the center of the room.

title: Town Barracks, Armory
description: Sturdy oak racks decorate an entire wall of the armory, their pegs holding an assortment of padded leather and suits of armor.  Long wooden tables and crates provide storage and convenience for piles of sharpened blades, spears, and arrows.  A series of featureless mannequins are propped up in a corner, one of them garbed in a brass-riveted tabard and an etched militia badge.

title: Town Barracks, Dining Hall
description: Two round oak tables dominate the center of the room, with wooden chairs and stools encircling each one.  Tin plates and utensils occupy a few spots along the tables, and uniformed militiamen move freely about, their chatter creating an interminable din of voices in the area.  Young orphan children dutifully carry bowls and cups back and forth between the hall and the kitchen just to the west, where the palpable scent of roasted boar originates from.

title: Town Barracks, Kitchen
description: The kitchen is aglow in a haze of orange light as the fires from the two large stoves in the back burn bright, their flames slow roasting the boars and quail turning on their spits.  A trio of curly-haired halflings shuffles back and forth between the cooking fires and some low countertops, feverishly preparing the next meal.  Above a stout wooden table, a long oak cabinet holds a range of bottles, cups and other refreshments.

title: Town Barracks, Reading Alcove
description: Decorated with little fanfare, this small room holds two round wooden tables and a handful of carved oak chairs.  A wide bookcase is guarded on both sides by two stuffed otter statues, and a few steel-incased lanterns for ample light when needed.  A large, tawny brindlecat hide rug is sprawled across the floor.

title: Barracks, Sleeping Quarters
description: Stout oak cabinets and shelves run a border around the chamber, many of them cluttered with boots, uniforms, small weapons, and linens.  Modest cots are setup in rows throughout the center of the room, some neatly tended and clean, others a disheveled mess, or occupied by a slumbering member of the militia.

title: Town Barracks, Storage Hall
description: The chamber narrows significantly, cluttered by rows and rows of unopened crates, barrels, and chests, each one labeled as food, ale, or supplies.  A low wooden shelf juts out from a far wall, its surface packed with folded clothing items, from tabards, to gloves, to boots and hats.  A few wooden tables have been stacked up in a corner, along with a number of unused cots.

title: City Stables, Stalls
