description: Soft whinnying, snorting, and the stamping of hooves resounds throughout the stables.  Stablehands are constantly on the move, fetching fresh horses for the traveling merchants, messengers, or guards who board their steeds here.  The stalls are clean and well-tended, and the horses seem content with their lots in life here in the Landing.

title: Black Void, Garden
description: Bathed in shadows, an unusual garden encircled by seven trees spreads across this side of the long rectangular platform surrounded by darkness.  The northern area of the platform is sectioned off, demarcated by a tall wall of woven roots that protrude up from the distinctively dark soil.  Clogging the air with its intensity, the stench of cruor and decomposition gleefully cavorts around weaker nectarous notes.  Descending down to ground-level is a stairway of small boulders, with a gate situated midway down.

title: Black Void, Orchard
description: Sequestered from the main garden, the orchard accommodates four black trees, a dead white tree and a rotted dead white tree split down the middle far from the platform edge and a tall wall of woven roots.  To the left of the nearly mature trees and in front of four rows of stakes, small black saplings splay out of the soil at peculiarly bent angles.  The handful of tiny wispy white strands of light floating over the other side of the platform seem to avoid wandering anywhere near the orchard, effectively couching it in a perpetual crepuscule.

title: Silvergate Inn, Observatory
description: Spiraling stone steps open into a room with a glass-paneled dome overhead.  A massive steel-riveted telescope is mounted on a rotating plate controlled by a series of pulleys.  Long benches positioned before the paneled glass north wall afford a spectacular view of the town and surrounding environs.  A large teak table curves along the south wall beneath framed constellation images.

title: Ferocious Thrak Table
description: Wood chairs are pushed haphazardly against the long wooden table.  A dagger with a carved bone hilt pins a dried-out apple to the table, providing an interesting centerpiece.  A picture of a thrak baring its teeth is drawn in fading paint.

title: Zephyr Hall, Black Drake Table
description: Stretched out before you is a dimly lit modwir table topped with smooth green felt, a magnificent black drake adorning its surface.  The eyes of the beast stare straight ahead, seemingly following any movement.  Resting atop the felt is a low-burning tallow candle, as well as three bone white ivory dice.  Behind the table stands an elegantly garbed dealer, his eyes blind and vacant.  His expression remains cold while his stick flashes out to scoop up the cubes.

title: Obsidian Tower, Stairway
description: Torchlight flickers across the polished surfaces from sconces carved into the walls at regular intervals.  The small circular landing in the stairs provides enough room for several doors and a bit of standing room to rest on before continuing up or down.

title: Briggette's Room
description: A hearth of twisted fel tree trunks takes up most of the wall opposite the door.  The fire within casts its ruddy glow about the room, adding an almost lifelike cast to the carving of the red fox guarding a basket of acorns near it.  Across from the fireplace stands a six-legged desk, the smooth front broken only by a single long drawer.  A travel-worn cloak lies strewn across the bed, partially obscuring the muted tapestry spread beneath.

title: Obsidian Tower, Guest Room
description: This bedchamber is lavishly and exotically decorated.  A velvet-covered couch sits in the front corner of the room behind a low mahogany table, looking on several Dhe'nar relics and weapons set into niches in the walls.  In the back corner sits a large canopy bed, the thick dark curtains promising rest safely tucked away from the light.

title: Obsidian Tower, Guest Room
description: This guestroom is modest but tasteful.  The walls are hung with several small tapestries depicting various Dhe'nar battles, and velvet curtains frame the glaes window.  A large bed with quilted covers and overstuffed pillows lies in the center of the room, with a matching nightstand sitting beside it.

title: Obsidian Tower, Stairway
description: This plateau in the stairs is decorated with various Dhe'nar relics which provide a distraction to the vertigo-inspiring twist of stairs below them.  Stairs also lead upwards to a landing high above.  An odd electrical sensation makes your skin tingle, setting your hairs slightly on end.

title: Dabu's Room
description: A gentle, rain-scented breeze pouring in from the huge bay window ruffles your hair.  The leaves of the herbs growing in pots near various other windows in the room wave in the wind, nourished by the fresh air and the warmth from the still-glowing embers in the stone hearth.  Over the fireplace you notice a fine portrait of a dark elven empath and half-elven cleric kneeling over a slain body in a forest. In the center of the room is a huge, neatly made bed full of soft pillows.

title: Otterex's Room
description: The modestly elegant walls of this oak panelled room are lined with shelves holding leatherbound tomes of Dhe'nar history and magic.  Two stuffed chairs sit in front of a large stone fireplace, logs and kindling neatly stacked beside them.  The flames of a fire happily burn in the hearth.  A carved oak bed sits in the corner, covered with a quilted spread and edged with faint runes of ancient Dhe'nar legend.  A large window frames a massive oak desk whose legs are carved in the likeness of great drakes.

title: Krynith's Room
description: The deep obsidian walls are dominated by the large bas-relief on the wall opposite the door.  Runes surround the huge soaring dragon, covering the black stone about it as if attempting to contain the great drake.  A shattered mirror covers the ceiling, backlit by a mysterious glow.  In each of the corners stands a modwir bookshelf lined with ancient tomes.  A large gold bed occupies the center of the room.

title: Yeesiuoler's Room
description: This room is notably bare of furniture.  A bed, built high off the ground, has been pushed up against the south wall, opposite the old wooden bookcase to the north.  Various tomes of all shapes and colors fill the shelves, the spines decorated by golden inked runes.  Beneath the window in the east wall is a large table covered in papers and unrolled scrolls.

title: Obsidian Tower, Stairway
description: Five glaes statues stand in alcoves that have been carved into the walls.  Four of the statues are crafted into the likeness of creatures formed from each of the elementals, while the fifth represents a large and powerful demon.  A large silver symbol is inlaid on the floor, the key points reaching the base of each statue.  Directly opposite the main stairs is a smaller staircase leading upwards through the ceiling.

title: Obsidian Tower, Rooftop
description: A thunderstorm rages disconcertingly close to this rooftop perch.  Peering through the battlements, the Sentoph mountains are visible, clouds obscuring the tops of their peaks.  Looking westward, you can make out the shape of a large castle set into a far mountainside, waiting at the end of a long trail.  A wide path winds between the battlements and a tall obsidian wall that follows the circle of the tower's curvature.  An enruned rolaren door serves as the only entrance into the high inner wall.

title: Starshadow's Room
description: Candles too numerous to count line the walls, filling the air with their heady and almost seductive scent.  A black wrought-iron four poster bed dominates the room, dark green silk tapestries hanging from the sides.  A fire burns quietly in the fireplace, and hung over the mantle is a portrait of Noi'sho'rah.  The floor is made of pure black obsidian, inset with a circle of copper.  Strange runes surround the circle, compelling to both the eye and the mind.

title: Celtic's Room
description: Something is distinctly out of place in this room.  Several gashes mar the furniture and the inside of the door, proving to be the claw marks of a powerful puma on closer inspection.  In the center of the room lies an oak-framed four poster bed with an enormous puma hide rug at the foot.  Sitting off to one side of the bed is a wooden box with a small sign above it.  A rolaren bastard sword hangs on the north wall, a small plaque mounted beneath it.

title: Lochraven's Room
description: Silver-inlaid black marble encompasses the walls and floor of this large room, thousands of tiny sparkling diamonds imbedded in the ceiling resemble the deep night sky.  Plush silver silk rugs and large pillows adorned with patterns of wild black roses cover the floor around an elegant fel table.  A large marble fireplace dominates the far wall, the constantly burning fire providing light and warmth in this dark room.

title: Starsnuffer's Room, Reception
description: A fireplace of blue flames burns silently in one wall, shedding a comfortable light over the tapestries and odd relics on the walls.  Two comfortable, high-backed chairs sit before the hearth, a small black varnished table between them.  Over the hearth hangs a magnificent dragon wrought from rolaren, the surface beaten to catch the reflection of the dancing flames.

title: Starsnuffer's Room, Bedroom
description: Four large black candles burn blue in the corners of the room.  The flames highlight the flecks of silver set into the perfect obsidian walls, ceiling and floor, giving the impression of a deep night sky full of flickering stars.  Set into the far wall is a beaten silver starburst, standing out amid the surrounding stars like the greatest of supernovas.  In the center of the room stands a black canopied bed, its heavy black curtains obscuring what lies within.

title: Starsnuffer's Room, Bathroom
description: Candles cover every flat surface in this large bathing chamber.  Flecks of silver wink out from the walls, and from the depths of the huge obsidian bathtub, making the basin look like an endless night sky.  Thick rugs obscure the floor and provide a warm place to put wet feet.

title: Starsnuffer's Room, Study
description: Shelves of black and dark purple tomes stretch from floor to ceiling, the spines of the books etched with spidery runes.  An immense desk of black wood rests at the end of the room, inlaid with silver runic symbols.  Scrolls and parchments are stacked neatly on the desk, next to a raven's quill and inkpot.  Behind the desk is a case of obsidian and clear glaes, full of various magical relics kept safely locked away.  In the center of the floor is a large scorched circle, blasted by some powerful force.

title: Voln Tapestry Table
description: The tapestry hanging behind the table depicts the god Voln, The Liberator.  He is dressed in black chain mail covered in a white surcoat.  In his hand is a white shield etched with faint images of souls floating upward, as if newly released from the rotting corpses beneath them.

title: Koar Tapestry Table
description: A tapestry of Koar hangs on the wall behind the table.  It depicts the king of the gods sitting upon a throne of stone wearing a golden crown and a flowing white robe.

title: Phoen Tapestry Table
description: Hanging on the wall behind the table is a tapestry that depicts Phoen, god of the sun.  You see a handsome muscular man dressed in a short golden tunic, suspended in mid-air against a sky blue background.  His flowing golden hair creates a bright halo around his face.

title: Eonak Tapestry Table
description: On the wall behind the table is a tapestry with the image of the god Eonak, his black hair and deep brown eyes reflecting the fire from his forge.  He is hammering a sword which is still red hot, and behind him you see other glorious weapons.

title: Lumnis Tapestry Table
description: Hanging on the wall behind the table is a tapestry that depicts the goddess Lumnis.  It shows a serene, tall and slender woman with ivory skin, dressed in a sweeping grey gossamer robe.  Her hair is black with a single shock of gray at her forehead.

title: Avignon's Magic Shoppe
description: A tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls, and an uneven wooden ceiling rises overhead.  A worn rug sits in one corner of an unfinished wooden floor.  There is a gilded maple cabinet on one side of the shop.

title: Berost's Combat Gear
description: Beneath an uneven wooden ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the plain wooden walls.  A plain wooden table sits in one corner while a worn rug rests on the wooden floor.

title: Twilight Hall, Cemetery
description: Surrounded by a short wall of stone topped with decorative wrought iron, an eerie grey-green fog rolls through a boneyard frozen in eternal autumn.  Branches of shade trees cast strange shadows over a collection of scattered stone benches, yet seem to avoid disturbing the stillness of the graves.  A small seating area which contains an ornately carved stone table is visible in the moonlight.  Beneath a great oak tree rests a handful of carved pumpkins and a lone grave.

title: Ravenswood, Streambank
description: The willows that line both sides of the stream bow over the burbling water, their hanging branches touching the moss-covered stepping stones that lead to the other side.  Filtered light flickers on the stream, reflecting patterns of shimmering light on the mossy banks.

title: Ravenswood, Streambank
description: Rounded stones half-buried in the mossy streambank mark the locations of ancient graves concealed by centuries of dirt and fallen leaves.  The forest is dark and impassable to the south, and candlelight flickers from the windows of small homes nestled among the willows.

title: Giantman Village, Market
description: A crowd of mostly women bustles about, talking and trading and bartering for daily staples.  Foods and goods of various purpose exchange hands, creating a makeshift market in the little town.  An open ramada shades a number of exotic foods and whatnots, the shopkeeper beckoning all passers-by to come and see.

title: House Brigatta, Upper Hallway
description: Dark oak railings climb to and from the two-story stairway, leading to this long hallway carpeted with a cerulean blue runner.  Pale walls and a series of skylights keep the upper part of the house brightly illuminated with sunlight.  An illustrative copper panel bears stylized images of constellations mixed with magical sigils and leads out to an observatory perched on the roof, and a little further along, a pale haon door heralds the library.  At the far end is a dark mistwood door braced with hammered black iron fittings.

title: House Brigatta. Cozy Sanctum
description: Dark woods and muted, cool hues predominate in this spacious bedroom.  Aside from the central four-poster bed facing a blue-grey riverstone fireplace, a full-length mirror, and a matching wash basin, the room is bare of other furniture.  Gracing the foot of the bed is a woven soft grey throw, and a plush carpet in shades of charcoal and antique gold adds notes of luxury in the otherwise austere chamber.  Soft sunlight filters through the sheer curtains that cover the only window, partially shaded by a large banyan tree.

title: House Brigatta. Bibliotheca
description: Large mullioned windows and high, arched ceilings contribute to the open and airy feel of this comfortable salon.  A pair of tufted cream silk chairs on curvaceous legs flank the blue-grey riverstone fireplace, their celadon cushions a cool contrast to the golden hue of the overstuffed settee opposite them.  Bookcases lining the northern wall contain volumes of poetry and books on art, to accompany the easel near the windows, taking advantage of the ample light.

title: Ebonstone Manor, Atrium
description: Moonlight filters in through a vaulted, glass-paned ceiling, sending motes of twinkling light to dance around the room from strands of crystal icicles strung overhead.  Beds of blooming winter roses are divided by a fountain-lined water rill leading to a magnificent conifer tree covered in ornaments placed atop a raised platform and surrounded by paper luminaries.  Parked nearby, a rolling ebonwood ladder is draped with ribbon-tied garlands and a low, parquetry bench holds a dark grapevine basket filled with evergreen sprigs of mistletoe.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Clumps of dirt make the travel here uneven and bumpy, and one lone torch provides only a small halo of light along the ground.  A stained steel ladder stretches up from a jagged rock wall.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: Cracks snake up and down the tunnel walls, darkness creeping along them like veins of shadows.  The tunnel comes to an end at an uneven slab of rock and stone, the occasional loose dirt falling to the ground.  A stained steel ladder is set into the wall, leading up.

title: Leafi's Confectionery Castle
description: A cake-shaped gift box wrapped with a cherry-topped ribbon hangs on one of the polished oak walls, and a varnished golden oak ceiling rises overhead.  A brilliant red hibiscus plant sits in one corner of a polished oak floor.  There is a three-tray bakery display case with a colorful treat motif on one side of the shop and a smiling sylvan waitress statue presenting a serving tray on the other.

title: Whisp's Outfitting
description: Varnished ebonwood walls rise from a speckled black marble floor.  Just above a scaled model of Hearthstone hangs a portrait of Darkstone Castle, and a vaulted ceiling completes the picture.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet and a vine-carved mahogany table stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Triumphs and Treasures
description: Beneath a mosaic tiled ceiling, a painting of a sundress-clad songmaiden battling bandits hangs on one of the smooth granite walls.  A mithril treasure chest accented with a veniom music staff and a wide faenor-trimmed table sit in opposite corners while a tiered alabaster fountain rests on a glossy mahogany floor.

title: Whisp's Weaponry
description: Varnished ebonwood walls rise from a speckled black marble floor.  Just above a brass flowerpot hangs a blue watered silk tapestry, and a vaulted ceiling completes the picture.  A vine-carved mahogany table and a gold-leafed mistwood cabinet stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Irregulars Barracks, Garden
description: This small garden is separated from the courtyard by the surrounding silvery haon trees.  A gently curved stone bench sits beneath the largest tree, scattered with fallen leaves and gently illuminated by a pale blue glass lantern on a silver post.  Across from the bench, a small dais supports a carved statue of a sleeping warcat, while the beginnings of a small flowerbed circles its base.

title: Baile Dragan, Lair
description: A floor-to-ceiling ceramic tile stove anchors one end of the room, surrounded by piles of jewel-tone velvet pillows, beckoning residents to gather there.  Against the opposing wall sits an enormous iron-bound chest.  As candles cast their flickering shadows across the hall, members wander off to their sleeping niches singly or in pairs, drawing heavy silk curtains of deep emerald green for privacy.  The sound of soft snoring can be heard occasionally above the soft murmur of conversations.

title: Baile Dragan, Cellar
description: A cool temperature makes the cellar at Baile Dragan an ideal storage area.  The room is filled with kegs of ale and cider and racks of bottled wines, some labeled with the finer vintages of decades past.  Neatly stored in the room are sacks of potatoes and root vegetables, armor and weapons, and other sundry goods necessary for the running of such an establishment.  A small niche is outfitted with a wooden table, a wash tub, and an iron brazier.

title: Baile Dragan, Library
description: The air in this dimly lit room carries the scent of parchment and leather.  Floor-to-ceiling bookshelves are packed tightly with thick tomes and parchment scrolls.  The most valuable volumes are located on a rack above a long study table, each fastened securely to a rod with a length of chain.  Oil lamps burn brightly on several reading desks equipped with inkwells and quill pens.  Two comfortable chairs and an overstuffed leather sofa create a cozy reading nook for more casual study sessions.

title: Baile Dragan, Sky Watch
description: Open to the elements, the roof of the Baile Dragan tower offers a good vantage point for watching the lights of town, as well as a superb place for observing the night sky.  A large telescope is prominently placed in the center of the rooftop, its brass fittings gleaming softly.  Affixed to the floor around the entire circumference of the area, is a brass plate that shows the constellations visible from each of four quadrants during every season.  A small garden is illuminated by moonlight.

title: Chamorr's Weaponry
description: Enclosed by ribbed black willow walls, the shop features a claw-footed brazier in the center of its marble floor.  A painted silk wall panel hangs under the vaulted ceiling.  Right near the front is a narrow glass-topped table.

title: Traiva's General Store
description: Blue watered silk walls rise from a dark-stained oak floor.  Just above a bathing maiden statue hangs a pearl-handled filigreed mandolin, and a modwir beam ceiling completes the picture.  A jewel-inlaid caddy and a glass-topped mistwood counter stand side by side in the middle of the room.

title: Chamorr's Weaponry
description: Beneath a vaulted ceiling, an ancient River's Rest map hangs on one of the ribbed black willow walls.  A Vornavian silk-lined display case sits in one corner while a mound of silk-covered pillows rests on the marble floor.

title: Chamorr's Weaponry
description: A painted silk wall panel hangs on one of the ribbed black willow walls, and a low skylight-set ceiling rises overhead.  A plush black bear fur rug sits in one corner of a gold-speckled marble floor.  There is a beveled glass-covered case on one side of the shop and a flexible willow woven basket on the other.

title: Traiva's Outfitting
description: Beneath a modwir beam ceiling, a blue watered silk tapestry hangs on one of the mahogany paneled walls.  A jewel-inlaid caddy and a glass-topped mistwood counter sit in opposite corners while an elegantly dressed maiden statue rests on an enameled hardwood floor.

title: Retrone's General Store
description: The broad sweep of the mahogany floor is interrupted by a worn rug.  Halfway to the vaulted ceiling, a tattered merchant permit hangs on one of the mottled grey marble walls.  A gold-leafed mistwood cabinet and an engraved copper bin are pushed close together in the back of the shop.

title: Retrone's Outfitting
description: Enclosed by painted white plaster walls, the shop features a woven Vornavian silk rug in the center of its limestone floor.  A multihued Vornavian silk tapestry hangs under the white stucco ceiling.  Right near the front is a vine-carved mahogany table and a wicker basket.

title: Retrone's Weaponry
description: Beneath a domed white stucco ceiling, a multihued Vornavian silk tapestry hangs on one of the painted white plaster walls.  A vine-carved mahogany table and a wicker basket sit in opposite corners while a woven Vornavian silk rug rests on a white limestone floor.

title: Tower
description: A rough angled ceiling of thin iron plates arcs overhead, supported by thick poles of iron that continue down to the ground that is far below.  Planks of wood make up the sturdy albeit rough floor, and a few small notches are cut into the dark metal walls.  The countryside expands out beneath you, its terrain easily visible from this high vantage point, the moonlight gently illuminating the interior of the tower.

title: Memorial Cavern, Forge
description: An iron anvil rests in the center of the small cavernous forge, surrounded by candles that keep the area dimly lit.  Tools of the trade lie scattered across the ground, covered in silt and mica.

title: Mountain Forest, Steep Path
description: Dense forest abruptly cuts off the trail leading up the mountainside, but a steep path can still be traversed through the lush greenery.  Small breaks in the canopy overhead allow sunlight to pour onto the forest floor.  The scent of wildflowers lingers in the air.

title: Mountain Forest, Secluded Path
description: Mossy vegetation covers everything in sight, from the trees to the forest floor.  Fallen leaves are strewn along the path, which leads eastward through a break in the mountain.  Rays of sunlight shine upon a lichen-covered boulder, highlighting odd markings in the stone.

title: Mountain Forest, Pond
description: A cherry tree stands guard over a small, shallow pond overlooking Halcyon Hills.  Forest creatures gather around the tranquil pond, some darting in and out of the area.  A leaf-covered wooden cabin has an open doorway, inviting adventurers inside.

title: North Dock, Catwalk
description: Varnished with crushed black coral to give purchase, the oak and teak catwalk gleams in the ambient light.  A glass and oak building and a teak and polished oak shop face one another on either side of the catwalk, each on several sturdy support posts sunk deep into the harbor.  A wide ramp leads down and away from the catwalk, while to the south, a large docking structure with ample portage is visible.

title: North Dock, Drenched Thrak Pier
description: Five distinct piers made of water-roughened oak and teak come together to create a large docking structure with ample room for portage.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Drenched Thrak Pier - Slips 1-5."

title: North Dock, Drenched Thrak Pier
description: Five distinct piers made of water-roughened oak and teak come together to create a large docking structure with ample room for portage.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Drenched Thrak Pier - Slips 6-10."

title: North Dock, Drenched Thrak Pier
description: Five distinct piers made of water-roughened oak and teak come together to create a large docking structure with ample room for portage.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Drenched Thrak Pier - Slips 11-15."

title: North Dock, Drenched Thrak Pier

Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Drenched Thrak Pier - Slips 16-20."

title: North Dock, Drenched Thrak Pier

Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Drenched Thrak Pier - Slips 21-25."

title: Hathus's Magic Shoppe
description: Beneath a mistwood beam ceiling, a portrait of Darkstone Castle hangs on one of the glossy mistwood walls.  A glass-topped mistwood counter sits in one corner while a worn rug rests on the oak floor.

title: North Dock, Foggy Larton Pier
description: Several large posts are situated at regular intervals along the teak pier, each carved with a striped warcat.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Foggy Larton Pier - Slips 21-25."

title: North Dock, Foggy Larton Pier
description: Several large posts are situated at regular intervals along the teak pier, each carved with a striped warcat.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Foggy Larton Pier - Slips 16-20."

title: North Dock, Foggy Larton Pier

title: North Dock, Foggy Larton Pier
description: Several large posts are situated at regular intervals along the teak pier, each carved with a striped warcat.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Foggy Larton Pier - Slips 6-10."

title: North Dock, Foggy Larton Pier
description: Several large posts are situated at regular intervals along the teak pier, each carved with a striped warcat.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Foggy Larton Pier - Slips 1-5."

title: North Dock, Briny Dakris Pier
description: Buoys emblazoned with the image of Spike the War Rat are strung along the water-roughened teak and oak pier, and cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip.  The soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air, and the pervasive scent of salt water and rotting seaweed drifts upon the wind.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Briny Dakris Pier - Slips 1-5."

title: North Dock, Briny Dakris Pier
description: Buoys emblazoned with the image of Spike the War Rat are strung along the water-roughened teak and oak pier, and cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip.  The soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air, and the pervasive scent of salt water and rotting seaweed drifts upon the wind.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Briny Dakris Pier - Slips 6-10."

title: North Dock, Knotty Beldrin Pier
description: The oak and teak pier is punctuated with rope-wrapped posts at regular intervals, and cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip.  The soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air, and the pervasive scent of salt water and rotting seaweed drifts upon the wind.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Knotty Beldrin Pier - Slips 1-5."

The soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air, and the pervasive scent of salt water and rotting seaweed drifts upon the wind.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Knotty Beldrin Pier - Slips 6-10."

title: North Dock, Salty Helga Pier
description: Several coils of rope as thick as a troll king's arms are stacked at regular intervals along the roughened teak pier.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Salty Helga Pier - Slips 1-5."

title: North Dock, Knotty Beldrin Pier
description: The oak and teak pier is punctuated with rope-wrapped posts at regular intervals, and cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip.  The soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air, and the pervasive scent of salt water and rotting seaweed drifts upon the wind.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Knotty Beldrin Pier - Slips 11-15."

description: Several coils of rope as thick as a troll king's arms are stacked at regular intervals along the roughened teak pier.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Salty Helga Pier - Slips 11-15."

title: North Dock, Salty Helga Pier
description: Several coils of rope as thick as a troll king's arms are stacked at regular intervals along the roughened teak pier.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Salty Helga Pier - Slips 16-20."

title: North Dock, Salty Helga Pier
description: Several coils of rope as thick as a troll king's arms are stacked at regular intervals along the roughened teak pier.  Cork and canvas bumpers pad each docking slip, and the soft sound of waves slapping against wooden support posts fills the air.  A carved driftwood sign reads, "Salty Helga Pier - Slips 21-25."

title: Greycil's Galleons and More
description: Numerous displays highlight a variety of ships and ship customizations, presumably available in this brightly lit and pristine shop.  An entire wall is devoted to ships in glass bottles interspersed with antique sailing flags, and a large teak counter holds a single candle, its strong citrus scent dispelling the more pungent odors coming from the pier outside.

title: Nexyn's Notables
description: Several ship banners are strung along the upper walls just above the myriad green-tinged leaded glass windows, and neatly stacked along the floors are several brightly colored canvas sails.  Dozens of coils of rope in various thicknesses and weights line the back wall and are piled up behind the polished teak counter.  A glass display in the center of the shop holds dozens of different boatswain's pipes, many looking to be several hundred years old.

title: Rusty Cutlass, Grub Hall
description: Burnished wooden planks curve out to form the massive hall of the tavern's entrance, with rows of sturdy oaken posts rising to connect with a network of rafters above.  Dozens of blackened oil lanterns hang from the ceiling, their light at times a haze behind wisps of smoke drifting in from the galley.  In the center rests a huge cast-iron pot surrounded by countless tables and barrel chairs.  A half-circle driftwood bar is nestled in the corner beneath a salt-stained crest.

title: Rusty Cutlass, The Hold
description: Faint light from the main deck above seeps in through tiny grates in the ceiling, just enough to illuminate part of the compartment's ballast in the form of piles of huge sandbags, wooden crates, and iron-banded barrels.  The rest of the hold is aglow from the fire of hanging lanterns which help to display a coral-ringed dart board hung firmly on a wall.  A large cloth hammock is pulled tight between two oaken posts in the far corner of the room.

title: Rusty Cutlass, The Galley
description: The back of the galley is dominated by an enormous red brick oven, its center set with a long oily grate above a glowing fire.  A high shelf almost droops beneath the weight of bags of flour, iron pots and pans, and nearly a hundred corked bottles of rum.  A wide worktable is suspended from the ceiling by heavy ropes and its surface is scattered with various meat cleavers, jars of spices, and old stains.  Several crates and iron-banded barrels occupy every corner of the kitchen.

title: Rusty Cutlass, Main Deck
description: The main deck of the tavern looks to be untouched by the elements, but its wooden plank flooring is marred by countless scuff marks.  Guests linger and speak in hushed tones along the wooden railings, while the murmur of voices carries down from the quarterdeck above.  A thick rope ladder hangs on the side of the huge wooden mainmast as lights flicker in the breeze from several tiny lanterns dangling from the ship's netting above.  Two wide wooden stairs frame a tall iron-bound door.

title: Rusty Cutlass, Forecastle
description: The surface of the forecastle rests in the shadow of the topsail and its wooden planks are a stark contrast to the main deck below.  Old stains from a mixture of blood, ale, and fish guts have discolored the flooring along every board near the railings.  A few wooden barrels sit in the center of the main railing, each one crowded with some tackle boxes, lures and tiny metal hooks.  Some carved wooden benches rest on each side of the sculpted bronze figurehead that faces out towards Darkstone Bay.

title: Rusty Cutlass, Gangplank
description: A pile of weathered and faded pillows provides a measure of comfort near a wide wooden railing that looks out over Darkstone Bay.  The salty spray of the waters periodically splashes up to add to the stains along a copper-banded keg, while a narrow wooden gangplank juts out over the side of the deck, warped under the weight of time and use.

title: Rusty Cutlass, Crow's Nest
description: The top of the main mast reaches its peak at the crow's nest, which has been crafted to resemble a huge wooden barrel held together by bands of sturdy iron.  From this vantage point more than half of Wehnimer's Landing can be seen, as well as far out onto the waters of Darkstone Bay.

title: Rusty Cutlass, Cabin
description: Several high-backed chairs hug the side walls of the cabin while a long glass-topped desk that stretches out before a row of tall arched windows overlooks part of the town and the bay.  A huge rust-covered bronze bird rests in one corner, opposite of it stands a salt-stained bookcase cluttered with tomes and trinkets.  Hanging on one wall are a heavy oak placard and a polished wooden weapon rack.

title: Rusty Cutlass, Quarterdeck
description: Two wooden stairs lead up to the expansive quarterdeck that provides a wide view of the deck and forecastle beyond.  A notched ship's wheel juts up from the center, while far behind it several tables and chairs for guests have been positioned about with each wooden leg nailed into the deck.  Several blued steel lanterns hang from a long wooden railing.

title: Scrivener's, Mail Room
description: The entire back wall of this utilitarian room is covered with wooden shelving to form a latticework of pigeonholes for mail.  Each of the side walls holds a similar set of shelves, though the openings are larger, some almost ample enough to accommodate an average-sized dwarf.  Separating the sparsely furnished reception area from the bustling activity of the mail center is a tall slate-topped counter.  Smaller display cases topped with thick glass bracket the entryway.

title: Silvergate Inn, Meadow
description: A soft breeze rustles the wide expanse of grass scattered with tiny wildflowers and enclosed by an ivy-covered stone wall.  Near a large meandering stream, a riverstone path leads to a large wooden dock.  Wrought iron tables and benches are spaced around a brick firepit amid clusters of tall evergreen trees, which provide pockets of shade.  Silvery lions mounted on the wall hold cut crystal oil lamps.  North of the path, bursts of color can be spied through the windows of a small copper-framed greenhouse.

title: Silvergate Inn, Chapel
description: Large picture windows, to either side of oak double doors, afford a view of a footbridge over a shaded pond in the garden.  Rows of modwir benches, carved to resemble tangled vines, face a dark green marble altar.  Behind the altar is a pair of trees, entwined with rose vines.  The trees grow up through an oculus at the far end of the chapel.  Floral garlands, tied with colorful ribbons, hang on stacked stone walls.  Cut crystal oil lamps festoon the walls as well, the ambient light reflecting off of their faceted sides.

title: Barracks, Officer's Lounge
description: Entering this warmly lit room, a mismatched collection of overstuffed leather armchairs frames the majority of the area, the pieces arranged in small cozy groups.  Amid one grouping, a low silvery haon table supports a tea service.  A tufted silk pillow here and a soft rolton-fleece blanket there add feminine touches to the otherwise masculine room.  Along the far wall, a birds-eye maple sideboard offers a variety of spirits and refreshments.  A burnished brass door leads back to the administrative offices.

title: Silvergate Inn, Lockers
description: Rows of lockers line the shelves along the walls of this compact space.  An old sturdy counter is centered between two sets of shelves, and appears to be capable of holding the contents of any of the lockers you can see.  Your locker has been removed from its assigned niche and sits ready for you.

title: Silvergate Inn, Lockers
description: Rows of lockers line the shelves along the walls of this compact space.  An old sturdy counter is centered between two sets of shelves, and appears to be capable of holding the contents of any of the lockers you can see.  Your locker has been removed from its assigned niche and sits ready for you.

title: Silvergate, Member's Lockers
description: Rows of lockers line the shelves along the walls of this compact space.  An old sturdy table is centered between two sets of shelves, and appears to be capable of holding the contents of any of the lockers you can see.  Your locker has been removed from its assigned niche and sits ready for you on an old sturdy counter.

title: A Secluded Corner
description: Pale mistwood paneling encloses the room, with a thin wash of silver lending a faint sheen.  A detailed circle of runes dominates the center of the floor, worked in pearlescent white tile amongst the greater pattern of azure waveform shapes.  Tightly rolled sheaves of paper peek out from small niches in the numerous scroll racks that line the walls.

title: Empath Guild, Master's Study
description: Bundles of dried herbs and flowers are hung from a row of neat hooks driven deep into the ceiling.  Rows of golden oak shelves and cabinets, filled with silk-lined drawers, run the length of the room.  A sturdy worktable, its surface sectioned into marble, steel, and granite to accommodate a variety of uses occupies nearly all of the floor space.

title: City Stables, Stalls
description: Soft whinnying, snorting, and the stamping of hooves resounds throughout the stables.  Stablehands are constantly on the move, fetching fresh horses for the traveling merchants, messengers, or guards who board their steeds here.  The stalls are clean and well-tended, and the horses seem content with their lots in life here in the Landing.

title: City Stables, Stalls
description: Soft whinnying, snorting, and the stamping of hooves resounds throughout the stables.  Stablehands are constantly on the move, fetching fresh horses for the traveling merchants, messengers, or guards who board their steeds here.  The stalls are clean and well-tended, and the horses seem content with their lots in life here in the Landing.

title: City Stables, Eastern Branch
description: Soft whinnying, snorting, and the stamping of hooves resounds throughout the stables.  Stablehands are constantly on the move, fetching fresh horses for the traveling merchants, messengers, or guards who board their steeds here.  The stalls are clean and well-tended, and the horses seem content with their lots in life here in the Landing.

title: Landing Hall, Main Lobby
description: Footsteps and hushed whispers echo off of the polished black-veined white marble floor, resounding throughout the room and amplified by the massive golden dome overhead.  A huge, polished gold chandelier dangles from the top of the dome from a thick mithril chain, dozens of candles providing ample light.  The sunlight streaming through the fanciful stained glass makes colored patterns upon the floor and the sweeping staircase that leads to the second floor.

title: Landing Hall, Second Floor
description: This landing offers a bird's-eye view of the main lobby, a polished gold railing keeping the unwary spectator from plummeting down.  Soft music can be heard from some fancifully-carved grand oak double doors, mixing with the echoes that float up from the lobby.  The walls and floors are bathed in multicolored light, the effects of the stained glass in the dome much more apparent from this vantage.

title: Landing Hall, Ballroom
description: Judging by the grandiose decoration and large size, this room seems to be intended for formal occasions.  An elegant crystal chandelier hangs from the ceiling, and gold and red tapestries cover the walls.  A dance floor is in the center of the room, surrounded by dinner tables.  Along the north wall, a stage has been set up for the band that is currently playing soft music.  The eastern wall is made entirely out of paneled glass, with two glass doors leading outside.

title: Landing Hall, Balcony
description: A refreshing breeze blows across the granite-railed balcony, offering a quick respite from the ballroom.  The high vantage point offers a clear view of the eastern part of Wehnimer's Landing, and hundreds of people wander the streets below, appearing as ants as they go about their business.  Two potted plants frame the glass doors leading back inside, and gold-stitched red banners are draped from the roof of the building.

title: Landing Hall, Bar
description: A large mahogany bar dominates the north end of this oak-paneled room, dozens of bottles lining the shelves behind it.  A few bar stools are bolted to the ground in front of the bar, while several plush lounge chairs line the walls.  The western wall bears a gold-framed oil painting, adding some decoration and color to this room, and a gold and red tapestry leads east.  Simple wooden tables are spaced several feet apart, offering patrons a place to sit with others and converse.

title: Landing Hall, Hall of History
description: Several small, flickering candles on the eastern wall provide light to this narrow hallway.  The western wall has been converted into an enormous mural, the dim light just bright enough to see every detail.  The hallway extends to the north, and some light can be seen at the end.  The noise from the main lobby has ceased completely, leaving the hallway in contemplative silence.

title: Landing Hall, Passageway
description: Four polished gold lanterns flicker lazily, providing ample light and drawing attention to a splendid watercolor hanging on the western wall.  Sounds from the main lobby are amplified here, echoing and reverberating in the spacious passage, providing the illusion that dozens of people are speaking at once.  In the north wall is an elegantly carved oak door, while the south wall contains a beveled arch.

title: Landing Hall, Lounge
description: A circular plush couch surrounds a large ivory carving in the center of this well-lit room.  Lining the walls are chairs of all shapes and sizes, offering a comfortable resting place for everyone, regardless of race.  Stretched from one corner of the ceiling to the other is a bright red banner stitched with golden thread.

title: Landing Hall, Auditorium
description: Sounds from outside barely penetrate the thick granite walls, leaving the large auditorium in a silent hush.  Sunlight streams in through the large bay window in the west wall, adding to the ambience provided by a small brass chandelier, casting the room in a soft glow.  Dozens of chairs have been set up in rows, all facing towards a large podium placed near the north wall.  The eastern wall is one large mural, the only decoration in this room.

title: Landing Hall, Hallway
description: This hallway ends in a small nook, with a small potted tree proudly defending its territory from the polished gold lantern fastened to the wall above it.  Loud laughs can occasionally be heard through an engraved granite arch in the north wall, while the sound of supplies being shuffled can be heard through the oak door in the south wall.

title: Landing Hall, Supply Shop
description: Several wooden shelves line each wall of this confined room, allowing for plenty of storage space.  Polished gold lanterns are bolted firmly to the walls, offering more than enough light to inspect the supplies that have been laid out.  Dominating the southern wall, behind a rough wooden counter, are two large iron bins, one painted red and the other gold.

title: Landing Hall, Hall of History
description: Light from the north floods into this room, but the candles on the eastern wall are still required to be able to see clearly.  A mural on the west wall draws attention, being the only thing in this nondescript room worthy of it.

title: Landing Hall, Pantry
description: Whitewashed walls and a stone floor enclose this small space.  It is kept perfectly clean, and the food all looks fresh and lovingly-prepared.  A vast stone sink in the corner still glistens from its last scrubbing.

title: Landing Hall, Hall of History
description: A gold chandelier provides the end of the hallway with abundant light from a cleverly recessed section of the ceiling.  It reveals a large circular room, and astonishingly, the walls have been painted in great detail with modern-day Wehnimer's Landing.  The illusion is effective, making it seem as if the room is placed strategically in the air above Wehnimer's Landing, offering a panoramic view of the entire city.  A large granite statue dominates the center of the room, gazing south.

title: Rooftop, Cubbyhole
description: Dozens of boxes lay stacked in this cramped interior.  Glancing over them you see they are labeled to different ports of call around Elanthia.  Dubiously diverted from their proper destination, they now sit in storage until the town constable has moved on to more pressing business, or at least accepted a few donations.

title: Bard Guild, Dressing Room
description: The dressing room is little bigger than a crowded closet.  A small dresser fitted with a mirror occupies one corner, opposite a makeshift clothes rack.  A small trunk and a chair complete the room's furnishings.

title: Bard Guild, Stage
description: Large and acoustically well proportioned, the stage opens expectantly to the auditorium -- lights and curtains, tabs and borders, all are cleverly placed to entice the audience's eye.  A semitransparent scrim hangs at the back from the grid of metal framework above.  A wide apron at the front of the stage completes the space, from which every seat in the house can be seen.

title: Bard Guild, Office
description: The Guild Hall's office is a roomy chamber paneled and furnished in gleaming mahogany.  Bright tones woven into the intricacies of an antique Illistim area rug enliven the dark wood, providing an attractive color contrast.  Where bookshelves filled with manuscripts don't claim the wall space, a number of beautiful lutes are hung from hooks made especially for the purpose, much like paintings would be displayed in other establishments.

title: Bard Guild, Music Library
description: Inside the Music Library, shelves stretch from floor to ceiling on every wall.  Polished mahogany mahogany ladders fitted with rollers on the feet give access to the higher shelves.  A single chandelier provides the sole illumination.  Its impressive size and intricate branches hold innumerable candles, casting a soft, yet thorough light well suited to poring through the most poorly scribbled of hand-written musical manuscripts.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tunnel here is almost entirely engulfed in darkness, and the walls are jagged and stained.  An old, musty smell hangs heavily in the air.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tunnel here is almost entirely engulfed in darkness, and the walls are jagged and stained.  An old, musty smell hangs heavily in the air.

title: Wehnimer's, Burrow Way
description: The tunnel here is almost entirely engulfed in darkness, and the walls are jagged and stained.  An old, musty smell hangs heavily in the air.

title: Rusty Cutlass, The Bilge
description: The deepest pit of the tavern is heavily cramped, with large rocks stacked about that once kept a measure of buoyancy for the ship when it was once at sea.  There is little room for anything else, save for a narrow walkway crossing from the back of the room to the ladder leading up.

title: Silver Knave Table
description: A stout ceramic vase filled with dark purple wolfsbane flowers sits in the center of the table, surrounded by several detailed images etched into the wooden table.  The carvings depict ships floating on a bay, toppled bags of coins, and the corpse of a lion in the depths of an open grave.

title: Golden Zealot Table
description: The image of a broken crown has been sloppily carved into the surface of the round table, each groove stained with old wine.  Around the table's edges show more etchings of a group of faceless adventurers standing triumphant over a pile of bald armored crusaders.

title: Rooftop Rook Table
description: Near the edge of the ship's railing, this table overlooks the murky waters of Darkstone Bay.  Etchings of eyeless rooks in flight spread out over the center of the table, each bird carrying a torch and dagger in its talons.

title: Blue Baystone Table
description: A small baystone vase rises from the center of the table, its light and dark blue surface polished to a sheen.  The small yellow flowers of bur-clover peek out from within the vase, almost hiding a small crack in the base.

title: Blood Marble Table
description: A curved blood marble platter dominates the center of the table, its red-speckled white depths serving as a home to an assortment of fresh fruit such as apples, pineapples, plums, and starfruits.  A few of the chairs surrounding the table are shorter than others.

title: Dark Bleakstone Table
description: A ring of dark red hydrangea reaches out from inside a gold-whorled dark bleakstone vase, which resembles more of a block than a true container.  The table is otherwise unadorned, save for a few splotches of dark green paint splattered on the wooden surface.

title: Concourse, South
description: Rows of planters line the concourse, each brimming with brightly colored plants surrounded by broad leaves, while elegant brass sconces cast a soothing light upon the smooth, onyx-swirled white marble floors and walls.  A golden arch rests next to a frosted window proclaiming "Two of a Kind" opposite a rounded arch next to a plaque that ascribes its entry to "Calm, Cool, Scented, I'm Yours."

title: Concourse, Southwest
description: Elegant brass sconces cast soothing light over smooth, onyx-swirled white marble walls.  Massive gold planters, brimming with brightly colored exotic plants, fill each corner.  A neatly engraved plaque reading "After All is Wed and Done" hangs over a carved arch, which is set into the eastern wall.

title: Concourse, Southeast
description: Elegant brass sconces cast soothing light over smooth, onyx-swirled white marble walls.  Massive gold planters, brimming with brightly colored exotic plants, fill each corner.  A neatly engraved plaque reading "With This Jewel, I" hangs over a carved marble arch, which is set into the eastern wall.

title: House Aspis, Foyer
description: Panelled in dark, aromatic hardwoods, this arched hallway conveys so well the authority and strength of Wehnimer's most ancient House.  Its marble floor is inlaid with tiles reflecting all the professions and races of Elanthia.  Muted candelabra lend an air of soft stateliness, and twin staircases spiral upwards to the next floor.  In the center of the room, a marble fountain effervesces with the gentle music of dancing water, and beyond it reposes an impressive oil painting of Aspis' founding members.

title: House Aspis, Trophy Room
description: The rich, musky aroma of puma leather hangs heavily in the air.  There is a fireplace for warmth on chilly nights with a buckler above it, and a well-stocked bar that lends warmth upon all occasions.  Many trophy heads line the dark maplewood walls, testament to the successful hunting efforts of Argent Aspis' fearless membership.  A swinging door on the room's north side leads to the kitchen.  Next to a wide bay window is a banner with a bronze plaque surmounting the case containing Aspis' charter.

title: House Aspis, Dining Room
description: Several ornate brass candelabras illuminate this spacious room in which several tables have been arranged.  The tables are elegantly covered with white linen tablecloths, and on each is a small silver dragon candleholder. The candlelight is reflected by the polished white marble floor, and heavy red velvet curtains cover the glass windows.

title: House Aspis, Kitchen
description: As you walk into this warm and homey place, the aromas of many meals past invade your senses.  Feasts of old have made their mark upon this room, from the large brick oven designed to roast whole roltons, to the pouches of herbs and spices strewn about the countertops.  A rack of burnished and well-used pots hang above your head, within easy reach of the stove top.  Next to the wastebin, sits a deeply-scarred and stained butcher block.  A hallway leads to the formal dining room.

title: House Aspis, Grand Hall
description: Polished maplewood floors sweep forward dramatically in this spacious formal dining area.  It is a gathering place House members use upon formal occasions.  Nearly spanning the length of the room is a polished table made of inlaid dir wood.  A smaller table sits joined to it at one end, reserved for Aspis officers and their distinguished guests.  To the west, a short hall leads to kitchens.

title: House Aspis, 2nd Floor Balcony
description: This balcony overlooks the main entry hall of the house.  It runs along two sides of the building and several doors open off of it.  Twin stairways descend to the main floor and a smaller staircase leads up to the next landing

title: House Aspis, 2nd Floor Hall
description: This end of the hall shows a lighter touch in the decor.  Pastel colors and light woods replace the heavier, darker colors elsewhere.  A curtained window open to the cool air allows a refreshing breeze to enter.  The door into Sincerity's room is finished in a light oak and carved with scenes of spring and summer.

title: House Aspis, 2nd Floor Hall
description: The entrance to Garret's room is here along this stretch of hallway.  The passage continues to the south and the east along the balcony.

title: House Aspis, 2nd Floor Hall
description: This end of the hallway leads to Nyte's room.

title: House Aspis, Nyte's Room
description: A tiny fireplace burns brightly in the far wall of this small cluttered room, casting dancing shadows upon the high four-poster bed that sits invitingly in the corner.  A matching table of modwir rests under the unadorned window.

title: House Aspis, Garret's Room
description: Garret's room is a haven of peace and tranquility.  The walls and floor are soft shades of grey with here and there some furniture of dark polished mahogany.  A small fire burns in the hearth spreading a comforting warmth that drives away the damp chill of the Bay.  Hanging above a tidy desk is an ancient greatsword bearing an elaborate crest engraved upon the blade.

title: House Aspis, Dremerie's Room
description: The walls are painted a pale golden hue with portraits of family and friends on all.  A cushioned bench sits opposite of a large soft feather bed, its head and footboards made of intertwined haon branches.  Various instruments hang from pegs, with a golden concert-sized harp taking pride of place before a window.  Bookcases line one wall, stuffed with music books and volumes of collected lore.

title: House Aspis, Sincerity's Room
description: Crystal mobiles hang before open windows sending rainbows skittering across sky blue walls.  Countless hastily-penned musical scores, half-finished limericks and just-begun stories cover the floor and furnishings.  What little can be seen of the actual decor reveals a twig canopy bed from which hang lengths of trailing white silk that stir in the breeze, a small unadorned vanity containing but a single hair brush, and a writing desk which seems to be the source of the parchment explosion.

title: House Aspis, 3rd Floor Landing
description: This floor holds the rooms of the House Officers and other senior members.  It is richly panelled in fine woods, and thick woven rugs cover the floor.  A staircase leads down to the lower floors.  A row of multi-paned windows gives light during the day, and a small table holds brass oil lamps and candles for use at night.

title: House Aspis, 3rd Floor Hall
description: At this end of the hall, an unused room waits for a new tenant.  Soft carpeting muffles your footsteps and polished woodwork covers the walls.

title: House Aspis, 3rd Floor Hall
description: Cemb and Sieglinde's room is along this part of the corridor.  Woven rugs of ancient design cover the stone walls and their patterns are echoed in the carpeting underfoot.

title: House Aspis, Erebor's Room
description: This room is sparse and simple, reflecting the stoic nature of its occupant.  On one side of the room is a bed with a simple wooden frame and headboard.  On the other side of the room stands a mahogany cupboard for storage.  Looking down, you see the room's one concession to luxury, a delicate mosaic of small tiles set into the floor forming an abstract pattern of colors and textures.

title: Cemb and Sieglinde's Room
description: Clean, white plaster walls are lit by sunlight streaming in through an airy window that overlooks the town.  All the furniture is made of a light, plain wood that has been carefully worked to show the grain.  A large bed occupies one side of the room.  The opposite wall contains a small fireplace with a black bearskin rug on the hearth, and a small painting of a mountain peak above the clouds hanging over it.  Flanking the window is a low, beautifully made wooden sword stand and a small shrine.

title: House Aspis, 3rd Floor Hall
description: The hallway ends at Dmitri and Tala's room.  Thick tapestries cover the walls to either side of a simple, but well-made wooden door.

title: Aspis, Dmitri and Tala's Room
description: This room is decorated in silver and black.  It is neat and tidy with nothing out of place and no dust to be seen anywhere.  There is a bed along one wall with an ebony wardrobe next to it.  A desk and a glass-fronted bookcase stand under a window across the room and a small, well-stocked bar completes the decor.

title: House Aspis, 3rd Floor Hall
description: The hall ends here at the room of Aurien and Lyrista.

title: Aurien & Lyrista's Room
description: This room glows with a cheery warmth from the fireplace at one end.  As you enter, you feel a great sense of peace and serenity here that relaxes you and makes your cares dwindle.  A huge fur rug covers the floor in front of the fireplace and an equally large fourposter bed occupies much of the room.  Next to the bed sits a handsomely carved nightstand and beneath the leaded glass windows sits a plush love seat.

title: House Aspis, Entryway
description: The overhanging stonework of Aspis' outer wall offers protection from the wind and rain.  Its darkly-veined red marble has been shaped into miniature columns and gargoyles - the latter seeming to follow your progress with their eyes.  An oaken door is carved to represent a top-down view of the city.  Very sturdy, it appears easily able to keep out all but Aspis members and their lucky guests.

title: House Aspis, Roundhouse
description: The most striking object in this circular room is the solid glaes column that rises from the center of the room to the ceiling.  It is apparent that this supports some great weight.  Floor-to-ceiling windows allow the light to stream in on the pool that surrounds the column.  Small benches and chairs line the tiled flooring, and a service bar circles the great column.

title: House Aspis, Observatory
description: The ceiling of this mystical chamber is a huge open dome of paneled glass.  The walls, also of glass, are covered in leafy vines of climbing ivy.  Centered in the room is a magnificent silver dragon, head held high, with eyes containing unimaginable knowledge.  A closer look shows the beast actually to be a large telescope, aimed directly into the sky.  Nearby is an old wooden table, heaped with astrological charts, scrolls, and other instruments of discovery.

title: House Aspis, Dragon's Back
description: Moonbeams and starlight cast the entire observatory in a mystical glow, especially here, high atop the back of the dragon.  A comfortable-looking, cushioned bench fills most of this small area, but the centerpiece of the dragon is the large silver and brass telescope affixed near the dragon's neck and pointed toward the heavens.  Steps along the tail lead back down to the main floor of the observatory.

title: House Aspis, Dragon's Lair
description: The walls of this room are filled with books, old and new.  A large, centered, modwir table gated with six chairs has several scrolls scattered on its scarred surface.  Two overstuffed chairs flank the fireplace to form a sitting area.  Atop the mantle, intricately carved silverwood dragon bookends brace several well-worn books.  A smaller version of the original painting found in the foyer of the House hangs above the fireplace.

title: House Aspis, Pool
description: Around the glaes column, the cool, refreshing water is deep enough for swimming.  A benched area for the poolside bar rests near the tiled steps for lounging or exiting.

title: House Aspis, Hallway
description: A honey oak door, an oak door, a modwir door, and a heavy red oak door line either side of the thickly carpeted hallway.  Flickering lanterns provide lighting for visitors and to draw attention to the walls where portaits of the leaders of Aspis through the ages hang, each framed in elegantly carved silverwood.

title: House Aspis, Hallway
description: This hallway provides access to an oak door and a carved door.  Flickering lanterns cast warm light upon the thickly carpeted area and draw attention to the walls where portraits of the leaders of Aspis through the ages hang, each framed in elegantly carved silverwood.

title: House Aspis, The Hive
description: The glowing warmth of the honey-colored, oak-paneled walls and ceiling envelop all who enter.  The floor is softly covered in a deep piled moss green carpet.  Illuminated by flickering wall lamps is a large quilter's ring with an unfinished quilt stretched taut within the frame.  Alongside a cozy, overstuffed chair sits a hand-woven basket overflowing with needlework supplies and yarn.

title: House Aspis, Sea Thrak Room
description: This elegantly furnished bedroom casts a quiet spell of calm.  Time has aged its wide modwir plank floors to a warm brown, softened by simple hand-woven rugs.  A matching quilt is pulled back from the pure white linens of the four-poster bed, where plump pillows lie invitingly.  On the side table rests a lit oil lamp and a crystal vase filled with freshly plucked sea lavender.  Billowing sea-cotton curtains frame a distorted reflection of the room in the leaded glass windows along the far wall.

title: House Aspis, Sun Room
description: The two outside corner walls of this room are glass doors granting access to a small, private garden.  Moonlight gives the red oak flooring a blue shading.  Chimes of all sorts drop down from the ceiling, their music casting a hypnotic sensation on every breeze.  A large red oak tub, built into the floor, is filled to brimming with steamy water.  Fluffy, absorbent towels are stored in a rack within easy reach.

title: House Aspis, Dragon Hideaway
description: The thick oak walls that make up this split-level hideaway are adorned in mystical elven patterns.  The bed, on the upper level, is enormously oversized and drowned in fresh silks.  Two steps down, windows of etched glass line the outer wall, while cushions at their base provide a spot for rest.  At the base of the steps are large bookcases, home to volumes of novels and books of history.  An old overstuffed chair sits in the corner.

title: House Aspis, Sun Room Tub
description: Warm to the touch, the water seems a perfect temperature for relaxing.  The heat source is revealed from the pressure of several valves jetting hot water into the tub.  The canted sides on each end of the tub provide an inviting place to lean back and relax.

title: House Aspis, Sun Room Garden
description: Secluded from view from other areas of the House by a tall stone wall covered in leafy vines, this garden opens to the west to overlook the river.  Two cushioned lounge chairs with matching table between them face the water offering a shadowy view of the night sky reflecting off the surface of the water.

title: House Aspis, Guest Room
description: A comfortable-looking canopied bed covered in thick fleece blankets stands at the far end of this room.  To one side, a cozy fireplace is flush with the wall, the logs within waiting to crackle with a warm blaze.  On the mahogany bureau is a delicate porcelain vase containing a tiny bunch of fragrant, freshly-picked violets from the garden.  Two beautiful hand-crafted chairs lined with silk nestle by the wall.

title: House Aspis, Griffin Room
description: This is a comfortable, simple bedroom.  The dominating feature is the large puffy bed set upon a carved and polished base made of modwir.  There are no other notable features except for a simple oak bookcase and a thin wool floor cover.  Tapestries adorning the walls are visible to those entering the room.

title: A Great Cover Up
description: Pale mistwood poles stand in each corner of the tent, holding the silk canopy high overheard.  The ground is covered by a plush pewter-hued velvet rug, with a circular cottonwood rack standing atop it in the center.  A delicate faenor chain curtain partitions off the rear of the tent and also provides access.

title: A Great Cover Up, Work Area
description: Soft purple silk rugs have been layered atop the velvet rug of the tent and strewn with some plush silver velvet cushions to provide a comfortable place to rest.  A small cottonwood table and a padded three-legged stool stand along the rear wall of the tent.

title: Shanty Town, The Garden
description: Faded gravel pathways create a series of meandering trails that stretch throughout an expansive and verdant green garden bordered by raspberry bushes.  Thick vegetation grows at the edges of the plot, while a rickety scarecrow stands guard over a wide field of pale flax.  Several varieties of squash are clustered around tidy rows of carrots, tomatoes, pea pods, strawberries, lettuce and cabbage.  A sturdy workbench rests beneath a tool rack holding a number of burlap sacks and stained shovels.

title: Shanty Town, Bread Booths
description: Tucked away just beyond the garden's edge is a stretch of gravel and dirt that has been cleared away for a semi-circle of several wooden booths and an old firepit.  Dozens of Shantytown residents mill about, enjoying some hot meals and relaxing beneath the canopy of a thicket of trees. Some sit upon heavy logs spread about.  A sweet, yet faint, mixed aroma of bread and flora permeates the area.

title: Gallardshold, Northern Field
description: Huge stone walls and ramparts stretch along the area, comprising the northern fortifications of Gallardshold.  Armored imperial soldiers march the length of the stone battlements, their eyes always trained to the distance.  To the south and east, the fortress city expands, while a narrow trail bends north into an expanse of trees.

title: Northern Woodlands, Small Trail
description: A narrow trail leads away from the great stone walls of Gallardshold and bends through thick patches of dark modwir trees.  A huge menacing forest rises up to the north.

title: Northern Woodlands, Trail's End
description: The trail gradually comes to an end, the dirt path eventually giving way to thick foliage and thorny brambles.  Rising up like a great foreboding force, the outer edge of the Wyrdeep Forest stretches as far as the eye can see.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Edge
description: The outer edge of the dense forest is blanketed in a welcoming array of lush green grass and colorful wildflowers.  Wide rows of ancient yew trees fashion a pronounced boundary as they sway to and fro, their twisted limbs stretching and beckoning, inviting passerbys into the forest's depths.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Opening
description: Wildlife is curiously absent at the entrance, and there is an unsettling calm that hangs in the air like a thick fog blanketing the encircling forest.  Faint bursts of sunlight bleed through modest breaks in the foliage overhead, affording barely enough light to illuminate the path.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Clearing
description: The meandering path that leads farther into the forest grows increasingly difficult to navigate, dead leaves and broken twigs forming a protective cover over the almost concealed pathway.  Crisp snaps and crackles burst noisily from the surrounding woods in an unsettling cacophony.  Toward the east, a small clearing draws attention, a visual distraction from the hypnotic calls of the forest.

title: Wyrdeep, Treetop
description: The giant wyrwood tree rises above a number of trees surrounding it, providing ample viewing on the forest below.  Vines run along the tree's numerous thick branches, twisting and coiling like thin snakes.  Periodically, the sound of leaves rustling or twigs snapping can be heard somewhere within the woods.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: Surrounded by pebbles and rocks meticulously placed, a wooden sign tilts on a splintered stake.  A solitary wyrwood tree looms above you, its twisted branches hanging uncomfortably still.  Adjacent to the circle of stones is a makeshift shrine covered with clumps of animal fur, bloodied claws and teeth, and what appears to be cracked feystones.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Briar Bed
description: Thick growth has reluctantly given way to a small clearing, prickly vines and sharply barbed briars threatening entanglement to any who attempt passage.  Broken clay pots and scorched slats of faewood are strewn across the ground, a faint smell of smoke hanging heavily in the air.

title: Wyrdeep, Golden Glade
description: Great wyrwood trees enclose this glade on all sides, their trunks as light as amber, their branches a pale green tinged with gold, looking almost unreal.  The air is peaceful, infused with wild scents from the surrounding forest and alive with the song of birds in the distance.  The grass covering the glade is lush and full, like a bed of viridian silk spread throughout the area.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: Moss-covered stones slick with strange chartreuse-hued algae border a small stream, its wavering voice gurgling like a victim of strangulation.  The pathway is hidden beneath a deep layer of flourishing vegetation that leads travelers along its green trail.  Guttural moans seep from the maze of trees that obstructs the view in all directions.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Twisting Path
description: Clouds of fog swirl along the ground, spawning tiny whirlpools of green mist that consume any dead vegetation that exists on the forest floor.  A deafening screech pierces the air, but is quickly muffled by echoing footsteps.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: The air is stagnant despite the fact that the dark green leaves on the imposing villswood trees rustle like a silent alarm.  A faint trickling of water can be heard in the distance.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Twisting Path
description: Hundreds of footprints litter the forest floor and point in every direction, indicative of to and fro travel.  Heavy fog laden with a viridian tinge hangs in the air, the diffused light casting a green glow along the ground.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: A small brook heads off through the trees to the west, but the thick vegetation blocks movement in that direction.  Clusters of exotic-looking mushrooms, ranging from very small to a width of nearly a foot, blanket the ground in a muted array of color.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: Thorn-covered vines wind their way across the ground and up each tree, strangling the forest in an unforgiving grasp.  Complex cobwebs decorate each branch, their skilled weavers veiled in dark shadows.  A smidge of light sneaks through an opening overhead, but is quickly snuffed by the shifting forest, leaving the area in near darkness.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: The lack of ambient light in the suffocating darkness makes it impossible to discern the time of day.  Eerie howls and muffled scampering confirms the presence of unseen beings, but offers little solace as the approaching sound resonates through the trees.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: A long slender branch hangs from an overhead limb, coiled and twisted into a natural noose.  A bed of crushed leaves and broken branches lies on the ground beneath the bark-covered appendage, a faint outline of footprints imbedded in the brush.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: The stream widens as it makes a sharp southwestern turn at an unexpected opening in the forest.  While the undergrowth remains unforgiving, a diminutive breach offers a rare glimpse deeper into the shrouded woodland; a small village lies in ruins.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Twisting Path
description: A partially concealed trail forks in numerous directions, and there seems to be a slight familiarity to the area.  The viridian-tinged fog thickens, leaving a stench in the air that burns with every breath.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: Tufts of blood-covered fur, some with remaining chunks of rotten skin, are scattered across the ground in an obvious display of recent bestial combat.  Nefarious shadows slither in and out of the trees, their silent movement detected only when the sounds of crackling underbrush echo through the area.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: Fractured and low-hanging limbs are draped in fine, hair-like moss, and form a natural cage around the branching walkway.  Hushed moans perforate the quiet and haunting cries linger in the air.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: Surrounded by a seemingly endless chamber of enclosing growth, the forest threatens to suffocate trespassers and keep its secrets cloaked in mystery.  Wild vines with a snake-like girth and thorns as sharp as daggers slither across the ground making the journey rather treacherous.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Twisting Path
description: Clouds of fog swirl along the ground, spawning tiny whirlpools of green mist that consume any dead vegetation that exists on the forest floor.  A deafening screech pierces the air, but is quickly muffled by echoing footsteps.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Twisting Path
description: Hundreds of footprints litter the forest floor and point in every direction, indicative of to and fro travel.  Heavy fog laden with a viridian tinge hangs in the air, the diffused light casting a green glow along the ground.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
description: Flowing with urgency, the stream empties into a dark, ominous cavity.  The water's roar is deafening, drowning all sounds from the enveloping forest.  Sharp and jagged rocks along the water's edge create a protective barrier from a fatal plunge into the cavern's depths.  The heavy growth to the south has become impenetrable.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Twisting Path
description: A partially concealed trail leads through a cluster of wide trees, ending at the edge of a small outcropping.  Below the ledge, a narrow stream can be seen winding through the forest, its waters a deep silver-blue.  A few faint footprints can be seen leading right up to the edge, then seem to disappear over the side.

title: Wyrdeep, Silver Stream
description: A narrow stream bends through the forest here, its smooth waters a deep silver-blue hue.  Small flashes of red and gold can be seen in the depths of the waters, as the occasional fish comes near the glass like surface.  Periodically, a warm wind stirs through the trees, rustling the dark leaves and creating a cacophony of disembodied whispers.

title: Wyrdeep Forest, Twisting Path
description: Clouds of fog swirl along the ground, spawning tiny whirlpools of green mist that consume any dead vegetation that exists on the forest floor.  A deafening screech pierces the air, but is quickly muffled by echoing footsteps.

title: Wyrdeep Forest
